story:
Successfully Funded on Kickstarter! 

 

Les Friction Music

Les Friction is an independent music group. We have released two studio albums: The self-titled Les Friction and the follow-up Dark Matter. The music weaves a story that we've always wanted to tell through other mediums. This graphic novel is here to bring more of the Les Friction saga to our fans and others, to captivate you with interesting characters and storylines beyond the music.  

Discover our music at:

 www.lesfriction.com

The Story

The year is 2051. Dark Matter is growing to consume the universe's home dimension. While traveling to other dimensions to escape their realities at home, people's soulless human shells remain on Earth – leaving the planet in shambles. Three children with extraordinary genes have been selected for a mission to stop Earth's destruction and return it to its natural state. But after preparing for years together, this make-shift family's fight to save the home dimension is threatened by an unexpected force.  

The book follows these three extraordinary characters after they have grown and come to terms with what their abilities mean to the world. With the ability to "travel," they are recruited by a corporation known as Dimensionet to help them hone their abilities and use them for the good of mankind. 

 Writer - Christopher George 

Chris is an accomplished video game artist/creator who has worked on dozens of games across a career of more than 25 years. He is currently proud to be Lead Character Artist at Infinity Ward, the creators of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare and Call of Duty: Warzone. 

Pencils/Inks - Robert Carey

Robert is a very talented comic artist who worked on the books Aliens: Resistance, James Bond 007, Red Sonja, and much more. His sharp details and edgy style is a perfect match to the story of Les Friction. We were thrilled that he agreed to partner with us on this. 

 

 

Dane Styler - Editor

An accomplished writer and comic creator in his own right, we were excited when Chris reached out to his friend Dane and he agreed to be our Editor. Taking Chris' script and fine-tuning it to flow as it needed to, Dane was invaluable in getting issue #1 to a perfect state.   

 Issue #1 - The first issue has been written, penciled, inked, and lettered. All that's left is coloring and sending it out to you!! We've already reached our goal on Kickstarter! The Indiegogo campaign is so we can reach a wider audience. Some of our fans have stated that they'd like to pay through other means, which Indiegogo provides. 

The End of the Beginning - We've written a single that is meant to accompany this first issue. All backers get a digital download to this song months before the official release as a thank you! 

Issues #2-6 - The rest of Volume 1 has been outlined and we have first-pass scripts completed. We'd love to fund all 6 issues with our first fundraising effort. Issues 2-6 are stretch goals. If these don't fund now, we will fund them independently. 

All backers will receive digital downloads for "The End of the Beginning," a NEW SINGLE from Les Friction! 

Special Tier Pledges!!

- Signed copies of the comic and music CD's from the group!

- Signed Vinyl Editions of both of Les Friction's albums! 

- Pencil Sketch inserts from writer and cover artist, Christopher George

- SuperFan Editions! Musical Instruments used to record Les Friction's albums.

story:
We are Project Zero One comics. We are a small group with big ideas. Some of us have worked in the comics industry for over fifteen years. Our company has traditionally been an outsourcing company, a model where we would provide illustration for independent creators all over the world. Now with the new year coming in all of us feel that it’s time to forge a new path for ourselves and our families.

We want to accomplish this is by starting to produce our own series of comic books.

We have a strong team of illustrators and writers.

We use a multi-thousand dollar creative suite that consists of the latest Wacom technology and a top of the line computer that is used to create everything digitally. This allows us to produce the highest quality work at very little cost.

All we need is you. The funding from this campaign will go towards the printing and distribution of the first six issues of our flagship title…

Bare arms.

Bare Arms takes place in a dystopian near future where the world economy has collapsed and people are left to fend for themselves. Tribe against tribe, people fight to survive a harsh new world full of danger, comedy, and mature themes that reasonable adults would enjoy. Must be of legal age to view mature content.

Why we need you.

Simply put. We are artists. We make art. Unfortunately artists have always relied upon others to flourish. When you buy something from an artist you’re buying more than an object. You’re buying hundreds of hours of errors and experimentation. You’re buying years of frustration and countless moments of triumph. You are buying more than just one thing. You are buying a piece of an artist’s soul, a piece of their life. The thing is most never get the chance for others to experience the art they create.

This mission will be more about our comics. We plan to use this project as a platform to invite and help other creators to follow their dreams. If this project succeeds it will help us to find and fund future creators, as a way to pay our good fortune forward. This is not about making money for us (although that’s never bad) but it is about starting something. Something we love.

Our Plan.

We already have much of the work done.  Your pledge will allow us to put out six issues, one per month, of Bare Arms. And if it is well received you can be happy that it’s all because you took a chance on a passionate group of artists who love what they do.

story:
Super science at its best! Murder Machine is an upcoming epic series about a Nazi robot gone good. Fighting alongside the American hero Golden Guardian and his unit of GIs against a myriad of Nazi super weapons the likes of which the war had never seen.


My name is Hamza Pecenkovic, I am a cartoonist living and working in Denver. My goal with this project is to complete a story out that has been three years in the making. I found a lot of inspiration for this story from pulp fiction mags and old science fiction novels.


The goal amount of $2500 will take care of the printing costs for five hundred copies of both the first and second issue of the book (twenty four pages each) as well as the necessary marketing to bring the name Murder Machine to the masses.


As a challenge I’ll begin drawing the first book as soon as the project opens for donations and attempt to finish it before the final minutes tick away. This way you’ll get to see some neat previews while the clock runs down and won’t have to wait very long for the incentives I’m promising over there in the right-hand column.


Thanks ahead of time for your support (whether you donate or help spread the word) and keep your eyes peeled for Murder Machine.

story:
Décembre 2014:  Un nouvel album de:  LA VIE QU'ON MÈNE pour 2015?

ENSEMBLE, CRÉONS L'OCCASION POUR LA RÉALISATION DU TOME 9 un

album: 64 pages couleur, pour l'automne prochain. L'album est pratiquement tout scénarisé et j'utiliserai 7 à 8 mois pour le dessiner. Pour ensuite le faire imprimer (avec le nom des supporteurs inclus dans l'album.)

Voyez à droite de l'écran les possibilités de supporter ce projet:


 QUI JE SUIS:

Mon nom est Line Arsenault, je vis à Québec. Je suis auteure de bandes dessinées (comic strips ) depuis bientôt 30 ans!.Mes courtes histoires sont réflectives, mais il semble, un écho et un miroir de notre société..J'observe,je note, je cherche l'angle... et réorganise en cases et en mots..C'est un peu l'art que j'ai développé au long des années et il paraît que je le fais très efficacement. :)

J'ai fait mes débuts à l`âge de 15 ans dans le journal de ma région natale : LA VOIX GASPÉSIENNE , avec des chroniques hebdomadaires d'humour, qui finalement auront duré 9 ans...!!!! ( 468 textes et le début de mes bandes dessinées). Merci M. Gilles Gagné!!

 Jusqu'ici j'ai publié 8 albums, dont 5 en couleur chez 400 coups/Mille Iles, et 3 à mon compte. Ma série s'appelle LA VIE QU'ON MÈNE.

Entre 1985 et 2004, j'ai publié dans plusieurs journaux et magazines dont: LE SOLEIL de Québec, 1985-86, et à nouveau de 2002 à 2004, À TOUS LES JOURS! J'ai publié aussi dans le magazine L'ACTUALITÉ, de 1992 à 1994, dans LE DEVOIR en 1996, SAFARIR en 1995, le journal interne de la Société d'Assurance auto du Québec (6 ans), le journal interne de l'AQRP (6 ans).

ÉCRITURE TÉLÉ: De 1996 à 2002, j'ai collaboré aux scénarios de UN GARS UNE FILLE, en travaillant pour Guy A. LEPAGE.

Mes albums se sont vendus  au Québec et Canada français entre 1995 et 2004, à chaque fois à près de 3,000 copies par tome. Ce  qui ( à ce qu'on dit dans le milieu) représente des chiffres de Best Seller. Ce dessin de la couverture du tome 1, a été également un succès inégalé sur t-shirts (Les Mecs) au Québec, entre 1989 et 1991. Près de 30,000 t-shirts de ce dessin ont trouvé porteur…!

 "Dernièrement encore, après une conférence, quand on m'a posé la question:Ce métier, c'est un choix que tu as fait? j'ai été incapable de dire oui! J'ai simplement travaillé vers ça, contrat par contrat, semaine par semaine, une étape à la fois, sans trop regarder en avant."  Moi, vers 2009



" C'est dans ses observations du monde qui l'entoure et dans le découpage qu'elle fait de ses petites histoires que réside sa force.  On aime ou  on n'aime pas son graphisme, mais force nous est de constater qu'elle a réussi ce que très peu réussissent: se créer une signature graphique originale et personnelle."

 Sylvain Lemay, Lurelu, printemps 2003

extraits album 5:On se faxe, on se digitalise, on se téléporte et on déjeune!


publication journal LE SOLEIL., 2002:


LE PROJET:

Réaliser et produire le 9e album de LA VIE QU'ON MÈNE, 64 pages, en couleurs. Je fais les textes, les dessins et la couleur. J'ai besoin d'y travailler au moins 7 mois en dessinant 8 à 10 pages par mois au minimum. Ensuite, organiser les étapes vers l'impression  et la reliure. Le tout pour livrer fin septembre  2015 pour mes supporteurs.

noir et blanc du début d'album 9

J'ai besoin de 9,000$ pour ce faire et imprimer au minimum 500 albums. Mon projet sera en ligne 40 jours. Vous verrez dans ma page comment vous pouvez contribuer à la réalisation de mon projet. Il existe plusieurs options, et même celle de partager ma page à vos amis. Vous pouvez donc faire partie du succès de ce projet, de différentes façons.. Voir les contreparties auxquelles vous pouvez participer dans l'onglet CONTREPARTIES.

L'album 9 de La vie qu'on mène sera plus personnel. Une sorte de journal de ces dernières années, oû, tout le monde autour de moi, vivait  de voyages et de satisfaisantes réalisations (!), alors que je ne cessais de chercher comment je pourrais faire mon prochain album, tout en écrivant la trame...de ce qui se passait... 

La création bandes dessinées a toujours été  l'autre moitié de ma vie de travail (J'ai animé des séances de conditionnement physique sur musique pendant 26 années) .Mes albums sont pour un public adulte, mais peuvent plaire aussi aux enfants.  J'ai des lecteurs de 10 à 90 ans!


POURQUOI UNE PLATE FORME DE SOCIO FINANCEMENT?

POUR LES AUTRES ALBUMS J'AVAIS FAIT DES PRÉPUBLICATIONS, ou J'AVAIS EU DES BOURSES DE TRAVAIL DU  CONSEIL DES ARTS DU CANADA, CETTE FOIS JE RECOMMENCE À NEUF.

.Indiegogo, logeant des plates-formes de socio-financement, est un moyen moderne et sécuritaire pour financer un projet. Ce moyen pourrait, je le souhaite, me permettre de continuer mon art, de livrer la marchandise à mes actuels et futurs lecteurs, dans un délai motivant.


PRIX ET MENTIONS:

J'ai obtenu au long des années, plusieurs bourses de travail, prix et mentions, dont Prix du festival Bd de Québec, 1995 pour album 1, Prix Humour 1998 album 4, et 2 Bourses du Conseils des Arts du Canada, dont une pour la réalisation de l'album 5. Je suis encore passionnée de mon art, je souhaite continuer! :)


CONFÉRENCES: Des centaines de conférences sur mon travail et le milieu de la bande dessinée, dans des écoles, des Clubs littéraires et Chambre de commerce de Ste-Foy.


Ci-bas: Exposition sur la bande dessinée québécoise, Musée des Beaux Arts du Québec, 2001, le musée avait conçus mes personnages en 3D..pour cette exposition!!!



Ci-bas, extrait album 5, On se faxe, on se digitalise, on se téléporte et on déjeune!

ci-bas, quotidienne dans LE SOLEIL, 2003


"Tout le comique se retrouve dans des répliques simples et désarmantes qui deviennent des prétextes à la critique acerbe de notre société aliénée et abrutie par des comportements qui frôlent la bêtise." Richard Langlois, journal Visages, avril 2003 au sujet de l'album 5.

ci-bas: illustration pou rLACTUALITE, 1992

Extrait de critique au sujet de mon album 5, printemps 2003.
¨Parmi les auteurs de bandes dessinées que je connais, Line Arsenault est l'une de celle que j'apprécie pour son caractère simple et son sens commun. C'est d'ailleurs celui-ci qui l'a menée à faire une série fondée sur l'observation sociale…bien qu'inscrite dans le registre humoristique et de la dérision, la réflexion à laquelle elle se livre n'en reste pas moins profonde.¨ Monique Pagé, Journal Tout en commun, Ottawa.


AVEC UNE GRANDE FÉBRILITÉ JE LANCE CETTE PLATE FORME QUI DURERA 40 JOURS……GO!

story: This project is closed
story_txt: This project is closed

story:
The goal of this project is to publish JADED: Last Night Out. It is an anti-drug comic, littered with reckless drug use, and the price you have to pay. It is a depiction of the NYC rave scene and what most people don't see. I have been working on this graphic novel for 2 years.


The story starts care free, and it is a "Choose your own Adventure" style with 8 possible endings. Some endings are more thought provoking and will hopefully allow a reader that is hooked in by the drug use, to think about their own choices. 


I set 3000 as the goal for publishing and shipping and I have already gathered a quote from a printing company.


The comic is a little short of 300 pages.


An older version of the comic is available on my website. This book will also be available on Kindle for 1 dollar. The goal is to spread drug awareness by reaching a specific market, the kind of person that would read a novel all about getting fucked up, and then being forced to reevaluate their decisions.


The book will sell for $25.


www.fuckmefashion.com *Click Jaded*

The goal of this project is to publish JADED: Last Night Out. It is an anti-drug comic, littered with reckless drug use, and the price you have to pay. It is a depiction of the NYC rave scene and what most people don't see. I have been working on this graphic novel for 2 years.
The story starts care free, and it is a "Choose your own Adventure" style with 8 possible endings. Some endings are more thought provoking and will hopefully allow a reader that is hooked in by the drug use, to think about their own choices. 

I set 3000 as the goal for publishing and shipping and I have already gathered a quote from a printing company.

The comic is a little short of 300 pages.

An older version of the comic is available on my website. This book will also be available on Kindle for 1 dollar. The goal is to spread drug awareness by reaching a specific market, the kind of person that would read a novel all about getting fucked up, and then being forced to reevaluate their decisions.
The book will sell for $25.
www.fuckmefashion.com *Click Jaded*

story:
VIEW THE CREEPY ARTGERM VAMPIRELLA BUST IN 360°!!

 
 

 

IT'S TRICK OR TREAT TIME!

Do you wait all year for October?  Is Halloween your favorite holiday of the year?  Do you love all things creepy and crawly?  We do too, and we're here to celebrate Halloween with some spooky treats for your collection!  

THREE SPINE-TINGLING HALLOWEEN SPECIALS

NOW OFFERED IN LIMITED-EDITION METAL COVERS FOR A SHORT TIME!

Each of the three covers is printed on a high-gloss 10.5mil, 270g poly film over metal with a sharp and vibrant image, bringing out all the original detail on these very unique collectible covers of Halloweens past.  Please note, always use caution handling metal covers as edges can be sharp.

VAMPIRELLA BUSTS BY ARTGERM

​These busts are based on Artgerm's Vampirella artwork and are available in 3 distinct editions standing 7.5" tall, with a 2.75" base! Each hand-painted, resin bust is produced in limited quantities and includes a numbered certificate of authenticity.

 

AND DON'T MISS THESE OTHER GREAT HALLOWEEN ITEMS...

THESE GREAT DEALS WILL GET YOU PLENTY OF "TREAT" FOR VERY LITTLE "TRICK"

SHIPPING AS ORDERS COME IN!

We want these treats dropped into your hands as quickly as possible! So we will begin shipping the items this month before the project closes!  The Metal editions are being printed right now and will be in our hands soon.  Everything else is ready to ship!  We're hoping everyone who receives their items early can take a picture and share with the IndieGoGo community here.

story:
THE PHYSICAL BOOK IS IN ITALIAN ONLY! If you're interested in the English version, please consider buying the Ebook.

Grimorio II sarà un'Antologia con 25 autori, di 200+ pagine completamente a colori, in rilegatura brossurata, formato 16,8x24 cm. 

Come il suo predecessore che ha sancito la nascita di Attaccapanni Press, Grimorio, Grimorio II conterrà un insieme di fumetti e illustrazioni che vi trascineranno in mondi e storie diverse, stavolta non nello stregato ma al di là del Velo: nel mondo degli Spettri.

Dal 2016 l'etichetta Attaccapanni autoproduce Antologie come questa su temi intriganti, coinvolgendo grandi professionisti e talenti emergenti in libri confezionati con la massima cura... Grazie ai crowdfunding!

Vogliamo portare questo libro tra le vostre mani a partire da Lucca Comics&Games 2018, dove ci troverete in Self Area, ma questo sarà possibile solo se oggi, come in passato, ci sosterrete! 

All'Editing Laura Guglielmo, Ariel Vittori e Laura Vivacqua, con graphic design di Laura Guglielmo e Cover di Isabella Mazzanti. Tra le pagine del nuovo Grimorio troverete i seguenti autori:

Con storie a fumetti: Agnese Innocente (Dieter è Morto), Ariel Vittori (Little Waiting), Carlotta Di Cataldo, Giopota (Un Anno Senza Te), Ilaria Catalani (Hadez), Monica Sangermano, Laura Guglielmo (Dharma), Laura Vivacqua, Lonnie Bao, Martina Naldi, Ryan Lovelock, Silvia Vanni (Salomè), Valentina Brancati (Les Ravencroft), Zeno Colangelo, Fabio Mancini & Marco Bucci (Nomen Omen), Stefano Martinuz.

Con illustrazioni: Clarissa Corradin, Flavia Sorrentino, Giorgia Casetti, Jacopo Camagni, Leandra La Rosa, Mirko Failoni (Historia), Niccolò Pellizzòn (Haxa), Simone D'Armini (Spider King).

Ecco un'occhiatina più attenta ai gadget e alle occasioni che potrete avere solo supportandoci in questa campagna!

Se non solo i fantasmi vi ammaliano, ma vi aggrada anche la visione del fumetto indie di Attaccapanni Press in generale, troverete un pacchetto particolare con tutti i nostri progetti 2018, con inclusi, oltre Grimorio II:

Minimenù, ricettario illustrato di 86 pagine a colori con rilegatura a spirale. La Nuke, Laura Guglielmo e Ariel Vittori presentano 3 menù completi per rifocillare colleghi e non, perché non si vive di solo ramen.

Clessidra, numero 1° del nuovo periodico annuale di Attaccapanni Press, spillato, 62 pagine. La rivista di storie sul Tempo che inizia il suo viaggio esplorando le 4 stagioni con 4 autori, in storie da 12 pagine ciascuna: Laura Vivacqua, Francesco Guarnaccia, Tamara D'Amato e Flavia Biondi.

Non avendo noi uno store online questa sarà l'unica occasione, se non potrete frequentare le fiere a cui saremo presenti, per recuperare tutte insieme le nostre pubblicazioni dell'anno.

In un altro pacchetto avrete invece la possibilità di recuperare Grimorio: il sortilegio da cui è nato tutto questo. Per saperne di più, nella pagina della sua vecchia campagna Indiegogo trovate tutti i magici dettagli.

L'altra occasione unica del nostro crowdfunding è di ottenere dei gadget bellissimi! Dal pacchetto Spectre in su, che trovate anche in numero limitato nell'opzione scontata EARLY BIRD, trovate un segnalibro 5x21 con il dettaglio di una tavola di Stefano Martinuz e un foglio formato A6 di sticker eleganti e divertenti disegnato da Laura Guglielmo.

Nel pacchetto Ouija (e in quelli che lo contengono, Crystal e Ghostly Commission) troverete anche l'ipnotica Enamel Pin argentata con l'occhio simbolo di Grimorio II. Sognavamo una spilla simile da molto tempo, non siete anche voi impazienti di sfoggiarla?

 

Abbiamo avuto il grande onore per questa campagna di collaborare con adepti di altre arti, ed ecco che nel pacchetto Skull trovate oltre al prezioso bottino del pacchetto Spectre anche un magico incenso in legno da bruciare per evocare qualunque spirito e uno splendido pendaglio in resina con una replica di teschio di corvo dal laboratorio di FiveForges. 

 

Nei pacchetti Crystal trovate l'intero pacchetto Ouija e in più un gioiello dall'officina di Clean&Decay, realizzato appositamente per noi in cemento, resina e pirite: spettrale, brilla nel buio! Potete scegliere il vostro, unico, tra quelli qui raffigurati scegliendo il pacchetto del numero corrispondente.

 

Sarà possibile ritirare in fiera solamente il perk 'The Tome - Lucca', che contiene il solo libro Grimorio II, presso il Lucca Comics&Games 2018. Tutti gli altri perk richiederanno il pagamento per il servizio di spedizione a domicilio: tutto questo per questioni di logistica che ci impediscono di portare fisicamente con noi troppi volumi!

Per il ritiro in fiera sarà necessario mostrare la stampa o la screenshot dell'ordine effettuato, comprensivo di numero ordine.

Se non potrete essere presenti per imprevisti dell'ultimo minuto, potrete tranquillamente delegare qualcuno al ritiro in fiera purché arriviate anche voi muniti di stampa o screenshot dell'ordine di cui vi hanno delegato il ritiro.

Se non siete sicuri di poter passare in fiera, vi consigliamo di scegliere il perk 'The Tome': effettueremo le spedizioni prima del Lucca Comics, quindi non sarete lasciati indietro!

Per Grimorio II abbiamo previsto una tiratura di 1000 copie, che stamperemo su carta patinata opaca grazie a PressUp. Avendo inoltre finito le copie di Grimorio, una parte del goal servirà alla terza ristampa del primo volume. 

La maggior parte dei fondi servirà dunque a coprire le spese di stampa (50%) e la produzione dei gadget dei vari perk (15%). Circa il 10% del goal servirà a pagare le tasse di Indiegogo e Paypal. Dalla nostra esperienza, il 12% corrisponderà a spese di spedizione, inclusive di packaging.

Un 6% ci permetterà di recuperare le spese promozionali sui social. Tutto il resto coprirà le spese di contabilità e amministrazione di Attaccapanni come Associazione Culturale per l'anno 2018. 

Arrivare allo stretch goal ci permetterebbe di destinare altri soldi alla stampa e alla creazione di uno spin-off del primo volume di Grimorio, che espanderà l'universo di una delle storie più amate del volume, creata da un grandissimo talento. Volete sapere chi? Aiutateci a raggiungerlo!

Abbiamo già sostenuto con successo tre campagne crowdfunding proprio qui su Indiegogo, per un totale di 3000 copie stampate, 50+ artisti coinvolti, 400+ spedizioni. Forgiate dal fuoco di mille pacchetti e prove di stampa, siamo pronte a rispettare tutte le nostre promesse e far sì che la vostra fiducia sia ben riposta. 

Potete aiutare Grimorio II a materializzarsi tra voi anche e soprattutto spargendo la voce: condividete la pagina della campagna sui vostri social media, parlatene con i vostri amici, familiari, colleghi! Ve ne saremo infinitamente grati.

Facebook: facebook.com/attaccapanni.press

Website/Tumblr: attaccapannipress.tumblr.com

Twitter: @grimorio_comic

Instagram: @attaccapanni.press

[ENG]

Grimorio II will be an anthology made up of 25 authors, +200 full color pages, 16,8 x 24 cm paperback format.

Like its predecessor, Grimorio, which gave a start to Attaccapanni Press as a whole, Grimorio II will contain both comics and illustrations that will lead you beyond the Veil, trespassing the boundaries which divide our world from the one of Spectres and Ghosts.

Since 2016, Attaccapanni Press has been making anthologies about fascinating themes, with original and diverse point of views, involving both professionals and emerging talents of the world of the Visual Arts. Everything made with love and care, and everything... thanks to a crowdfunding campaign!

We would love to present the book at Lucca Comics & Games 2018, where you'll find us in the Self Area, but in order to do so we need YOU to help US!

The editors on the project are the three founders of Attaccapanni Press: Laura Guglielmo, Ariel Vittori and Laura Vivacqua; graphic design is by Laura Guglielmo, while the cover will feature splendid art (current design not final) by Isabella Mazzanti.

Here's the complete list of authors featured in the book:

Comics: Agnese Innocente (Dieter è Morto), Ariel Vittori (Little Waiting), Carlotta Di Cataldo, Giopota (Un Anno Senza Te), Ilaria Catalani (Hadez), Monica Sangermano, Laura Guglielmo (Dharma), Laura Vivacqua, Lonnie Bao, Martina Naldi, Ryan Lovelock, Silvia Vanni (Salomè), Valentina Brancati (Les Ravencroft), Zeno Colangelo, Fabio Mancini & Marco Bucci (Nomen Omen), Stefano Martinuz.

Illustrations: Clarissa Corradin, Flavia Sorrentino, Giorgia Casetti, Jacopo Camagni, Leandra La Rosa, Mirko Failoni (Historia), Niccolò Pellizzòn (Haxa), Simone D'Armini (Spider King).

Let's take a closer look at the rewards that you'll only be able to get by supporting us in this campaign!

If, along with ghosts, you are also interested in the way Attaccapanni Press makes comics, among the perks you will find one in particular which will get you all of the three new books we will be making in 2018:

Minimenù, an illustrated cookbook by La Nuke, Laura Guglielmo and Ariel Vittori, with 3 complete menus perfect to satisfy the palates of both fellow artists and sophisticated gourmet friends.

The first issue of Clessidra, our label's first magazine of short comics about the concept of Time. This first issue will be about The Four Seasons, and it will feature four 12-page stories by Laura Vivacqua, Francesco Guarnaccia, Tamara D'Amato and Flavia Biondi.

In a separate package you can instead pick up the first volume of Grimorio: the spell that started it all. You can read more about it in the Book's old Indiegogo campaign page, here.

Since we don't have an online store, this crowdfunding will be the only chance to get these books if you already know you won't be able to attend any of the future conventions we'll participate in.

By supporting this campaign you can also get cool, unique merchandise! From perk Spectre and up (you can also get a discounted EARLY BIRD version of it, if you're quick!), you'll have a 5x21 cm bookmark with the detail of a page by Stefano Martinuz and a A6 format sticker sheet featuring elegant and whimsical designs by Laura Guglielmo.

In the Ouija perk (and in bigger perks Crystal and Ghostly Commission) you will also find the hypnotical silvery Enamel Pin with the iconic Grimorio II eye. We have been dreaming of a pin just like this for a long time, aren't you also impatient to show it off?

 

We had the great honor to collaborate with great artisans, and here's the first example. In the perk package Skull you will find, along all the goodies of the Spectre perk, a stick of magical wooden incense to call any spirit and a splendid resin pendant with a crow skull replica and crystal from FiveForges's workroom. 

 

In the Crystal packages you will find all items included in the perk Ouija and furthermore a jewel from Clean&Decay, specially designed and custom made for us in concrete, resin and pyrite: it's so ghostly it glows in the dark! You can pick out your unique necklace among the ones pictured and choose the matching Crystal perk number.

The only perk that can be picked up at Lucca Comics and Games 2018 after purchasing it is 'The Tome – Lucca', featuring the book only, in Italian. All of the other perks will have to be shipped for logistic reasons.

To collect the volume at the convention, you must present the printed receipt or a screenshot of your purchase, including the order number.

Shouldn't you be able to do this in person for any reason, you can ask a friend to do so on your behalf: they will also have to bring along a printed receipt or a screenshot of the purchase, including the order number.

In case you wish to receive the book before the con, which will take place in late October, we suggest you get the perk 'The Tome', which will be shipped right before the convention.

The first print run of the book will cover 1000 copies, all of them featuring opaque patinated paper,  once again in collaboration with the online printing service PressUp. Part of the money we will collect will also be used for the third reprint of the first volume of Grimorio, since they are currently sold out!

Most of the funds will cover the printing process (50%) and the merchandising included in some of the perks (15%). 10% of the funds will pay for Indiegogo and PayPal fees. In our experience, 12% of the funds will be needed for shipping and packaging.

6% of the funds will pay for ads on social media. The remaining funds will cover Attaccapanni Press' accounting expenses as a cultural association.

If we reach the stretch goal, we will be able to make and print a spin-off comic of the first volume of Grimorio, which will expand the universe and setting of one of the most beloved short stories from the first book. Which story? Help us reach it and you'll find out!

We have already successfully run three crowdfunding campaigns for our books here on Indiegogo, for a total of 3000 printed books, +50 authors involved, +400 shippings. Forged by the hellfires of a thousand packages and print proofs, we are ready to keep our promises and deserve the trust you may choose to bestow on us.

You can also help Grimorio II become a reality by spreading the word with your friends and sharing this campaign on social media! We'd be infinitely grateful.

Facebook: facebook.com/attaccapanni.press

Website/Tumblr: attaccapannipress.tumblr.com

Twitter: @grimorio_comic

Instagram: @attaccapanni.press

Since we don't have an online store, this crowdfunding will be the only chance to get these books if you already know you won't be able to attend any of the future conventions we'll participate in.

By supporting this campaign you can also get cool, unique merchandise! From perk Spectre and up (you can also get a discounted EARLY BIRD version of it, if you're quick!), you'll have a 5x21 cm bookmark with the detail of a page by Stefano Martinuz and a A6 format sticker sheet featuring elegant and whimsical designs by Laura Guglielmo.

In the Ouija perk (and in bigger perks Crystal and Ghostly Commission) you will also find the hypnotical silvery Enamel Pin with the iconic Grimorio II eye. We have been dreaming of a pin just like this for a long time, aren't you also impatient to show it off?
 

We had the great honor to collaborate with great artisans, and here's the first example. In the perk package Skull you will find, along all the goodies of the Spectre perk, a stick of magical wooden incense to call any spirit and a splendid resin pendant with a crow skull replica and crystal from FiveForges's workroom. 
 

In the Crystal packages you will find all items included in the perk Ouija and furthermore a jewel from Clean&Decay, specially designed and custom made for us in concrete, resin and pyrite: it's so ghostly it glows in the dark! You can pick out your unique necklace among the ones pictured and choose the matching Crystal perk number.

The only perk that can be picked up at Lucca Comics and Games 2018 after purchasing it is 'The Tome – Lucca', featuring the book only, in Italian. All of the other perks will have to be shipped for logistic reasons.
To collect the volume at the convention, you must present the printed receipt or a screenshot of your purchase, including the order number.
Shouldn't you be able to do this in person for any reason, you can ask a friend to do so on your behalf: they will also have to bring along a printed receipt or a screenshot of the purchase, including the order number.
In case you wish to receive the book before the con, which will take place in late October, we suggest you get the perk 'The Tome', which will be shipped right before the convention.

The first print run of the book will cover 1000 copies, all of them featuring opaque patinated paper,  once again in collaboration with the online printing service PressUp. Part of the money we will collect will also be used for the third reprint of the first volume of Grimorio, since they are currently sold out!
Most of the funds will cover the printing process (50%) and the merchandising included in some of the perks (15%). 10% of the funds will pay for Indiegogo and PayPal fees. In our experience, 12% of the funds will be needed for shipping and packaging.
6% of the funds will pay for ads on social media. The remaining funds will cover Attaccapanni Press' accounting expenses as a cultural association.

If we reach the stretch goal, we will be able to make and print a spin-off comic of the first volume of Grimorio, which will expand the universe and setting of one of the most beloved short stories from the first book. Which story? Help us reach it and you'll find out!

We have already successfully run three crowdfunding campaigns for our books here on Indiegogo, for a total of 3000 printed books, +50 authors involved, +400 shippings. Forged by the hellfires of a thousand packages and print proofs, we are ready to keep our promises and deserve the trust you may choose to bestow on us.
You can also help Grimorio II become a reality by spreading the word with your friends and sharing this campaign on social media! We'd be infinitely grateful.
Facebook: facebook.com/attaccapanni.press
Website/Tumblr: attaccapannipress.tumblr.com
Twitter: @grimorio_comic
Instagram: @attaccapanni.press

story:
The Vagabond 

A new black & white comic series is ready to hit the Independent Comic Book scene and its homeless hero is leading the way in The Vagabond. 

 

Synopsis

The story follows the journey of a Homeless Vagabond, who gets himself into all sorts of Bizarre Situations. The protagonist is forced to embrace Vigilantism and becomes well versed in saving people along his travels, even though hes more concerned about where his next meal is going to come from. 

Bios

Nathanael Hopkins-Smith (Writer)

The Vagabond was originally a short film made by the Writer in 2005. In 2006 he continued his passion for making movies by attending Film School, which eventually landed him a job in TV where he has been working behind the scenes for the last 3 years.

The type of films Nathanael wants to make requires a lot of time & money (which he doesnt have hence indie gogo campagin) So he combined his Passion for storytelling with his love of comic books and decided to turn "The Vagabond" into an on going comic series.

Nathanael is in the process of getting several comic book ideas off the ground, including "The Vagabond" so expect to see more projects from him in the near future.

Sam Finlay (Artist)


Sam is an artist, graphic designer and animator. He has been exhibiting work in various galleries around Sydney, Australia for just under a decade and in the last 5 years has moved into the digital realm by studying a Masters of Animation and is now working on various animation projects and mobile game art, animation and development. Vagabond is a project combining his traditional work, digital design and love of comics as a unique artistic medium.

You can check out Sam's animation and game art on his site: www.animateitall.com

Comics by Comic Fans

Written & Illustrated by people who love comics for people that love comics.

Our influences range from 70s-80s Action/Martial Arts Movies to the classic Marvel & DC lineup, to the more cult classics Such as Garth Ennis (Punisher/Preacher/Hitman) Alan Moore (Watchmen/V for Vendetta/From Hell) Mark Miller (KickAss/Wolverine: Oldman Logan/Civil War/Superman Red Son) and Robert Kirkman (Walking Dead/Invincible)

 

  

Supporting Independent Comic Books

The Australian Comic Book Industry is very small and needs all the help it can get, with Australian Actors making it big in Hollywood and even playing Iconic Comic book characters such as Wolverine, Thor, Dr Doom, and Hulk, its about time we see some Australian Comics get the exposure they deserve.

 

How you can Help?

By donating to our cause from as little as $1 you get a personal thank you on our blog and facebook page, $6 gets you a Digital copy of the comic, $10 for a signed copy, $20 for Signed Copy + Digital Print & Stickers,$30 for Vagabond Album + Previous Perk $300 for Original Artwork + everything in the previous Perks. If you're a bit low on cash but still want to help, give us a like on facebook and be in the running to win Awesome Prizes.


Where does the Money go, you ask?

The money that you so kindly donate will go to such things as: Fliers, Advertising, Printing, Stalls at comic book conventions and last but not least future Issues of The Vagabond.

 

Plugs for the Vagabond

http://primomag.com.au/2011/04/15/the-vagabond-comic/

http://australiancomicsjournal.com/?p=776

Low on Cash? Give us a like on facebook to be in the running to win prizes like Original Art & Free Comics

http://facebook.com/the.vagabond.comic 

For Updates & Release Dates

http://thevagabondcomic.com

story:
About Me



My name is Alex Banchitta, I'm the founder and owner of Fright Entertainment, an independent comic book company that started up in 2012 (visit www.frightentertainment.com for more information on the company and you can also click here to read an advanced copy of the first issue of Champions of Earth). I am the co-creator and writer on Champions of Earth, as well as the character designer and cover artist for issue four of the mini-series. I have a bachelor's degree in Cartooning from the School of Visual Arts, I've taken several courses on writing through Gotham Writers' Workshop, and briefly performed stand up comedy in New York City.


About Champions of Earth



Champions of Earth is a four issue comedy/superhero mini-series created by me, Alex Banchitta, and fellow writer, James Riccardo. The story follows two dimwitted teenagers who became famous as a result of them going on a crime spree after unintentionally gaining superpowers and kidnapping a man who turned out to be a very savvy agent to the stars. The boys would have to pay for their crimes if it wasn't for the fact that they mistakenly framed the city's two most beloved superheroes for their actions.

Champions of Earth is an important project to me because I've always loved superhero stories about teenagers, but was tired of reading about only heroic and noble protagonists. CoE is about two average kids taking advantage of the situation, doing what many kids their age with superpowers would do.

I've always been a big fan of Peter David's run on Young Justice and early issues of Robert Kirkman's Invincible. They were fun comics about being young and having supernatural abilities, but in contrast to those comics, the protagonists of Champions of Earth don't have role models to guide them.


How Your Contributions Will Help

By pledging to this project, you will help young creators enter a very competitive market. Most independent comics never get past the first issue because the sales generated are insufficient to finance the continued production of the book. More often than not, by the time people learn about the book and become interested in the story, the creators can no longer afford to fund it. Your pledge ensures that this mini-series will be completed and made available to comic book fans looking for something that takes itself less seriously than your average Marvel or DC superhero story.


What We Need and Why

We are looking to raise $2,300 to help pay for lettering of the entire mini-series, inking for the final half of issue two & all of issue four, penciling for issue four, toning for the entire book, and printing costs. If the book doesn't reach its goal in the time frame allotted, we will continue to take pledges via PayPal and fund the book as best we can on our end to ensure its completion. If we don't reach our goal it's likely the book will see a fall 2015 release instead of October 2014.

If we manage to exceed our goal of $2,300 and raise $4,940, we will release the book in full color instead of black & white. The chances of this pushing the release date into November 2014 are slim, but as a precautionary measure, we'd like to at least mention that adding the colors could possibly delay the release date by one month.


Awesome Perks!

We want to make sure backers are rewarded for helping us get this book out- so all physical copies of the mini series will have special limited edition covers available only to the backers of the Indiegogo campaign. Each issue will have a limited print run of a maximum of 225 copies, in the back of each issue will be a thank you to all the backers who helped make this project possible. In addition, each copy will be signed by the creators, Alex Banchitta and James Riccardo.

There is an exclusive sketch by co-creator Alex Banchitta of Jupiter Man or the Scarab available to backers of the campaign. There will only be 12 of these sketches created and they will all be numbered and signed. 

We will also offer a limited plushy of Jupiter Man or the Scarab available to Indiegogo backers. Only 15 of these dolls will be available.

Last, but certainly not least... you have a one-of-a-kind opportunity to have your full name featured somewhere in the comic! If you're the one lucky backer that grabs the Champion Bundle, we will put your full name somewhere in the comic. It could be in a line of dialog, a store sign, graffiti on a wall, the possibilities are endless! Don't worry about it getting lost in the background, we'll make sure you can't miss it.


How to Help if You Can't Pledge

Spread the word! It's that simple. There's a freely available advanced copy of the first issue here. Share it with your friends and colleagues! You can also share the campaign with the Indiegogo share tools, and other websites like Twitter, and Facebook. If you have a comic book blog, you can even write a review of the book to help increase exposure.


Still Not Sold?! Check Out Some Reviews of Issue 1

"It was an entertaining issue and I would definitely check out the next issue." - Dustin Cabeal, Comic Bastards

"... the creative team deserves accolades for managing to string together a first issue that marries words and art in a way that lends itself to the story being told." - Dante Buccieri, Rhymes With Geek


Credits


Written and Created by: Alex Banchitta & James Riccardo.

Artist(s): Koko Amboro, Scott Shriver, Ben DeRosa, Chandra P. Kelly, Marcelo Salaza, Gabe Pinto, Alex Banchitta


Color Samples

Jupiter Man Sample Sketch by Alex Banchitta

The Scarab Sample Sketch by Alex Banchitta

Jupiter Man Plushy by Sarah Ashworth

story:
Who are we?

SaikouCon (meaning "best convention") is the Northeast's newest largescale anime convention. Presented by Anime Ate My Brain Magazine, a division of Tastes Like Rock! Publishing, the convention promises to be a yearly high point in the Summer months of the anime convention season. Bousting a dedicated staff of longtime Japanese anime and manga fans, SaikouCon hopes to be one of the Tri-State area's must see conventions. We will be taking place on August 16, 17, and 18 of 2013 at The Best Western Plus Lehigh Valley Hotel and Conference Center in Bethlehem PA. featuring guests of honor prolific cosplayer RuffleButt (formerly known as AnimeAngel and better known as Jessie Pridemore), Voice Actress Terri Doty, Voice Actor John Swasey, Voice Actor Darrel Guilbeau, Voice Actor Steve "Warky" Nunez. Guests The D20 Girls Project  musical guests Turning Down Harvard, DJ Soul Eater, and Adam WarRock.

Why are we looking for additional funding?

We're looking for additional funding to help make SaikouCon all it can in it's first year. With the funding received here through Indie-Go-Go we will be able to dedicate more revenue from guest admissions and vendor spaces to bring in more talent and entertainment, host more activities, throw bigger events. In the present economy, we know asking for added funding above the admission is a lot, but we also know a great convention can't be thrown without great supporters and fans.

 

Why should you care enough to donate?

Simple, supporting conventions, be they anime centered like us or any other kind of fan convention, supports the fandom and gives us all somewhere safe to meet where we won't be judged by loving anime or any other genre entertainment, where bullies can't reach us to make us ashamed of our passion for the things we love, someplace where we can make new friends and connections with people of like mind and like interest, somewhere we can have fun above anything else.

 

Thank you for your donations, both of cash and of helping spread the word not only about our Indie-Go-Go campaign but also about our convention. If you want to help more directly visit www.saikoucon.com for more information on our convention and to buy passes to our event or buy a vendor or Artist Alley spot and sell in our merch room.

story:
To all my dearest family and friends...

As you may or not be aware I am in my final year and preparing for my degree show and graduation! (Yes, finally... I know!)

For my final year project this year, my key piece of my degree show is a 40 page graphic novel called ADEN which I am hoping to self publish. I have been working on the images since September 2013 and I need a little bit of your help to push me through the last part of my degree!

I hadn't anticipated how much it would cost to self-publish, but the format of the book I want to print is an A4 landscape book printed by the company Exwhyzed (http://www.exwhyzed.co.uk/). The format of my illustrations needs to be landscape so that it suits the cinematic design I want to express in my work. I really want to create a bespoke highly designed graphic novel so that my work is at the highest quality possible.

I was hit with a quote for £364 for 10 copies of the books and £448 for 20. Ideally I'd like to get 20 so I can send it out to publishers as part of my portfolio to help build my profile on my work! (For some reason, Indiegogo only lets you have a minimum for £500, but even then any money that could go towards raising funds for my book would be great!)

I am trying to raise as much money as I can so I can print my book to the highest standard as its a pretty pivotal moment in my life that I've been working towards for nearly four years now. I need to get my book printed on the 7th April to have it arrive in time for Degree Show! I can't express how much even the smallest contribution would be to help me reach somewhere I never thought I would manage to be!

ADEN is an artistic silent narrative graphic novel about a man's journey through a surreal dystopian location called ADEN and through his experiences it shapes his understanding of his own existence.

This will be exhibited to thousands of people on May 24th - 1st June 2014 at Edinburgh College of Art Degree Show, so you are all welcome to come and see the exhibition then! I will also be exhibiting at D&AD New Blood in London on Tuesday 1st July to Thursday 3rd July.

For everyone that contributes and leaves their name, I will include your name in my book to say a massive THANK YOU!

It's great having so many people involved so far in helping publish my graphic novel. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and helping me to graduate!

Laura x

www.lauragriffinillustration.co.uk

To see more images of ADEN: http://lauragriffinillustration.tumblr.com/post/69637864618

story:
Hey there, Matt Warwick's the name. I am an artist going by the handle 'DrDubz,' and I specialise in hyperkinetic action art. As such, I am pouring this expertise into an ongoing comic series called 'FERAL', which features a lot of head kicking, coupled with a narrative of personal development, sportsmanship, and the dangers of ego and pride.

FERAL follows an unknown hustler named Hayley Rosa as she endeavours to settle a score with a man named Dr.Brandt, the only fighter to beat her. To do that, she enlists in the city-wide circuit of fighters known as 'Feral', and starts to climb the ranks. As she does so, the journey begins to change everything she believes she is capable of, unleashing dangerous parts of her she never knew she had...

This is the second book in the FERAL series, which will see the circuit drag out more of Hayley's darker sides as she struggles to find her footing whilst pushing against the strength of the city's top tier. 

Of course, readers of the first book will be treated to even more bone-crunching action, as the menacing Tiziano makes his true debut... Click here to grab yourself a PDF download of the first comic if you've yet to experience FERAL. It's 150+ pages, packed with intense art, great characters and eye popping action!

    To tackle the next book and continue this saga through to completion, I'll need funding. I'm under no pretense that FERAL exists because of its fans, so I strive to give them something fantastic and fresh in the world of furry comics.

    What I am asking for in this campaign is the basic funding for the majority of the costs involved with self publishing. This includes printing costs, advertising and programs/ equipment. I've enlisted Taala to help speed up the shading process (as she helped on the first book), but she also needs to live, thus I am paying for her time. On top of that, some of the higher tier perks are being coloured externally by Neko-Maya, the same one who coloured both the current and previous front covers of FERAL.

    Since the last comic was a decent success (sold around 30 of the 50 I took to Confuzzled, and orders still coming in), the funding goal has been reduced drastically, compared the last two campaigns. However, because most of my current money is going on moving out fairly soon, I have decided to get the essentials using public funding. Also I am sticking with a fixed funding option so Paypal doesn't rinse it horribly (meaning less of your money is wasted because of Paypal taxing each payment that comes in individually).
    Estimated costs of each item are as follows - 
    • Manga Studio EX5 (needed for its specific comic creation tools to speed up the creation process) - $110
    • A new external Hard Drive (my current one is slow, nearing capacity and very old. This is to ensure that things don't go horribly wrong, incase my computer explodes) - $100+
    • Printing costs (self explanatory really. Will be going with the same printers as before, since their service was awesome) - $450-500
    • Merchandise creation (all the awesome little collectables like postcards, posters and whatnot, as well as advertising space and stuff) - $250 - 350
    • Paid help (my shader, Taala, is still in essence my employee, so I will need to allocate suitable wages for her work. I am also collaborating with other artists to make the top tier perks even better, so think of it as you're also paying THEM for incredible results!) - $400-500
    • General costs (postage, travel etc etc) - $100
    The perks for contributing to the campaign include lots and LOTS of awesome art, including an entire comic with your character (click here to check out the last contributor's comic) and of course, a copy of Part 2 when it is complete! 
    As I mentioned before, the FERAL comic is built upon fans and as such, community inclusion is something I very much enjoy doing. For example, check out the people who contributed in the last campaign and got an extras role in the comic itself:-

    This time around, I'm going to be creating something more personal that you can touch. All $100 perks will be turned into physical badges, so you can literally wear your badassery. They will still be featured in the book, placed in the crowds and such, making your character a living, breathing part of the FERAL world.
    It has to be known that you don't NEED to be a furry to enjoy this. Humans, though rare, are welcome in this world and are seen as no different (since my roots are in manga, I have the skills to draw human characters).
    Check the Gallery to see other examples of perk commissions from the last campaign!

    What happens to all the excess money? Well, your devotion and constant volleys of Dollar bill Hadokens will not go unrewarded. I've set up some stretch goals to ensure that I don't just pile up money in a bathtub and bathe in it.

    Beforehand though, I'll make this clear - none of the initial $2000 will be used for living expenses. However, more money means more stuff, and indeed I will likely be able to allocate the excess money to ease the commissions load, thus leaving more time to work solely on the comic and nothing else!
    Also, for every stretch goal I hit, I will add another 10 books to the final print amount, meaning more FERAL for everyone!
    • $3000 - FERAL part 1 second wind! I'll print off a second run of 100 FERAL part 1 books, so if you missed the initial hype, you can jump right back on it! $3000 GOAL IS HIT!!! AN EXTRA 100 FERAL VOLUME 1 WILL BE PRINTED OFF, AS WELL AS 10 ADDITIONAL VOLUME 2 BOOKS!
    • $4000 - FERAL: Bigger and Better! I'll print off a run of A4 versions of both the first and second books, both with more pages featuring additional artwork throughout! $4000 GOAL IS HIT!!! 25 LIMITED EDITION A4 BOOKS OF BOTH VOLUME 1 AND 2 WILL BE PRINTED, AS WELL AS ANOTHER 10 OF THE ORIGINAL VOLUME 2, MAKING THE SECOND VOLUME 120 BOOKS STRONG!
    • $5000 - FERAL Short stories! Hayley isn't the only one that needs fleshing out! For reaching this goal, I'll make and print a limited run of a book featuring short stories of the current top tier, where they came from, their stories and a deeper look into their lives...
    • $6000 - FERAL physical miniatures! This amount will fund casting and creation of exclusive and awesome marble-look plastic 5'' miniatures of the protagonist Hayley, which will be added to the 'Sleeper Hold' ($250) perk and also available for general sale.

        When I completed the first book, I felt myself become stronger and smarter. However, this knowledge and experience brought many unseen hurdles into view, thus even with my sudden boost of passion, I tread more warily this time.
        Of the many problems that a self employed freelance comic artist encounters, here are the ones that are most dangerous...
        • Funding not reaching its goal - The worst case scenario with this is that the comic is severely delayed. Since I opted for fixed funding this time around to maximise backing funds, it also means I could get literally nothing at all. This in turn means that I will need to look for other ways to get the money to do everything, mostly by doing other art, meaning the comic is put on the backburner for a few months (or maybe more...).
        • Not finishing by the deadline - Well, I've made a grand promise to complete this by the end of May. I am fully capable of doing this, now I have real help to take load off my shoulders. To help speed things up, I am streamlining the creation process using Manga Studio, which allows me to see a constant PDF view of my comic, meaning I can plan ahead with double page spreads and the such, eliminating guess work and also discarding the need for outsourcing the print PDF creation.
        • Unforeseen computer and hardware problems - My computer is pretty old, my Wacom tablet even older. Both have run at a consistently good click since I got them early 2008 - 2009, what with near constant use and abuse. However just because nothing IS wrong doesn't mean something CAN'T go wrong. All of FERAL is created digitally, and as such if one piece of hardware dies, the project is brought to a grinding halt. With the new hard drive, I can ensure that the project itself is spared in the unlikely event of the death of my computer, and my current model of tablet is cheap to replace. I have prepared for the worst, and like above, the worst thing that will happen are severe delays.
        --------------------------------
        In the unlikely event that one of the above happens, you will all be noted as soon as possible. That said, nothing will stop this project from happening. It will only be slowed, never halted, so regardless of what the world decides to throw at me, FERAL will be made!

        Not all of you are capable of putting cash into the campaign and there's nothing wrong with that at all! Sometimes, recognition and exposure trumps funding, so why not give us a like on Facebook, follow on Twitter, bookmark the Main Website and tell all your friends and family!
        Also, there is also an option to save on the digital copy of the first book by sharing on social networking. Simply go to the payhip site and click on the sharing button (below the buy button) to get a cool discount!
        Also, totally check out the other artists who contribute their time to my project, like Neko-Maya and Taala, since they deserve special mention for being awesome and mega talented in their own right!
        --------------------------------
        So that's it. Thankyou for taking the time to look over, consider and contribute to one of the most passionate projects I've ever created, one that will continue on to an awesome final conclusion.
        As always guys, take care and see you at the next fight!
story_txt:
Hey there, Matt Warwick's the name. I am an artist going by the handle 'DrDubz,' and I specialise in hyperkinetic action art. As such, I am pouring this expertise into an ongoing comic series called 'FERAL', which features a lot of head kicking, coupled with a narrative of personal development, sportsmanship, and the dangers of ego and pride.





FERAL follows an unknown hustler named Hayley Rosa as she endeavours to settle a score with a man named Dr.Brandt, the only fighter to beat her. To do that, she enlists in the city-wide circuit of fighters known as 'Feral', and starts to climb the ranks. As she does so, the journey begins to change everything she believes she is capable of, unleashing dangerous parts of her she never knew she had...
This is the second book in the FERAL series, which will see the circuit drag out more of Hayley's darker sides as she struggles to find her footing whilst pushing against the strength of the city's top tier. 


Of course, readers of the first book will be treated to even more bone-crunching action, as the menacing Tiziano makes his true debut... Click here to grab yourself a PDF download of the first comic if you've yet to experience FERAL. It's 150+ pages, packed with intense art, great characters and eye popping action!

As I mentioned before, the FERAL comic is built upon fans and as such, community inclusion is something I very much enjoy doing. For example, check out the people who contributed in the last campaign and got an extras role in the comic itself:-






This time around, I'm going to be creating something more personal that you can touch. All $100 perks will be turned into physical badges, so you can literally wear your badassery. They will still be featured in the book, placed in the crowds and such, making your character a living, breathing part of the FERAL world.
It has to be known that you don't NEED to be a furry to enjoy this. Humans, though rare, are welcome in this world and are seen as no different (since my roots are in manga, I have the skills to draw human characters).

Check the Gallery to see other examples of perk commissions from the last campaign!



What happens to all the excess money? Well, your devotion and constant volleys of Dollar bill Hadokens will not go unrewarded. I've set up some stretch goals to ensure that I don't just pile up money in a bathtub and bathe in it.Beforehand though, I'll make this clear - none of the initial $2000 will be used for living expenses. However, more money means more stuff, and indeed I will likely be able to allocate the excess money to ease the commissions load, thus leaving more time to work solely on the comic and nothing else!
Also, for every stretch goal I hit, I will add another 10 books to the final print amount, meaning more FERAL for everyone!

I'll print off a run of A4 versions of both the first and second books, both with more pages featuring additional artwork throughout! $4000 GOAL IS HIT!!! 25 LIMITED EDITION A4 BOOKS OF BOTH VOLUME 1 AND 2 WILL BE PRINTED, AS WELL AS ANOTHER 10 OF THE ORIGINAL VOLUME 2, MAKING THE SECOND VOLUME 120 BOOKS STRONG!



$5000 - FERAL Short stories! Hayley isn't the only one that needs fleshing out! For reaching this goal, I'll make and print a limited run of a book featuring short stories of the current top tier, where they came from, their stories and a deeper look into their lives...

$6000 - FERAL physical miniatures! This amount will fund casting and creation of exclusive and awesome marble-look plastic 5'' miniatures of the protagonist Hayley, which will be added to the 'Sleeper Hold' ($250) perk and also available for general sale.



  



When I completed the first book, I felt myself become stronger and smarter. However, this knowledge and experience brought many unseen hurdles into view, thus even with my sudden boost of passion, I tread more warily this time.

Funding not reaching its goal - The worst case scenario with this is that the comic is severely delayed. Not all of you are capable of putting cash into the campaign and there's nothing wrong with that at all! Sometimes, recognition and exposure trumps funding, so why not give us a like on Facebook, follow on Twitter, bookmark the Main Website and tell all your friends and family!
Also, there is also an option to save on the digital copy of the first book by sharing on social networking. Simply go to the payhip site and click on the sharing button (below the buy button) to get a cool discount!
Also, totally check out the other artists who contribute their time to my project, like Neko-Maya and Taala, since they deserve special mention for being awesome and mega talented in their own right!

As always guys, take care and see you at the next fight!

story:
Read Ch 1 for FREE | Click Here

WHAT IS THE ELEMENTAL BALANCE?

The Elemental Balance is a story about 4 individuals from around the world who gain the powers of the Elements. They are known as the Elementals. They don’t know how or why they got these powers, but they all died from a natural disaster caused by the Element's energy they harness.

The story follows their journey of finding one another in hopes of unraveling the truth behind their powers and its connection to their resurrection. Instead, they discover that they're being hunted by a mysterious force!

The story has been written by Zain Shenwari with artwork done by Luke Horsman.  All of the artwork and most of the coloring and lettering have been completed and now all that remains is...

...your support to fund the prints for Chapter 4

 

So...What's the Story Like? If you've enjoyed shows like NBC's "Heroes" and Netflix's show "Sense8" then you would definitely enjoy The Elemental Balance. 

ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 4 | FIRED UP

They say LOVE is like FIRE because when you're in love the heart ignites. But when the heart breaks, it burns! 

Chapter 4 of the Elemental Balance takes us to the other side of the world to Chile, South America. A country known for its dense population of volcanoes, surrounding its border by the ring of fire.  A suitable birthplace for the Fire Elemental.

Adriana and Lucia have best friends since childhood but are polar opposites of one another. Adriana prides herself in being good, while Lucia could care less about her image. Growing up, their parents nicked name them "Angelita y Diablita" or translated in English as "little Angel & little Devil".

After one of them goes through a heartbreak , the other helps by suggesting going on a hiking trip up a volcano.

 

What could possibly go wrong?

Discover the secrets revealed at the pinnacle of a Volcano in Chapter 4, Fired Up.

Below are the items listed under the "Perks"

 

Paper Action Figures


 

Digital Comics

 

Physical Comics

 

Signature (Signed Comics | Add-On)

 

Book Marks

 

Wristbands

 

Metal Pins

 

Necklace (From the comic book)

 

Fire Elemental Button

Stickers

Mini Posters (7" x 10.5")

...And more ITEMS to come...

CRITIC REVIEWS: 

CJPendragon from "But Why Tho?".  Click here for the full review.

"The Elemental Balance is a weirdly awesome mash-up of science, superpowers, and humanity that will leave most readers vying for more. It’s well-written, with just enough suspense to have a thrill for your experience."

Steven Leitman from "Reading with a Flight Ring". Click here for the full review.

Part of the joy of reviewing books is when people send me their books and I have no idea who they are or what they do. It is that surprise moment when you feel like you’ve discovered something fantastic. This is the kind of book I tell you about and seek folks this out at conventions.

Mike from "Chico Comics Page". Click here for the full review.

"In comics there are indie publishers, and then there are indie publishers. There was confidence in the writing, the art, and overall design of the book. The art in here is fantastic. Everything feels like a comic I should be reading off the stands." 

Trever from "Frags and Beer". Click here for the full review.

"I enjoyed every panel of this book, and hope to see a lot more from Luke. The pages have a lot of movement and detail. The characters look great against wonderful backgrounds. The pencils are up there with the best that I’ve seen from any company, large or indie. This book is definitely worth checking out." 

ABOUT ME: 

Hi, my name is Zain and I’m the writer for The Elemental Balance. I’ve always had a passion for writing stories. In fact, my first story “Game Plan” was written to impress my wife. Spoiler alert, it paid off! I find it rewarding to bring entertainment to people, that’s my niche! My style of storytelling is grounded in reality but, nonetheless, is fiction. Characters are set in unrealistic situations but have very relatable emotions. Imagine if someone could achieve greatness with a determined will, how would they react if they had powers? This is what my stories are rooted in….emotions! 

 

ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Luke Horsman is an extremely talented artist from the UK. He is well versed in many forms of art mediums. In fact, Luke did the pencils, ink, and coloring for the first three chapters. His artwork has truly brought the characters from the script to life. 

It's been a blast working with him. We mesh really well. I'm particular with scenes and visual symbolism and he's keen on creating eye-catching, bold illustrations. Together we made an excellent team!  

Check out Luke's website for awesome artwork by clicking here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes budgets are tight, and we understand if you can't contribute.  But you still can help us out tremendously if you get the word out.

The easiest way to do that is by using the Indiegogo share tools. 

Contact Us

Need some help? We're always happy to answer any questions. You can contact us through Indiegogo or send us an email at inzanecomics@gmail.com.  Or you can visit us on our website www.inzanecomics.com.

Or...Visit our Social Media sites: 

 

 

We here at inZane Comics would like to thank you for your support and hope to bring you amazing comics for years to come!

story:
Thank you note from the Creator in Advance:

My name is Gabriel Hernandez creator of ghcomics inspired by recent events to tell truth along with fiction that will make you laugh, smile, cringe, love, and maybe even cry a little.

My background is I am a proud Texan, born and raised in San Antonio now residing in Dallas, Texas.  I started writing at a very young age but started applying 5 years ago my concepts after my mother passed away. I recognized that writing was an outlet for me to deal with her death as she is deeply missed. I am also proud father of 3 boys Joshua, Matthew, Mariano, and a granddaughter Citlali who I adore and will continue to do this for them.

This comic will be first of many as I'm looking to raise to cover cost as far as printing, promoting, advertising, and helping others. My passion is to tell your real Super Hero Stories through my website www.ghcomics.com. I have learned we have super heroes everyday around us like your mom, father, coach, and pastor you name it. I want to help promote your comic ideas no matter what age or gender as we will tell our Super Hero stories together. My website is new so please allow me some time to create a user friendly and low cost effective way to create. 

We are looking for the Elite 50 at $40.00 for a Signed Comic, Coffee Mug, T-shirt up to XL, and a special thank you with your name on the comic itself. Please see other contributions as they are all special to me and surprises will come along for all backers. It's not about the money for me as we are only looking for $500.00 for a successful campaign to launch. So please contribute and be a part this revolutionary team of ghcomics as we are just getting started. 

Feel free to email me ghcomics@yahoo.com if you need assistance or have any questions I can help and support any ideas you have. Please allow me time to respond promptly. I like would to thank you all for your kind support and backing welcome to the Family. 

Kind Regards,

Gabe Hernandez

story:
AUTISM VS ALIENS

Autism vs Aliens is a graphic novel series, written in collaboration by Daniel Wolther and Jaime A. Heidel. It tells the story of a young adult with autism named Jason. After his family and all other neurotypicals are abducted via mind control by a corrupt alien species, Jason finds himself accepted into an informal military with the intention of rescuing those who have been lost!

OUR GOAL

We hope to provide a story to not only entertain but inspire and empower those on the autism spectrum and those with other disabilities!

FREEKING COMICS

FreeKing Comics consists of only two people at the current time. However ,we're hoping to branch out and hire more talented individuals, although we're not able to, due to financial restriants. This is where you come in!

YOU CAN HELP!

We've set up a list of rewards for all of our Indiegogo backers.
story_txt:
AUTISM VS ALIENS
Autism vs Aliens is a graphic novel series, written in collaboration by Daniel Wolther and Jaime A. Heidel. It tells the story of a young adult with autism named Jason. After his family and all other neurotypicals are abducted via mind control by a corrupt alien species, Jason finds himself accepted into an informal military with the intention of rescuing those who have been lost!
OUR GOAL
We hope to provide a story to not only entertain but inspire and empower those on the autism spectrum and those with other disabilities!
FREEKING COMICS
FreeKing Comics consists of only two people at the current time. However ,we're hoping to branch out and hire more talented individuals, although we're not able to, due to financial restriants. This is where you come in!
YOU CAN HELP!
We've set up a list of rewards for all of our Indiegogo backers.

story:
UPDATE

We’ve done it! We’ve hit out 50% minimal target! ISSUE 1 IS GETTING MADE!

WHAT IS THIS?

A 28 page full colour comic book with stunning artwork and a great, original story; the first of 5 issues making up graphic novel “Return of the French Guy”.

WHAT’S IT ABOUT?

In 2003 we invited you to ‘rewrite the rules’ with “Shotgun”, “3 Seconds” and “Ex”, three short films making up Star Wars fan film favourite “The Unwritten Rule Trilogy”. Now the ‘Unlikely Jedi’ are back in graphic novel/comic “Return of the French Guy”, a homage to Star Wars and superhero mythology, telling the story of four ordinary guys who unwittingly discover the Force is real! The story jumps back and forth between the life-changing events surrounding their Force-powered ‘awakening’ and the present day, where they are forced to confront the mistakes of the past and struggle through conflict and hilarity to find their place in a world that will never understand them.

Issue 1 begins a year after “Ex”, reintroducing the protagonists of RYAN, MICHAEL and JON, who are hard at work honing their skills to prepare for an unknown, ominous threat that only Michael believes is real.

WHO IS MAKING IT?

Ryan Brain - Co-Creator, Project Manager & Writer (www.ryanbrain.co.uk)

Jonathan Carey - Co-Creator, Web Manager & Creative Consultant

Abel Garcia – Artist (www.abelgarciablog.blogspot.co.uk)

 

HISTORY OF THE PROJECT

"Return of the French Guy" started out as a feature-length sequel to "The Unwritten Rule Trilogy", which was a series of Star Wars fan films we made back in 2003 and 2004. It started out as just a single film - "Shotgun" - but we enjoyed making it so much and it was so well received by our friends and the fan film community that we had to make more. By the time we completed "Ex", the third part in the trilogy, we already had ideas for a two-hour epic that would explore the questions we'd always avoided - who were these guys? How can they use the Force? Where did they get lightsabers? What the hell is going on?! "Return of the French Guy" was meant to answer those questions.

Unfortunately, we were in our final years of university and our coursework had to take priority. Once we graduated, life just sort of swept us away from one another, and despite a deep desire to tell this story, we missed our window. So for the past few years we've been trying to figure out an alternative way of telling this story that doesn’t require taking a few months off work to shoot a film. A couple of years ago we realised that it would make an amazing episodic story, and a graphic novel/comic was the perfect fit.

We began rewriting the script to fit a 4-6 panel format designed to be released in weekly instalments, but we still had one fundamental problem: we can’t draw! So we started searching for artists who would design the characters and create a library of assets that we could use to piece each page together ourselves. Some very kind and talented artists donated their time and efforts to this endeavour, but it was impossible to get them as invested in the project as we wanted them to be. So despite the best of intentions, that idea ultimately failed.

And then crowd funding happened.

BOOM! It was everywhere! And suddenly this story that we'd been trying to tell for years and had all but given up on, suddenly and unexpectedly had one last hope. YOU are our one last hope. Our only hope.

 

WHAT YOU ARE HELPING TO CREATE

You are helping to create the first of what we hope to be a 5 issue comic book story making up graphic novel “Return of the French Guy”. This is the only place that you’ll be able to get your hands on a physical copy of this comic, and quantities are LIMITED! Once they’re gone they’ll never be available again, so grab yours now while you have the chance!

 

HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT US

There are two things you can do to help make "Return of the French Guy" a reality: You can make a pledge, choosing from one of the options on the right, for which you'll receive an awesome reward. And the other thing you can do is simply tell people about the project! Like us on Facebook, Follow Us on Twitter and share and retweet our status updates. We need pledges to make this project happen, and for that we need to spread the word, so any way you can help do that, please do!

 

REWARDS

In exchange for a pledge of any amount, you’ll receive something awesome, and the more you pledge the more you get!

Pledge only £1 ($2)

  • Your choice of three beautiful Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

Pledge £5 ($8)

  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
  • All Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

Pledge £10 ($16)

  • A physical, signed copy of Issue 1!
  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
  • All Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

Pledge £15 ($24)

  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
  • All Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

  • Your choice of three amazing t-shirt designs in high-res PSD format that you can use to print your own garments!
  • A black & white digital portrait in high-res PSD format of your favourite character, or yourself or a friend drawn in the style of Unlikely Jedi!

  • The same full colour digital portrait in high-res PSD format

  • Your choice of three amazing t-shirt designs in high-res PSD format that you can use to print your own garments!
  • A black & white digital portrait in high-res PSD format of your favourite character, or yourself or a friend drawn in the style of Unlikely Jedi!
  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
