Pledge £100 ($160)

  • Yourself written into the story as a background or supporting character!
  • A full colour digital portrait in high-res PSD format of yourself, a friend or your favourite character in the style of Unlikely Jedi!
  • Help decide how the pitch video ends!
  • Your choice of three amazing t-shirt designs in high-res PSD format that you can use to print your own garments!
  • A black & white digital portrait in high-res PSD format of your favourite character, or yourself or a friend drawn in the style of Unlikely Jedi!
  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
  • All Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

Pledge £150 ($240) and get EVERYTHING! All digital rewards! All physical rewards!

  • Yourself written into the story as a background or supporting character!
  • A full colour digital portrait in high-res PSD format of yourself, a friend or your favourite character in the style of Unlikely Jedi, PRINTED ON A T-SHIRT!
  • The same full colour digital portrait in high-res PSD format
  • Unlikely Jedi skin for your phone, ipad, tablet, e-reader, ipod, laptop or game console (your choice or device and image!)
  • Help decide how the pitch video ends!
  • A limited edition Unlikely Jedi t-shirt!
  • All three amazing t-shirt designs in high-res PSD format that you can use to print your own garments!
  • A black & white digital portrait in high-res PSD format of your favourite character, or yourself or a friend drawn in the style of Unlikely Jedi!
  • A physical, signed copy of Issue 1!
  • Complete PDF or CBR of Issue 1!
  • All Unlikely Jedi desktop wallpapers!
  • Your name on the Thank You page of the book!

 

Want a combination of rewards? Just choose the primary reward you want and then add the difference for the other ones, and let us know exactly what you'd like!

 

LEGAL DISCLAIMER

“Unlikely Jedi” does not take place in the Star Wars universe, nor does it contain any characters created by LucasFilm Ltd. Beyond the use of the word Jedi and similar references to Star Wars, “Return of the French Guy” is an original story, a homage to a cultural phenomenon. At worst, it could be considered fan fiction, which LucasFilm Ltd. has historically been supportive of.

Any and all funding we receive through Indiegogo will be used to produce the Unlikely Jedi comic/graphic novel and related promotional material.

Unlikely Jedi is not made, distributed, or supported by LucasFilm Ltd. and/or its licensors.

Jedi is a Trademark of LucasFilm Ltd. Star Wars, the Star Wars logo, all names and pictures of Star Wars characters, vehicles and any other Star Wars related items are registered trademarks and/or copyrights of Lucasfilm Ltd., or their respective trademark and copyright holders.

 

FAQ

What happens if you don't hit your target? Will you be able to provide all the rewards?

Yes, absolutely! As long as we hit 50% of our target, we still get to make the full 28 page first issue, and provide all the promised rewards for backers, but we'll have to make a sacrifice in terms of quality - Abel will just produce each page in black and white, leaving it up to Jon and Ryan to decide if they want to colour each one in themselves or just release the comic as-is.

If we don't hit 50% then we will provide all rewards first (as much as is possible without the budget to complete the first issue) and then make as much of the comic as we can!

So what happens now if we get more than 50%?

We'll improve the quality of issue 1 and make as much of issue 2 as we possibly can before setting up another campaign to get the rest made!

Why does the video talk about Kickstarter at the end?

When we filmed it, we originally intended to post the video on Kickstarter, and we weren't able to get back together to re-shoot it for Indiegogo. Hopefully it doesn't really matter!

story:
hi

my name is baraka noel. i am currently on my 2nd national tour. check out every show from the tour, if you like. (i try to make em different)

my wife has been traveling with me, but cannot continue. our vehicle is in need of, perhaps - $1000-$2000 of work, to correct a faulty transmission.

(interestingly, perhaps - the transmission failed on the car we lived in on our first tour. that one lasted 13 months, but if the car hadn.t bailed it would probably still be going on.)

i make art. i run a show on the central coast of California. i had this crazy idea for a cooperative art space, which is currently in San Francisco and known as Merchants of Reality.

i once threw an eight day festival in the Bay Area. i.ve dropped a few hip hop records that some people thought were pretty amazing.

i am tired.

i have never really tried to make money. i have none. this tour requires more time than exists every day. i know how to do the work. but i could use help. here.s a list of upcoming shows ...

i believe that my work is worth more than nothing. i.ve worked my hardest to uplift communities and have certainly made mistakes in the past. i am committed to a number of shows across the country. i hope to be able to make it to each and every one - i never voluntarily cancel a show.

what do i need? a vehicle and enough funds to meet the basic needs of the tour:
  •  gasoline
  •  the tools of production
  •  promotion
  •  incentives to employ a booking and management team
  •  routine vehicular maintenance
  •  daily costs of food, shelter & showers
  •  wifi - rent @ cafes and coffee shops
  •  weather appropriate clothing
  •  time to book shows that pay more than nothing
  •  incidentals for show production
  •  the occasional drink at a bar (to be accepted into the room at an open mic)
  •  space in which to record
  •  time
  •  a $ cushion for unforeseen circumstances
  • & other costs you may, perhaps, imagine.

i am in debt to friends, family, and a hospital. i hope that my work - to which i have dedicated myself for more than ten years - can be sustainable. i am losing faith.
if this  project works: i believe i can succeed professionally as a performer in a sustainable manner. i have proven this in the past.

i can offer:
  • Music - so much dope music & some really weird music too. 
  • a show - for the right price i will come and rock a show for you. 
  • a commissioned piece of writing on a subject / for a person of your choice
  • a haiku postcard from the road
  • there are books - hand bound, gorgeously written books
  • a set dedicated to you (we record every set)
  • a personal skype show
  • a collaboration
  • soft sculptures of any object you desire
  • wonderful paintings of nature and tragedy
  • other stuff, and

we might be able to even work out a dvd.

got questions? call me: 301.452.2355


i have seen my work uplift communities and expand art forms. For Example:
  •  Merchants Of Reality helped artists fend for themselves and work affordably.
  •  Laugh Louder (on the Central Coast) is still paying comics for their work and bringing new energy into the Central Coast scene.
  •  My first two albums made a small but significant impact on the hip hop community.
  •  My crew, theUnreal, has engendered homage across the continent of North America.

it will take time to build the shows that can become sustainable. i am relying on the kindness of family, friends and strangers to over come this. simple things - food, shelter, show promotion, booking help  (i offer a commission to whoever can book me the type of shows my tour requires & a blue print for how to book these shows)


i plan to reach out to hotels - beginning with ones i have already featured at - to build showcases in their bars and restaurants, to support their profit structure and provide temporary shelter on this journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • tell people about the work & link them to the sites.
  • encourage them to contribute and check out the shows.
  • look into other campaigns that you might be more willing to support.

http://emelialoomis.tumblr.com/

https://barakanoel.wordpress.com

barakanoel@gmail.com

 time

 a $ cushion for unforeseen circumstances

& other costs you may, perhaps, imagine.


i am in debt to friends, family, and a hospital. i hope that my work - to which i have dedicated myself for more than ten years - can be sustainable. i am losing faith.
if this  project works: i believe i can succeed professionally as a performer in a sustainable manner. i have proven this in the past.


i can offer:
Music - so much dope music & some really weird music too. 
a show - for the right price i will come and rock a show for you.  a commissioned piece of writing on a subject / for a person of your choice
a haiku postcard from the road
there are books - hand bound, gorgeously written books
a set dedicated to you (we record every set)
a personal skype show
a collaboration

soft sculptures of any object you desire


wonderful paintings of nature and tragedy

other stuff, and

we might be able to even work out a dvd.
got questions? call me: 301.452.2355


i have seen my work uplift communities and expand art forms. For Example:


 Merchants Of Reality helped artists fend for themselves and work affordably.

 Laugh Louder (on the Central Coast) is still paying comics for their work and bringing new energy into the Central Coast scene.

 My first two albums made a small but significant impact on the hip hop community.

 My crew, theUnreal, has engendered homage across the continent of North America.


it will take time to build the shows that can become sustainable. i am relying on the kindness of family, friends and strangers to over come this. simple things - food, shelter, show promotion, booking help  (i offer a commission to whoever can book me the type of shows my tour requires & a blue print for how to book these shows)


i plan to reach out to hotels - beginning with ones i have already featured at - to build showcases in their bars and restaurants, to support their profit structure and provide temporary shelter on this journey.


Other Ways You Can Help

 
tell people about the work & link them to the sites.
encourage them to contribute and check out the shows. look into other campaigns that you might be more willing to support. 
 http://emelialoomis.tumblr.com/

https://barakanoel.wordpress.com

barakanoel@gmail.com

story:
Only 10$ for a digital pre-order!

First newspaper article about Ash is out! Click to see a mostly-finished frame! http://www.northernlife.ca/news/lifestyle/2012/...

Summary:

Johnathan Ash is a detective.

Well, used to be.

Fifteen years ago, while investigating a string of grisly murders, Detective Johnathan Ash was run down while following up on a lead. Fortunately, a passerby saw the incident and called an ambulance. He was rushed to the hospital, and after intensive surgery, was lucky to survive, and with only a few side-effects.

For one, a tiny shred of scrap metal had been imbedded in his brain, and could not be removed without risking further damage. For two, the damage to his brain had caused him to develop clairvoyance, mild telekinetic powers, and a limited psychic ability.

With his new-found senses, he came to the horrible realization that the killer was none other then his own brother, Quinton Ash. Leading the police to Quinton was no small task, having to convince them that his 'flash of insight' was valid, but eventually Ash won out. Unfortunately, rather then be caught, Quinton sat down, poured a nice glass of scotch, and set his house on fire around himself.

The case was closed, and with it, Ash's career. His 'sudden realization' looked more like an admission of guilt rather then a moment of brilliance. With no control over his ability to 'read minds', and no way to prove himself, the chief of police suspected Ash was an accomplice to his brother's crimes. Besides, who ever heard of a mind reader? An investigation was launched, and Ash's badge and gun were taken away permanently. His name tarnished and his reputation shot, his life fell apart around him. His wife left him, taking everything with her, leaving Ash to have to take a job as a cab driver while living out of a shady motel in the worst part of town.

Fifteen years later, another string of shockingly similar murders takes place, and the police force once again suspects Ash. Sending in a rookie detective, who happens to be a cold-hearted cop with past connection to Ash, a web of intrigue and conspiracy is suddenly revealed, and it's up to Ash and his unlikely ally to solve the case...

And maybe, just maybe, get Ash's badge back.



I say, what's all this about, then?

Why, I'll tell you what it's about!

'Ash' is a graphic novel that I've written, and want to show the world. Unfortunately, since my drawing skills are about on-par with that of the average two year old, the standard approach just isn't going to cut it. But, while spending some time at a photography store a while back, it hit me: Why not use pictures instead of drawings? I can still tell a fantastic story, and with the right people involved, 'Ash' will come out looking like a movie! Well, a movie that you read.

...Which is just called a 'book'. You know what? Not important.

What is important is how much work is going into this project, is going to be put into the project, and how great I think the end result will be!

Who the devil are you?

I'm Batman.

Well, no, sadly. But, who I am is Jesse Jordan, a freelance writer based out of Sudbury, Ontario. 'Freelance' is a polite way to say I work a ton, but make  little money. But, writing has been my lifelong dream, and I'm way okay with that. I can be found on IMDB as the writer for the upcomming feature film 'Luxeon', (http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2400397/), and all across the interwebs for writing articles and bit pieces on various websites, podcasts and organisations. I'm currently working on two more screenplays, various short films, stories and videos that will be posted up all over the place!

Alright then. Why are you here, and why should I give you my money?

Well, to be honest, it's because I can't afford to do this project on my own! For starters, Printing the book will cost roughty four thousand dollars. Advertising will be close to five thousand, then there's the supplies, food and transportation for the cast and crew, locations, lighting, costumes, props, the website...

There's a LOT that needs to be paid for. I've managed to assemble a fantastic group of actors/models, and some lovely photographers who also think my idea is pretty fantastic, and we will do the project regardless, but without funding, it's not going to be able to get off the ground =/

Wait, you want how much... For a book?

15,000 is a lot, I know! But here's the thing; This project is being worked on and produced as if it were a movie; Sets, lighting, locations, actors, props... Everything! Because of that, it's a lot more expensive then just any graphic novel.

Thankfully, effects will be done digitally, but still. That's a lot of stuff to pay for!

Take a look at this list, and hopefully you'll understand why I'm trying to raise so much. In order of importance:

PRINTING AND PUBLISHING COSTS:

-Will cost, according to an exact quote, 3,971.00$ after tax. Why so much? Because we need very high-quality printing to get a really good rendition of these photos!

QUITE HONESTLY, if we can raise this 4K, I'll be more then happy. Why? Because with printing paid for, the project will still happen! Even if everything else has to begged, borrowed, or stolen (Not litteraly...), the project will still move forward as long as printing is paid for!

ADVERTISING:

-Between web advertising, social media marketing, ads on various webcomic sites, and some flyers and banners for the local bookstores, the amount needed for advertising is about 5,000.00$. The more money that goes into advertising, the better though, because advertising the book is what will make it sell!

CAST AND CREW:

-If I can, I'd love to reward the crew for their time and effort. Once the bases are covered as far as printing and perks goes, and the advertising is satisfactory, I'd like to be able to pay my actors, photographers, and digital artists if I can! They aren't expecting anything from this, and neither am I, but if we can raise the money, then so be it!

FINALLY... THE COST OF PERKS!

-A portion of the proceeds of this indiegogo will actually just go right back to thanking you for your donation! Once you figure in printing limited edition hardcovers, the posters, shipping and handling, etc., it should come out to around 1,500.00$, give or take.

What's in it for you?

The thrill of completing my dream of having written a comic book! I'm not doing this for money, as nice as it would be to become a writer as a living. This is a dream project, and I'm doing everything I can to make it happen!

To that end, If we happen to raise more money then what actually ends up being needed, there will be more perks given out as a thank you for making this happen!

What's in it for us, eh?

Every time you donate, you get a little piece of my heart to take home with you, you beautiful person, you <3.

But seriously, there are some fantastic perks that range from a personalised 'thank you' card, to actually getting to appear in the graphic novel! Each and every donation will seriously make a big impact on how possible this project will become. Not to mention giving you spot in the credits as a contributor!

And now, a word from our gentleman host


This project is a culmination of over a year's worth of work for me, and the shooting for the first few scenes started as of July 8th, and will continue on to well... As long as it takes!

Without your help, this project will finish, and go no where for a long, long time, until I can somehow amass all this money on my own. Will it happen? Eventually. I'm committed to this project 100%. Will it happen before, say, 2014? I have no idea. With full funding, if we get it, this project aims to be released February 2013, and will be...

The world's first (photo)graphic novel released!


No, seriously. If I'm able to get full funding, Ash will be the first graphic novel to be made, published and released using still photographs with digital post edits rather then art for all of it's panels!

story:
Watch a special video message from the author entitled: "Just Create! - Discovering Yourself Before You Die" located in "The Creator(s)" section below to find out exactly why we`ve decided to launch this Indiegogo campaign, and why I highly encourage everyone to reach out and embrace their creative talents!

Updates!

2/11 - We`ve just completed some awesome promotional sketches for both "The Ryukage" comic series and "C.D.U.L.O.: The Outer Rim" , which you can find below!

Project Wild FIRE is a series of creative media projects based on the sci-fi / action novel; "Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage", which was published in 2007. You can find the Amazon.com and iTunes links for the first book below.

                                          

  • Official Website : http://cre8tivemv.com/wildFIRE/
  • Amazon.com : http://www.amazon.com/Wild-FIRE-Legend-Ryukage-Book/dp/0977813606
  • Lulu.com : http://www.lulu.com/shop/walter-ragland/wild-fire-legend-of-the-ryukage-clans-book-1-volume-1/ebook/product-17507870.html
  • iTunes : https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/wild-fire/id458694269?mt=11

Originally intended as a 13 episode drama for Japanese TV, "The Ryukge" is now being converted into a 26 Issue Comic Series (storyline completed) that will stand as a prequel to the events of the first book "Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage".

Genres : Martial Arts, Action, Fantasy Supernatural, Science Fiction

Feel : Serious / Gory / Dark

Formats : Online Manga (black and white comic series for promotional usage), iOS Application (full color pages with animations, bonus content and  interactive elements for download on iPhone and iPad).


SYNOPSIS : Hitoshi Morita is a traveling ronin samurai and trader. After a particularly long journey across southern Asia; he finally returns home to his wife and six lovely daughters. However; their happy family reunion ends in a fiery bloodbath when one of mankind`s most sinister and ancient evils awakens to once again wreak havoc upon the world. Seeking to wipe out the remaining descendants of their old nemesis, Ayami Nishiyama, once and for all; the demons relentlessly attack Hitoshi and his family. But who are these mysterious warrior monks who have come to balance the scales? Will the blood of the Nishiyama clan be enough to contain the sinister evil that is about to be unleashed once more upon the world? The battle for mankind`s future begins now!

Those of you who are new to Wild FIRE, please feel free to view the FIRST 10 Pages of The Ryukage comic online for FREE! If you like what you see, come back and support our campaign.

Follow us at: WILD FIRE SITE | TWITTER | FACEBOOK

Sample Page 1

Sample Page 2

The Ryukage (Main Cast) - Promo

We`ve already penciled and inked the First 10 Pages of ISSUE #1 and are currently working on the next 10 pages in addition to Programming the iOS Version of the Comic for the App Store.

However; this project is 100% creator-owned, so until now the funding for this comic and all other projects in the Extended Projects Overview below has been completely out-of-pocket; which I must admit is a bit tough to manage. So in order for this to to be a success, we need to ask for your generosity! Without YOU the chances this becoming a reality are very low indeed.

WHAT YOUR SUPPORT DOES : All money raised will go directly towards The Ryukage Comic & iOS App production & promotion costs and to give backers some cool rewards! Costs will include:

  • Paying the Comic Artist
  • Hiring our Assistant Comic Artist and Inker to work with us full-time (he only works with us part-time at the moment because we don`t have the funds to bring him fully on-board yet - but he`s good!)
  • Paying the Graphics Designer (logo/info)
  • Paying the iOS Development Costs (iPhone & iPad Versions)
  • Paying the printing & shipping costs of prints
  • Hiring an Editor (we really need one!)
  • Hiring an Admin Assistant to help keep track of and manage Contributor Perks (so that artists and I can just continue working on finishing the comics)
  • Paying the printing & shipping costs of t-shirts/mouse pads
  • Paying expenses for other promotional materials (multimedia, etc)

Our purpose is to complete the FIRST 10 ISSUES of this comic series in order to use them as marketing and promotional tools (while creating a strong fan base) for the related projects noted in the Expanded Project Overview section below.

IF THIS CAMPAIGN RAISES MORE THAN OUR TARGET for completion of the first comic series; we`d like to proceed immediately with production of the next project on the list, which is a 26 episode Flash Animated video series entitled; "C.D.U.L.O. : The Outer Rim" (details below in the Extended Projects Overview) plus finish writing the second novel of the series!

For that to happen, we sincerely need Your support!


Keith Gutierrez - Comic Artist / Illustrator

Hi! I’ve been doing illustrations for more than 10 years. As an avid fan of comic books/manga/graphic novels of all types, I don’t limit myself to a single genre, style or approach. I’m also a BIG fan of JRPGs, which give me a great deal of inspiration and ideas for my work. I like to push my limits with each new project I`m involved in to see how far can go. I sincerely believe that limiting one`s desire to progress would ultimately reduce one`s chances of learning new things; which in turn would cause their skills to rust.

As a freelance graphic artist; I engage in commission based projects, concept art, portrait drawings, illustrations for children’s books, graphic designs for mobile games and applications, website artwork, logo designs, 3D modeling of buildings: exterior and interiors, etc.

For more info and samples of my work, please feel free to check out my portfolio at:

www.k-e-i-t-h.deviantart.com

Undertaking this particular project has proven to be one of the most rewarding, challenging and fun learning experiences I`ve had in quite a while! The depth of the storyline and characters as well as the sheer scale of this overall project have given me a very rare opportunity to cut-loose and dive much deeper into exploring my artistic talents. We really do have a lot in store for you with this so I`m looking forward to completing this series and making it a HUGE success! But as mentioned in the video above; for that to happen we desperately need your help; therefore, I`d like to thank you all in advance for your contributions and support!

Chadvar Yordanov - Comic Artist / Illustrator / Animator

What you need to know about me probably can`t be found on a piece of paper; well at least not in words. I prefer to let my portfolio speak for itself. But to provide a little background; I finished a degree in traditional animation in 2012 and have been working as a freelance animator ever since. I specialize in concept art, storyboards and comic book illustrations and consistently complete works for various clients. I am an over-achiever with a tendency to put all my energy into my work. I`m always seeking new challenges, in order to improve my skills, while fueling my creativity with self-criticism, caffeine and nicotine. In the words of the famous Charles Bukowski: "Find something you love and let it kill you", that`s basically how I live.

To give you an idea of the quality of work your contributions will assist in adding to this project, feel free to stop by the links below and check out  samples of my work. This is the real McCoy; everything else is fugazy... fairy dust. Meaning that it doesn't really matter.

http://vimeo.com/chavdaryordanov

http://vimeo.com/chavdaryordanov

Like the other members of our team, I am also a big fan anime and manga, particularly the titles from the 80s and 90s that I grew up with. I love colorful characters, inventive and often crazy designs and the depth of stories with vast worlds to explore! Stories with a lot of fast-paced action will keep me glued to my seat for hours on end and “Project Wild FIRE” is no exception. After all, the main reasons I got involved in with The Ryukage project in the first place is because all these aspects are present in almost unhealthy doses!
If you find yourself reminiscing about the golden age of comics and anime; the days of lively and believable characters with deep and exciting story lines, or if you constantly find yourself asking - "Why don't they make them like that anymore?"; then this is the project that you should keep your eye on and support to your fullest capacity, because we really do have quite a lot of jaw-dropping excitement in store for you with this one. Support us and see watch us deliver a story that will both shake and satisfy you to the core!

Walter S. Ragland, Jr.  - Author / Creative Director

Hello, I`m the creator of the Wild FIRE series, iOS Applications / Game Developer and CEO of cre8tive Media Vault. You can learn more about me from my LinkedIn profile below:

http://jp.linkedin.com/pub/walter-ragland/4/1b0/928

Wild FIRE originally started off as a simple video game concept back in the late 1980`s and I`ve been working on this project now for over 20 years. Most of the content that you will find on the website or in the Extended Projects section were created by me in my spare time after working hours. That`s because I really love this story!

After an unexpected trip to the ER here in Tokyo at the end of 2012 (Nothing too serious and I`m 100% fine now), I decided to dedicate the rest of my life and energy to creating all of the wonderful things that I have locked away in my vivid imagination!

After a brief search, I`ve managed to track down some old friends of mine who are just as crazy and passionate about creating as I am. We have the same artistic aspirations - so here we are!

I want this project to not only be one that inspires a new wave of creativity in our mainstream media; but also something that encourages people to be their best and leave something of value behind for those who will come after us. This project is just the beginning of that journey.

Your contributions would hopefully be the catalyst to inspire a new generation of creative people with ideas and the courage to move us into a brighter future!

A video message from the author:

"Just Create! - Discovering Yourself Before You Die"

FOR CONTRIBUTING TO THIS PROJECT, YOU WOULD RECEIVE (See Sidebar For More Details):

*** The Top 25 Contributors will receive special mention as well as advertisement space at the top of our Wild FIRE Website - Reserved just for You! ( Weekly list update ). However; we really want to show our appreciation to everyone who will contribute to this project, so everyone will be listed on our website under the Contributors Page (unless otherwise requested)!

But of course, that`s not all! Here our some of the other Perks that we have in store for you:

       
  • KINDLING Contributors ($1 or more) - Eligible for First Issue Credits!
                                   - The Beginning of a Legend Perk

  • SPARK Contributors ($5 or more)
                                   - Prometheus Hammer! Perk

  • FLAME Contributors ($10 or more) - Eligible for ALL Issue Credits+ iOS App
                                   - The First Masamune Perk

  • BONFIRE Contributors ($20 or more) - Eligible for Book 1 Signed Copy        
                                   - Infrit: the Son of Flame Perk

  • FIRE STORM Contributors ($25 or more) - Eligible for First 10 Digital Comics!
                                   - The Blessings of  Kilauea Perk  
   
  • PHOENIX Contributors ($50 or more) Eligible First 10 iOS Apps & Book 2
                                   - Flames of Life Perk
     

*** Next Level Contributor ( FIRE DRAGON ) Perks to be revealed after our initial
      funding goal of $35,000 has been reached!
    
IF THE FUNDING GOAL IS NOT REACHED, the received funds will be utilized in future Wild FIRE based projects detailed in the Expanded Project Overview below. Contributors would still be rewarded some of the same perks from these other projects. Additional funds would be recycled back into Indiegogo in order to provide jobs and continued support for creative-minded people like ourselves!

Where Are We Headed With This in the Future? 

The expanded project will involve a wide range of printed, online and App Store-based media content, including:

  • 5 Complete Novels ( 6 volumes) with Screenplay adaptations for 5 feature films.
       Formats : Standard Print & Binding (with color inserts), iBook (with Animations,
       Bonus Content and Interactive Elements for download on iOS Devices).

       The Books:
                               - Wild FIRE Book 1 - Vol.1 : Prelude To Destruction (completed)
                                        * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE RED Now!
                                        * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE BLUE Now!
                                        * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE BLACK Now!
                               - Wild FIRE Book 1 - Vol 2 : Legend of the Ryukage (in progress)
                               - Wild FIRE Book 2 : Operation Dragon Strike
                               - Wild FIRE Book 3 : When Legends Die
                               - Wild FIRE Book 4 : Ryukage Apocalypse
                               - Wild FIRE Book 5 : Ryukage Rebirth

              ** Storyline Completed for ALL Books in the series
              **** Read the Screenplay Adaptation Sample of Book 1 (Mature Content)

Wild FIRE : Legend of the Ryukage (Promotional Video)


* C.D.U.L.O. : The Outer Rim - Flash Animated Web Series - 26 Episodes
                                                   (Cyber-punk, pilot episode concept completed)
                                          
                                           Based on the events between Chapters 3 and 4 of Book 1,
                                           this series follows the adventures of Zinjin and his elite
                                           intergalactic team of super-powered soldiers in their quest
                                           to locate the Shi`aki`s homeworld and intercept them on
                                           their path to destruction.
                                          
                                           Formats : Flash / Web / YouTube



              


* Ryukage Chronicles - Flash Animated Web Series ( 50 episode concept )

                                         Based on the adventures of the main Wild FIRE cast in
                                         relation the events taking place between Books 1 & 2.
                                                      
                                         Formats : Flash / Web / YouTube

             


* Wild FIRE : Blitz - 3D / 3rd Person RPG Shooter
                                     ( In Progress on the Unity 3D Platform)
   
                                     This game is a sequel to Book 1 and picks up where the
                                     book splits into 3 separate storylines (one for each main
                                     character). This will also expand to 2 Fighting Games based
                                     on the comics, novels and animated movies.
         
                                     Formats : Web / Console / iOS

Wild FIRE : L.O.R. Promotional Artwork

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help!

  • If you like what you`ve seen here so far, please feel free to spread the word about this campaign!
  • Don`t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • And as this is my first time creating a campaign, any feedback that you might have about this campaign would be more than appreciated!
story_txt:
Watch a special video message from the author entitled: "Just Create! - Discovering Yourself Before You Die" located in "The Creator(s)" section below to find out exactly why we`ve decided to launch this Indiegogo campaign, and why I highly encourage everyone to reach out and embrace their creative talents!Updates! 2/11 - We`ve just completed some awesome promotional sketches for both "The Ryukage" comic series and "C.D.U.L.O.: The Outer Rim" , which you can find below!Project Wild FIRE is a series of creative media projects based on the sci-fi / action novel; "Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage", which was published in 2007. You can find the Amazon.com and iTunes links for the first book below.                                            

Official Website : http://cre8tivemv.com/wildFIRE/

Amazon.com : http://www.amazon.com/Wild-FIRE-Legend-Ryukage-Book/dp/0977813606

Lulu.com : http://www.lulu.com/shop/walter-ragland/wild-fire-legend-of-the-ryukage-clans-book-1-volume-1/ebook/product-17507870.html

iTunes : https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/wild-fire/id458694269?mt=11

Originally intended as a 13 episode drama for Japanese TV, "The Ryukge" is now being converted into a 26 Issue Comic Series (storyline completed) that will stand as a prequel to the events of the first book "Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage". Genres : Martial Arts, Action, Fantasy Supernatural, Science FictionFeel : Serious / Gory / DarkFormats : Online Manga (black and white comic series for promotional usage), iOS Application (full color pages with animations, bonus content and  interactive elements for download on iPhone and iPad).SYNOPSIS : Hitoshi Morita is a traveling ronin samurai and trader. After a 
particularly long journey across southern Asia; he finally 
returns home to his wife and six lovely daughters. However; their happy family reunion ends in a fiery bloodbath when one of mankind`s most sinister and ancient evils awakens to once again wreak havoc upon the world. Seeking to wipe out the remaining descendants of their old nemesis, Ayami Nishiyama, once and for all; the demons relentlessly attack Hitoshi and his family. But who are these mysterious warrior monks who 
have come to balance the scales? Will the blood of the Nishiyama clan be
 enough to contain the sinister evil that is about to be unleashed once 
more upon the world? The battle for mankind`s future begins now! Those of you who are new to Wild FIRE, please feel free to view the FIRST 10 Pages of The Ryukage comic online for FREE! If you like what you see, come back and support our campaign.Follow us at: WILD FIRE SITE | TWITTER | FACEBOOKSample Page 1Sample Page 2The Ryukage (Main Cast) - PromoWe`ve already penciled and inked the First 10 Pages of ISSUE #1 and are currently working on the next 10 pages in addition to Programming the iOS Version of the Comic for the App Store. However; this project is 100% creator-owned, so until now the funding for this comic and all other projects in the Extended Projects Overview below has 
been completely out-of-pocket; which I must admit is a bit tough to 
manage. So in order for this to to be a success, we need to ask for your generosity! Without YOU the chances this becoming a reality are very low indeed.WHAT YOUR SUPPORT DOES : All money raised will go 
directly towards The Ryukage Comic & iOS App production & promotion costs and to give 
backers some cool rewards! Costs will include:
Paying the Comic Artist

Hiring our Assistant Comic Artist and Inker to work with us full-time (he only works with us part-time at the moment because we don`t have the funds to bring him fully on-board yet - but he`s good!)

Paying the Graphics Designer (logo/info)

Paying the iOS Development Costs (iPhone & iPad Versions)

Paying the printing & shipping costs of prints

Hiring an Editor (we really need one!)

Hiring an Admin Assistant to help keep track of and manage Contributor Perks (so that artists and I can just continue working on finishing the comics)

Paying the printing & shipping costs of t-shirts/mouse pads

Paying expenses for other promotional materials (multimedia, etc)
Our purpose is to complete the FIRST 10 ISSUES of this comic series in order to use them as marketing and
promotional tools (while creating a strong fan base) for the related projects noted in the Expanded Project Overview section below. IF THIS CAMPAIGN RAISES MORE THAN OUR TARGET for completion of the first comic series; we`d like to proceed immediately with production of the next project on the list, which is a 26 episode Flash Animated video series entitled; "C.D.U.L.O. : The Outer Rim" (details below in the Extended Projects Overview) plus finish writing the second novel of the series!For that to happen, we sincerely need Your support!Keith Gutierrez - Comic Artist / IllustratorHi!
 I’ve been doing illustrations for more than 10 years. As an avid fan of
 comic books/manga/graphic novels of all types, I don’t limit myself to a
 single genre, style or approach. I’m also a BIG fan of JRPGs, which 
give me a great deal of inspiration and ideas for my work. I like to 
push my limits with each new project I`m involved in to see how far can 
go. I sincerely believe that limiting one`s desire to progress would 
ultimately reduce one`s chances of learning new things; which in turn 
would cause their skills to rust. As a freelance graphic 
artist; I engage in commission based projects, concept art, portrait 
drawings, illustrations for children’s books, graphic designs for mobile
 games and applications, website artwork, logo designs, 3D modeling of 
buildings: exterior and interiors, etc.For more info and samples of my work, please feel free to check out my portfolio at:www.k-e-i-t-h.deviantart.comUndertaking
 this particular project has proven to be one of the most rewarding, 
challenging and fun learning experiences I`ve had in quite a while! The 
depth of the storyline and characters as well as the sheer scale of this
 overall project have given me a very rare opportunity to cut-loose and 
dive much deeper into exploring my artistic talents. We really do have a
 lot in store for you with this so I`m looking forward to completing 
this series and making it a HUGE success! But as mentioned in the
 video above; for that to happen we desperately need your help; 
therefore, I`d like to thank you all in advance for your contributions 
and support!Chadvar Yordanov - Comic Artist / Illustrator / AnimatorWhat you need to know about me probably can`t be found on a piece of paper; well at least not in words. I prefer to let my portfolio speak for itself. But to provide a little background; I finished a degree in traditional animation in 2012 and have been working as a freelance animator ever since. I specialize in concept art, storyboards and comic book illustrations and consistently complete works for various clients. I am an over-achiever with a tendency to put all my energy into my work. I`m always seeking new challenges, in order to improve my skills, while fueling my creativity with self-criticism, caffeine and nicotine. In the words of the famous Charles Bukowski: "Find something you love and let it kill you", that`s basically how I live.To give you an idea of the quality of work your contributions will assist in adding to this project, feel free to stop by the links below and check out  samples of my work. This is the real McCoy; everything else is fugazy... fairy dust. Meaning that it doesn't really matter.http://vimeo.com/chavdaryordanovhttp://vimeo.com/chavdaryordanovLike the other members of our team, I am also a big fan anime and manga, particularly the titles from the 80s and 90s that I grew up with. I love colorful characters, inventive and often crazy designs and the depth of stories with vast worlds to explore! Stories with a lot of fast-paced action will keep me glued to my seat for hours on end and “Project Wild FIRE” is no exception. After all, the main reasons I got involved in with The Ryukage project in the first place is because all these aspects are present in almost unhealthy doses!If you find yourself reminiscing about the golden age of comics and anime; the days of lively and believable characters with deep and exciting story lines, or if you constantly find yourself asking - "Why don't they make them like that anymore?"; then this is the project that you should keep your eye on and support to your fullest capacity, because we really do have quite a lot of jaw-dropping excitement in store for you with this one. Support us and see watch us deliver a story that will both shake and satisfy you to the core!Walter S. Ragland, Jr.  - Author / Creative DirectorHello, I`m the creator of the Wild FIRE series, iOS Applications / Game Developer and CEO of cre8tive Media Vault. You can learn more about me from my LinkedIn profile below:http://jp.linkedin.com/pub/walter-ragland/4/1b0/928Wild FIRE
 originally started off as a simple video game concept back in the late 
1980`s and I`ve been working on this project now for over 20 years. Most
 of the content that you will find on the website or in the Extended Projects section were created by me in my spare time after working hours. That`s because I really love this story! After
 an unexpected trip to the ER here in Tokyo at the end of 2012 (Nothing 
too serious and I`m 100% fine now), I decided to dedicate the rest of my
 life and energy to creating all of the wonderful things that I have 
locked away in my vivid imagination! After a brief search, 
I`ve managed to track down some old friends of mine who are just as 
crazy and passionate about creating as I am. We have the same artistic 
aspirations - so here we are!I want this project to not only be 
one that inspires a new wave of creativity in our mainstream media; but 
also something that encourages people to be their best and leave 
something of value behind for those who will come after us. This project
 is just the beginning of that journey.Your contributions would 
hopefully be the catalyst to inspire a new generation of creative people
 with ideas and the courage to move us into a brighter future!A video message from the author:"Just Create! - Discovering Yourself Before You Die"FOR CONTRIBUTING TO THIS PROJECT, YOU WOULD RECEIVE (See Sidebar For More Details):*** The Top 25 Contributors will receive special mention as well as advertisement space at the top of our Wild FIRE Website - Reserved just for You! ( Weekly list update ). However; we really want to show our appreciation to everyone who will contribute to this project, so everyone will be listed on our website under the Contributors Page (unless otherwise requested)! But of course, that`s not all! Here our some of the other Perks that we have in store for you:        
KINDLING Contributors ($1 or more) - Eligible for First Issue Credits!                                   - The Beginning of a Legend Perk
SPARK Contributors ($5 or more)                                    - Prometheus Hammer! Perk
FLAME Contributors ($10 or more) - Eligible for ALL Issue Credits+ iOS App
                                   - The First Masamune Perk
BONFIRE Contributors ($20 or more) - Eligible for Book 1 Signed Copy         
                                   - Infrit: the Son of Flame Perk
FIRE STORM Contributors ($25 or more) - Eligible for First 10 Digital Comics!                                   - The Blessings of  Kilauea Perk       
PHOENIX Contributors ($50 or more)  Eligible First 10 iOS Apps & Book 2
                                   - Flames of Life Perk      *** Next Level Contributor ( FIRE DRAGON ) Perks to be revealed after our initial      funding goal of $35,000 has been reached!     IF THE FUNDING GOAL IS NOT REACHED, the received funds will be utilized in
 future Wild FIRE based projects detailed in the Expanded Project Overview below. Contributors would still be rewarded 
some of the same perks from these other projects. Additional funds would
 be recycled back into Indiegogo in 
order to provide jobs and continued support for creative-minded people 
like ourselves!
 Where Are We Headed With This in the Future? The expanded project will involve a wide range of printed, online and App Store-based media content, including:5 Complete Novels ( 6 volumes) with Screenplay adaptations for 5 feature films.       Formats : Standard Print & Binding (with color inserts), iBook (with Animations,       Bonus Content and Interactive Elements for download on iOS Devices).       The Books:                               - Wild FIRE Book 1 - Vol.1 : Prelude To Destruction (completed)                                        * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE RED Now!                                         * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE BLUE Now!                                        * Read Wild FIRE Book 1 : EPILOGUE BLACK Now!                                - Wild FIRE Book 1 - Vol 2 : Legend of the Ryukage (in progress)                               - Wild FIRE Book 2 : Operation Dragon Strike                                - Wild FIRE Book 3 : When Legends Die                                - Wild FIRE Book 4 : Ryukage Apocalypse                                - Wild FIRE Book 5 : Ryukage Rebirth              ** Storyline Completed for ALL Books in the series              **** Read the Screenplay Adaptation Sample of Book 1 (Mature Content)Wild FIRE : Legend of the Ryukage (Promotional Video)* C.D.U.L.O. : The Outer Rim - Flash Animated Web Series - 26 Episodes                                                   (Cyber-punk, pilot episode concept completed)                                                                                      Based on the events between Chapters 3 and 4 of Book 1,                                           this series follows the adventures of Zinjin and his elite                                            intergalactic team of super-powered soldiers in their quest                                           to locate the Shi`aki`s homeworld and intercept them on                                           their path to destruction.                                                                                      Formats : Flash / Web / YouTube               * Ryukage Chronicles - Flash Animated Web Series ( 50 episode concept )                                         Based on the adventures of the main Wild FIRE cast in                                         relation the events taking place between Books 1 & 2.                                                                                                Formats : Flash / Web / YouTube              * Wild FIRE : Blitz - 3D / 3rd Person RPG Shooter                                     ( In Progress on the Unity 3D Platform)                                         This game is a sequel to Book 1 and picks up where the                                     book splits into 3 separate storylines (one for each main                                     character). This will also expand to 2 Fighting Games based                                     on the comics, novels and animated movies.                                                Formats : Web / Console / iOSWild FIRE : L.O.R. Promotional ArtworkOther Ways You Can HelpEven if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help!If you like what you`ve seen here so far, please feel free to spread the word about this campaign!Don`t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!And
 as this is my first time creating a campaign, any feedback that you 
might have about this campaign would be more than appreciated!

story:
Overview

SOS Volume 2 is a 55-page black & white graphic novel that contains issues #5-7 of a limited series. SOS is a black comedy/action series that chronicles the misadventures of three brothers who were former super-soldiers in World War II in a program called the Supernatural Offensive Squad.

In Volume 1, monsters from a dimension called the Abyss threatened New York. The brothers formed a monster-hunting business called SOS to combat the interdimensional threat.

In Volume 2, the brothers now deal with extraterrestrial threats when they are transported to planet Ventron. Ventron is a hellish world ruled by the sadistic Queen Lizbella where prisoners are made to fight to the death!

Written by Chimera

Art by Ibai Canales

Lettering by Eric Weathers

Front Cover by Kim Jacinto

Background:

I created the concept for SOS back in 2005 based on the comics, movies, and animated shows I enjoyed as a kid. I want "SOS" to embody the spirit of entertainment from the 90's and early 2000's. TMNT, X-Men, Justice League TAS, Jackie Chan Adventures, Hellboy, Spawn, and Hellsing were the biggest influences for this series.

Over the years, I fleshed out the characters and plot, so I would create the best series I possibly could. With your support, I will bring to life Volume 2 of "SOS" which takes the brothers into outer space. There they fight aliens and learn more about their origins.

Ashcan

The 20-page ashcan contains two bonus chapters where SOS fight their rogue's gallery of villains.

Written by Chimera

Cover by Matthew Weldon (line art) Kid Icarus (colors)

Bonus chapter #1 by Joe Ball (line art) Marcos Martin (colors) Eric Weathers (letters)

Bonus chapter #2 by Rafael Chrestani (line art) Leanore King (colors) Eric Weathers (letters)

Stretch Goals

$4,000: Every backer receives a bookmark with art by Caanan White

$5,000: Every backer receives a print of the five characters with art by SIX AM comics

$6,000: Every backer receives a trading card of Megus by Andrew Huerta

$7,500: Every backer receives a secret print by Joe Ball

$9,000: Every backer receives a full color 24-page supplemental comic

BOOKMARK BY CAANAN WHITE

Print by SIXAM Comics

Trading card by Andrew Huerta

Risks & Challenges

With my last campaigns, SOS Volume 1 and SOS Onslaught, I was able to get fully funded and fulfill the campaign relatively on time. Although we may run into obstacles, I will update all backers if this occurs. I believe transparency is very important.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if you can't contribute no worries! Just help spread the word via Twitter, Youtube, Facebook, and Instagram. Just make sure to share that Indiegogo link!

story:
Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget).

 

Menu

Introduzione

La storia

I Perks

I personaggi

Il progetto

Come useremo questi fondi?

Come possiamo aiutare?

 

INTRODUZIONE

Mi chiamo Martina (anche se spesso pubblico online con lo pseudonimo di Mortinfami o MortinfamiArt), e sono illustratrice e fumettista freelance, ma soprattutto sono una fiorentina DOC.

Ho sempre frequentato scuole d’arte: mi sono diplomata al Liceo Artistico di Firenze, laureata all'Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna (indirizzo fumetto&illustrazione) e ho conseguito il diploma nel corso di fumetto alla Scuola Internazionale di Comics.

Ho pubblicato miei lavori in Italia presso piccole realtà editoriali come Crazy Camper, Nowhere Publishing e Cyrano Comics, all'estero presso la DabelBrothers e ora sono qui, con Tatai Lab, per presentarvi il mio progettoDEVA.


 

LA STORIA

Nei primi due volumi seguiamo la storia di Unalome, che da recluso nel palazzo degli imperatori diventa prima fuggitivo, assieme alla guerriera Wu e al monaco Gamgon, e poi vera e propria parte attiva nelle forze della federazione: gli imperatori dichiarano infatti guerra alla federazione, e nel secondo libro assistiamo ai nostri protagonisti separarsi alla disperata ricerca di alleati per poter contrastare la schiacciante forza avversaria. 

Nell’ultimo capitolo della trilogia il gruppo si riunisce, nonostante gli screzi, le incomprensioni e le paure, e assieme i nostri eroi si schierano per affrontare lo scontro finale con gli ormai potentissimi imperatori.

Come si concluderà la storia?

 

 

I PERKS


UNALOME - LIBRO A CARTOOMICS: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è già pronto e lo puoi ritirare a Cartoomics.


GAMGON - LIBRO A CASA: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è pronto e lo riceverai direttamente a casa tua!


WU - LIBRO + SHOPPER (Cartoomics): Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio! Ritiri a Cartoomics.


JALA - LIBRO + SHOPPER (Casa): Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio!
Ti verranno spedite a casa.


SHENG - SOLO SHOPPER: una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% da aggiungere ad un altro perk.


FEILI - 3 VOLUMI: La trilogia di Deva, completa, a prezzo scontatissimo + la Stampa della Cover in omaggio!


MEI - LIBRO + CUSTOM A4: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A4 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover!


SIONG - LIBRO + CUSTOM A3: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A3 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover!


KENDRA - ROYALE: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio + uno Stand di WU + un quadernino A6 personalizzato DEVA + stampa A4 colorata ad acquerello, firmata e numerata dall'autrice.

 

 

I PERSONAGGI

Unalomeè un sarto di grande talento, dall’età identificabile attorno ai 30-35 anni: ha un carattere buono e socievole, è sempre pronto ad aiutare chiunque sia in difficoltà e non farebbe male ad una mosca. Di aspetto ricorda in tutto e per tutto un essere umano alto e robusto, ma in aggiunta è nato con due paia di corna e i lobi delle orecchie allungati.

 

Wuè una giovane ma potentissima guerriera di appena 23 anni, dai lunghi capelli e le folte sopracciglia sempre corrugate: è testarda e leale, mette la forza fisica e le abilità in combattimento prima di qualsiasi cosa, ma il suo carattere spesso duro o aggressivo nasconde un lato molto affettuoso per le poche persone a cui vuole bene. A modo suo.

 

Gamgonè un bhakti(una razza identica a quella umana ma caratterizzata dalla presenza di un paio di braccia aggiuntive) e un adepto del Culto delle Origini. È un ragazzo di 27 anni che vive una vita da monaco guerriero nonostante la totale avversione per la violenza: di bell’aspetto, estremamente cordiale e gentile, ma anche molto, molto pigro. 

 


 

IL PROGETTO

DEVA è la mia prima trilogia a fumetti, ideata e disegnata completamente da me.
Dentro ci sono tre anni della mia vita: tre anni di gioie, di soddisfazioni, di crescita personale e artistica, ma anche tre anni di delusioni e di dolori. Un po’ quello che succede ai personaggi che ho creato.
Nessuno di loro percorre la propria storia felice e spensierato, nessuno di loro si trova davanti la strada spianata, senza ostacoli da superare o imprevisti.
Nessuno di loro vivrà il proprio futuro così come se lo erano immaginati quando hanno mosso i primi passi nelle tavole del primo volume, perché il destino muta, cambia le carte in tavola.
Ma ognuno di loro, alla fine di questa saga, potrà ritenersi cresciuto, a proprio modo.
Ed è così che mi sento io: più forte, più grande, più saggia. È questo quello che mi ha dato creare questa storia. E spero che leggerla vi farà emozionare tanto quanto ha emozionato me realizzarla.

 


 

COME USEREMO QUESTI FONDI?

DEVA è stato realizzato da Martina nel corso del 2019, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab. 
Si tratta di un progetto da 96 pagine ed è già tutto pronto.

I fondi che raccoglieremo verranno usati nel seguente modo:

€ 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo

€ 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget

€ 1.300 per la spedizione
 

COME POSSIAMO AIUTARE?

Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo questa pagina, sui diversi social network.
Segui i nostri account:
Facebook 
Instagram
Youtube
story_txt: Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). MenuIntroduzioneLa storiaI PerksI personaggiIl progettoCome useremo questi fondi?Come possiamo aiutare? INTRODUZIONEMi chiamo Martina (anche se spesso pubblico online con lo pseudonimo di Mortinfami o MortinfamiArt), e sono illustratrice e fumettista freelance, ma soprattutto sono una fiorentina DOC.Ho sempre frequentato scuole d’arte: mi sono diplomata al Liceo Artistico di Firenze, laureata all'Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna (indirizzo fumetto&illustrazione) e ho conseguito il diploma nel corso di fumetto alla Scuola Internazionale di Comics.Ho pubblicato miei lavori in Italia presso piccole realtà editoriali come Crazy Camper, Nowhere Publishing e Cyrano Comics, all'estero presso la DabelBrothers e ora sono qui, con Tatai Lab, per presentarvi il mio progettoDEVA. LA STORIANei primi due volumi seguiamo la storia di Unalome, che da recluso nel palazzo degli imperatori diventa prima fuggitivo, assieme alla guerriera Wu e al monaco Gamgon, e poi vera e propria parte attiva nelle forze della federazione: gli imperatori dichiarano infatti guerra alla federazione, e nel secondo libro assistiamo ai nostri protagonisti separarsi alla disperata ricerca di alleati per poter contrastare la schiacciante forza avversaria. Nell’ultimo capitolo della trilogia il gruppo si riunisce, nonostante gli screzi, le incomprensioni e le paure, e assieme i nostri eroi si schierano per affrontare lo scontro finale con gli ormai potentissimi imperatori.Come si concluderà la storia?  I PERKSUNALOME - LIBRO A CARTOOMICS: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è già pronto e lo puoi ritirare a Cartoomics.GAMGON - LIBRO A CASA: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è pronto e lo riceverai direttamente a casa tua!WU - LIBRO + SHOPPER (Cartoomics): Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio! Ritiri a Cartoomics.JALA - LIBRO + SHOPPER (Casa): Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio!Ti verranno spedite a casa.SHENG - SOLO SHOPPER: una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% da aggiungere ad un altro perk.FEILI - 3 VOLUMI: La trilogia di Deva, completa, a prezzo scontatissimo + la Stampa della Cover in omaggio!MEI - LIBRO + CUSTOM A4: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A4 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover!SIONG - LIBRO + CUSTOM A3: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A3 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover!KENDRA - ROYALE: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una bellissima Shopper in Cotone 100% e una Stampa della Cover in omaggio + uno Stand di WU + un quadernino A6 personalizzato DEVA + stampa A4 colorata ad acquerello, firmata e numerata dall'autrice.  I PERSONAGGIUnalomeè un sarto di grande talento, dall’età identificabile attorno ai 30-35 anni: ha un carattere buono e socievole, è sempre pronto ad aiutare chiunque sia in difficoltà e non farebbe male ad una mosca. Di aspetto ricorda in tutto e per tutto un essere umano alto e robusto, ma in aggiunta è nato con due paia di corna e i lobi delle orecchie allungati. Wuè una giovane ma potentissima guerriera di appena 23 anni, dai lunghi capelli e le folte sopracciglia sempre corrugate: è testarda e leale, mette la forza fisica e le abilità in combattimento prima di qualsiasi cosa, ma il suo carattere spesso duro o aggressivo nasconde un lato molto affettuoso per le poche persone a cui vuole bene. A modo suo. Gamgonè un bhakti(una razza identica a quella umana ma caratterizzata dalla presenza di un paio di braccia aggiuntive) e un adepto del Culto delle Origini. È un ragazzo di 27 anni che vive una vita da monaco guerriero nonostante la totale avversione per la violenza: di bell’aspetto, estremamente cordiale e gentile, ma anche molto, molto pigro.   IL PROGETTODEVA è la mia prima trilogia a fumetti, ideata e disegnata completamente da me.Dentro ci sono tre anni della mia vita: tre anni di gioie, di soddisfazioni, di crescita personale e artistica, ma anche tre anni di delusioni e di dolori. Un po’ quello che succede ai personaggi che ho creato.Nessuno di loro percorre la propria storia felice e spensierato, nessuno di loro si trova davanti la strada spianata, senza ostacoli da superare o imprevisti.Nessuno di loro vivrà il proprio futuro così come se lo erano immaginati quando hanno mosso i primi passi nelle tavole del primo volume, perché il destino muta, cambia le carte in tavola.Ma ognuno di loro, alla fine di questa saga, potrà ritenersi cresciuto, a proprio modo.Ed è così che mi sento io: più forte, più grande, più saggia. È questo quello che mi ha dato creare questa storia. E spero che leggerla vi farà emozionare tanto quanto ha emozionato me realizzarla.  COME USEREMO QUESTI FONDI?DEVA è stato realizzato da Martina nel corso del 2019, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab. Si tratta di un progetto da 96 pagine ed è già tutto pronto.I fondi che raccoglieremo verranno usati nel seguente modo:€ 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo€ 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget€ 1.300 per la spedizione COME POSSIAMO AIUTARE?Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo questa pagina, sui diversi social network.Segui i nostri account:Facebook InstagramYoutube

story:
Why Comics?


Why should socialists and communists care about comics? For us, the answer is simple - comics are where the people are.

Since 2008, a once-niche corner of popular culture has expanded rapidly - providing a near endless supply of spectacle, merchandise and ideology. People flock to see the latest movie, people cosplay and people read comic books in print and on their tablets and phones. Thousands if not millions of socialists already engage with a form of literature and theatre that insidiously reproduces the ideology of the ruling class. Steve is a military super weapon wrapped in a flag. Tony is the archetypal American industrialist and arms dealer. Thor is a monarchistic  deity. It goes on. Socialists have two choices - we can either shun this fandom, or we can accept it as a modern phenomenon and insist it be placed in a proper social context. Everything is ideological. Explaining that is important and rewarding work.

But this is not some joyless nitpick - we love comics. We love how outlandish, absurd and problematic they are, and beneath that all, so many comic books are legitimately wonderful and unique. Navigating the morality and political aspect of comics is a challenge. To meet that challenge, we're creating Four Colors Red: a series of zines and, we hope, podcasts. With your help we can  push this project as far as it can go.

Dr Trevor Strunk is Philadelphia's Master Of Menace. His podcast No Cartridge Audio has built a space for leftists to enjoy and explore the hobby of video gaming in reactionary and troubled times. He's begun to explore the world of the Fighting Game Community with your help. Now he's asking for that help again: to launch a year long program of comics criticism that makes sense of another inscrutable and surreal facet of fan culture. He'd also really, really like to talk to you about how much he likes Bone.

For our first year, Four Colors Red will break down into six major case studies. The core of each case will be an electronically published zine of no less than 32 pages. If we can hit our first stretch goal, we’ll produce a podcast for each, where Trevor and guests interrogate each subject in the same dynamically dialectic fashion No-Cartridge subscribers have come to expect. If we can go further, we hope to do podcasts featuring comics creators and even take a no-holds barred look at  fan favourite Achewood, free for everyone! Keep checking back for our stretch goals!

Disclaimer: Four Colors Red is a fair use educational and critical project. All copyrights and trademarks are assigned to the original owners.

ISSUE #1:  MEGACITY: THE THATCHER YEARS

What better way to explore the connection between comics and the radical right than beginning with Judge Dredd? Starting development just after Margaret Thatcher became leader of the British opposition in 1975, Dredd spent the next 15 years in a cycle of dark social satire and redemptive heroic science fiction - torn between social commentary and commercial concerns. Every time Dredd would get too fascistic and repressive, a fantastic and existential threat would arise - climaxing in Necropolis, City Of The Dead, and a showdown with  his alien Nemesis, Judge Death. A month later, Thatcher was gone - leaving a broken and divided UK in her wake. This zine will provide a history of the first 13 years of Dredd stories against a backdrop of government repression and social decline, as well as examining the fandom that still surrounds Thatcherism to this day. This is a fantastic way to learn about Judge Dredd and the collapse of the post-war consensus, particularly for American readers.

ISSUE #2: ADVENTURE CAPITALIST

Do you ever wonder what union rights are like in the world of Stark? Who actually builds the suits? Does any of this actually make sense? Stan Lee once described Iron Man as the political comic of the Marvel age - a politics rooted in anticommunism, imperialism and a magical capitalism divorced from both economy and ecological cost. Using the original Tales Of Suspense run, the Matt Fraction film era run and the early issues of the current Dan Slott jawn as our texts, we'll go all in on the cool exec with the heart of steel, pulling no punches. What do the heroic adventures of a shameless industrialist mean in the world after Jobs and Musk? What compels a grown man to show up at an active rescue operation with an unsolicited minisubmarine? If you've ever wanted to imagine what a technocratic superhero would be like in the real world, you have so many horrifying examples today - we're going to tie it all together.
 

ISSUE #3 SYNTHPOP VS THE DARK GODS

Returning to 2000ad, we examine Grant Morrison and Steve Yeowell's seminal take on superheroes in the 1980s: Zenith! We’ll explore 1980s pop and melancholy , MKULTRA, Cthulhu, Acid House. Michael Heseltine, creators rights, the thin line between superhuman and god as well as offer our take on the eternal wizard war between Morrison and Alan Moore! One of the finest examples of revisionist superhero storytelling from the 1980s is also the least discovered. This zine is really going places. Not to be missed!

ISSUE #4: AT HOME, WITH BONE

Carl Barks. Bill Parker and CC Beck. Jack Cole. Will Eisner. And, of course, Jeff Smith. Wait, really?

Really; no Mount Rushmore of comics that make you feel like a happy child on Christmas is complete without the one young gun who every millennial comic book fan grew up with. Jeff Smith's Bone embraces the cartoon sensibilities of Barks' classic Uncle Scrooge books, the swashbuckling spirit of Parker and Beck's Captain Marvel, the troubled mania of Cole's Plastic Man and the experimental architecture of Eisner's Spirit and wraps it in a fantasia worthy of the name. How did a comic that embraces innocence and adventure land at all in the era of Desert Storm, Kosovo bombings, election fraud, 9/11, and the Iraq War? Why does this mix of Pogo and Moebius appeal to the child and adult in you all at once? And what about adventure pure in spirit speaks to the socialist project? Get ready to hope again.

ISSUE #5: ODINSON OR FAILSON?

Jack Kirby and Walt Simonson have grasped something about the mythology of comics that so few people seem to understand. They aren't about power fantasies. They aren't about humanising the gods. They aren't even about mythology. Comic books like Thor are about putting the omnipotent figures we have crafted as human beings into our real world to see what, exactly, might happen. And what happens? Rainbow bridges. A son’s endless quest to please a distant and disdainful father. Frog Thor. A space horse who takes over when Thor taps out. FROG THOR. As Norse Mythology is left fragmented and incomplete, so Thor can fill the gaps with carnival glee, revealing the roots of our anxieties, ambitions, dreams, and potential as people. But only if embraced in a spirit of revolt.


ISSUE #6: MODERN LOVE, MODERN ROCKETS


What is the Millennial Ulysses? A lot of people would tell you it's been written by a Franzen, Copeland or Zadie Smith. They would be wrong. The time-strewn, international, messy, tragi-comic Love and Rockets laid the ground for dozens of magic realist webcomics and helped define a whole generation of self-published artists and creators. Jaime and Gilberto Hernandez have created in this massive anthology a tale which alternates between Archie Comics and Gabriel Garcia Marquez, layered with a DIY ethic and the history of an America we see the current president and government so fomenting against. What does a truly global future look like when we remove the false peace of cosmopolitan compromise?

NOTE: All zines will be offered at six dollars a pop upon release. Help us raise the funds we need and get a nice discount!

 

Stretch Goal #1: $3000 - PODCASTS!

 

If we can break 2k, we can make these zines. If we can break 3k, every zine will get a supporting podcast! Podcasts will be offered à la carte or with a season pass. We’ll start announcing prospective guests and filling the details as we approach our funding goals! We have more ideas for podcasts and other stretch goals too. Keep checking back.


We Need Your Support!

 

Making these is going to require your help. Even publishing the zines electronically is going to be a big ask. That's why it's important this project receives enough funding to allow us to devote the care and attention it needs. Turning down freelance work to burn the midnight oil on a zine, SSL certificates for websites and even small treats like a coffee all add up. If you can fund us to $2,000, we can start this up. If we can get it to $3,000, we can broaden our scope considerably and produce a worthy sister podcast to No-Cartridge while ensuring both receive the funds they need and keeping Trevor from having to subsist on a diet of wild flowers and morning dew. This is a true passion project, years in the making, and each of our reward tiers comes with some form of product for you. Help us create a self-funded voice and resource for the comics reading left in 2019 and we will reward you with senses-shattering discourse. We really can't do this without your help!

 

Qualifications

 

Trevor Strunk is a PHD in American Literature with a heart of gold. Comics are his first love: you can hear about his second love of video games at No-Cartridge and his third love of watching Paw Patrol with his daughter over at @hegelbon on twitter. He can write with the speed of five panthers and podcast with the voice of ten podcasters. He's made over 80 podcasts in a year and a half while maintaining a strong commitment to socialist principles. As the project progresses we hope to announce more collaborators who'll join Trevor to share their own perspectives and experiences.

 

Challenges

 

Raising a young family and juggling work in late capitalism meant we had to set a realistic timescale on this one. That timescale is a six month lead time to create six zines and we hope, more than six podcasts, which will be spread over 12 months for delivery. The more money we can get, the more we can plan for and commission, but each stretch goal and reward is realistically focused on getting the work delivered on time. We will be using the PDF format to distribute the first year of zines in order to make the most efficient use of your support and ensure speedy delivery.

story:
The Finest: A GI Joe Costume Club is happy to announce that 2018 has already been a record-smashing year for our veteran fundraising campaign, and we’re excited to end the year with a bang! 

We are proud to have so many active duty service members and veterans in the Finest, and since our club was founded in 2007, we’ve strived to support charity organizations that help servicemen and women after they return home in an impactful way. Here’s how you can help!

OUR CAUSE

For the third consecutive year, the Finest is proud to support K9s For Warriors, an organization dedicated to providing service canines to warriors suffering from Post-traumatic Stress Disability, traumatic brain injury and/or military sexual trauma as a result of military service post-9/11. 


Ninety-five percent of the canines in the K9s For Warriors program come from rescue shelters, and in 2015, the organization was able to raise more than $5.5 million dollars, which allowed them to pair 51 Warriors with service dogs – that’s at least 102 lives saved because of each person’s contribution! In September 2016, K9s for Warriors opened their second kennel, which houses up to 27 dogs in training; the 17,000 sq. ft. training facility now can house and train up to 54 dogs! In May 2017, they trained and graduated their 300th warrior!


We are dedicated to helping them reach their goal of helping 12 warriors each month, so 100% of the net proceeds earned from our charity campaign will be donated to K9s for Warriors! 

PERKS!

We can’t support this amazing organization without the help of the GI Joe fan community, and to show our appreciation for your generous donations, we've created three brand new items and designs specifically for this campaign!

  • Patch
  • Challenge Coin
  • T-shirt

These all-new items are being offered for the first time ever, so get them now while supplies last and get geared up early for 2019!

* NOTE: We are happy to ship perks anywhere in the world! If you are outside North America, please email us your location and we will let you know what additional shipping charges may apply.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Donating funds is the best way to get involved, but if you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and family! Share our link on Facebook, Twitter, or other social media. Let other fandom groups know what we're doing and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. Harness the power of technology to help us achieve our goal! Get involved however you can - all help is appreciated!

The more funds we collect, the more funds go to K9s For Warriors and to veterans and their families who need our help! Our goal is to continue to help the men and women who sacrifice so much for us every single day, and to let them know that we value and appreciate their contributions and sacrifices! Please join with the Finest, and together, let’s use our love for GI Joe to make a lasting difference in the lives of military personnel and families!

Thank you!!!!!
