HOW YOU CAN HELP
Donating funds is the best way to get involved, but if you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and family! Share our link on Facebook, Twitter, or other social media. Let other fandom groups know what we're doing and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. Harness the power of technology to help us achieve our goal! Get involved however you can - all help is appreciated!
The more funds we collect, the more funds go to K9s For Warriors and to veterans and their families who need our help! Our goal is to continue to help the men and women who sacrifice so much for us every single day, and to let them know that we value and appreciate their contributions and sacrifices! Please join with the Finest, and together, let’s use our love for GI Joe to make a lasting difference in the lives of military personnel and families!
Thank you!!!!!

story:
The Nandi Bear Tenants

Hello, I've been making comics, music and films since I was 7 years old... over 30 years ago now. It's all very low budget and basically home made. I work at an elementary school with grades 1 through 3 and in class I have been teaching the kids how to make comics and films and other creative things like that, I have been helping kids make so many comics this year and they always ask me to show them my comics. The truth is the last 15 years or so I have been mostly concentrating on my films, and haven't done too much in the way of comic making. I still have my favourite characters and all the adventures and worlds I created growing up in my head, so I decided that this summer (since I wouldn't be working) I would spend the summer making a big epic comic.. something not too grown up that I could end up showing the kids in my class as an example, and to get them even more excited to see that things can be accomplished. 



A few months ago I made a series of cartoons about one of the old superheroes I made up when I was a kid who was based on a real cat I had (We're talking 1985...) Anyway, I had such an amazing time bringing Dorriss Doom and her friends to life, that that was another reason I wanted to focus on making comics again for a while. Dorriss Doom premiered at this year's Calgary comic and entertainment expo. It was a huge hit and I had kids asking for my autograph the rest of the weekend. It was bizarre and awesome. Bottom line is, people love Dorriss Doom. And this comic is gonna rock. 

Watch my Dorriss Doom cartoons:

Episodes One and Two: http://youtu.be/FpXHtZl7IgY  

Episodes Three and Four: http://youtu.be/8IGZmubGVKQ  

Episodes Five and Six: http://youtu.be/UnmrUiS2VRw  

Or just watch the whole thing in one go, and see a bunch of extra weird stuff in the full DVD version: http://youtu.be/GIlj-suKN1Q  

What We Need & What You Get

I am hand drawing every page and colouring it with watercolour paints. I am scanning the finished pages and doing the text on my computer (Using a font I made myself.) The whole story is 50 pages long, and I anticipate it will take me until the end of August to make it all. All together I plan on it being a 56 page book. I want to get it printed properly and will be going through createspace to get that done, as they have reasonable prices and also have your book for sale on amazon.com and make it available to librarys and schools. The money I am trying to get will go towards the printing of 100 copies of the comic. I will use these copies to give to the people who funded the project and also have some to give away and sell at comic conventions. 


    The Story

    The story is about Naiad Bear, who inherits a load of money and a giant creepy haunted house from her Auntie Nandi. Naiad invites her friends Dorriss and Pattee over to stay with her and have a seance. They contact the other side and are told of a sinister plot that involves the King of the Cat planet and how he plans to destroy Mars! Being an old friend of the King, Pattee can't believe he would do such a crazy thing, and they take off to the cat planet to investigate. New friends are made and old friends are found, and the plot gets thicker and stranger and this intergalactic tale of war and espionage basically ends up in a shouting match at a tree house. Also.. Giant Robots!


    Also, if I can make my $700 goal, I will send out a special home made Nandi Bear Tenant T-shirt to the first 20 people that helped out! 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please share this campaign! 
      And go visit my website and watch tons of movies and listen to and download a bunch of music or something.. or follow us on facebook. I do so much stuff all the time and basically give it all away for free.. 
      http://scentertainment.ca  
      SC Entertainment on Facebook  
      It would be lovely if I could print out some nice quality comics for once in my life. I've been making lousy black and white photocopies of stuff for so long it hurts.. and heck, I am gonna be 40 next year.. I should have something that looks grown up for once!

story:
The definitive How-to-Draw book from Bart Sears, and much more! This edition will be a full 144-page hardcover, making it one of the best how-to-draw manuals ever published, perfect for beginners and more advanced artists alike. This edition, edited by Bart Sears himself, will be over-sized, measuring 8.5 x 11 inches.

Acclaimed comic artist Bart Sears taught an entire generation to draw with his Brutes and Babes column in Wizard Magazine, which was the bible of the comics industry for a decade. In the pages of Wizard, Bart presented dozens of drawing and storytelling tutorials, providing an expansive education in comic art and illustration.

Now, through this Indiegogo, Bart Sears is finally collecting all his influential drawing lessons. The classic Brutes and Babes lessons have been expanded, updated and revised, as well as re-designed for a more reader-friendly and eye-pleasing experience.  Bart's tutorials delve into anatomy, storytelling, perspective, layout, design, breakdowns, body language, gesture, proportion, structure, and much, much more. Bart has also written and drawn five completely new lessons just for this collected edition.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                                      

As part of this project, we are also publishing the first volume of the Ominous Press Black Book series of art books. The initial volume, "The Art of Bart Sears," is the first comprehensive collection of Bart Sears artwork. The material collected ranges from published masterpieces to never-before-seen commissions, concept designs and much, much more. All of the art has been culled from Bart's files, selected personally by him.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Interior Art Pages!

Original Cover Art Pages
 

Team Ominous: The dream team gathered by Bart consists of designers, editorial staff, customer service and support staff to make sure your experience is the best it can be. 

Links: 
Youtube: https://youtu.be/z4AhlgixbK8 
Instagram: http://instagram.com/ominous_press
Facebook: http://facebook.com/ominouspress
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/ominouspress/
Web: www.ominouspress.com

WHAT WE WILL USE YOUR MONEY FOR
Funds raised will be used to completely redesign the original Brutes and Babes columns, expanding and revising each. New artwork and content is also being created, making for the best package possible. The cost of printing these volumes will also be considerable.

Contact us: Click the icon for Bart Sears, and then Contact button. We are here to make your experience smooth and problem free.

Add-Ons: We are happy to assist with any add-ons through an over-pledge. Email us to let us know what you would like to add, and we will accommodate your request as best as Ominously possible.

International Shipping:  When ordering from outside the United States, we can combine shipping for you to get the best rate possible.

Your participation is the driving force of this campaign. We very literally cannot do this without you. Our sincere thanks for considering us, and supporting us. 

                         THANK YOU!

This edition will be a full 144-page hardcover, making it one of the best how-to-draw manuals ever published, perfect for beginners and more advanced artists alike. This edition, edited by Bart Sears himself, will be over-sized, measuring 8.5 x 11 inches.Acclaimed comic artist Bart Sears taught an entire generation to draw with his Brutes and Babes column in Wizard Magazine, which was the bible of the comics industry for a decade. Bart has also written and drawn five completely new lessons just for this collected edition.
Drawing Powerful Heroes: Brutes and Babes
We have a wide array of Rewards planned for this campaign, from a Digital Edition of Bart Sears' Drawing Powerful Heroes: Brutes and Babes! to rare opportunities to obtain original art from Bart Sears. With your help, we can bring this project to fruition. 
Bart Sears has been drawing comics professionally for 30 years, working for DC, Marvel, Valiant, CrossGen, Image, Dark Horse and a number of other publishers. His powerful, bold art style has graced titles including "X-O Manowar" and "Turok" for Valiant, and "Justice League Europe" and "Batman" for DC. He's also known for his many Wizard Magazine covers, and especially for his Brutes and Babes art tutorials that appeared in the magazine, inspiring a generation of artists.

Learn proportion and structure.
 

 

Learn the steps from the thumbnail sketch to final pencils.
 

 

Learn how to tag your character with different body types.
 

 

Learn why detail is important in character design.
 

 

Thumbnail rough to final inks: Deathstroke cover!
 

 

The process, from pencils to color!
 

 

How rough drawing becomes final pencils.
Inside Drawing Powerful Heroes

Bart's talents have also been applied to toys, designing C.O.P.S., G.I. Joe, and WWE for Hasbro, Marvel Legends and X-Men for ToyBiz, as well as video games, producing concept art for Heatwave Interactive and Kalani Games.

Toy sculptural drawing - Marvel Legends Wolverine.
 

Toy sculptural drawing - Cable: Underwater.
 

C.O.P.S. year three concept drawing - The Bug.
                                      

G.I. Joe vehicle driver design drawings.

The initial volume, "The Art of Bart Sears," is the first comprehensive collection of Bart Sears artwork. The material collected ranges from published masterpieces to never-before-seen commissions, concept designs and much, much more. All of the art has been culled from Bart's files, selected personally by him.

The Black Book: The Art of BART SEARS
This edition will be 108 pages and sized at a full 8.5 x 11 inches. The book will include published classics, as well as masterpieces never previously seen by the public.

"X-O Manowar" wraparound cover, pencils.
 

Wizard Magazine #19 cover image.
 

X-Men commission artwork.
 

Wizard Magazine #9 dressed cover and illustration by Bart "Wittman" Sears.
 

Judge Dredd cover art.
 

"Blade" #1 cover art, pencils.
 

Iron Man commission.

Interior Art Reward Pages
Original Cover Art Pages

story:
Update: June 27, 2011

We are FUNDED! In less than 4 days you guys have helped us hit our Indiegogo comic project goal! We are completely blown away THANK YOU! ♥ Every extra bit of funding will go into the book, packaging and shipping of the rewards, and future reprints of this project. Thank you so much for your support! We could not have done this without you.


Who are we?

Katie Shanahan is a cartoonist from Toronto, Canada. She's worked in the animation industry for the past 5 years as a storyboard artist, animator and designer, and keeps an active online presence with frequent art and comic updates.


Steven "Shaggy" Shanahan is a motion graphic animator, video editor, and compositor, who's early interest in radio plays lead to him creating a humorous audio short in 2005, called Silly Kingdom.


About "Silly Kingdom" the radio play

The first chapter, titled "Alengrimrickshaw's 211th Birthday", follows the efforts of a cheerful Princess, a power hungry Prince, and a clever Jester, as they attempt to put on a birthday celebration for the Kingdom's ancient and crotchety jerk-of-a-wizard, Alengrimrickshaw. Sufficed to say, things take a turn for the explosive!


Following the audio drama, many more short stories set in the world of Silly Kingdom have been written, and now, they are ready to be told with the launching of Katie and Shaggy's newest collaborative comic, Silly Kingdom.


About "Silly Kingdom" the comic!

Taking inspiration from the radio play, the comic will be a 32 page (approx) black and white inked humor fantasy illustrated by Katie and written by Shaggy. Suitable for all audiences (of awesome readers!)


With published works printed in critically acclaimed comic anthologies ("Flight" volumes 7 and 8, "The Anthology Project" volume 2 and "Side B: A Music Lover's Comic Anthology"), Silly Kingdom marks the Shanahan sibling's first self published work, which they aim to premier at the upcoming San Diego Comic-Con and Tr!ckster in July.  


What We Need & What You Get

The accumulated price of printing the first run of Silly Kingdom books ($600), the flight from Toronto to San Diego and back ($1,260), and accommodations for the convention ($840) is a bit of a strain on a freelancer artist's budget. The whole endeavor is going to run us a total of $3,100.


This is why we've decided to turn to IndiGoGo (and you guys!) in hopes of raising the funds to get this project off the ground. In return for your support we'll reward you with a bevy of perks, such as shout-outs, buttons, prints, original art commissions (fan-art, yourself drawn in Katie's style, whatever you want!) and of course, the comic itself.


We are also offering access to a new live stream series called Shanahanigans which will follow the behind-the-scenes of our present and future comic projects.  Watch Katie draw, hear Shaggy yammer on, and you the viewer can get involved with questions, and maybe even requests!


You can also get access to the Silly Kingdom art blog, where you can follow the progress from thumbnails to final page, see the evolution of character and location design, and gain insights into the comic making process.


What if we exceed our goal?

That would be fantastic! Every extra bit of money will go into packaging and shipping of the comics and rewards to you guys! Anything above that will go into printing more Silly Kingdom books in the future, so we can bring them around to other comic convention we'll be attending!


What if we don't meet our goal?

We're still going to print this comic because we're both really excited about it. It'll just take us longer to build up some money to mail out all the comics and rewards as shipping fees will have to come from our own pockets.

Questions? Comments?

Please feel free to drop us a line and we'll get back to you as quickly as possible! Katie can be reached at shanahan(dot)katie(at)gmail.com and Shaggy at shaggyshan(at)uberfriendship.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share the link:

indiegogo.com/Silly-Kingdom-at-San-Diego-Comic-Con


Beyond that, your continued interest and support of our work keeps us going.


Thanks a bunch!

- Katie & Shaggy


Our Links

Katie:

Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/ktshy

website/blog: http://www.ktshy.com


Shaggy:

YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/user/ShaggyShan

Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/shaggyshan

Other Works: http://uberfriendship.com/

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Minna Sundberg and "Stand Still. Stay Silent" is my ongoing webcomic (which you can read for free over here), a mostly light-hearted story in a post apocalyptic Nordic setting.  It's a story about friendship and a long journey to explore uncharted places in a forgotten world, sprinkled with some Finnish and Norse mythology, magic and a tiny dash of horror.

I've been drawing and posting this comic online for almost a year, and with the first ~200 pages done I feel it's a good time to start preparing for the first printed book in the series. And that's what this print drive is all about: to fund the printing of the books and to act as a preorder system for all of you who want a copy!  Hooray!


  • Hardcover 
  • Chapters 1-4
  • 260+ pages in full color
  • ~17x24 cm
  • Bonus content in the back (maybe even a short extra comic snippet.)
  • No cat hairs (not a guarantee)
That's the mock-up and basic specs of what the final thing is going to be like. The cover isn't 100% finished, but mostly I'm just going to polish up the ornaments and add some detail to them, so that image is quite close to what it's going to end up looking. :3
Timeline: I'm currently drawing chapter 4 (the last one for this book) and it'll be in the bag before the end of the year. After that I'll start prepping all the pages for print and make the extra content, then finally send it all of to the printers. If all goes according to plan I should be able to start sending out everyone's books in early summer. 
(For the record: I've gone through this book-printing crowdfunding process once before with my first comic "A Redtail's Dream". It all went quite smoothly and I got the books finished and sent out on time. I also learned a whole lot of things that'll hopefully make things flow even smoother this time.  Fingers crossed!)

If you want to add extra items to your package go ahead and do so! This chart here shows the cost of any items added to one of the base pledge levels. 

If you haven't pledged yet click on the pledge level you want, and on the first tab there's a field called "additional gift". Here you can simply write in the value of the extra item(s) that you wanted.
If you've already pledged and want to still add things: click on "contribute now" at the top (pink button), select "no perk" and enter in the value of the extra items you want. Make sure you use the same account/email for each contribution you make so that I'll be able to merge them afterwards.

You'll be able to pick out which extra items you paid for after the campaign ends when I send out the backer survey.

(For Finnish backers: feel free to subtract 10$ from the add-on books due to lower domestic shipping costs.)


*Edit* All stretch goals reached! Kitty made it to the litter box! Hoooorayyy!

Okay, I didn't want to get carried off with a lot of extra stuff to make on the side, instead just stick with what I know I can do well: a cute little SSSS-themed postcard print set! Five prints in total. I'm still painting them (one is done) but you can see the previews below.
 Suitable for sending to friends and family or to keep for yourself, and a nice thing to get with your book if you're the kind of person who likes...things. With their books. There will be a sixth print design added to the set if we reach the 75k stretch goal. 


-for joining in on the print drive or for just reading my comic! And if you want to help out in a non-monetary way just tell your friends, your enemies, dog, cat and hermit neighbour about this.   

 

SSSS is a member of and  gets promotion help from The Hiveworks. An extra thanks to them.

It all went quite smoothly and I got the books finished and sent out on time. I also learned a whole lot of things that'll hopefully make things flow even smoother this time.  Fingers crossed!)

If you want to add extra items to your package go ahead and do so! This chart here shows the cost of any items added to one of the base pledge levels. 

If you haven't pledged yet click on the pledge level you want, and on the first tab there's a field called "additional gift". Here you can simply write in the value of the extra item(s) that you wanted.

If you've already pledged and want to still add things: click on "contribute now" at the top (pink button), select "no perk" and enter in the value of the extra items you want. Make sure you use the same account/email for each contribution you make so that I'll be able to merge them afterwards.You'll be able to pick out which extra items you paid for after the campaign ends when I send out the backer survey.(For Finnish backers: feel free to subtract 10$ from the add-on books due to lower domestic shipping costs.)











*Edit* All stretch goals reached! Kitty made it to the litter box! Hoooorayyy!Okay, I didn't want to get carried off with a lot of extra stuff to make on the side, instead just stick with what I know I can do well: a cute little SSSS-themed postcard print set! Five prints in total. I'm still painting them (one is done) but you can see the previews below.
 Suitable for sending to friends and family or to keep for yourself, and a nice thing to get with your book if you're the kind of person who likes...things. With their books. There will be a sixth print design added to the set if we reach the 75k stretch goal. 






-for joining in on the print drive or for just reading my comic! And if you want to help out in a non-monetary way just tell your friends, your enemies, dog, cat and hermit neighbour about this.   

 
SSSS is a member of and  gets promotion help from The Hiveworks. An extra thanks to them.

story:
ONLY ITALIAN

IMPORTANTE - LEGGETE TUTTO CON ATTENZIONE

 

Salve a tutti, sono Georgette, l'autrice di Brand Röd.

Dopo un anno e mezzo sono in procinto di stampare il secondo volume di quest'opera la quale, salvo imprevisti, dovrebbe uscire per la fiera Cartoomics che si terrà a Milano RHO dal 9 all'11 di marzo. 

Ancora una volta sono qui a chiedere il vostro aiuto. Sono riuscita a pagare lo stand della fiera, il parcheggio, l'alloggio e i vari gadget ma senza il vostro supporto non mi sarà possibile stampare il nuovo volume. Purtroppo so' povera (in realtà sono state tutte le spese sopra elencate che mi hanno reso povera.)!
 

Come sarà il secondo volume di Brand Röd?
Il volume conterrà l'intero terzo capitolo della storia (disponibile su Tapas) più una ventina di pagine extra. In tutto sarà sulle 70 pagine come il primo.

I premi.
Ho cercato di dare più scelta possibile con i pacchetti, ma ovviamente non potevo farne mille quindi ho cercato di crearne un numero giusto senza che il tutto apparisse troppo dispersivo.

PER CHI HA NEL PACCHETTO GADGET A SCELTA E/O LA DEDICA PERSONALIZZATA.
Se volete essere sicuri di ricevere il gadget che volete e/o lo sketch del personaggio che vi piace, per favore fatemelo sapere!
Avete due soluzioni:
1. Usare il pulsante "Ask a question" di Indiegogo, situato appena sotto al titolo della campagna.
2. Scrivere un messaggio privato alla mia pagina Facebook.

In entrambi i casi specificate chi siete (nome e cognome), quale pacchetto avete scelto e aggiungete il gadget che vorreste e chi desiderate vi disegni nella dedica. 

Qui di seguito vi lascio le immagini dei nuovi gadget:

I DESIGN DEI PORTACHIAVI SINGOLI


LA COPPIETTA


LE DUE NUOVE SPILLE


Mi raccomando, non partecipate al crowdfunding come anonimi! Ho bisogno di sapere chi siete per potervi riconoscere e avere i vostri dati per la spedizione!

CHI MI SEGUE SU PATREON E DONA DAi 5€ IN SU NON PAGA LA SPEDIZIONE!

Rischi, imprevisti e soluzioni.
Purtroppo non ho la certezza al 100% di riuscire a portare a termine il volume e mandarlo in stampa in tempo. Magari riesco a mandarlo in stampa ma succede qualche imprevisto, tutto è possibile. Comunque, se non dovessi avere il cartaceo per il Cartoomics di marzo, stamperò ugualmente i volumi (mi pare ovvio!). In questo caso invierò il volume via posta anche a chi ha scelto l'opzione "ritiro a mano" in fiera, senza spesa di spedizione.
Se invece i volumi saranno presenti al Cartoomics ma chi ha scelto il ritiro in fiera non si presenterà gli sarà comunque inviato il pacchetto per posta con, però, l'aggiunta della spesa di spedizione.
Insomma, in ogni caso avrete quello per cui avete donato! Croce sul cuore!

story:
Our Story

Who is Little Charlie Rose? 

 

...  He's a little guy who may or may not bear some resemblance to a great broadcaster, though any resemblance is a tribute and strictly a result of parody.  He's a guy who loves to hit the town.  Little New York is still pretty big. 

 

Little Charlie loves going to parties but struggles to get the invites.  He is still hip though he needs a new hip. 

 

He's got a sense of humor but doesn't much like being at the center of a practical joke. 

 

The show satirizes Big Media, the Establishment, some of our own beloved Artists, and takes on both High and Low Culture. 

 

 

Who the Hell are we?

 

The show is produced by a group of comedians and webheads who shall be known as Dwayne Membrane and Friends. 

 

Season 1 kinda...  emphasis on kinda...  Took off.  Episode 106, featuring Little Dr. Drew Pinsky, received the following praise from Elaine Liner, who is actually a published writer and heretofore unbeknownst to us.  "Funny!  Strange!"  (From her twitter feed:  Elaine is "Theater critic/feature writer, Dallas Observer; Flip filmmaker, photographer, public speaker, native Texan"...). 

 

Well, it's not quite being annointed 'the next big thing' by the New York Times, but then we spend our days on twitter, not the New York Times anyway.  Elaine evidently found the show via youtube, and tweeted about it...  Which is exactly what we hoped would happen! 

 

Considering that "Funny!  Strange!" is precisely what we were intending, as far as we're concerned, the show is already a critically-acclaimed, smashing success. 

 

... But we've only just begun. 

 

Right now we've finished eight episodes, enough to create an appetite out there for the show.  At that point, the 'what-if' o-meter jumped into the red.  What if we made another eight?  What if we made another twelve?  What if we created a campaign to actually fund the show? 

 

So here we are. 

The Impact

The impact is as follows:  laughter (at least that's what our viewers tell us...  oh yeah, there's that 100% funny rating on Funny or Die as well, I guess that's somethin'...  Though eventually that perfect record will no doubt drop a bit, we're not naive).

 

Someone might learn something or experience the joy of shared insight and/or experience.  Though that sounds kind of lofty and high-falutin' at our little studio...  Ya never know.   

 

We're entertainers.  We're here to entertain you.  It's actually hard work.  Breaking through to a broader audience takes time.  Thus far, the show has been watched, enjoyed, rated and reviewed.  But it hasn't been able to support itself.  This campaign allows for that. 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need money in order to create more shows.  We're just getting started...

  

As for perks...  Well, we're here.  We're not short on ideas, though the show does take place in a little world. 

 

We'd love to interact with our followers & viewers.  Suggest a guest, or literally advertise your business on the show.  We're not afraid to stoop over to scratch a mouse's head...  Nor are we afraid of brand placement and/or actual advertising. 

 

The question is, How Can We Keep Working on the Show?   

Answer:  Working Capital. 

 

You want perks?  Happy to oblige.  Anyone who throws in fifty bucks will damned sure get a t-shirt with the Little Charlie logo on it. 

 

More than that, we need to see if anyone out there who gets the show - BUT WHO DOES NOT KNOW US, which is important - would actually pay to help keep it broadcasting. 

 

Sounds like a boondoggle.  An impossibility.  But we're dumb enough to try, and shameless enough to pitch it to you, the indiegogo.com surfer.  There's an element of pure subway-busking to this...  only the subway includes the whole world, it doesn't smell like years-old urine, and you don't have to look sadly past us while we shuck and jive for the two bits! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just watch the show and share the links.   

 

Little Charlie is an ornery little rascal.  He wants his own t-shirt.  So hopefully we'll get to that phase. 

 

Best,

Dwayne Membrane and the Little Charlie Rose Show crew

story:
Tara's Tale

When Tara was nine her father died and she was adopted by the Satos, owners of multi-million dollar enterprise Mirai Systems. Ten years later, the young woman once again had fate abruptly pull the rug from under her feet.

Faced with a situation she could never have dreamed of, threatened by those she had considered friends, Tara had to make a choice. So she put on a mask and cape, becoming someone who could do what no one else seemed prepared to - protect Costa City and fight those who exploit it for their own ends.

She became Lady Phantom.

This is her story.

***

With Lady Phantom we are looking to create a classic vigilante tale updated for today. We want to create a rich and believable world with a lot of diversity, realistic and varied characters, and a back-drop of current issues and politics - hopefully without stereotyping or sugar-coating.

Our story takes place in Costa City - a (mostly) fictional harbor city on the Oregon coast; a city with strong Japanese connections and long time history of racial prejudice, brought to the boiling point by the current political climate. During the series we will touch on such subjects as racism, sexism, lgbtq-issues, ethics and morals, corruption, and violence from those who are supposed to protect us.

Lady Phantom lives in a very real world, and the real world isn't always a pretty place. It isn't always easy to distinguish the heroes from the villains - almost no one is all good or all evil - and our story and characters should hopefully reflect that.

We want to entertain you, but we also want to make people think, and we want to present a multi-faceted and modern vigilante story that isn't afraid to deal with controversial and difficult issues. We want a main character who is human, relatable, flawed - but who can still be a good role model.

This will not all happen immediately, of course - a comic book issue can only hold so much. Our plans are long term and bigger than a single story arc, and as the story progresses you should see more and more facets of both the characters and the world around them.

***

You can download our prequel, Lady Phantom Issue Zero, and read the story of how Tara started on the path to becoming a vigilante:

Issue Zero is also available to read in the comichaus app, and all six issues of the mini-series will see digital release there before it becomes available anywhere else!

In the upcoming mini-series we get to follow Tara as she takes to the streets in pursuit of the elusive Poet - a key figure in Costa City's underworld - in order to get to the bottom of the weapon smuggling that has taken place through her father's company. We will also follow Detective Darko of the CCPD as he investigates the claims of a costumed vigilante on the streets of Costa City.

Work in Progress

We have been working on the Lady Phantom mini-series for two years now, and the script for the first six issues is pretty much complete. In addition, we have an outline and ideas to continue the story in another twelve issues, divided into two six issue story arcs.

Issue Zero has already seen print in a once-in-a-lifetime limited and numbered edition of 250 copies. Once these are gone there will never be any more, so if you haven't secured a copy for yourself already make sure to check out our perks below!

The pencils for Issue One are done and our artist Thomas is busy doing inks and color. Issues Two through Four have been laid out with thumbnails and rough art, and layout is in progress on Issue Five, and when everything is done we will collect all six issues in a Trade Paperback.

All in all we have the script and layouts for roughly 170 pages of content divided over six issues, plus ideas and outlines for an additional 350 or so pages, for a total of OVER FIVE HUNDRED comic book pages! Phew!

A massive undertaking, and that's why we need some help!

Creative Team

The core team behind Lady Phantom is a somewhat unlikely duo - American writer Julie K Taylor and Swedish artist R Thomas Allwin.

Julie K Taylor - Creator & Writer

Julie is the brains behind the character, story and world of Lady Phantom. Without her, this comic would never have existed. She is a mixed race single mother who lives in Wisconsin, USA with her children, writing whenever she gets a chance between work and studies.

The idea for Lady Phantom started as a novel, but she quickly realized that she wanted to make it into a comic instead. As a fan of superheroes and a mother of three, she saw the need for strong black female leads to serve as role models and idols for young girls and boys of color.

 

R Thomas Allwin - Artist & Co-creator

Thomas is the one responsible for the visual interpretation of the characters, locations and style of Lady Phantom. He lives just south of Stockholm, Sweden with his girlfriend and their child, working part time driving trains and dividing the rest of his time between his family and his business as a self-employed artist.

When Julie sent out the call for artists interested in working on Lady Phantom, he was hesitant at taking on such a massive project, but after hearing her pitch and her ideas he knew that there was no way he could pass. Quickly, his role extended to co-creator and together the two worked on the story and the characters while Julie wrote the script.

***

Proofreading and Editing
In addition to our core dynamic duo, we are also working closely with proofreader and editor Moriarti Shankweiler - linguistics major and avid comic book reader - to make sure Lady Phantom keeps a professional standard.

Guest Cover Artist
And we are very excited to introduce seasoned comics creator and illustrator Robert Sammelin as our first guest cover artist! Robert is Concept Art Director at DICE and has done a lot of comic book covers for Boom! studios, in addition to his work on several major video game lines. Check out some of his work here and see why we are so excited to have him on board!

https://www.artstation.com/robertsammelin

***

We really look forward to bringing you the story of Lady Phantom and we hope it will have something for everyone - but don't give it to your kids, at least not the younger ones. There WILL be swearing, foul language, and various adult subjects. But we are not going to be unnecessarily explicit, so mature teenagers (I know, that sounds like an oxymoron, but they are out there!) could be a potential audience.

Your Assistance!

In order to make all this happen, we need you - the fans and hopefuls - to help us. Don't get us wrong here, we believe in ourselves and Issues One through Six along with the collected TPB WILL happen. We are fully funded and so all of our initial expenses are already paid for. We will publish everything digitally and make small print runs for backers, selected stores, to sell at cons and online, and we will be very happy with that.

But Lady Phantom could be so much bigger; so much more.

With your help as backers, signal boosters and supporters we are confident that we can build enough interest in Lady Phantom to keep the story going beyond issue six. Our ultimate goal is to get Lady Phantom into the Previews catalog and Diamond distribution so that it will be available for order everywhere - either as a self published comic under our own label or on an indie publisher - but that takes effort and a pretty big established audience.

So if you like what you see and have faith in us, help spread the word so we can cover our expenses and really move forward with all of this. Even if you can't help back us with money, you can get the word out there and bring Lady Phantom to new eyes and minds - something which is so much more valuable in the long run!

You can do this by sharing our content on social media, but also by sharing Issue Zero - you are more than welcome to copy the pdf and send it to friends, family, strangers or enemies - anyone who might be interested - as long as you don't alter it or charge for it.

Budget Breakdown

How will we use your money? I'm glad you asked!

Roughly 40 % of what we get will go to covering perk fulfillment as needed, about 20% will be invested in marketing and advertising, 10% go to covering fees, and the remaining 30% will go to cover the expenses and salaries of the Creative Team.

As you can see, our primary concern right now isn't making a lot of money - we just want to cover our expenses while we produce and distribute our creation on a bigger scale and reach a bigger audience.

Distribution Schedule

So, how will we go about fulfilling all of our promises, you ask? Well, the goal is to finish one issue every other month starting now in June and going until July next year. Of course, we know how life has a tendency to interfere with the best laid plans, and so we have given ourselves an extra two months to get everything together.

If you throw your hat in with us, this is when you can expect your stuff:

  • August 2018: pdf edition of Issue One
  • August 2018: physical edition of Issue One and other physical rewards that can be completed now.
  • September 2018: pdf edition of Issue Two.
  • October 2018: physical edition of Issue Two.
  • November 2018: pdf edition of Issue Three.
  • December 2018: physical edition of Issue Three.
  • February 2019: pdf edition of Issue Four.
  • March 2019: physical edition of Issue Four.
  • April 2019: pdf edition of Issue Five.
  • May 2019: physical edition of Issue Five.
  • June 2019: pdf edition of Issue Six.
  • July 2019: physical edition of Issue Six.
  • August 2019: pdf edition of Issues Zero through Six, collected.
  • September 2019: physical edition of the collected Trade paperback
  • 2020: The next installment of Lady Phantom!

Reward Packages

There are three current possible pre-order levels.

  • You can subscribe digitally, and get pdf's of all six issues as they are produced.
  • You can subscibe physically, and get each issue sent to you as they are printed.
  • You can pre-order the collected TPB for delivery once the full mini-series is finished.

In addition, we have one spot left in the crowd! Get your choice of separate issues or TPB, and be drawn as an extra in the comic! This will only be available for a short time, so please have your photos ready!

Risks and Challenges

So what could go wrong?
Well, a lot. Anything can happen really, and we've already seen proof of how personal issues can affect the creation of a comic.

BUT...

...we are determined and confident, and we ARE doing this, no matter what!

Delays is the biggest risk we face - not being able to churn out pages at a fast enough pace to make our deadlines. We've given ourselves some leeway, but we are still running on a fairly tight schedule and juggling day jobs and families.

We'll get it done, though.

On time - or as close to it as is humanly possible.

What else can tie us up? Printing and shipping.

Costs can go up, delays can happen, packages can get lost. Shipping is already expensive and while we would love to offer traceable shipments it will get prohibitively expensive, especially for the subscribers who will receive six or seven separate packages. We aim to ship as safely and securely as possible, though, and we plan to replace or reimburse lost orders as far as possible.

The risks to you should be low to non-existant. At worst, perhaps you'll have to wait a little bit longer than expected, but we WILL get you your comics!

Work in Progress
We have been working on the Lady Phantom mini-series for two years now, and the script for the first six issues is pretty much complete. In addition, we have an outline and ideas to continue the story in another twelve issues, divided into two six issue story arcs.
Issue Zero has already seen print in a once-in-a-lifetime limited and numbered edition of 250 copies. Once these are gone there will never be any more, so if you haven't secured a copy for yourself already make sure to check out our perks below!

The pencils for Issue One are done and our artist Thomas is busy doing inks and color. Issues Two through Four have been laid out with thumbnails and rough art, and layout is in progress on Issue Five, and when everything is done we will collect all six issues in a Trade Paperback.
All in all we have the script and layouts for roughly 170 pages of content divided over six issues, plus ideas and outlines for an additional 350 or so pages, for a total of OVER FIVE HUNDRED comic book pages! Phew!
A massive undertaking, and that's why we need some help!
Creative Team
The core team behind Lady Phantom is a somewhat unlikely duo - American writer Julie K Taylor and Swedish artist R Thomas Allwin.

Julie K Taylor - Creator & Writer

Julie is the brains behind the character, story and world of Lady Phantom. Without her, this comic would never have existed. She is a mixed race single mother who lives in Wisconsin, USA with her children, writing whenever she gets a chance between work and studies.
The idea for Lady Phantom started as a novel, but she quickly realized that she wanted to make it into a comic instead. As a fan of superheroes and a mother of three, she saw the need for strong black female leads to serve as role models and idols for young girls and boys of color.
 

R Thomas Allwin - Artist & Co-creator

Thomas is the one responsible for the visual interpretation of the characters, locations and style of Lady Phantom. He lives just south of Stockholm, Sweden with his girlfriend and their child, working part time driving trains and dividing the rest of his time between his family and his business as a self-employed artist.
When Julie sent out the call for artists interested in working on Lady Phantom, he was hesitant at taking on such a massive project, but after hearing her pitch and her ideas he knew that there was no way he could pass. Quickly, his role extended to co-creator and together the two worked on the story and the characters while Julie wrote the script.
***
Proofreading and EditingIn addition to our core dynamic duo, we are also working closely with proofreader and editor Moriarti Shankweiler - linguistics major and avid comic book reader - to make sure Lady Phantom keeps a professional standard.
Guest Cover ArtistAnd we are very excited to introduce seasoned comics creator and illustrator Robert Sammelin as our first guest cover artist! Robert is Concept Art Director at DICE and has done a lot of comic book covers for Boom! studios, in addition to his work on several major video game lines. Check out some of his work here and see why we are so excited to have him on board!
https://www.artstation.com/robertsammelin
***
We really look forward to bringing you the story of Lady Phantom and we hope it will have something for everyone - but don't give it to your kids, at least not the younger ones. There WILL be swearing, foul language, and various adult subjects. But we are not going to be unnecessarily explicit, so mature teenagers (I know, that sounds like an oxymoron, but they are out there!) could be a potential audience.

Your Assistance!
In order to make all this happen, we need you - the fans and hopefuls - to help us. Don't get us wrong here, we believe in ourselves and Issues One through Six along with the collected TPB WILL happen. We are fully funded and so all of our initial expenses are already paid for. We will publish everything digitally and make small print runs for backers, selected stores, to sell at cons and online, and we will be very happy with that.But Lady Phantom could be so much bigger; so much more.
With your help as backers, signal boosters and supporters we are confident that we can build enough interest in Lady Phantom to keep the story going beyond issue six. Our ultimate goal is to get Lady Phantom into the Previews catalog and Diamond distribution so that it will be available for order everywhere - either as a self published comic under our own label or on an indie publisher - but that takes effort and a pretty big established audience.
So if you like what you see and have faith in us, help spread the word so we can cover our expenses and really move forward with all of this. Even if you can't help back us with money, you can get the word out there and bring Lady Phantom to new eyes and minds - something which is so much more valuable in the long run!You can do this by sharing our content on social media, but also by sharing Issue Zero - you are more than welcome to copy the pdf and send it to friends, family, strangers or enemies - anyone who might be interested - as long as you don't alter it or charge for it.
Budget Breakdown
How will we use your money? I'm glad you asked!
Roughly 40 % of what we get will go to covering perk fulfillment as needed, about 20% will be invested in marketing and advertising, 10% go to covering fees, and the remaining 30% will go to cover the expenses and salaries of the Creative Team.
As you can see, our primary concern right now isn't making a lot of money - we just want to cover our expenses while we produce and distribute our creation on a bigger scale and reach a bigger audience.
Distribution Schedule
So, how will we go about fulfilling all of our promises, you ask? Well, the goal is to finish one issue every other month starting now in June and going until July next year. Of course, we know how life has a tendency to interfere with the best laid plans, and so we have given ourselves an extra two months to get everything together.
If you throw your hat in with us, this is when you can expect your stuff:

August 2018: pdf edition of Issue One
August 2018: physical edition of Issue One and other physical rewards that can be completed now.
September 2018: pdf edition of Issue Two.
October 2018: physical edition of Issue Two.
November 2018: pdf edition of Issue Three.
December 2018: physical edition of Issue Three.
February 2019: pdf edition of Issue Four.
March 2019: physical edition of Issue Four.
April 2019: pdf edition of Issue Five.
May 2019: physical edition of Issue Five.
June 2019: pdf edition of Issue Six.
July 2019: physical edition of Issue Six.
August 2019: pdf edition of Issues Zero through Six, collected.
September 2019: physical edition of the collected Trade paperback
2020: The next installment of Lady Phantom!


Reward Packages
There are three current possible pre-order levels.

You can subscribe digitally, and get pdf's of all six issues as they are produced.
You can subscibe physically, and get each issue sent to you as they are printed.
You can pre-order the collected TPB for delivery once the full mini-series is finished.

In addition, we have one spot left in the crowd! Get your choice of separate issues or TPB, and be drawn as an extra in the comic! This will only be available for a short time, so please have your photos ready!
Risks and Challenges
So what could go wrong?Well, a lot. Anything can happen really, and we've already seen proof of how personal issues can affect the creation of a comic.
BUT...
...we are determined and confident, and we ARE doing this, no matter what!
Delays is the biggest risk we face - not being able to churn out pages at a fast enough pace to make our deadlines. We've given ourselves some leeway, but we are still running on a fairly tight schedule and juggling day jobs and families.
We'll get it done, though.
On time - or as close to it as is humanly possible.
What else can tie us up? Printing and shipping.
Costs can go up, delays can happen, packages can get lost. Shipping is already expensive and while we would love to offer traceable shipments it will get prohibitively expensive, especially for the subscribers who will receive six or seven separate packages. We aim to ship as safely and securely as possible, though, and we plan to replace or reimburse lost orders as far as possible.The risks to you should be low to non-existant. At worst, perhaps you'll have to wait a little bit longer than expected, but we WILL get you your comics!

story:
Imagine a book so clever, so funny AND so Catholic... Can you imagine it? Does it even exist in this fallen world?

It does now!

We have ventured to gather the most clever, Catholic cartoonists on the interwebs and bring them together to publish that very book. We call it:

The Ultimate Catholic Comic Book

This book is a compilation of work from cartoonists you know and love online. These artists are:

Tom Gould - Tomics

Tom Gould is a lifelong cartoonist with a soft-spot for puns, parodies, and religion. Combining the three was only a matter of time, and through the result – dubbed “Tomics” – he’s able to live the dream he’s had since he was a scribbling babe.

Tomics launched on Facebook in February of 2015. Since then, a strong following and community has grown around the comics. Below are a few favorites. You can also see more here: Facebook.com/tomicscomics/

 

 

 

Jason Bach - Jason Bach Cartoons

Jason Bach grew up in Portland, Oregon reading Calvin and Hobbes and dreaming of being a professional cartoonist. After getting a Bachelor's degree in Spanish and pursuing a Master's in Theology, he found success in 2012 with his ongoing series of Catholic cartoons. He has contributed work for many Catholic organizations, including Our Sunday Visitor, Sophia Institute Press, and Word on Fire Ministries. 

You can see more of Jason's work here: Facebook.com/JasonBachCartoons/

 

 

Pat Cross - Pat Cross Cartoons

Pat loves drawing. He loves America. He loves the Big Man upstairs. His drawings are basically the result of putting these three elements into a petri dish and letting them brew for a few years. His hope is that you will find his work thought-provoking, insightful, profound and maybe, just maybe, a bit humorous.

You can see more of Pat's work here: Facebook.com/patcrosscartoons/

 

and introducing... 

John Smillie

John Smillie is a young hobbyist animator and cartoonist. He enjoys sharing his stories, his sense of humor, and now his faith with the world. His cartoons are a mix of satire and fantastical storytelling with a balance between adorable and creepy. He shares his cartoons on Tumblr and Youtube.

His very first Catholic cartoon, The First Rosary, went viral online immediately. We are excited to have his new work featured in this book.

Here are the details:

This book will be comprised of work never-before-seen online, on the fridge, or anywhere else you could think of. All the comics will be drawn specifically for this book and it's beloved backers and readers.

We are aiming to have the book printed and shipped in the of spring of 2017, hopefully around May. This gives the artists ample time to put on their thinking caps and draw some inspiredwork of art. 

We are planning on printing 500 books, but we would LOVE to print more! We will be able to print more books if we reach the original goal + stretch goals! If we are able to reach the funding goal and have leftover books, we will be selling them online and will work on getting them distributed to bookstores all over the country.

The Publisher

Beaver's Pond Press located in Minnesota is working with us to publish this book. They have an awesome team and they are excited to be publishing this Ultimate Catholic Comic Book with us. The book will be printed in the United States. You can learn more about them at their website: http://www.beaverspondpress.com/

Allocation of funds received:

Here is the breakdown of how the money will be used:
A majority of the budget, about 90%, will be towards printing the book, that's what this is all about! 9% will be allocated for fees encountered through Kickstarter and payment processing. The last small bit will be for miscellaneous payments helping get this campaign off the ground.

TL;DR

The Ultimate Catholic Comic Book is in the beginning stages and we are ready to go. The talented artists are ready to draw their hearts out; we have a publisher lined up to print the book once it is ready; online distribution is ready; and bookstore distribution is in the works. All that's needed now is YOUR SUPPORT! We are excited to put this book together for everyone and their mother to enjoy!

story:
My name is RB and you might see my illustrations in various publications - Expose 10, Exotique 7 ,Imagine FX Magazine , Fantasy Artist Magazine , Heavy Metal...and many more .  2 years ago I met Alberto Ruiz , great artist ,great guy and publisher                    ( Brandstudiopress/Trinquette )  . He liked my work so we published my book "Art of RB White "  .It was accepted very well with my fans all over the world and everyone wanted my book with some  personal touch - original drawings . So I was very, very busy doing sketches   and pencil renderings and giving them away  . After one year I looked at my files  and decided to publish  the selection of the best ones   .

                      

      WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN ABOUT?

The Purpose of this campaign is to raise enough funds for a small print run ( 1000 copies ) of a book filled with my pencil renderings and sketches .Lot of those images I already sent to my fans all over the world so it would be nice to share them with all of you .Images that will be included in the book range from 5 minutes sketches to 2 day  ,11x17 inches big , pencil renderings .

The best part of this project is that all the artwork is done during previous 2 years so after the campaign is over I'll go straight to print !                  

 I appreciate any help that I can get  and remember that sharing this campaign on all social networks is just as valuable to me as a donation .


HOW IS THIS BOOK GOING TO LOOK LIKE? 

This will be 48 pages sketch book . Full color soft cover and black/white gray scale interior pages . Estimated delivery date is March 2014 .

                                       

          

                                                            page samples


        AND WHAT ABOUT THE MONEY ?

If the goal isn't met everything that is donated  ( after fees and taxes ) will go towards the print costs and all of the funders will receive their packages - guaranteed !

Reaching the goal will cover cost of a 1000 books print run , Indiegogo share , money transfer fees and taxes . That amount also includes freight books to me , packaging and shipping to all of you .

Stretch goals sounds to crazy for me now but you never know .So all unexpected money will go towards adding more pages to the book. I have so many sketches I would like to share and they are left for Sketchbook #2 but with your help they can be published sooner than planned !

story:
Make Believe Is About To Become A Reality

London 1899. Steam billows out from every corner of the city while huge Zeppelin airships float in the sky overhead, and Clockwork Servants, the mechanical slaves that keep society ticking along, duck through the alleyways.


Welcome to the Steampunk world of Clockwork Watch - a place where Victorian values collide with anachronistic technology.

 

Clockwork Watch is an immersive story and participatory experience set in a retro-futurist vision of Victorian England. The narrative is played out across two graphic novels, interactive promenade theatre, live action role-play, online adventures, an interactive book and a feature film.


Concept Painting of Clockwork Servant from Doodle to Finished Watercolour

With a creative team that has collectively been in the driving seat of disruptive, innovative storytelling for over 5 years this grassroots project looks to push the boundaries of entertaining transmedia projects...  But more about that later...


What's This About?

This appeal is to raise printing fees for our first graphic novel called - The Arrival. If we raise more than the target amount, it will be put towards developing the film script, launching our website, and developing the promenade performances.


The Arrival tells the story of a world struggling with technological and social change.  New models of  clockwork servants become ever-more advanced and human-clockwork hybridisation is the talk of the town; the clockworks are becoming more human, and not all humans are as human as they think they are.



Images of Chan Ranbir and Clockwork Servant

Our second graphic novel, called – The Breakaway, will open up the world and the cast of characters, soon to be seen with their own compelling stories being played out across different mediums. 


The world introduced in the graphic novels will be played out online, with audiences able to interact with artefacts from the storyworld and live action role play events.


This will culminate in the cast of characters taking up residence in The Old Vic Tunnels for a live event like no other- a one-off hybrid of interactive theatre, prohibition party, steampunk spectacle, and club night.



First Generation Clockwork Servant


The final ‘event piece’ is the feature film- a noir love story set in, you guessed it, steampunk London. Alongside which, we'll publish an interactive book by none other than Alison Norrington.


By funding the printing costs of The Arrival, you’ll also be contributing to the final graphic novel anthology, with contributions from artists, authors, and graphic novellists. Proceeds will be donated to a charity determined by members of our Facebook Group.


Clockwork Watch was created by Yomi Ayeni. 


Is This Similar To Your Last Transmedia Project - Breathe?

Breathe was a series of short films delivered over a three week period,, Whereas the whole experience of Clockwork Watch will run for the best part of twelve months. The project is a multifaceted, participatory, and immersive experience, involving live action role-play, augmented reality, graphic novels, live events, as well as interactive promenade theatre in London, an interactive journal and not forgetting the film. ;)


People want more from their entertainment, and why shouldn't the cinema experience begin the moment a ticket is bought online? How about that pre-film drink at a theatre, could that be part of the experience? There's even room to seed sub-plots in a graphic novel months before the actual film release. There are a million different ways of telling you a story, including letting you be part of one.


Our projects offer a chance to get involved in a compelling narrative running parallel to day-to-day life.  We think we can enrich storytelling and tell bigger, more exciting stories by giving them room to breathe and our audiences room to engage with them, as much, or as little, as they’d like.


The Money

Where we are at right now:

    - We have the film script

    - The graphic novels are being illustrated

    -  The universe is set to go

    - We've mapped out the entire production

    - We have a great team of strategic partners attached


And There Are Other Ways You Can Help!

Clockwork Watch is a global concept and we're looking to get the word out to as many steampunk enthusiasts as we possibly can. With your assistance we may be able to host Clockwork Watch Embassies in other countries! Kindly tweet, post on Facebook, your WordPress blog, Steampunk Forum, or any other media you have access to.


Thank you for your encouragement and support.


The Talent

Yomi Ayeni: Creator and producer of interactive projects such as Breathe (film), Violette's Dream (ARG), Global E-Missions (ITV), and winner of the 2002 Best Use of New Media Award. Works as freelance digital and social media strategist for advertising agencies in London, and hosts a Steampunk event called Seductive Alchemy.


Alison Norrington: CEO and Founder of storycentralDIGITAL. Crossplatform Author & Producer - chicklit story 'Staying Single' and 'Loving NY' (currently in pre-production). Novelist - Class Act, Look Before You Leap, Three of a Kind. Journalist - WIRED, Times Educational Supplement, RedBook, Woman's Way, Irish Evening Herald, Daily Mail. Playwrite - A Fish & A Bonsai, Pistols at Dawn.  Conference Chair for StoryWorld Conference & Online Community Manager for TEDx Transmedia.


David Varela: An accomplished writer who also works across theatre, radio, film and interactive. In 2009, he created Xi,  on of the biggest Alternate Reality Games, and has worked on a multitude of interactive games and dramas. David also writes and produces games for companies like Reebok, Dr Pepper, The BBC and Sony Playstation.


Corey Brotherson: Writes for websites, publishers, magazines and TV. He's a published comicbook writer: co-creator of Bad Luck Inc., A Twilight's Promise, Fragile, The Twilight Cleaner, Magic of Myths and Butterflies and Moths - a full length graphic novel.


Jennie Gyllblad:  Is a comic-book artist and illustrator living in the UK. She loves creating stories and characters using traditional media such as watercolour, gouache, ink and pencil.  Her current projects include a fullength graphic novel with writer Corey Brotherson, titled 'Butterflies and Moths', a short story for the anthology called 'Bayou Arcana' and her own story 'Skal'. Jen has previously worked with RPG publishers such as 'Mongoose Publishing', 'Myling' and 'Kaleidoskop', but also frequently does portrait work, character designs and other painting commissions.


Sam Howey Nunn: Producer: adventures, transmedia, digital and live theatre, games, festivals and events.  Her current projects include an adventure for Coney, an interactive children’s e-book, and a documentary on D-Day.  She is also building the biggest community of writers, directors and producers exploring immersive, interactive storytelling- Stellar Network.

In 2009, he created Xi,  on of the biggest Alternate Reality Games, and has worked on a multitude of interactive games and dramas. David also writes and produces games for companies like Reebok, Dr Pepper, The BBC and Sony Playstation.

Corey Brotherson: Writes for websites, publishers, magazines and TV. He's a published comicbook writer: co-creator of Bad Luck Inc., A Twilight's Promise, Fragile, The Twilight Cleaner, Magic of Myths and Butterflies and Moths - a full length graphic novel.

Jennie Gyllblad:  Is a comic-book artist and illustrator living in the UK. She loves creating stories and characters using traditional media such as watercolour, gouache, ink and pencil.  Her current projects include a fullength graphic novel with writer Corey Brotherson, titled 'Butterflies and Moths', a short story for the anthology called 'Bayou Arcana' and her own story 'Skal'. Jen has previously worked with RPG publishers such as 'Mongoose Publishing', 'Myling' and 'Kaleidoskop', but also frequently does portrait work, character designs and other painting commissions.

Sam Howey Nunn: Producer: adventures, transmedia, digital and live theatre, games, festivals and events.  Her current projects include an adventure for Coney, an interactive children’s e-book, and a documentary on D-Day.  She is also building the biggest community of writers, directors and producers exploring immersive, interactive storytelling- Stellar Network.

story:
The Dying Breed

Five people living in very remote and wild parts of North America each live a 'dying breed' lifestyle. Happy in their chosen lives they find themselves diagnosed with mysterious and chronic/terminal diseases.


They all come together when they realize the source of their diseases came from the New Day Corporation and the owners Mitch and Orrin VanBeck aka The Brothers.

The Dying Breed realizes they need to find a cure to save themselves, and that is the red algae which The Northeastern Mariner aka Machias St. John can help them find. The Brothers want it too, to patent and profit from in their Big Pharm business.

Covering contemporary issues of environmental poisoning, big pharm, agriculture via frankencrops and the Oligarchy arising from the Corpratacracy, The Dying Breed brings new heroes to fight what the little man in the fields, streets and factories cannot.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The Dying Breed Issue #1 had a run of 1000 copies. Approximately 12% went to backers from a successful Crowdfund on KS. Another 10% went out to subscribers who found the series through various promotions and shows as well as our website www.teamdyingbreed.com. At present, The Dying Breed is being carried at several brick and mortar comic book shops in NYC, Syracuse, NY, Seattle, and Los Angeles. 
  • We are going for $1500 on IndieGoGo to help us with the printing and shipping costs for Issue #2. This is a slow growth business and it takes at least a year to get the series into the black which I have every intention of doing. After the first year I am going to begin to explore the launch of a second new series, to help build a new Comics Brand - Feral Comics. 
  • I am offering some GREAT perks including decals, signed print issues, eVersion subscriptions as well as print subscriptions, a copy of the yearly Graphic Novel and even having you drawn into an issue as either a supporting hero or villain, your choice! Check 'em out in the Gallery!

  • I am choosing the flex-funding to help with printing costs. This is not a hand out. I will use the money raised to go into the printing and shipping/mailing costs for Issue #2.

About the Creator and Writer

Eric "EJ" Cedric moved to Los Angeles where he honed his craft as a writer and made a segue into the entertainment industry. He has worked as a consultant on TV shows, providing his wilderness, Search and Rescue and backcountry expertise. (2008-2013) Cedric has been a private pilot, his favorite thing in the world to do, fly airplanes.

Cedric has worked as a writer of TV and features. EJ wrote a screenplay for a major super hero property and several other screenplays that range from a Himalayan Crime Drama to an arctic adventure screenplay. (2008-2014)

He has adapted his first book, "North by Southeast" into a screenplay. The story is based on his experiences living in a small Yupik Eskimo village along the frozen Bering Sea, where he worked as a dog-sledding guide. (2013)

Cedric is the creator of "Port City", a television hour-long serial-drama in development.

As a cruel irony, in December of 2013 as EJ was scripting The Dying Breed and developing a six-issue run for individual prints and a graphic novel, he was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. Never ever compromising on his writing and storytelling career, instead of delving into self-pity it has forced his march forward into creating a fantastic story that now has new, personal meaning to his life.

The passion of flight and aviation has been stripped away due to the diagnosis, but his commitment to writing, his career in entertainment and the creation of The Dying Breed is now stronger than ever.

Says Cedric, "Multiple Sclerosis has changed my life, without a doubt, and it sucks. But my work and artistic creations are now what drives me and gives me that internal fire to keep pushing through this horrifying disease. Creating, writing and telling stories in a variety of mediums is not just what I do anymore, it is who I am. For anyone who has ever faced a chronic and/or terminal disease, be a part of this and show the world we have much to offer and still have that fire in our hearts."

And yes, much like how The Dying Breed are racing a clock in the story, I too am racing a clock to get this project funded, finished and out into the world so I know I have made a difference in this lifetime. And what better way to make a difference than by entertaining and providing a great story and comic book series/Graphic Novel for all to enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Eeven if you can't be a financial backer, you can be a backer by spreading the word via social media:

  • Make as many Twitter posts as you can manage for The Dying Breed's IndieGoGo campaign! Post it on Facebook!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
