story:
The action-packed Cavewoman: Metal Age is a brand new, full color 2-issue series and the first official title launched under the new Amryl Dark Entertainment banner. This InDemand campaign will continue the successful Kickstarter launch of the first issue of the new series here on Indiegogo, and the second issue will follow shortly thereafter in follow up campaigns. Both issues are completely finished, lettered, and colored, so as soon as issue one is fulfilled to all backers, we will get underway with the follow up campaign for the exciting conclusion in issue #2! Both issues will be 24 pages of pure, action-packed story with no ads or filler!

We know that people have their preference of crowdfunding sites so we wanted to make our books available to fans on both of the main crowdfunding sites. Continuing our successful campaign here allows us to serve both communities. 

Story synopsis:

Our fearless Cavewoman was first warned by Razor of an impending threat to literally everything in Cavewoman: Razor’s Run. A threat by the name of Malevolence, The Mother of Demons and she who rules over the realm of Limbo in the space between all worlds. Her power is growing and soon it will require every capable warrior across time, including our Cavewoman, to band together to stop her when the time comes. Is that time now?

Ever since that fateful meeting, Meriem has been haunted by nightmares of the horrors to come. Until one day, while on her morning hunt through the jungle, she comes across some demon minions of Malevolence intruding upon her lands thanks to a portal torn between her world and Limbo. With the threat now at her doorstep, she decides to take the fight to them and crosses over into Limbo, the realm beyond all. There she faces unspeakable evil, vile demon creatures, and human sacrifice! There will be blood, sweat, and of course, METAL! Join us for the Metal Age. It’ll be one hell of an adventure!

7-page preview! 

What we need & what you get!

Cavewoman: Metal Age was set to solicit through Diamond Distribution for a standard release to all comic stores this summer, but due to COVID-19 that was all shut down and we needed to look into alternative avenues to get the product out to fans. We ultimately decided that crowdfunding would be our best way to get the books out and we hope you will support us here! 

We have already written, drawn, and lettered the books. We do these comics upfront "on spec" and get paid on the backend after sales. So we aren't just looking to make enough money to just release the books, but to also pay the creative team for writing, drawing, coloring, and lettering the books. Without the normal chain of distribution through Diamond Distribution and comic stores, we need to take it to the people directly to get the story out and also get us all paid. These books are done and ready to be printed and distributed. This is why we need your help.

These are being sold here similar to our other crowdfunding campaign, only with Indiegogo logos on back instead and all will also have titles on them as shown below. Rather than running the usual full print run for either campaign, we are doing smaller, closed editions with each. So these editions are exclusive to Indiegogo and will be individually serially numbered with the print run count in a closed edition just for here, but the covers are essentially the same on the front. 

So we will run this InDemand campaign for 30 days and then we will print based on orders to make sure we keep the print numbers as low as possible for you! This will also allow us to be able to do some fun stretch goals, because we WANT you to get cool freebies! (check out the stretch goals further down!) After the campaign, we will go to print and deliver in October!

What YOU get:

The 7 incredible covers for Cavewoman: Metal Age #1 are done by some incredible indie comics talents including Andrew Mangum (covers A-C), Bill Maus (cover D), Budd Root (covers E & F), and Izik Bell (cover G)!!! We have them available in both full color covers or the even more limited b&w variants of each! We even have premium cover enhancements that are awesome looking and even more limited! All Premium Enhanced books are virgin covers! (scroll down further to see those)

As the main cover, Cover A will be the mass-market edition at $8 here and no print limit. Covers B-G variant covers are limited to 300 copies max (or less) and will be $15 each. The b&w variant covers are the same prices as their colored counterparts, but are limited to only 150 copies max (or less). A digital PDF edition of the comic is free with any pledge level as well!

We also are doing a $10 custom blank sketch cover that will not be sold in stores and is just for these campaigns with the Indiegogo logo printed on the bottom front corner. We also have a limited supply of the fully b&w Cavewoman: Metal Age #1 Fanexpo edition for $20. We printed 100 unnumbered copies of this special edition in advance for a convention we were supposed to do in March but was cancelled, so we are selling some of them in our campaigns. These have a pencil cover and b&w interiors instead of full color like the regular books. All covers are shown below.

**covers C & D are the topless variants so they are censored below but will not be censored when printed**

There is also a Premium SILVER Wraparound virgin cover edition that will form a large 4-cover image with the wraparound cover coming on Metal Age #2. It is only available in the Premium Silver and is not exclusive to either crowdfunding campaign, with no logos at all. 

This ONE cover will not be serially numbered because the other half of the image from issue #2's wraparound cover wouldn't match numbers anyway since they aren't being printed together.  These will be limited to 200 copies each, but they won't be serially numbered like everything else, similar to the Fanexpo edition.

Cover enhancement options available: 

We have some extremely nice cover enhancement options as well, only for our backers of the crowdfunding campaigns! So these WILL NOT be available in stores later, just like the sketch cover blank and the Fanexpo edition these are ONLY for these campaigns. The price on these is $50 each and we are limiting them to just 100 copies max of each or just limited to orders here, whichever is least. We did the same thing in the KS campaign and like those, the back covers will have the Indiegogo logo just for this campaign, and will be serially numbered with print count numbers on the front right bottom corner of each book.

We are offering enhancements in METAL, SILVER, GOLD, CHROME and CRYSTAL as cover enhancements! So below we have examples of SILVER on the extremely limited wraparound cover (the other half of the image will be a wraparound for issue 2), the Izik Bell cover G, and the Lords of Limbo 11x17 print. (the actual SILVER print will be 11x17 but the sample is smaller since it was just a sample)

Here are close up pics of each of the enhancements. ALL ENHANCED BOOKS WILL HAVE VIRGIN COVERS WITHOUT ANY TITLES. Shown here are CHROME, CRYSTAL, and SILVER for the wraparound cover. CHROME is like holofoil and rainbow in the light, CRYSTAL is very prismatic across the entire surface, and SILVER is very shiny like polished metallic chrome.

Shown below are SILVER, GOLD, and METAL enhancements. Silver is like polished metallic silver chrome, Gold is a very shiny metallic gold, and the Metal is an actual silver sheet of sheet metal with a polished color image printed right on it. (the titles on the SILVER & GOLD will not be on the real books, they were mistakenly put on the sample copies we printed below.)

ORIGINAL ART AVAILABLE!

ADD-ON PERKS:

We have several add-on perks available to add to your main perk during checkout, including the single cover art prints and the trading cards below that are only sold as add-ons.

PRINTS:

We will be offering limited edition art prints of all of the color covers for $10 each as seen below, or all 7 prints for $55. (the print set of 7 is also available as a perk on it's own, and it comes with a free digital PDF edition of the comic as well!)

We also have a special print of the Lords of Limbo that comes on an 11x17 sheet of SILVER stock so that it is shiny. This is the complete image that the 2 SILVER wraparound covers will form when put side by side and these prints will be $20 each as they are Premium stock.

TRADING CARDS:

We also have some custom trading cards made just for this campaign. First up is the 4-card Lords of Limbo trading card set for $10. The trading cards have character bios with some background info you wouldn't get otherwise!

The other set of trading cards we have are printed on actual metal! The "Metal Age" metal cards are printed full bleed to card size sheets of metal and feature "Metal Age Meriem" and "Malevolence, The Ultimate Evil!" This 2-card set is also $10 and only available here! (the Malevolence card is censored for here only and will not be censored on the actual card)

STRETCH GOALS:

We have some fun stuff coming as stretch goals, including bookmarks, stickers, the trading cards above, and 4x6 virgin cover mini-prints!

Who we are:

Amryl Dark Entertainment in a new imprint of Amryl Entertainment, the longtime publisher of Cavewoman comics for over 2 decades. This new imprint is completely independent from Amryl Entertainment & the Amryl Universe, and will offer a different, darker take on the Cavewoman character as well as explore the new shared universe with Razor and the returning London Night universe of characters that will soon be relaunching as well under Amryl Dark. This "parallel world" will be darker, the tales will be bigger, and the stories & characters will connect in exciting new ways. Amryl Dark will change the status quo, but unlike most reboots we will not be throwing out the existing history of Cavewoman or Razor, but rather building upon what is already established  and taking that in a new and exciting direction. You are in for a wild ride with Amryl Dark Entertainment!

Meet the Amryl Dark Entertainment team:

Dave Kopecki – Writer & Editor                                                                                             

Andrew Mangum – Artist & Art Director                                                                               

McLain McGuire – Lettering & Graphics                                                                                      

Kevin Alsop - Publisher

The Amryl Dark imprint is overseen and managed by Dave Kopecki as the Writer & Editor of the line, Andrew Mangum handles the art and oversees Art Direction for the entire line, and McLain McGuire handles all the lettering, graphics, and design. 

We three independently produce and deliver the finished product to the publisher at Amryl Entertainment, who prints and distributes the books for us under our imprint. We do not even solicit our books until they are already completed so that we always deliver as promised, on time, every time. As such, our books will be released as a series of one-shots or miniseries rather than regular monthly comic books. 

Our goal is to deliver fun, '90s-style comic books as opposed to the more traditional modern storytelling in comics that are "written for trade" and that slowly build over 6 issues or more to tell a story. Each series we do will be a 1 or 2-issue self contained story while also part of the larger whole of an interconnected universe.

Risks & Challenges

As we have learned with the pandemic, things can happen to delay delivery. But both issues of Cavewoman: Metal Age are completely finished and issue 1 already printed so the risk is extremely minimal and we intend to ship immediately after the campaign ends. We are a new imprint of a well-established comic publisher with over 2 decades of proven industry success, so you can expect the same quality and on-time delivery of excellent product here. You won't have to wait months for this comic.

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone can contribute to the campaign, but you can still help us out by sharing the project across social media, if you like what you see. We are launching a whole new shared comic universe, and especially at the beginning it is important to get the word out there, and that is where you all come in.

McLain McGuire – Lettering & Graphics                                                                                      
Kevin Alsop - Publisher
The Amryl Dark imprint is overseen and managed by Dave Kopecki as the Writer & Editor of the line, Andrew Mangum handles the art and oversees Art Direction for the entire line, and McLain McGuire handles all the lettering, graphics, and design. 
We three independently produce and deliver the finished product to the publisher at Amryl Entertainment, who prints and distributes the books for us under our imprint. We do not even solicit our books until they are already completed so that we always deliver as promised, on time, every time. As such, our books will be released as a series of one-shots or miniseries rather than regular monthly comic books. 
Our goal is to deliver fun, '90s-style comic books as opposed to the more traditional modern storytelling in comics that are "written for trade" and that slowly build over 6 issues or more to tell a story. Each series we do will be a 1 or 2-issue self contained story while also part of the larger whole of an interconnected universe.
Risks & ChallengesAs we have learned with the pandemic, things can happen to delay delivery. But both issues of Cavewoman: Metal Age are completely finished and issue 1 already printed so the risk is extremely minimal and we intend to ship immediately after the campaign ends. We are a new imprint of a well-established comic publisher with over 2 decades of proven industry success, so you can expect the same quality and on-time delivery of excellent product here. You won't have to wait months for this comic.
Other Ways You Can Help
We completely understand that not everyone can contribute to the campaign, but you can still help us out by sharing the project across social media, if you like what you see. We are launching a whole new shared comic universe, and especially at the beginning it is important to get the word out there, and that is where you all come in.

story:
86'd is the brainchild of Bill Hook and Nick Perry of 86'd Studios. It is an anthology with a carny/freak show theme that features a number of prominent creators from the world of comics as well as artists and creators that have never worked in comics before. The project originally drew inspiration by the Eerie and Creepy magazines of Warren Publishing but is in no way an imitation of those classic titles. The diverse creators and their varied styles have taken the original concept and twisted and molded it into something original and new. It will have a magazine format and 52 black and white pages of creepy awesomeness. This flip book will have 2 covers featuring art by both 86'd co-publishers Bill Hook and Nick Perry.

The purpose of this project is to give like minded artists and writers an avenue to feature their work in a setting where there are no editorial limitations to their ideas or the content of their stories. We want to draw attention to a group of outstanding creators that we feel are very deserving. Our end goals are to open doors for artists that may have otherwise been closed and to produce the first of many books that celebrate the indie spirit of art and comics, while still capturing the imagination of the mass market.

 

The majority of the proceeds from this campaign will go the production and promotional costs of the 86'd publication. Additional funds will go towards compensating creators and others that have volunteered their time and talent toward the goal of making 86'd a reality.

 

86'd: A Horror Anthology is suggested for mature readers. This book contains images of violence, gore, sexual situations, and nudity. It not suggested for children under 17. 

 

Contributors to the book include:


  • Grfxmonkey (David Rose)
  • Arnus
  • Bill Hook
  • Doug Griffin
  • Scott Griffin
  • Nick Perry
  • Kelsey Wroten
  • C.W. Cooke
  • Antoine Duthoit
  • Mike Sullivan
  • Brian Holderman
  • Greg Smallwood
  • Jeff Johnson
  • Brian Patterson
  • and more...

 

 

We have offered a number of amazing incentives that we have outlined in extensive detail here on our page. Below are some examples of process work by the creators involved with the project.


More process pics from the book can be seen here:
http://86dstudios.blogspot.com/

story:
Zu mir

Ich bin Dominik Forster, 29 Jahre alt, aus dem schönen Nürnberg, Buchautor und Vorkämpfer für eine zeitgemäße Suchtprävention.

 

Ich war viele Jahre schwer drogenabhängig, habe so ziemlich alle Drogen dieser Welt ausprobiert und mit harten Drogen gedealt. Nachdem mein „Business“ aufgeflogen war, musste ich für mehrere Jahre ins Gefängnis.

 

Nach meiner Entlassung folgten mehrere Entzüge, Therapien und Rückfälle. Aber ich hatte das große Glück, auf Menschen zu treffen, die mir neue Wege aufgezeigt haben. Heute bin ich clean und ich habe einen verantwortungsvollen Umgang mit meiner Sucht gefunden.

 

Meine Mission

All diese Erfahrungen möchte ich weitergeben. Nicht als Moralapostel - sondern eher wie ein großer Bruder, von dem man lernen kann. Deswegen engagiere ich mich seit Jahren ehrenamtlich in der Suchtprävention, v.a. an Schulen.

 

Anfangs habe ich einfach aus meinem Buch vorgelesen und aus meinem Leben erzählt. Mittlerweile bezeichne ich meine Auftritte als Drogenbriefing: Immer noch basiert alles auf meinen Büchern und meinen Erfahrungen. Aber ich habe das angereichert -  z.B. mit Erklärungen zum Verlauf von Suchterkrankungen. Und ich "spiele" verschiedene Figuren aus den Büchern, damit das Ganze nachvollziehbarer wird, aber auch eindringlicher und unterhaltsamer.

Meine Aufklärung ist authentisch und lebensnah. Vor allem ist sie erfolgreich: Denn ich spreche die Sprache der Jugendlichen und komme aufgrund meines „Lebenslaufes“ sehr glaubwürdig rüber. Ich kenne eben beide Seiten: Den Kick, den Drogen verschaffen können, und die Gefahren, die damit verbunden sind - bis hin zum totalen Absturz.

 

Die Vorlage: crystal.klar. Das Buch

"crystal.klar" ist die Geschichte meines Lebens: Vom Gelegenheitskiffer zum Crystal Meth-Dealer. Absturz und Gefängnis. Entzug, Therapie und Rückfall. Das Buch ist mittlerweile ein echter Bestseller (mehr als 20000 verkaufte Exemplare) und die Rezensionen z.B. auf Amazon sind super!

Übrigens: Die Fortsetzung von „crystal.klar“, „klar.kommen“ ist vor einigen Wochen im Fabulus-Verlag erschienen.

Auf meinen Veranstaltungen erlebe ich immer wieder, wie wie sehr meine Erlebnisse und Erfahrungen die Jugendlichen bewegen. Ich erhalte sehr viele Zuschriften von jungen Menschen, die sich intensiv mit der gesamten Drogen- und Suchtproblematik auseinandersetzen, nachdem sie „crystal.klar“ gelesen haben.

 

Die nächste Stufe: crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel

Mit Eurer Unterstützung will ich nun die nächste Stufe zünden und „crystal.klar“ als Graphic Novel herausbringen!

Denn ich bin mir sicher, dass ich mit einem Comic noch viel mehr und ganz andere Menschen als bisher ansprechen kann. Mir geht es darum, auch die als meine „Leser“ zu gewinnen, die eigentlich gar nicht so gerne lesen.

Wie könnte das besser funktionieren als mit einem stylischen Band, der die Kids allein schon aufgrund seiner coolen Optik anspricht?

Es müssen also Storyboard, Scripting und Artwork für den Comic erstellt werden. Das kann ich nicht selbst übernehmen, das ist extrem aufwändig, dafür brauche ich Profis. Und die habe ich gefunden:

Mit Stefan Dinter vom Stuttgarter Zwerchfell-Verlag habe ich einen erfahrenen Scripter für das Projekt gewonnen, der das Storyboard erstellt und mein Buch als "Co-Autor" in das Format der Graphic Novel „übersetzt“.

Für das Artwork zeichnet Andreas Butzbach verantwortlich. Seine ersten Entwürfe für den Comic findet Ihr hier:

Kindheit

 

Fett im Business

 

Absturz

 

Knast

 

Cool, oder?

Der fertige Band „crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel“ wird einen Umfang von 64 Seiten haben!

 

Das Crowdfunding

Ich habe vom renommierten Panini-Verlag die Zusage, dass sie "crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel" herstellen und vertreiben werden, sobald ich ihnen die fertige Druckvorlage anliefere.

Mit Eurer finanziellen Unterstützung kann ich Stefan und Andreas fair bezahlen und die Druckvorlage für Panini herstellen.

Als Gegenleistung für Eure Unterstützung biete ich Euch gemeinsam mit meinem Team eine Menge attraktiver Dankeschöns an. Schaut Euch einfach auf der Seite um und sucht Euch was Passendes aus. Wie Ihr seht, unterstützt auch Panini das Funding aktiv durch die Bereitstellung von hochwertigen Dankeschöns, die das Herz von jedem echten Comic-Fan höher schlagen lassen.

Jeden eingenommenen Euro stecke ich direkt in die Finanzierung von „crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel“. Je mehr Geld ich auf diesem Wege erlöse, desto schneller und besser können mein Team und ich uns an die Arbeit machen!

Ich möchte mit „crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel“ einen Comic an den Start bringen, der das Zeug hat, das Buch von Christiane F. als Schullektüre abzulösen: Drogenaufklärung 2.0!

Und es wäre ein absolutes Highlight meines Lebens, wenn ich „crystal.klar. Die Graphic Novel“ im kommenden Juni auf dem „Internationalen Comic Salon Erlangen“ präsentieren könnte -  also in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft meiner Heimatstadt Nürnberg.

 

Aus gegebenem Anlass ... Zahlung mit PayPal

 

Ganz wichtig: Wer eine Kreditkarte hat, bucht sein Dankeschön bitte ganz regulär über Indiegogo!

 

Wie manche von Euch bereits bemerkt haben, ist die Zahlung per EC-Karte auf Indiegogo leider nicht möglich.

Aktuell bietet Indiegogo nur Kreditkartenzahlung an.

Für alle ohne Kreditkarte biete ich als Alternative an, dass Ihr das Geld für Eure Dankeschöns direkt auf mein PayPal-Konto "dominikforster@gmx.net" einzahlt, das ich extra für das Funding eingerichtet habe.

Bitte gebt bei der Zahlung mit PayPal unbedingt Euren Namen und Eure Adresse an und welches Dankeschön Ihr wie oft haben wollt!

Und berücksichtigt bitte die Versandkosten, die bei einigen der Dankeschöns anfallen!

 

Ganz wichtig: Wer eine Kreditkarte hat, bucht sein Dankeschön bitte ganz regulär über Indiegogo!

 

Wer weder eine Kreditkarte besitzt noch PayPal nutzt, schickt mir bitte eine Mail - wir finden eine Lösung!

story:
The Cast!

'The Order of CelesSteel' are a team of characters based on the 12 signs of the Western Zodiac - see if you can guess who represents which? Originally mortal humans (with the exception of one...), each member was chosen by the benevolent Star Gods to receive their powers, and charged with the task of saving the last remnants of humanity in the dying fantasy world of Gaiamor, decimated in a war of hatred, greed and lust for power. 

Along their journey through many adventures together, this team of mismatched heroes and heroines will have to learn to coexist and work together to battle back against the forces of evil. Heavily inspired by 80s cartoons, movies and fantasy, CelesSteel tells its story in strong, shameless 'straight from the heart' fashion. The characters all have their own individual back stories, and are designed and written to be immediately familiar and engaging. We want to take older readers right back to their childhoods when fiction truly had the power to touch you, and make you feel that same feeling of fascination and intrigue modern fantasy so often fails to engage.

The ultimate goal is to make you laugh when your heroes become friends with one another and enjoy their gung-ho moments of camaraderie, smile as some may fall in love, and...in cruel (but meaningful) Transformers 86' fashion, some might not make it to the end...

Check back regularly throughout the campaign, when I'll be talking about each character individually and giving a little more background on each, and a few notes of the ideas behind their designs.

The Sample!

Download the full FREE comic here: https://www.celessteel.co.uk/free-download/

The Pitch!

To try and get more people interested in the comic, and on board to start financially supporting the whole CelesSteel project, and the ongoing creative efforts of myself and Retrolution Games. Whilst the comic and videogame are our primary pursuits, we intend to greatly expand and produce far more products, merchandise and projects as we continue to gain experience, grow and develop as a team, and the more people are willing to help out by pledging to and financing us, the more we'll be able to do.

The initial goal is to reach our target of $5000 to produce a new story once we're done wrapping up Part 3 of our current story Murder City Meltdown. As explained in the video, the new story will focus more of developing the characters and their relationships with each other and the world around them, initiating story arcs we can continue to build upon as the story evolves. This means that fans will have the chance to keep on financing us, giving feedback on how the story is developing and which characters and arcs they want to hear more from, and hopefully lead to the creation of a truly imaginative and satisfying canon.

As fan interaction is important to us, we'll also give regular opportunities for generous and enthusiastic backers to cameo in stories. The kind of adventures the CelesSteel team embark upon will naturally see them meeting many side characters such as villagers, refugees, prisoners, damsels and dudes in distress etc, and these would be perfect roles to be filled by fans.

Feedback on the two comics we've produced so far (available from our website www.celessteel.co.uk, and Part 1 is FREE!) has been absolutely fantastic so far, with readers commenting on how well the characters and story emotionally engage with a strongly nostalgic feel as well as the striking quality of the colours and artwork, but we're facing an uphill battle to get it out there to a suitably large enough audience to render the project a success, which will require ongoing investment and effort in order to do so. The more fans are able to help us with this, the greater our chances of doing so - if you give us the support, helping us with donations and by spreading word, in return we'll do our best to keep providing you with the engaging, emotive and exciting fantasy you're looking for.

So thanks for joining us on our creative journey, and who knows? Maybe one day, CelesSteel could really BE something...?​

story:
Short Summary

"If I don't get the lead role in the Hollywood remake, I'm going to be well p***ed off" Danny John Jules (Red Dwarf, Blade 2 etc)

The original Reynard City was strongly influenced by 90s cartoons such as Thundercats, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and the Batman and X-Men animated series. On a basic level it's about three superhero foxes who come to Earth and stop an evil robot fox. However, the story takes a few strange and surreal turns and it soon becomes clear that there is more to it then what you might expect.

Characters

“You had me at superhero foxes” Shaney​ (Webhero Network)

Vibes/AK Girl: When we first meet Vibes, she seems like an ordinary person who works as a DJ at a radio station. But she is also troubled by strange visions and soon she finds out she is actually AK Girl, a psychic superhero vixen with an unusual weakness.

Guillermo/Hyper Rob: The son of a notorious gangster, Guillermo is driven by the need to fight injustice as well as find his lost love Sal. But Vibes is scared that Sal may not be the woman he remembers...

Sal/Wondervixen: Guillermo is determined to track down his lost love. But some troubling visions from Vibes suggest that this former child talent show star is not all she appears to be...

Mega Fox: The fearsome robot fox, brought into the world to create order, who instead decided to impose his own.

Caramel Girl: When Janice loses a key catering contract, she and her friends the Bakery Boys steal some experimental weaponry.

To find out more click on the characters page (as well as find out about some other characters who may make an appearance!)

Talent

“A great project you’ve clearly put a lot of passion into” PhantomStrider (Youtube reviewer)

"21st century angst with a 1980s/1990s palette” Natalie Knowles (Artist)

We have been lucky to work with a whole bunch of creative talent, who themselves have gone on to produce some brilliant titles of their own (such as Dan "Vanguard" Butcher and Susie "Perrywinkle" Gander).

Nicholas Webb and Strider Syd both worked on Issue 11 of the comic, with a bold visual style that has been described as "halfway between Marvel, DC and anime." 

To find out more about the incredible people that have worked on this project look up our team page.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for the £500 breaks down into two main parts-

1. £300 This is the amount we need to get 100 printed copies of the comic.

2. £200 This will cover the cost of merchandise that we want to order in to fund other costs, using established local brands like Green Farm Coffee and Saffire Chocolates, as well as Badge Base who have been very supportive.

If we don't meet these targets, then however much we make will go toward these costs, and will mean there is more money for the artists and creative talent that have worked hard. On the other hand if we get more than our target then the additional money will be given to the team and put aside in a fund for commissions to support other artists (depending on how much additional funds above £500 are raised). You can find out more about our team on our page here.

With regard to merchandise, this is a good time to talk about the perks. Our perks will range from an online copy of Reynard City Chronicles #1, all the way to a special Fox Box complete with merchandise, exclusive gifts, artwork AND a personalised message from AK Girl herself (voiced by the very talented Hayley Evenett, check out her vlog she performed/edited below!)

 

The Impact

We have been fortunate to get support before. We have some fantastic Patreon backers, sponsors (including Visualise Web Design, Norwich Kitty, Edward Couzens-Lake and D'Almaine Photography).

However, in order to get Reynard City on a high enough level and to be able to give the artists the support they deserve, we need your support. Being able to cover the costs of printing and merchandise will mean when we sell those items we will be able to support getting out to more conventions, support the artists more and get commissions for artists who deserve additional exposure.

My eventual dream would be to produce a Reynard City animated series, but I am aware that is very much a long term goal and that first of all I want to make a comic series anyone can enjoy, whether you are a hardcore comics fan or someone like me who discovered them after watching Saturday morning TV cartoons.

Risks & Challenges

It is understandable- delays happen with comics, even at the highest level. At present, Reynard City Chronicles is about 12 pages away from completion. Our aim is to produce one 40 page graphic novel every year. We already have an excellent artist (Joel Draco Petterson) lined up for Reynard City Chronicles #2, and there are plans in place for a full series, with a narrative that goes from beginning to end.

In effect this campaign is building on ten years of work that went into the original series, listening to feedback from both loyal fans and casual readers alike in order to make something that everyone can enjoy.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, there are a number of ways you can help us-

1. Share the link!

2. Create fan art and post it with the link to the Indiegogo.

3. Post a video telling people about the comic and add a link to the Indiegogo.

4. Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Deviantart

5. Subscribe to our Youtube news channel and comics channel

6. Join in with the roleplay forum (shoutout to John Paul Guerra, who also did the welcome video and regulars like Van Hikari, Polaris and Somco!)

Finally, a big thank you to everyone who has worked on this project. If you donate to this, remember this is not just for one person but also Susie, Dan, Jed, John, Nicholas, Syd, Joe, Hayley, Cmore, Marie, Foxybop, Ceri, Becky, Ian, David, Seb, Raye and others.
story_txt:
Short Summary

"If I don't get the lead role in the Hollywood remake, I'm going to be well p***ed off" Danny John Jules (Red Dwarf, Blade 2 etc)
The original Reynard City was strongly influenced by 90s cartoons such as Thundercats, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and the Batman and X-Men animated series. On a basic level it's about three superhero foxes who come to Earth and stop an evil robot fox. However, the story takes a few strange and surreal turns and it soon becomes clear that there is more to it then what you might expect.
Characters
“You had me at superhero foxes” Shaney​ (Webhero Network)
Vibes/AK Girl: When we first meet Vibes, she seems like an ordinary person who works as a DJ at a radio station. But she is also troubled by strange visions and soon she finds out she is actually AK Girl, a psychic superhero vixen with an unusual weakness.
Guillermo/Hyper Rob: The son of a notorious gangster, Guillermo is driven by the need to fight injustice as well as find his lost love Sal. But Vibes is scared that Sal may not be the woman he remembers...
Sal/Wondervixen: Guillermo is determined to track down his lost love. But some troubling visions from Vibes suggest that this former child talent show star is not all she appears to be...
Mega Fox: The fearsome robot fox, brought into the world to create order, who instead decided to impose his own.
Caramel Girl: When Janice loses a key catering contract, she and her friends the Bakery Boys steal some experimental weaponry.
To find out more click on the characters page (as well as find out about some other characters who may make an appearance!)
Talent
“A great project you’ve clearly put a lot of passion into” PhantomStrider (Youtube reviewer)
"21st century angst with a 1980s/1990s palette” Natalie Knowles (Artist)
We have been lucky to work with a whole bunch of creative talent, who themselves have gone on to produce some brilliant titles of their own (such as Dan "Vanguard" Butcher and Susie "Perrywinkle" Gander).
Nicholas Webb and Strider Syd both worked on Issue 11 of the comic, with a bold visual style that has been described as "halfway between Marvel, DC and anime." 
To find out more about the incredible people that have worked on this project look up our team page.

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal for the £500 breaks down into two main parts-
1. £300 This is the amount we need to get 100 printed copies of the comic.
2. £200 This will cover the cost of merchandise that we want to order in to fund other costs, using established local brands like Green Farm Coffee and Saffire Chocolates, as well as Badge Base who have been very supportive.
If we don't meet these targets, then however much we make will go toward these costs, and will mean there is more money for the artists and creative talent that have worked hard. On the other hand if we get more than our target then the additional money will be given to the team and put aside in a fund for commissions to support other artists (depending on how much additional funds above £500 are raised). You can find out more about our team on our page here.
With regard to merchandise, this is a good time to talk about the perks. Our perks will range from an online copy of Reynard City Chronicles #1, all the way to a special Fox Box complete with merchandise, exclusive gifts, artwork AND a personalised message from AK Girl herself (voiced by the very talented Hayley Evenett, check out her vlog she performed/edited below!)

 

The Impact
We have been fortunate to get support before. We have some fantastic Patreon backers, sponsors (including Visualise Web Design, Norwich Kitty, Edward Couzens-Lake and D'Almaine Photography).
However, in order to get Reynard City on a high enough level and to be able to give the artists the support they deserve, we need your support. Being able to cover the costs of printing and merchandise will mean when we sell those items we will be able to support getting out to more conventions, support the artists more and get commissions for artists who deserve additional exposure.
My eventual dream would be to produce a Reynard City animated series, but I am aware that is very much a long term goal and that first of all I want to make a comic series anyone can enjoy, whether you are a hardcore comics fan or someone like me who discovered them after watching Saturday morning TV cartoons.

Risks & Challenges
It is understandable- delays happen with comics, even at the highest level. At present, Reynard City Chronicles is about 12 pages away from completion. Our aim is to produce one 40 page graphic novel every year. We already have an excellent artist (Joel Draco Petterson) lined up for Reynard City Chronicles #2, and there are plans in place for a full series, with a narrative that goes from beginning to end.
In effect this campaign is building on ten years of work that went into the original series, listening to feedback from both loyal fans and casual readers alike in order to make something that everyone can enjoy.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, there are a number of ways you can help us-
1. Share the link!
2. Create fan art and post it with the link to the Indiegogo.
3. Post a video telling people about the comic and add a link to the Indiegogo.
4. Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Deviantart
5. Subscribe to our Youtube news channel and comics channel
6. Join in with the roleplay forum (shoutout to John Paul Guerra, who also did the welcome video and regulars like Van Hikari, Polaris and Somco!)
Finally, a big thank you to everyone who has worked on this project. If you donate to this, remember this is not just for one person but also Susie, Dan, Jed, John, Nicholas, Syd, Joe, Hayley, Cmore, Marie, Foxybop, Ceri, Becky, Ian, David, Seb, Raye and others.

story:
Hello Everyone!

It's Toni Vitale, Writer/Director, Actress and creator of the

Comedy Show "Laughin With TV" 

.

Years ago I worked as a bartender to pay the bills so I could follow my dreams. Late nights, A tough negative business. The party life stole the spotlight instead of my passions. Had this idea for a comedy show, people in my surroundings said I'd never create it. The strong desire to believe in myself especially as an artist jump started a positive change of life. Inspired by the Secret, I realized this was not the lifestyle I wanted to live. Quit Bartending, completed a 180 and dedicated my life to being healthy. Working around dark negative surroundings for so may years made me realize how beautiful positive happy emotions really are. Laughter is one of the best ingredients in the world. There's nothing in the world like funny erupting the soul. This prompted me to build the courage and strength to believe in myself to create the show. One day I put everything aside to write/direct/produce my live comedy show.  Emptied my pockets, put my heart and soul into creating a show I've dreamed about for a long time. It was worth every ounce of energy and worth every penny. Laughter is my home.

"Laughin With TV" is a live sketch comedy show with in-between comedic videos. (Similar to SNL) It has a full cast of 5 as well as a breakdancer crew. The first show was a great success. Since then I have gained knowlege behind the scenes as well as creating material from everyday reality. This next show will be bigger. All the Artists involved get a piece of spotlight. One of the greatest learnings I've had is to take the back seat and support others work. Creating funny showcasing talented artists who also have a dream. Eager to get the next show up and running. All donations will go to Cinematography, Editing for the of the videos, rehersal space, show space, costuming, props, photography, promotional tools, bio booklets....

I cast a man named Steve Walk for one of the videos. He loved comedy and wanted to get back into acting. 3 months after we filmed he was diagnosed with terminal cancer and he passed away. Beautiful soul he had, proud to have given him his last opportunity on screen making funny, but sad he was taken away. 

This show is important to me because it represents change of life. Inspiration to change and live a positive happy life and believing in yourself. Alot of work goes into creating a show. Funny laughter takes a break from the "serious" in life. If there is anything you've ever wanted to do, don't let anyone tell you that you can't do it. You can do anything you put your mind to. All donations are very much appreciated.

Life Is Too Short... Let's Cook Up Funny and RADIATE LAUGHTER!

Thank You Sincerely,

"Laughin With TV" Productions

www.LaughinWithTVproduction.com

story:
MOVIE NIGHT – Comic Anthology by various Artists


Several awesome comic artists and Illustrators have been invited to bring their favourite movies along to MOVIE NIGHT! 

Featuring the work of....

Aike Arndt  http://www.aikearndt.de/
Amelie Persson  http://www.ameliepersson.com/
Andreas Schuster http://mrschuster.tumblr.com/
Charlotte Hofmann  http://www.charlottehofmann.de/
Dirk Sandbaumhüter  http://sandbaumhueter.tumblr.com/
Johannes Mundinger  http://www.jmundinger.de/
Lizz Lunney  http://lizzlunney.com/
Mikkel Sommer  http://mikkelsommer.com/
Malte Spindler  http://terraphantasia.tumblr.com/
Mario Puschmann
Nadine Redlich http://www.nadineredlich.de/
Peter Bröcker  http://pescho.bplaced.net/
Roland Holzer
Sophia Hirsch  http://www.sophia-hirsch.de/
Thomas Wellmann  http://www.thomaswellmann.eu/
Tine Fetz http://www.tinefetz.net/
Wilm Lindenblatt  http://wilmlindenblatt.com/

...and more to be confirmed!

The anthology will be in English and German, printed in full colour and A5.

Join the party by pre-ordering your copy of the anthology now!

For 3 EURO you can buy a pdf copy of the anthology to enjoy in the privacy of your digital devices!

For 8 EURO you can buy a real pyhsical copy of the anthology printed in full colour! (incl. postage in Germany)

For 15 EURO you can buy the anthology and you will also get a selection of exciting extras such as badges, stickers and postcards! (incl. postage in Germany)

There will also be the option to buy signed original artwork from the artists involved!

Every one who supports the project will get a special invite to the launch night which will include pizza and beers. Come and join us for MOVIE NIGHT fun times.

https://www.facebook.com/movienight.comic


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
It’s here! Welcome to the first WCBs Indiegogo project, Stealing Solo: A Captain’s Parody. Stealing Solo . The story is simple a group of men, after the utter disappointment that was Episode VII, decide to kidnap Harrison Ford and force him to remake the movie in their basement. Stealing Solo started out as a joke on the podcast and now it is going to become a full fledged comic book, but the ambition doesn’t stop there. Ultimately, Stealing Solo is destined to become a film that embraces the absurdity of the situation and celebrates the true spirit of Star Wars, but that’s only possible if we work together as a community.

There are many perks for you choose from, but no matter what level you choose to join, you will have in your hands what someone has called the best Star Wars parody since Spaceballs…..just ignore that that person was me…

Release date: February of 2019.  

Since we've blown past our goal, let's talk stretch goals. These stretch goals will be given to all backers, no matter what tier your backed the project at.

$30,000 - Early Bird Certificate. Stealing Solo doesn't hit your doorstep until Feb. 2019, but once we reach this stretch goal, all backers will receive an Early Bird Certificate, reminiscent of what Kenner did for Christmas 1977. Basically, it's something by the holidays to hold you over until the book comes out. 

$50,000 - Anthology: Ashcan Edition. My first comic can be yours once this goal is reached. It's a 32 page bonus book titled, "Anthology"  Anthology is a series of 3 stories that cover the darker side of life. Tales of suspense, intrigue and science fiction. A can't miss of fans of the classic EC Comics of yesteryear. 

$100,000 - Anthology: Special Edition. My first comic with a twist. At this level, I'm going to have this re-colored professionally, re-lettered, and printed to the same stellar quality of Stealing Solo.

story:
STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!

WE DID IT. We hit 7k!!! That's GREAT news. Now, in addition to the Vampirella perk you chose, you'll also receive a very special trading card of my Vampirella artwork. :) - Mindy!

 

 

CELEBRATES 50 YEARS

...and Comic Book artist, Mindy Wheeler, partners with Dynamite to produce this unique, limited-edition cover!


"I'm so excited to be working with Dynamite on this 50th anniversary cover! It's especially an honor to be creating a Vampirella piece at this time when she has reached such an important milestone." - Mindy Wheeler

Whether you're already a Vampirella fan, or curious where to start, Vampirella #1 is the beginning of her modern story and there's a good reason why it has sold over 150,000 copies to date...

VAMPIRELLA #1 is WRITTEN by Christopher Priest with INTERIOR ART by Ergun Gunduz​

"Unexpectedly dark and trippy ride that's worth checking out for fans and newcomers alike." - Adventures in Poor Taste

"This is everything I could have hoped for... Highest possible recommendation." - SciFi Pulse

"The book comes together seamlessly, making it a strong start for a new ongoing series starring a character that has seen decades of stories." - ComicsBeat

"Gündüz is such a brilliant artist, carefully crafting each scene to deliver the most intensity and emotion." - Horror DNA

COVERS ARE AVAILABLE SIGNED AND CGC GRADED!

THESE OTHER GREAT ITEMS CAN BE ORDERED ON THEIR OWN OR AS AN ADD-ON TO ANY OTHER PERK

Stay Tuned for Stretch Goals Coming Soon!

story:
Hello, comics lovers, supporters, and friends. John G. here, writer and creator of The Grim Reaper, bringing you the sequel to our first successful campaign: The Grim Reaper 2.

In this cosmic horror adventure, we will continue the story of the Grim Reaper as he travels to hell, trying to find out who is killing the immortals, and most importantly, with what!

Along the way, he will be faced with many more challenges and foes that will change him forever and put his strength and power to the test. The Grim Reaper has many forms, we have seen him as the mysterious man with the hat, or the cloaked angel of death. This time he is in battle mode, as he unleashes his dark powers, and lets the rage within him consume him.

For this iteration of our beloved character, we have developed crazy new adventures, great supporting characters, tons of action, and lots of great art by the hand of the very talented artist Carla Tornielli. For this campaign, we have decided to try bold things that would surely rock your world, and explore exciting new concepts in this passion project that means so much to both me and Carla, and which has brought us so much joy! I am confident to say that this is our best work yet, and we want you to be a part of it!

 

 

Help us fund this exciting project, and explore all of the cool rewards that we have for you!

 If you help us get funded you can choose to get the Grim Reaper 2, but also an amazing spin-off story involving The Grim Reaper and the mad monk of Siberia, the well-known necromancer and wizard, Rasputin.

"The Curse of the Medallion" is the title of the Spin-Off book we offer along Issue 2.

 

Also, if you missed out on the first issue of The Grim Reaper, you can also get a copy with a variant cover!  How cool is that?! 

In addition to this amazing content, we'll also have some merch available, such as sketches, pin-ups, draw-ins, and a mystery box which will contain secret merch and books.

 

 

 

 

(A little Work In progress of one of the Pin-Ups we offer).

 

 

If you loved the first issue, you are surely going to love this one even more!

Myself and Carla could not thank you enough for all of the support, and the great feedback you had given us. So, to all of the fans of The Grim Reaper out there, I am here to tell you that this one is for you.  This second issue has everything that made the first issue great, while bringing new things to the table that we know you'll love too!

 

And to all of you who are new to this, and have never heard of this project, let me welcome you to the Grim Reaper family, and assure you that you'll not regret backing this book(s).

 

 

We pride ourselves in early delivery, hard work and taking care of all of our supporters. 

If you are a returning backer, you know this to be the case, but if you are new let me tell you right now that there are no risks with this project. The project is almost complete, and we will go out of our way to get it to you before the deadline, just like last time!  It doesn't matter if you are in the U.S. or overseas, if you backed this project, you will get your rewards on time.

This picture is from our last campaign fulfillment.  (The shipping date was set for May 2020, and it was successfully fulfilled in November 2019, just a month after the campaign ended. )

 

Here are some pages from the interior art, which is still in progress. This isn't the final product yet.  Most of the comic pages are mostly complete like the following ones, so the wait will not be long. The talented artist Carla Tornielli is responsible for the amazing art, inks, and colors, giving this project's covers, pin-ups and pages the same high quality. 

 

 

We understand not everyone can contribute, however, there are other ways you can help!

Spread the word on social media, twitter, YouTube, use the IndieGoGo sharing tools, tell your friends and family.

Help us reach enough people, and there will be a reward for you too!

Thank you all again for your support, and we hope to see this project funded!

Also, follow us on our social media:

John Gallagher: 

 Twitter: @JohnGal74923137 

Email: whitecatcomics.staff@gmail.com

Carla Tornielli:

Twitter:  @Carla_Tornielli

Email: whitecatcomics.staff@gmail.com

Instagram: @Whitecatcomics

If you loved the first issue, you are surely going to love this one even more!
Myself and Carla could not thank you enough for all of the support, and the great feedback you had given us. So, to all of the fans of The Grim Reaper out there, I am here to tell you that this one is for you.  This second issue has everything that made the first issue great, while bringing new things to the table that we know you'll love too!
 
And to all of you who are new to this, and have never heard of this project, let me welcome you to the Grim Reaper family, and assure you that you'll not regret backing this book(s).
 


 

We pride ourselves in early delivery, hard work and taking care of all of our supporters. 
If you are a returning backer, you know this to be the case, but if you are new let me tell you right now that there are no risks with this project. The project is almost complete, and we will go out of our way to get it to you before the deadline, just like last time!  It doesn't matter if you are in the U.S. or overseas, if you backed this project, you will get your rewards on time.
This picture is from our last campaign fulfillment.  (The shipping date was set for May 2020, and it was successfully fulfilled in November 2019, just a month after the campaign ended. )
 

Here are some pages from the interior art, which is still in progress. This isn't the final product yet.  Most of the comic pages are mostly complete like the following ones, so the wait will not be long. The talented artist Carla Tornielli is responsible for the amazing art, inks, and colors, giving this project's covers, pin-ups and pages the same high quality. 





 
 

We understand not everyone can contribute, however, there are other ways you can help!Spread the word on social media, twitter, YouTube, use the IndieGoGo sharing tools, tell your friends and family.Help us reach enough people, and there will be a reward for you too!Thank you all again for your support, and we hope to see this project funded!Also, follow us on our social media:John Gallagher:  Twitter: @JohnGal74923137 Email: whitecatcomics.staff@gmail.comCarla Tornielli:Twitter:  @Carla_TornielliEmail: whitecatcomics.staff@gmail.comInstagram: @Whitecatcomics

story:
WELCOME TO DYNAMITE'S COLLECTIBLE EXTRAVAGANZA FOR OCTOBER 2020!

We know you love collecting comics - so do we!  Nothing brings a smile to our face like being able to check special editions off our hunting list as we try to complete our collections.  With conventions all shelved this year we are bringing the chase comics to you. And this special IndieGoGo page is dedicated to helping readers find the comics and rare variants they need to complete their collection.  

THE RARER THE BETTER!

Are you a relic hunter?  Someone that wants the absolute rarest and most limited collectibles out there in your collection?  Maybe you are an eBay warrior looking for the impossible to find variants to grade and sell online.  Dynamite's Virgin cover program is the height of rarity and these books are nearly impossible to find in the wild.

  

BIG NAME ARTISTS 

We've got your favorite cover artists right here!  

LUCIO PARRILLO

ARTHUR SUYDAM

PEACH MOMOKO

JOSEPH MICHAEL LINSNER

FEDERICI

KANO

JONATHAN LAU

JAE LEE

BEN OLIVER

WILL ROBSON

LEE WEEKS

JUNGGEUN YOON

 

CGC GRADED TO PERFECTION!

Do you want only certified perfect books in your collection?  Then check out these awesome rare covers graded by CGC and slabbed for safe keeping!  We've got the hardest to find Virgin Art Covers and the great Peach Momoko variants all graded and ready for you!  

 

48 HOUR EARLY BIRD DEALS!

Everyone loves a deal!  We've set aside a small number of Dynamite's best Virgin Art covers and hard to find 1-in-10 Incentive cover comics just for our early birds.  Get a random 1-in-10 Incentive Book for just $10 ($20 Value)  or a random Limited Edition Virgin Art cover for just $20 ($50 Value)  for the first two days of this campaign!  Get those deals while they last!!

 

GOTTA GET EM ALL!

Part of the fun of collecting is getting all the standard chase variants of your favorite titles. If you are a fan of big bold bombastic variants, then you want to see what all the awesome artists are doing on the comics you collect.  We are making it easy to track them down with these sets of all the standard variant cover comics for the month.  Each set includes all the $3.99 variants of each issue.  Its a quick and easy way to complete your collection with one Add-On purchase!

COMIC SHOP FRIENDLY

We love comic shops and want to help them to service customers in their stores!  If you have a retailer number and want to order any of the Dynamite comics or exclusives, please reach out to us at this email:  customerservice@dynamite.com

We will gladly work with you to get the comics you need to you right away!

 

CAREFUL PACKAGING & IMPACT RESISTANT MAILERS

We know what it is like to order a comic you plan to grade or get signed and have it arrive dinged up.  Our shipping team treats these comics and shipments like the collectibles they are, making sure everything is picked accurately, packed carefully, and shipped in mailers that are specially designed to lessen the damage that can happen through the mail.  And if there is a problem, we will do everything possible to make the situation right for you.  

TIMELY SHIPPING IS A MAJOR PRIORITY

This project covers books due to ship in October.  As soon as the books ship to us, our warehouse pros will get the orders turned around and out to you promptly.  It is our goal to have the IndieGoGo filled promptly and for you to be enjoying the books!  Please note, CGC graded books can ship up to 60 days later than unsigned books due to grading timetables.

story:
Lire en

Français

Read in

English

À propos de l'autrice

About the Author

Mon nom est Jessi, alias Anouk, et je suis l'autrice derrière le webcomic médiéval fantastique L'armée du Soleil.

J'ai auto-publié divers fanzines queer dont Sofa (2017), Le soir où Kovalev a fait un tour du chapeau (2018), Tout va bien (2018) et Nuit blanche (2018).

La normalisation de la diversité et de la queeridentité est au coeur de mon travail et ma raison de faire de la bande dessinée.

En avril 2018, L'armée du Soleil s'est mérité le prix Jacques-Hurtubise remis lors du Festival Québec BD pour encourager l'auto-édition.

My name is Jessi, a.k.a Anouk, and I am the author and artist behind the medieval fantasy webcomic Sun's Blade.

I self published queer zines such as Sofa (2017), Everything's Fine (2018) and White Knight (2018).

Normalising diversity and queer identity is at the core of my creative work and the reason why I'm making comics in the first place.

In April 2018, Sun's Blade received the Jacques-Hurtubise award.

À propos de
L'armée du Soleil

About
Sun's Blade

Inspirées d'une campagne de jeux de rôle inachevée jouée durant 1 an avec un groupe d'amis, les premières planches de L'armée du Soleil ont vues le jour sous forme d'un pilote de 15 pages en mai 2016. Ces pages ont été révélées au public 6 mois plus tard en prévision d'un lancement officiel du webcomic retravaillé.

Inspired by an unfinished role playing campaign played over a year with a group of friends, the first panels of Sun's Blade were born as a 15 pages pilot in May 2016. Those pages were revealed to the public eye 6 months later as the official webcomic was reworked and launched.

Vous pouvez lire les 3 premiers chapitres de L'armée du Soleil en ligne:

You can read the first 3 chapters of Sun's Blade online:

Depuis le 8 mars 2017, L'armée du Soleil est mis en ligne toutes les deux semaines.

À ce jour, le webcomic contient 3 chapitres totalisant 92 pages.

Since March 8 2017, Sun's Blade is updated online every two weeks.

To this day, the webcomic contains 3 chapters for a total of 92 pages.

Le livre

The Book

Les chapitres 1, 2 et un bonus exclusif seront compilés dans un 1er livre physique et auto-publié à paraître pour le Festival de bande dessinée de Montréal (FBDM) le 24 mai prochain.

Chapters 1, 2 and an exclusive bonus will be compiled into a 1st self-published physical book set to be released for Montreal's comic arts festival (MCAF) on May 24.

Avoir des copies de L'armée du Soleil à ma table de convention va rendre le projet concret aux yeux des visiteurs et lui donner la crédibilité qu'il mérite. Je suis très fière de l'avoir amené jusqu'ici et votre contribution l'aidera grandement à grandir.

L'impression d'une bande dessinée couleur est assez dispendieuse. Le but de cette campagne est d'aider à financer l'impression de "L'armée du Soleil, livre 1" pour la saison des conventions. 

Having copies of Sun's Blade to sell at my convention table will give credibility, visibility and the recognition this project needs and deserves. I'm very proud of it and your contribution will greatly help a small project grow.

Printing a colour comic is quite expensive. The goal of this campaign is first to help "Sun's Blade, book 1" be printed for the upcoming convention season.

Synopsis

Suite au naufrage du navire sur lequel y voyageaient, Anaïs, Wilhem et Fritz sont pris sur une île inconnue et enneigée. Le groupe parcourt le territoire à la recherche de quelqu'un ou quelque chose qui pourra les aider à les guider vers la maison.

Chapitre bonus: Wilhem avant la tempête...

After the ship on which they were travelling crashed, Anaïs, Wilhem and Fritz are stuck on an unknown snowy island. They then journey on the lands in hope of finding anyone or anything that can help them find their way back home.​

Bonus chapter: Will before the storm...

Ce qu'on a besoin

What We Need

Ce que vous recevez

What You Get

DIGITAL pack

  • PDF de "L'armée du Soleil, livre 1"
  • Dossier contenant tous les fonds d'écrans
  • PDF version of "Sun's Blade, book 1"
  • Folder containing every wallpapers

PHYSICAL pack

  • Copie physique de "L'armée du Soleil, livre 1"
  • Signet
  • Autocollant du Soleil
  • Ex-libris exclusif
  • Physical copy of "Sun's Blade, book 1"
  • Bookmark
  • Sun sticker
  • Exclusive ex-libris

Rogue Pouch

  • Feuille d'autocollants à l'effigie des personnages principaux
  • 3 macarons à l'effigie des personnages principaux
  • Sticker sheet featuring the main characters
  • 3 pinback buttons featuring the main characters

Risques et défis

Risks & Challenges

Les délais sont très serrés et les risques de prendre du retard sont relativement grands.

C'est pourquoi mon temps et mon énergie seront consacrés prioritairement à la finition des livres. Dans le pire des cas, les contreparties viendront plus tard.

Objectif atteint ou non, tous les fonds amassés vont servir à l'impression des livres et des contreparties.

The deadlines are very tight and there are risks of being late.

That's why my time and energy will be first spent on finishing the books. Worst case scenario, the merch will come later.

No matter what, every dollar collected will be used to print the books and its merch.

D'autres manières d'aider

Other Ways You Can Help

Si tu ne peux pas contribuer en argent, surtout, ne le fais pas! C'est beaucoup plus important que tu puisses te nourrir et te loger que de te vendre mon projet.

Tu peux aider en partageant la campagne sur tes réseaux sociaux! Parles-en à ta famille, tes amis, tes collègues et fais savoir que L'armée du Soleil s'en vient!

Suis-nous sur Facebook et Instagram, et abonne-toi à la liste d'envois!

If you can't back the project, please don't! It's way more important for me that you eat and pay your rent than buying my product.

You can help by sharing the campaign on your social medias. Talk about it to your friends, collegues and family, and let everybody know that Sun's Blade is coming!

Follow us on Facebook and Instagram, and subscribe to the mailing list!

story:
Short Summary

Once upon a time, in a film acting studio far far away (actually not that far- just in Charlotte, NC, but depending on where you're located it could be far far away)...a small group of individuals realized that they were tired of being "normal."  So, under the close direction of Elizabeth Byland, director of improv at Acting Out Studio, these adults dared to do the unthinkable... IMPROV!

These brave individuals overcame their fears, and conquered the impossible, withstood treacherous turbulence, and pterodactyl dinosaur attacks!  Nothing could penetrate their unbreakable bond, a bond that forever would glue these brilliant and oh so abnormal minds together.  Almost like an adhesive, if you will. 

After countless hours of rehearsal, these creative minds put their improv skills to the test each month, and performed under the name of "Mom's Adhesive Improv Team".  Not only did Mom's Adhesive perform regularly each month in their home studio for packed out crowds, but they also performed at the Cape Fear Festival in Wilmington, NC; The Capri on Main Theatre in Gaffney, SC; The Actees Showcase Performance at CPCC, and now they embark on their biggest accomplishment and journey yet... The Tampa Improv Festival in Tampa, FL!  

But they could use your help!

It is nothing short of a gift and true honor to have been invited to perform at the Tampa Improv Fest!  It is by far, the grandest opportunity given, and one that Mom's Adhesive is beyond ready to embrace.  However, with it comes a financial obligation for travel expenses that stack up quite high for a team of well... not so normal, but oh so very brave team of warriors! 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $3,000, which will provide Mom's Adhesive Improv Team with an excellent contribution for the following:

-Round trip flight is estimated at 272.00 a ticket.  

-Hotel for two nights estimated at 300.00 per room  (hoping to find an air bnb that will accommodate all)

-The improvisers are in high hopes of attending some of the amazing workshops offered.  

-Meals will be as cheap as they come with fast food adventures!

If we do not meet our goal, then we will graciously and humbly take any contribution big or small, goal met or just short, and happily apply it towards our travel expenses!

The Impact

You see, the art of improv isn't about being funny.  Sure, that's a perk, but that's not what we strive for.  Mom's Adhesive defines and illuminates the very meaning of improv: listening and responding with honesty, positivity, and integrity to one's inner voice and of the beautiful people around them on and off stage.  

Attending the Tampa Improv Festival provides us with the opportunity to share our gift of honest and creative storytelling through our very own long form of improvisation that we have created and finessed for several weeks of rehearsal.  The format that they will debut at Tampa is a format that relies on the direct and unique experiences of their individual lives and how those experiences, in fact, impact the world around them.  See! I told you they were brave! 

This kind of creative work requires fearlessness, a type of courage that can't be found in a children's novel... This type of work requires all the courage, fearlessness, and support from YOU!  

Risks & Challenges

The risk?... Everything is a risk- it's unscripted.  Welcome to improv.  But why spend your life hiding behind the risks and challenges, when you can grab the person's hand next to you and jump off that cliff together?  

Other Ways You Can Help

We absolutely understand that sometimes, making a donation just isn't feasible.  We want you to know that is more than okay!  We'd love for you to just send us some positive juju, warm thoughts, fuzzy vibes, and share our indigogo page!

story:
Dear Friends,

Pokey the Penguin needs your help NOW.

     For almost 17 years Pokey has made us laugh. I remember the first time I read Pokey in my college computer lab. At first I didn't get it. But I kept reading.

  After about 50 comics, I started to laugh.

   After 100 comics, I was quoting it with my friends.

   I met people in England who had Pokey posted all over their bathroom walls. I met people who got together because of Pokey.
   That's why I'm teaming up with Steve Havelka,THE AUTHORS of Pokey the Penguin, to run this campaign to help fund more Pokey adventures.  Why now?

"I want to work less on day-job work, and work more on Pokey adventures! If you want to see more Pokey comics, could you please give?" -Steve


    People all over the world love Pokey. People in Finland, Germany, Japan, Brazil, the UK, and even Australia and New Zealand love Pokey, and have ordered Pokey books.

  Pokey fans on twitter have said many things about Pokey, including:





        It may surprise you to know that Pokey has influenced art figures such as Corey Archangel and M.K. Hobson, writer of historical fantasy. 

    If Pokey has ever made you laugh, please, give to THE AUTHORS to help them keep writing.


  Steve has never sought personal fame or promoted this comic, it is all done through fans like you.

       You are what makes Pokey go.


  When we read your words on Twitter or Tumblr, or read your emails, it makes us all so happy. Thank you for your words of support.

   Today, Steve and I are asking if you would do something more than offer words. Would you please donate to keep Pokey going?

   When you donate, you are making Pokey live on. Please, consider a donation today. Even a penny will help. Matt says:


   Donations to Pokey the Penguin are not tax-deductible, but are going to make more Pokeys.

   If we raise $2,000 by December 3rd, THE AUTHORS will make 10 more Pokeys by the end of the year.

    If we raise $5,000 by December 3rd, THE AUTHORS will make 20 more Pokeys by December 31st.

"Your support means so much to me. Pokey loves to read your email, and so do I." -Steve


  Thank you for supporting Pokey. Without fans like you, Pokey the Penguin would not be possible.

     Please, give today, and let's make more Pokey adventures happen!

     Friends of Pokey & THE AUTHORS

   P.S. If Pokey has ever made you laugh, please consider donating to keep Pokey the Penguin going.  If we raise $2,000 by December 3rd, THE AUTHORS will write 10 more Pokeys! Let's do it!

What We Need & What You Get


Your donation may have features such as:

  • A customized Pokey gif
  • Thank you note from Pokey,
  • Or a 10 book set!


    If we raise $2,000 by December 3rd, THE AUTHORS will make 10 more Pokeys by the end of the year.

If we raise $5,000 by December 3rd, THE AUTHORS will make 20 more Pokeys by December 31st.


    Risks & Challenges

         Friends of Pokey and Steve Havelka have never launched a campaign for Pokey before. This is a challenge.

         We hope to overcome it by having a professional fundraiser and friend of Pokey, Mazarine Treyz, of Wild Woman Fundraising, come in and help us achieve our goal.

         We are counting on Pokey fans to help us achieve our goals of more Pokey comics!

    Other Ways You Can Help


    Please promote this campaign on Twitter, Tumblr, and email it to your friends who love Pokey!  Here's the short URL for you: http://igg.me/at/POKEY/

    Remember: Not liking Pokey the Penguin=total dealbreaker

story:
We are "The Colleagues' Publications" ("Οι εκδόσεις των Συναδέλφων") a small, workers' owned and workers' managed publishing house and bookstore, located in Exarheia district, Athens, Greece.

We want to print an English version of a comic book we had printed in Greek "Εδώ Ελεύθερα Εξάρχεια" as "Exarcheia Free Calling Zone".

It is a 128 pages black and white comic with the history of Exarcheia from 1850 till our days. Exarcheia is the capital of counter coulture and anarchists in Athens, Greece.

It is a project we postponed the last few months because of cash sortage, so we need your help to make it happen.The art is done, the translation is done, but it can get better, so now we are in the stage of translation editing and proof reading. Some footnotes need to be added, too.

We have pdfs, comic books, t-shirts, signed comic books.

If we don't reach our goal, the comic is going to get printed anyway at the end, but it is going to take some time more.Your contribution will help us print our 77th book, and the first one in english. You will help spread out the word about this unique area of Athens.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us realise our goal by spreading the word, we are based in Greece so we have limited access to english speaking people. If you live in the english speaking world or have friends speaking english let them know.

story:
Our Story

Hallowscream is a global horror comic that brings artists and writers together from around the world. The project is open to both amateur and professional comic creators and you can see the mix of styles and stories for yourself in the first two issues. Visit the Hallowscream website to view the 2009 and 2010 issues of Hallowscream.


In March of this year we announced details of Hallowscream 2011 on various platforms around the internet. From that announcement we received loads of stories from eager horror writers all looking to see their work appear in an online comic. Some of these terrifying tales were already in script format while others arrived as spooky short stories or even petrifying poems. We were then able to match these stories to comic artists who had answered our call and wanted to be a part of Hallowscream.  We also received a few completed horror strips from existing comic creators which had yet to be published. This year's issue features the work of contributors from America, Australia, UK (where it all began) and the rest of Europe!


Doing it for the Love

Hallowscream started as a fun project for a group of friends who wanted to make a comic but has since grown to so much more. While the 2011 issue still includes contributions from founder members we have opened the door to other horror lovers who want to be part of an indie comic. This has strengthened the quality and made for a more interesting blend of horror. Take a look at Back from the Depths to see where it all began.


It would be wonderful to be able to supply the artists and writers who have given their time and energy with a real copy of the comic they can hold, love, show their friends and family and pass on to their grandchildren.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise enough money to supply each writer and artist of the stories that appeared in all 3 issues with their own printed copy of whichever issue they contributed to. We also need to cover the postage cost to send out these copies.


If the full target is not reached then the campaign will be cancelled and this fang-tastic comic will not be printed. It's all or nothing by October 31st.


Should the target be passed any remaining money will be used to print the 2012 issue, which you are all welcome to submit your own horror stories and art work when details are announced.


Everyone who contributes to this campaign will receive a printed copy of Hallowscream 2011 with their name included on the credits page. There are other special rewards for higher contributions which you can see on the right of this page. The Hallowscream T-Shirt is a thing of beauty and will probably take pride of place in your wardrobe. The limited edition hardback copy of Hallowscream 2011 is a rarity while the unique 3 issue hardback copy of Hallowscream will be the only one in existence with a special thank you page dedicated to the yourself.




Spread the Word

This project would not exist without the contributions made by horror fans, artists and writers. Please tell all your friends about Hallowscream and spread the word that Hallowscream.


Updates will be posted in The Theatre of Terror horror comic blog and anyone who contributes will receive email updates regarding this campaign's progress.

story:
UPDATE 17 October: TODAY IS THE FINAL DAY of the campaign so NOW IS THE TIME to make your pledge.  Remember that IndieGoGo's flexible funding option means that we WILL get your pledge and every dollar helps.  Thanks!!!

What if everyone who ever had superpowers had gone insane and become a threat to society?  What if, after decades of this, one man gained abilities "far beyond those of mortal men" but kept his sanity?  Recently discharged from the Army and faced with a society that fears superhumans, a government that hunts them down and growing numbers of crazed supervillains all around him, JACOB ROTH must decide to either put himself at risk by using his powers to help people or do nothing and remain safe while innocent people get hurt.

“THE F1RST HERO” is a unique new take on the superhero mythos, written by ANTHONY RUTTGAIZER and illustrated by PHILLIP SEVY with colors/letters by KT SMITH (American Splendor, Northern Guard) and covers by LEE MODER (Shinku, Wonder Woman, Stars and S.T.R.I.P.E.).  The first story arc is four issues long and debuts around March 2014 from ACTION LAB COMICS (Molly Danger, Princeless, NFL Rush Zone).

(above: Issue 1, Page 9.  ---  below: Issue 1, Page 14)

"A really, really good high concept. It instantly offers a reader a character who we know will face tons of nasty challenges and a character who is unique in the world - always a good start."
- Ty Templeton: Writer, Batman Adventures

"I like the implicit sense of humour. I like the idea that [superhumans] are shunned. I like the dilemma."
- Mark Askwith: Senior Producer, Space Television

"Anthony Ruttgaizer has created a 'Mutant Registration Act' that actually makes sense."
- George Zotti: Co-Owner, Silver Snail Comic Shops

"The premise sounds very interesting. I'm inclined to think it'll be a hit."
- Richard Pace: Penciller, New Warriors/Starman

"I thought [the preview] was great."
- Tony S. Daniel: Writer/Artist, Detective Comics/Action Comics

"[Sevy] is ready to go!"
- Francis Manapul: Writer/Artist, Flash

 

We are hoping to raise at least $7500 so that we can cover our production costs for the series and so we can distribute some publicity material about the series to retailers.  And, of course, a chunk of the money (upwards of 50%) will go towards fulfilling the rewards themselves and covering the IndieGoGo/PayPal fees. 

But the more money we raise, the more we can get done.  If we exceed our goal, the additional money raised will go towards covering some of our start-up legal costs, having some banners made for conventions and getting a head-start on our second story arc/mini-series.

First and foremost, each and every reward package includes the complete four issue series in digital and/or print format.  So you don't have to worry about finding a local comic shop that is carrying the book or whether or not they will sell out of the book before you get there.  Make any level of pledge to help the book get produced and you will get a copy.

The rewards are pretty simple but really fun.  You can get the entire four issue series delivered to you digitally, readable on any home computer, smart phone or tablet, as a PDF for only $5.  If you prefer to read story arcs all at once, we have packages that include the TRADE PAPERBACK starting at $25.  And for all you purists, we can send you ALL FOUR ISSUES IN TRADITIONAL PRINT FORMAT for as little $35.  And you can add the PDF edition of the book to any other package by just adding $5 to your pledge.

We've also tried come up with a few higher tier rewards to spark your interest.  T-SHIRTS, ORIGINAL PAGES OF ART from the series or even brand-new CONVENTION SKETCHBOOKS each featuring a one-of-a-kind original drawing (one character of your choosing) by such amazing artists as FRANCIS MANAPUL (The Flash, Witchblade), MARCUS TO (Batwing, Flash, Red Robin, Cyborg 009), and our own LEE MODER and PHILLIP SEVY.

Or maybe you'd like to see YOUR FACE in the pages of "THE F1RST HERO".  For $125, we have a package that includes a CAMEO APPEARANCE.  For $250, you can buy yourself a SPEAKING PART in the book!  For the big ticket price of $1000, you can become a MAJOR RECURRING CHARACTER in The F1rst Hero.  Your character will be part of storylines for years to come.  Plus, we'll throw in a ton of original art, copies of the comic and other swag.

Please use the share tools near the top of this page and help spread the word about "THE F1RST HERO" via Twitter, Facebook, e-mail, carrier pigeon, smoke signal, jungle drum, interpretive dance or whatever else is available to you.  Even if you can't contribute, you can help make this project successful by telling your friends and neighbours about it.  

The success of this book will be told by how many people buy it, read it and enjoy it.  And if Volume 1 is successful, we'll bring you Volume 2 and 3 and 4 and a whole lot more as we tell the story of "THE F1RST HERO".
