story:
RAPINA: Comic por EKN (2014)

My name is Elkin Grueso (EKN ) , I'm 33 years old and I like to draw comics. I Like Read Comic Books of Manga and American Style. This time I bring a project I want to run . It RAPINA .

  • Argument
RAPINA: The Comic tells the story of a young Afro Colombian named Michael Carabalí (18) who want to help your family to out of poverty, but society is not allowed. RAPINA has to go through many trials if he wants to meet its target. A real life case.  www.rapina.fundaorigen.com 


Technical details of the Comic:

  • Script and Drawings: Elkin Grueso (EKN)
  • Number of Pages: 40 Pages Full Color
  • Number of Chapters: One-Shot (Auto - Conclusive )
  • Format: Graphic Novel.
  • Nationality: Colombia .
  • Genre: Action , Drama, Everyday life , Social Problem , Report .
  • Technique: Drawing Style Afro.
  • Tools: Stylus (Tablet Digitizer )
  • Language: Multi-Language


Tasks to complete the Comic:

story:
Nancy Brooks grew up listening to stories of amazing creatures from her mother's homeland of El Salvador. While she enjoyed the supernatural 'true' stories of witches and goblins, the only thing anyone else outside the Salvadoran community knew about was the Civil War that raged through that country during the 80's. She decided to use her writing to get at least one of these stories out there - El Cipitillo, a mischievous goblin. After she self-published The Isle of Cipit, (which won an award for Best Action-Adventure) she was pleased to find it had drawn interest to other legends. That began her quest to bring back legends that were slowly being forgotten.

Nancy has self-published five action-adventure/occult/supernatural romance novels based upon legends from El Salvador, the Amazon, France, the Middle East, and the United States. She’s currently working with several other legends from around the world, with her main goal being to rekindle interest in ancestral stories and history. She travels cross-country every year to find new tales, meet new people, and gather
information for new locations on which to center her stories. Everything in her
books is based upon research, and the legends can be further investigated by
interested readers. She has also begun a lecture series based on the legends
featured in her books.

Understanding that reading is not everybody’s cup of tea, one of her dreams is to expand into other mediums in order to reach more people. She has partnered with Shane Burke to produce The Isle of Cipit in graphic novel form. Shane is a graphic designer, illustrator, and artist with several years of experience working with the entertainment industry, private collectors, and children’s books. Comic book art was Shane's first true love, and he is eager to get started on the action-packed The Isle of Cipit.

While both Nancy and Shane are passionate about this project, the time and effort needed to produce this comic book will decrease other projects Shane will be able to take on. Concentrating on other fund raising projects will also decrease Nancy's efforts to teach the value of ancestral legends and slow the publication of her sequels. Both author and artist are willing to give back with their original works for any donations given. Shane has offered original art, and Nancy is ready to include donators into her stories - both are priceless considering art and the written word can last for centuries.

They are currently requesting $3000, but any additional funds will be used towards graphic novels based on the sequels. Any promotional efforts will be appreciated.

For more information on Nancy Brooks please log on to: Legendseeker.com

For more information on Shane Burke please log on to: Beezink.com
story_txt: Nancy Brooks grew up listening to stories of amazing creatures from her mother's homeland of El Salvador. While she enjoyed the supernatural 'true' stories of witches and goblins, the only thing anyone else outside the Salvadoran community knew about was the Civil War that raged through that country during the 80's. She decided to use her writing to get at least one of these stories out there - El Cipitillo, a mischievous goblin. After she self-published The Isle of Cipit, (which won an award for Best Action-Adventure) she was pleased to find it had drawn interest to other legends. That began her quest to bring back legends that were slowly being forgotten.Nancy has self-published five action-adventure/occult/supernatural romance novels based upon legends from El Salvador, the Amazon, France, the Middle East, and the United States. She’s currently working with several other legends from around the world, with her main goal being to rekindle interest in ancestral stories and history. She travels cross-country every year to find new tales, meet new people, and gatherinformation for new locations on which to center her stories. Everything in herbooks is based upon research, and the legends can be further investigated byinterested readers. She has also begun a lecture series based on the legendsfeatured in her books.Understanding that reading is not everybody’s cup of tea, one of her dreams is to expand into other mediums in order to reach more people. She has partnered with Shane Burke to produce The Isle of Cipit in graphic novel form. Shane is a graphic designer, illustrator, and artist with several years of experience working with the entertainment industry, private collectors, and children’s books. Comic book art was Shane's first true love, and he is eager to get started on the action-packed The Isle of Cipit.While both Nancy and Shane are passionate about this project, the time and effort needed to produce this comic book will decrease other projects Shane will be able to take on. Concentrating on other fund raising projects will also decrease Nancy's efforts to teach the value of ancestral legends and slow the publication of her sequels. Both author and artist are willing to give back with their original works for any donations given. Shane has offered original art, and Nancy is ready to include donators into her stories - both are priceless considering art and the written word can last for centuries.They are currently requesting $3000, but any additional funds will be used towards graphic novels based on the sequels. Any promotional efforts will be appreciated.For more information on Nancy Brooks please log on to: Legendseeker.comFor more information on Shane Burke please log on to: Beezink.com

story:
The Story in a Nutshell

Written and illustrated as a quirky tribute to two special people I lost to cancer, CHICKENHEAD is the story of an imaginative boy named Ed. He loses his hair and uses the head of his brother's chicken costume to hide the baldness. He even wears it to school! He is frustrated and keeps to himself until mute little Tablet climbs through his bedroom window. Tablet at first annoys Ed with her scribbly little notepad and her girliness, but ultimately, Tablet manages to silently pull Ed out from under the chicken head and back into play.

What I Need & What You Get

CHICKENHEAD needs to be published and spread, but I can't do it on my own! Your contributions are essential!

The goal of $1400 will pay for:

1. hardcover copies to go to the families of the two people for whom CHICKENHEAD was written.

2. paperback dummies to be sent to prospective publishers and literary agents

3. a limited number of smaller paperback versions to be sold to collectors and art/book events

4. and of course, perks for the contributors!

 

If I don't reach my goal?

Any amount contributed will still be deeply appreciated and used as efficiently as possible. The hardcover copies for the families and producing the contributors perks are my highest priorities!

The Impact

CHICKENHEAD has been created with the intention to share the joy left in me by two incredible people. This book is made with a nod to their humor and approach to life. It's my hope that readers get to experience and relate to that!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Talk to your friends about this campaign or e-mail its link!

Follow the CHICKENHEAD blog and share it on Facebook:

http://chickenheadbook.blogspot.com

story:
Michael T. Gilbert’s Wraith series was a 1970s cult classic, and a training ground for Gilbert’s later work on Elric and Mr. Monster. Conceived as a funny-animal version of Will Eisner’s Spirit, The Wraith’s fans include Eisner himself, who wrote: 

“The Wraith has a lot of originality. 
Your style and approach are very vigorous!”

Appearing in all six issues of Star*Reach’s Quack!, as well as Michael T. Gilbert’s Strange Brew, this volume collects every Wraith story, scanned from the original art for the first time. 

It also features unpublished drawings and photos, plus an intro by Mr. Monster himself! 

Michael T. Gilbert’s commentary on each story provides a fascinating behind-the-scenes look at the 1970s comic book scene.

 

The Book

  • Black and White, with Duotone coloring
  • 96 pages
  • Graphic Novella format (a soft cover that feels like a hard cover)
  • 7" x 10"
  • Matte paper
  • 50 copies of a special signed and numbered plate

 

Hip Perks

ALL PERKS CAN BE ADDED-ON TO YOUR ORDER DURING CHCECK OUT

1.5" Punk Rock Style Button

2.5" x 9.75" Double Sided Bookmark

 

The Spirt: An 80th Anniversary Celebration Graphic Novella

Read the stories that inspired the creation of The Wraith! ... Will Eisner's The Spirit. Acknowledged by everyone from Alan Moore to Michael Chabon, Eisner is one of the most important comic book creators of all time! This collection features 9 stories, 4 of them with all-new coloring by Eisner Award-winning colorist Laura Martin and Eisner Award-nominated colorist Jeromy Cox. 

Each story is also introduced by a notable comic book insider, including: 
Bruce Canwell • Greg Goldstein ​• Denis Kitchen • Paul Levitz • Dean Mullaney • Diana Schutz • Beau Smith • Craig Yoe.
 

 

----------------------------------------------------

 

Women's T-shirts

 

Men's T-shirts

 

A Peek Inside the Graphic Novel

 

Meet the Creator, Michael T. Gilbert

Michael and his Inkpot Award, 2014 San Diego Comic-Con

 

Michael T. Gilbert's first comic stories were printed in 1973 in his self-published underground, New Paltz Comix. He began drawing for several Star Reach and Kitchen Sink titles; a mix of underground comix (Slow Death, Bizarre Sex, Harvey Pekar’s American Splendor) and ground-level comics such as Star*Reach, Imagine and Quack! He also worked on the celebrated Elric series with P. Craig Russell and Roy Thomas, a Pacific Comics adaptation of the Michael Moorcock sword and sorcery novels. He’s written or drawn comics starring Superman, Batman, Dr. Strange, Elric, The Simpsons, SpongeBob and the Disney characters. But Michael’s signature creation remains his fearless monster-fighting superhero, Doc Stearn … Mr. Monster, currently celebrating his 36th birthday. 

Michael introduced Mr. Monster in 1983, with new stories appearing in Dark Horse Presents beginning in 2012. For the last twenty years Mr. Monster has also hosted Michael's “Mr. Monster’s Comic Crypt,” a monthly column devoted to comic book history for Alter Ego magazine. Michael has also designed t-shirts, TV graphics and gruesome tattoos. In 2014, Michael received an Inkpot award from the San Diego Comicon.

 

Will Eisner and Michael T. Gilbert, 2001

story:
Hello. I am Rich Hillen Jr the creator, artist and writer of the now infamous Serial Killer Coloring Book. Each comic/zine includes killers to color, activities, interviews, letters from serial killers, serial killer art and serial killer recipes and reviews. Originally published from 1999-2001 the Serial Killer Coloring Books have been out of print since 2003. It is time to carry to torch forward.

Since I don't have the luxury of "discounted" printing and unpaid artists and writers like I did for the first 5 issues, I need to raise money for the final product this time around. 

If you can help out with any contribution it would help. If you can't contribute money and you want to help out please spread the word.

story:
Short Summary


Hello! My name is Thomas Keith and I am a comic book creator and represent 50% of the creative time behind the Raven. I am a writer and love nothing more than writing comic books.  Eric Schock, my partner on this project is a full time Comic Artist and designer who lives that comic life we all dream of.

 Who are we?

o  I am Thomas Keith, graduate of the University of Arizona, a husband, son, brother, uncle, cousin and writer. My work includes self published Brief History in Time, Atlantis: Fall of an Empire, Chance Tales and the End of Times cult. Free Lance work includes writing for Quantum Conditioning by Ross Demma', Lettering and editing Man with a Gun by Logan Naugle as well as Writing several titles for Learning A-Z's Educational Graphic Novel line.

o  Eric Schock, Graduate of Joe Kubert Scholl of Cartoon Graphics, Al Collins Graphic Design School and attended classes at Pima Community College. Eric's work includes Ash-Tray Comics, Evil Robo Presents, Unite and Take Over vol.1, and vol.2, Novem, Evil Robo presents the Golden Age, The Bald Avenger, and Jim Haggin. Eric has also worked on Steampunk Originals, and his artwork is featured in the movie Night of the Living Dead: Re-animated. Eric is a full-time Freelance Artist/Designer.

Eric and I share a love and passion for comics that we are not only lucky enough to have significant others that tolerate it, but FULLY SUPPORT US!  Our passion is not only creating new and original stories and characters, but to educate people on the history of our craft...

WHICH BRINGS US HERE!

       


WE NEED YOUR HELP TO BRING THE GOLDEN AGE RAVEN TO THE PEOPLE!

What We Need & What You Get

Why IndieGoGo?

 Frankly, it's an awesome platform for like minded people who love and support art. I believe in "throwing your hat over the wall." What does that mean? It means you believe in what you are doing SO MUCH that you are willing to take a giant leap of faith and bet on yourself.  After discussing with Eric, we felt THIS is the place for our vision and goal.

That being said...

THE BOOK IS ALREADY DONE!!!

Eric and I, after many sleepless nights and late phone call and email sessions, wrapped the book and have already formatted for print and publishing.

If the book is already done, why do you need our help?

With the book being done, we have invested A LOT of man hours into it. We love what we do, the hours are truly a labor of love from the rewrites, edits, pencils, inks, colors, letters, formatting and so on... if all that translated into dollars the book would have millions of copies in circulation... however... it does not translate.

We have set a goal of $2,000, but in all honesty, anything will help. As I said before, I believe in "Throwing your hat over the wall". I believe in this book, I know Eric believes in this book. Now we hope that you believe in this book and concept.

Here is the breakdown of money contributions.

·  Printing- We want to print a couple versions of the book.

o  First is a regular, 20 page color comic with the first appearance of the Raven from sure fire comics #1 

o  Second is an IndieGoGo version with a couple extra pages strictly for you good people that invest into our vision. 

o  Also, we want to give your more bang for your buck. We are also looking at doing bonus prints and maybe a sketch cover option for your CON goers our artists. 

·  Shipping- I'd love to hand you all a copy personally, but chances of you being down the street are minimal.

o  Shipping will be fun, honestly, this is the part I would list as a challenge. Shipping can always be a struggle between packing, labeling, weighing and insuring and so on. But, come hell or high-water, it shall be done! 

o  Some perks may be odd sized, so shipping varieties may be costly as well.

·  Time and Effort- Those late nights... OH, those late nights.

o  Printing and shipping IS OUR GOAL AND PRIORITY, Anything left over will go to the amazing work Eric put into this book. Eric being the consummate professional, and believing in me and this project, dove in head first to help me get this project done. If you haven't read it, please go read Wil Wheaton's blog on artists compensation (http://wilwheaton.net/2015/10/you-cant-pay-your...), he puts its better than I. AGAIN,  PRINTING AND SHIPPING IS OUR GOAL AND PRIORITY, but it always an honor to reward great work!

The Impact

Eric and his company, Evil Robo Productions, LLC, has done many awesome books, and have had in the past a few that have centered around the Golden Age, and public domain characters including a great Character called The Owl . Eric and I bumped into each other at Tucson Comic-Con where we discussed finally working on a project together... He floated the idea of doing one of these public domain characters... The reason being... Eric and I are old school. While people are lining up to meet the names we all know, Eric and I talk about Jack Kirby, Steve Ditko and many of the great artists and writers that truly crafted the heroes and worlds we love so much... BUT, If I ask who is Jerry Robinson or Bill finger? How many of you knew without searching online? Let alone names like Jack Cole, Will Eisner... or the creators of the Raven, Robert Turner and Joe Archibald? 

Before being a collaborator, I was and am a fan boy of Eric and his work. So having owned and read his book the Owl, I pitched the Raven as a prequel of sorts and homage to the golden age creators as well as answer the origin question of this modern day Robin Hood... We almost went to work immediately.

Our Goal- This isn't just a funny book

·  First, to show the world that there is more capped crusaders then the one Hollywood tells you about. The path to Hollywoodland is paved with many, incredible and forgotten stories and characters-- We want to pay homage to those who came before us. Eric has his original characters The Bald Avenger and Jim Haggin and I have mine, Mikey and Liz from Brief History in Time and so on... None of which would be possible without the efforts and works of people that hardly anyone has heard of.

·   Eric has successfully created These Golden Age books in the past and I have ran successful crowd sources in the past for my all ages books Brief History in Time.

Want to see what we can do and what we have achieved? Check out evilrobo.com and silliemonkie.com

Risks & Challenges

I am proud to see the risks and challenges our VERY, VERY minimal.... The Book is done and is ready to print. We just need you!

The only real risk is books/ prints getting lost via shipping and needing to be replaced... That's it!

We will stay on this through constant updates and replies to any concerns.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE, PLEASE SHARE! We love you and your support, but THE MORE, THE MERRIER!

SHARE, SHARE, CONTRIBUTE and SHARE AGAIN!

story:
Will you like Jonah's Voyage to Atlantis?  

If you like any of these things then YES, you're going to love it:  

  • Stories that feature mythological characters and themes, medieval legends and stories that highlight the battle between good and evil. 
  •  Books like Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit, and Chronicles of Narnia 
  •  Movies like Lord of the Rings by Peter Jackson, Star Wars, and Avengers
  •  Comic books like The Action Bible, The Saints Chronicles, Finnian and the Seven Mountains, and Zita and the Spacegirl

This is our BIGGEST PROJECT YET!! Take a look at what to expect in our new single-issue 40 page comic book (including 6-8 pages of extra material!)

Not all who wander are lost...

The ancient city of Nineveh is under the spell of a malevolent demon who thirsts for souls. In an effort to break free the people of Nineveh from the evil darkness that enslaves them, God sends the prophet Jonah to deliver a message of warning.

However, Jonah turns timid and flees in the opposite direction, away from his divine quest. 

A violent storm at sea puts Jonah at the mercy of a mammoth creature that takes him down into the watery depths. Down in the coldest, quietest waters, in the forgotten elder city of Atlantis, Jonah learns how black the shadow is that falls over Nineveh, and is given a legendary weapon in hopes that he can save the city before it is too late.

Sample Pages

 "I have what some might call an Atlantis complex....This legend or myth or dim memory of some ancient history has always troubled me. In sleep I had the dreadful dream of the ineluctable Wave, either coming out of the quiet sea, or coming in towering over the green inlands. It still occurs occasionally, though now exorcized by writing about it. It always ends by surrender, and I awake gasping out of deep water. I used to draw it or write bad poems about it." ― J.R.R. Tolkien

With this project, we are inspired by the Book of Jonah, as translated by J.R.R. Tolkien (in the Jerusalem Bible). Jonah prays in the belly of the whale and the words used by Tolkien are very interesting and reveal a fascinating Hebrew tradition.

The waters surrounded me right to my throat, the abyss was all around me. The seaweed was wrapped around my head at the roots of the mountains. I went down into the countries underneath the earth, to the peoples of the past. (Jonah 2:6-7)

All other translations omit this verse or translate it differently. However, after some research, this corresponds to an ancient Hebrew story of Jonah traveling to the underworld. You can read more about this Hebrew rabbinic tradition here.

While not directly related, Tolkien had a similar passage in The Lord of the Rings. When Gollum sees the Misty Mountains for the first time he says, “It would be cool and shady under those mountains. The Sun could not watch me there. The roots of those mountains must be roots indeed; there must be great secrets buried there which have not been discovered since the beginning.”

What’s even more fascinating is where Jonah was planning on traveling to, “Jonah rose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord” (Jonah 1:3). Recently some historians have linked this biblical city with the legendary city of Atlantis. You can read more about this fascinating connection here.

Putting it all together, we are exploring these connections and creating a comic book centered on Jonah, as he travels to the legendary city of Atlantis after being thrown overboard. 

It is a mix of biblical history, fantasy and mythology, all merged together to tell a story of mercy, forgiveness and the light that shines in the darkness. Spiritual warfare is also a key plot of this re-telling of the Jonah story, highlighting the spiritual forces active in this world.

CREATOR/WRITER - Philip Kosloski is a writer well known for his accessible articles on topics of spirituality and Church history at Aleteia.org as well as his comic book series Finnian and the Seven Mountains and The Mission of Joan of Arc.

CONSULTING EDITOR - Lewis Helfand is freelance comic book writer and editor. Lewis Helfand's credits include the award-winning Mother Teresa for Campfire Comics and Nelson Mandela: The Unconquerable Soul; named graphic novel of the year at Comic-Con India.

ADVISOR - Kaitlyn Facista is a writer, hobbit at heart and host of the Tea with Tolkien podcast.

For this issue, we are teaming up with Cornerstone Creative Studios to create a high-quality comic book with a compelling story and stunning visuals!

Faith-Filled Stories that Captivate, Inspire and Entertain

Tired of boring, faith-based entertainment?

We understand how many Christian comics and media offers sub-par products that don’t appeal to a wide audience.

That’s why we created Voyage Comics & Publishing.

We aim to provide amazing stories, rooted in the Catholic faith, that anyone can pick-up and enjoy.

Check out the places we have been featured on our Media page!
story_txt:
Will you like Jonah's Voyage to Atlantis?  If you like any of these things then YES, you're going to love it:  
Stories that feature mythological characters and themes, medieval legends and stories that highlight the battle between good and evil. 
 Books like Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit, and Chronicles of Narnia 
 Movies like Lord of the Rings by Peter Jackson, Star Wars, and Avengers
 Comic books like The Action Bible, The Saints Chronicles, Finnian and the Seven Mountains, and Zita and the Spacegirl
This is our BIGGEST PROJECT YET!! Take a look at what to expect in our new single-issue 40 page comic book (including 6-8 pages of extra material!)Not all who wander are lost...The ancient city of Nineveh is under the spell of a malevolent demon who thirsts for souls. In an effort to break free the people of Nineveh from the evil darkness that enslaves them, God sends the prophet Jonah to deliver a message of warning.However, Jonah turns timid and flees in the opposite direction, away from his divine quest. A violent storm at sea puts Jonah at the mercy of a mammoth creature that takes him down into the watery depths. Down in the coldest, quietest waters, in the forgotten elder city of Atlantis, Jonah learns how black the shadow is that falls over Nineveh, and is given a legendary weapon in hopes that he can save the city before it is too late.Sample Pages "I have what some might call an Atlantis complex....This legend or myth or dim memory of some ancient history has always troubled me. In sleep I had the dreadful dream of the ineluctable Wave, either coming out of the quiet sea, or coming in towering over the green inlands. It still occurs occasionally, though now exorcized by writing about it. It always ends by surrender, and I awake gasping out of deep water. I used to draw it or write bad poems about it." ― J.R.R. TolkienWith this project, we are inspired by the Book of Jonah, as translated by J.R.R. Tolkien (in the Jerusalem Bible). Jonah prays in the belly of the whale and the words used by Tolkien are very interesting and reveal a fascinating Hebrew tradition.The waters surrounded me right to my throat, the abyss was all around me. The seaweed was wrapped around my head at the roots of the mountains. I went down into the countries underneath the earth, to the peoples of the past. (Jonah 2:6-7)All other translations omit this verse or translate it differently. However, after some research, this corresponds to an ancient Hebrew story of Jonah traveling to the underworld. You can read more about this Hebrew rabbinic tradition here.While not directly related, Tolkien had a similar passage in The Lord of the Rings. When Gollum sees the Misty Mountains for the first time he says, “It would be cool and shady under those mountains. The Sun could not watch me there. The roots of those mountains must be roots indeed; there must be great secrets buried there which have not been discovered since the beginning.”What’s even more fascinating is where Jonah was planning on traveling to, “Jonah rose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord” (Jonah 1:3). Recently some historians have linked this biblical city with the legendary city of Atlantis. You can read more about this fascinating connection here.Putting it all together, we are exploring these connections and creating a comic book centered on Jonah, as he travels to the legendary city of Atlantis after being thrown overboard. It is a mix of biblical history, fantasy and mythology, all merged together to tell a story of mercy, forgiveness and the light that shines in the darkness. Spiritual warfare is also a key plot of this re-telling of the Jonah story, highlighting the spiritual forces active in this world.CREATOR/WRITER - Philip Kosloski is a writer well known for his accessible articles on topics of spirituality and Church history at Aleteia.org as well as his comic book series Finnian and the Seven Mountains and The Mission of Joan of Arc.CONSULTING EDITOR - Lewis Helfand is freelance comic book writer and editor. Lewis Helfand's credits include the award-winning Mother Teresa for Campfire Comics and Nelson Mandela: The Unconquerable Soul; named graphic novel of the year at Comic-Con India.ADVISOR - Kaitlyn Facista is a writer, hobbit at heart and host of the Tea with Tolkien podcast.For this issue, we are teaming up with Cornerstone Creative Studios to create a high-quality comic book with a compelling story and stunning visuals!Faith-Filled Stories that Captivate, Inspire and EntertainTired of boring, faith-based entertainment?We understand how many Christian comics and media offers sub-par products that don’t appeal to a wide audience.That’s why we created Voyage Comics & Publishing.We aim to provide amazing stories, rooted in the Catholic faith, that anyone can pick-up and enjoy.Check out the places we have been featured on our Media page!

story:
Our Story

The comic industry finds is at an impasse.  It's as if it is a constant state of flux, and like anything in a period of transition, some of the most important elements are often lost in the shuffle as it adjusts and adapts to changing times.  There's no doubt that industry is kept alive by the sales of large publishers, but we must never forget that the industry thrives by the sale of its independent publishers.  It was the independent publishers who helped comics evolve past capes and cowls, it was the independent publishers who turned comics from children's reading material into one of the highest forms of art.  And ultimately it will always be the independent publishers that help feed and grow the larger publishers, providing them with the next generation of writers and artists.  Yet now, amidst all the changes, it's the independent publishers who are struggling to maintain their place in the industry.  

 

Liber hopes to change that.  With a focus solely on quality small press, independent, and self-published comics, Liber offers publishers the things they they won't find with other distributors.  Liber offers creators a chance to grow, a chance to find their voice, and more importantly, find those who will listen.  Liber's distribution services are free to publishers and creators, and we also offer several low cost marketing and printing services designed to help connect you with those anxious to carry your work.  

 

As a distributor we want our publishers to feel like their titles are safe so they can focus on what's important - making the best comics possible.  Publishers will never have to worry about a title being dropped or reorders not being taken due to low sales numbers.  We'll carry your titles as long as you're willing to print them.  And to help get your books into stores we strive to offer retailers the highest discounts possible, along with an easy to use and intuitive ordering system to make any book Liber offers just a click away.  

 

We know that the comic industry is only as strong as the books it produces, and we want to make sure its strength never waivers. 


The Impact

What will retailers put on their shelves if indie comics are no longer distributed?


What We Need & What You Get

All funds will be put into promotion to build brand awareness, improve the platform for easier ordering, and to recruit top talent to list their titles with us,


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by spreading the word! Tell your comic shop that there is a brand new distributor in town and we make it easier and more cost effective for them to stay in business.

story:
Well, this campaign is over, but you can still get news about our project at http://EaGoGo.WapshottPress.com

See you later

All Perks over $300 discounted 30% for our last week!

One more Perk!  Color prints, signed and mailed by Molly in mid-November.  Print sizes approximately 8”x12” printed on Strathmore paper.  See below:

Color prints, signed and mailed by Molly in mid-November.  Print sizes approximately 8”x12” printed on Strathmore paper.  $45 each.

Eschaton-a-Go-Go.  In a parallel universe, Dr. Ravana drags her sister, General Kumbhakarna, into a war on the Gods.  They lose, and are sentenced to a period of exile and penance in our universe.  They meet up with Lake Baikal lake spirits on a spree and help out evolving humanity as best they can.  This ranges from fighting off monsters from another universe to fixing the internet to witnessing the All Girl Rapture and how this affects the future of mankind.

Kumbhakarna in our universe

Eschaton-a-Go-Go IndieGoGo Campaign. Molly Kiely and Ginger Mayerson really need you, your help, and well, your money to raise $12,999 to create the art and publish “Eschaton-a-GoGo,” a rollicking tale of two or more universes, demigoddesses, lake spirits, librarians, comic book fanboys, and how the All Girl Rapture affects the future of mankind.  And the cheesecake, beefcake, panoramic landscapes, cityscapes, surreality, romance, humor, horror, action and emotion as only Molly Kiely can draw.

Ravana and a woolly mammoth

The script was finished in 2009 (Sample), but due to massive time constraints (ie: motherhood) on Molly, only a few sketches and drawings were created.  Fast forward to 2013, and the only thing stopping us from finishing the artwork for a 70- 80 page graphic novel and publishing it is money.

All Girl Rapture 

Yes, money.  We need money for Molly Kiely to have the time and supplies to draw/ink/letter/and in some cases paint 70-80 pages of this epic, and epically wacky epic, fun-filled, sexy, action-packed, and thought provoking graphic novel.

Ginger Mayerson needs money to put it together as a book and publish it.  Yes, Molly is going to have more fun than Ginger, but that’s okay because this book is very much worth it.  And Ginger has an excellent track record for publishing books at the Wapshott Press.

The War in Heaven


Our Perks are the perkiest and only available as fundraisers for this project.  Ever.  These wonderful perks will never ever be available in any other way except as a fundraiser for “Eschaton-a-Go-Go.  So get ‘em while you can.  

One of our very fine perks:  the Postcard Perk for $20 or more (more for postage if outside of the U.S. And, no, sorry, you don't get all of these postcards. You get 2 each of these, so 12 postcards cards in the set)

Also check our blog/website  for updates, social media, and all the news that fit to post to a wordpress.com blog.  If you'd like to help us get the word out about the campaign, there are web banners and graphics you can hotlink to on our website.

As for Ginger and Molly.  Well, the eyes have it.

Please feel free to contact either of us through the blog/website if you have any questions about this project or whatever, such as how you can contribute outside of IndieGoGo. (Yes, honey, we're looking at you!)  Thanks.

Ringing endorsements:

“A graphic novel written by the fabulous Ginger Mayeron (of Hackenbush fame) and the amazing Molly Kiely (Diary of a Dominatrix, Tecopa Jane)? And it takes place in a parallel universe? And there are magical elk headdresses? So there IS something to look forward to! I support this project with all my heart, and you should too. It's gonna be awesome.”
Lene Taylor, Comics Reading Diva, 'I Read Comics' and 'Look at his Butt' podcasts

"News of new comic art from Molly Kiely is not only long overdue, but also very welcomed. I can't wait to read it."
Eric Reynolds, Associate Publisher and Very Cool Guy at Fantagraphics Books, Seattle, Washington

“In 2008, I directed a well-received production of Ginger Mayerson’s bloodily biting political satire, Darkness at Sunset and Vine.  This work embodies what I like best about Mayerson’s work – muscular, lightening-paced plotting that has the brains to match its brawn, and quirky characters that despite being drawn in shades of soul-scorching neon and unflinching black, still retain their power to engage the reader’s empathy.  Mayerson’s novels are a swift left hook to the right frontal lobe -- wicked, witty, and wonderful.”
Kelly S. Taylor, Ph.D., Associate Professor in Communication Studies and Storytelling Prima Donna at North Texas State University, Denton, Texas (no relation to Ms. Taylor, or Liz Taylor, Zachary Taylor, or Taylor Swift for that matter)

Vibheeshana

If you would like to join the Skype conference calls and/or the Google Hangouts to hear how the campaign is going, see new videos and images before they're public, or talk about whatever, here's how to do that:  on Skype please add eschatonagogo to your Contacts so I can put you on the calls.  For Google+, add us to your circles at Molly Kiely Ginger Mayerson, which makes Google+ good for something.  All Hangouts will be public and we can only wait 10-15 minutes for people to show up.  Talk to you soon!

All times are Pacific Times:
Skype; Monday; September 9; 10AM
Google Hangout; Thursday; September 12; 11AM
Skype; Tuesday; September 17; 12PM
Google Hangout; Friday; September 20; 1PM
Skype; Thursday; September 26; 2PM
Google Hangout; Saturday; September 28; 3PM
Skype; Thursday; October 3; 4PM
Google Hangout; Sunday; October 6; 5PM
Skype; Friday; October 11; 6PM
Google Hangout; Monday; October 14; 7PM
Skype; Thursday; October 17; 8PM
Google Hangout; Tuesday; October 22; 9PM
Skype; Friday; October 25; 10PM
Google Hangout; Wednesday; October 30; 10PM

If you'd like to get the reminder emails, please sign up on our ReachMail email blast (where you will also get to see new art before it goes public) or find it on the blog sidebar.  We're only using it for Eschaton-a-Go-Go and not very often after the IndieGoGo campaign ends.

Oh, and also: 

Unlockable rewards, because unlockable rewards are cool:

If we raise $15K, all contributors above the $800 level will receive a copy of the graphic novel.
If we raise $18K, all contributors above the $600 level will receive a copy of the graphic novel.
If we raise $21K, all contributors above the $300 level will receive a copy of the graphic novel.
If we raise $25K, all contributors above the $200 level will receive a copy of the graphic novel.
If we raise $30K, all contributors above the $100 level will receive a copy of the graphic novel, and if you contributed over $1,000, and you are in Los Angeles, Ginger Mayerson will take you on her Blade Runner mini-tour and buy you lunch at Grand Central Market, as well as personally hand you your signed by Ginger and Molly, gift wrapped copy of the graphic novel.

Please feel free to contact either of us through the contact page of our blog/website if you have any questions about this project or whatever.  Thanks.

Kumbhakarna

story:
Quando un gigante barbuto inizia a seminare panico e sfasciare tutto in città, gli Zeroi si attivano per scoprire da dove venga l'abnorme creatura che si fa chiamare Magnitudo. Mentre il Trio capitanato da Ferrotipo cerca di arginarne la furia distruttiva, Gecko e Gattopardo indagano seguendo piste separate, ma le loro strade –e i loro caratteri così diversi– sono destinate a incrociarsi… e a scontrarsi!

E mentre gli Zeroi ne sbagliano una dopo l’altra, qualcuno trama nell’ombra per fare di Magnitudo una forza del male ancor più sinistra...


ZEROI è la terza miniserie (dopo il successo di "Rim City" e di "Quebrada - Seconda caduta") della nuova etichetta indipendente  RADIUM. Un'avventura folle e coloratissima di 80 pagine a colori in formato comic book, dedicata al più assurdo gruppo di supereroi che potete trovare sulla carta stampata.

Sceneggiatura dell'improbabile duo Tuono Pettinato / Matteo Casali e disegni di Cinci con le copertine di Lorenzo De Felici. Altra bellissima gente farà una comparsa in questo progetto, ma ne parliamo più avanti...

Perchè ZEROI?

C’è stato un tempo in cui i piccoli lettori di fumetti potevano trovare nelle avventure dei loro eroi un modo unico di raccontare il mondo: storie in cui gli eroi si battevano per il bene senza troppi lati oscuri, prima delle tante guerre segrete, crisi più o meno infinite e morti di superuomini.

C’è stato un tempo in cui i supereroi erano uno svago, ma anche un modo per iniziare a prendere le misure con la vita, come ricorda il motto reso celebre dall’Uomo Ragno, “Da un grande potere, derivano grandi responsabilità.”
C’è stato un tempo in cui leggere storie di supereroi con superproblemi era divertente e a suo modo educativo.

Quel tempo è tornato grazie agli Zeroi.

IN DEMAND e STRETCH GOAL

Per coronare nel modo migliore il progetto ZEROI abbiamo chiesto ad alcuni maestri del fumetto di confrontarsi con brevi origin stories dei nostri personaggi! Se verranno raggiunti gli obiettivi dello schema sottostante queste storie verranno aggiunte direttamente in tutte le edizioni di Zeroi! cosa aspettate?



PERK!

PERK "STAGIONE UNO"


PERK "LIMITATISSIMO"



ADD ON! 

ADD ON CARTONE
Per chi desiderasse trasformare il Trade Paperback contenuto nei perk di ZEROI nell'edizione Hard Cover sarà sufficiente fare una donazione libera di 10 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON "CARTONE" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta!


ADD WHITE COVER IN BIANCO
Vuoi una trade paperback con cover in bianco da farti autografare e dedicare dagli autori in fiera? Sarà sufficiente fare una donazione libera di 20 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON "WHITE COVER IN BIANCO" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta! Attenzione: questo add on è diverso dal PERK WHITE COVER che vi permetterà di scegliere tra gli artisti radioattivi (Cinci, Tuono Pettinato, Daniele Orlandini, Michele Bertilorenzi e Cammo) da chi farvi illustrare la copertina in bianco ricevendola direttamente a casa vostra!

ADD ON "MUG-NITUDO" SERIE TUONO e SERIE ZEROI!
Una MUG degli ZEROI? Perchè no! Perchè non SETTE! 
Una bella tazza di latte fumante, girelle e buondì e la colazione è fatta! A scelta tra i soggetti che vedete (e vedrete) qui sopra con una donazione libera di 20 € per ogni tazza e la solita mail a info@progettoradium.it con oggetto "MUG-NITUDO". Se volete la serie TUONO intera (composta di 3 mug) prezzo scontato a 50€, per la serie completa ZEROI (composta di 4 mug) 70€.

ADD ON TEE VOGLIO BENE!
Qui sopra vedete due t-shirt che NON SONO LA T-SHIRT STANDARD del progetto ZEROI. Sono magliette indossate da alcuni dei personaggi (e uno di questi e collegato a uno dei grandi misteri della prima stagione di Zeroi!) della storia. Potete richiederle in aggiunta a un qualsiasi PERK che prevede un materiale a stampa (quindi dal PRINT in su) effettuando una donazione libera di 18 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON "TEE VOGLIO BENE" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta! Potrete scegliere il soggetto (e forse anche il colore, dipenderà dal numero di ordini!) direttamente nella vostra area riservata (dove selezionerete anche taglia e sesso!).

ADD ON TPB e HC!
Avete già perkato una copia cartacea e ne volete una in più? Basta fare una donazione libera di 15€ (TPB) o di 25€ (HC) e invarci la solita mail con oggetto "ADD ON TPB" o "ADD ON HC" così potremo inserire i premi aggiuntivi nel vostro perk!


Gli autori


Matteo Casali fa il suo esordio sulle pagine della serie indipendente “Bonerest”, pubblicata anche negli Stati Uniti. Ha creato e scritto “Quebrada”, “Silent Dance” e “Sotto un Cielo Cattivo” e collaborato, tra gli altri, con Coconino Press, Eura, saldaPress e RCS Rizzoli. Ha ripreso l’opera di Hugo Pratt con “Gli Scorpioni del Deserto” e scritto “La Neve se ne Frega”, adattamento a fumetti del romanzo di Luciano Ligabue. Dal 2003, primo italiano a farlo, scrive diversi albi per DC Comics, come “99 Days”, Best Crime Comic al Spinetingler Award 2012. Nel 2009 scrive per “What If? Astonishing X-Men” e per “Iron Man: Titanium” di Marvel Comics. Al momento sta lavorando a sceneggiature di Kriminal (Mondadori) e Dylan Dog (Bonelli). Ha insegnato e insegna Sceneggiatura e Storytelling all’Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna e nelle sedi della Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Reggio Emilia, della quale è co-fondatore e Direttore Creativo, e di quella di Firenze.

Tuono Pettinato, classe ’76, autore, fumettista, illustratore, chitarrista finto. Si laurea in cinema al Dams di Bologna e frequenta l’Accademia Drosselmeier di Giannino Stoppani. È co-fondatore del collettivo Superamici con i quali pubblica la rivista Hobby Comics ed il free-press Pic Nic (del quale è anche copywriter). Autore di best-unsellers autoprodotti come Il Corso di Fumetti Dozzinali e I Sottutto, ha collaborato con la rivista ANIMAls (Coniglio Ed.) realizzando la serie de I Suberoi. Nel 2009 pubblica la sua prima raccolta di storie brevi, Apocalypso – Tuono Pettinato: gli Anni Dozzinali (Coniglio Ed.) che raccoglie le sue collaborazioni a vari albi collettivi precedentemente pubblicati. Dello stesso anno è Galileo! Un Dialogo Impossibile (Felici editore). Per la casa editrice per ragazzi Campanila illustra i libri Il Nonno e Caterina, La Valle Nebbiosa, La Vera Storia d’Amore di Giacomo Candulli, Storie della Natura, il libro per bambini sul wrestling del quale è co-autore Rumble e la serie di Antìkoi – Dei, Mostri ed Eroi del Mondo Classico. Collabora con Repubblica XL realizzando la serie dei Ricattacchiotti. Lucca 2010 vede l’uscita di Garibaldi (Rizzoli) ed è attualmente al lavoro sull’autobiografia a fumetti Il Magnifico Lavativo (Topipittori) e la ZeroGuida Roma 2011 (Edizioni Zero). Ha lavorato, tra gli altri, con Hamelin, Radio Sherwood, CFA Paz e Napoli Comicon. Vincitore dei premi Nuove Strade 2009 (Napoli Comicon) e Carlo Boscarato 2010 come Miglior Autore Unico (Treviso Comic Book Festival), vive a Pisa ma ha esposto in tutta Italia e all’estero.

Cristian "Cinci" Canfailla, nato ad Alessandria, frequenta l’Istituto Statale d’Arte Benvenuto Cellini di Valenza, per poi proseguire gli studi artistici all’Accademia Albertina di Belle Arti di Torino. Segue il corso di fumetto di tre anni e quello di colorazione digitale alla Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Reggio Emilia. Ha collaborato come disegnatore con Crazy Camper e con il fumetto Online di Paola Barbato “Davvero” in veste di colorista. Con la casa Editrice Giunti e l’amico Riccardo Guasco, pubblica “100 grandi personaggi D’Europa” e “100 grandi personaggi D’Italia”. Copertinista della serie “Prigioniero 8″ edito con Damage Comix, al momento sta lavorando ad un fumetto chiamato “Chunks” con lo sceneggiatore Matt Garvey.

I costi di spedizione in Italia sono compresi nei perk. 

Tutti i finanziatori residenti in Unione Europea, al di fuori dell'Italia, devono aggiungere 5,00€ di donazione extra al proprio perk (inclusi quelli che contengono solo contenuti digitali) per coprire gli ulteriori costi di fatturazione. I finanziatori non residenti in Unione Europea devono contattarci a info@progettoradium.it per definire, caso per caso, i costi di spedizione e fatturazione.
I volumi a stampa e l'intero progetto sarà disponibile SOLO in LINGUA ITALIANA.
Se il progetto andrà a buon fine sarà possibile prenotare il ritiro del proprio perk presso alcune fumetterie "radioattive" sparse in tutta Italia (un elenco aggiornato è consultabile qui)

Per ulteriori informazioni contattateci via mail: info@progettoradium.it


A cosa ci servono questi fondi? 

Abbiamo bisogno di 29.000€ per coprire le seguenti spese:

  • 20.000 € copriranno i compensi per i cover designer, gli autori, i colorista, il letterista e l'editor di Zeroi.
  • 3.000 € copriranno le spese di realizzazione delle ricompense.
  • 1.000 € copriranno i costi di promozione del progetto.
  • 1.000 € copriranno i costi di fatturazione.
  • 4.000 € copriranno le quote trattenute da Indiegogo e Paypal e le tasse italiane.


Supporters
story_txt:
Quando un gigante
barbuto inizia a seminare panico e sfasciare tutto in città, gli Zeroi si
attivano per scoprire da dove venga l'abnorme creatura che si fa chiamare
Magnitudo. Mentre il Trio capitanato da Ferrotipo cerca di arginarne
la furia distruttiva, Gecko e Gattopardo indagano seguendo piste
separate, ma le loro strade –e i loro caratteri così diversi– sono destinate a
incrociarsi… e a scontrarsi!E mentre gli Zeroi
ne sbagliano una dopo l’altra, qualcuno trama nell’ombra per fare di
Magnitudo una forza del male ancor più sinistra...ZEROI è la terza miniserie (dopo il successo di "Rim City" e di "Quebrada - Seconda caduta") della nuova etichetta indipendente  RADIUM. Un'avventura folle e coloratissima di 80 pagine a colori in formato comic book, dedicata al più assurdo gruppo di supereroi che potete trovare sulla carta stampata.Sceneggiatura dell'improbabile duo Tuono Pettinato / Matteo Casali e disegni di Cinci con le copertine di Lorenzo De Felici. Altra bellissima gente farà una comparsa in questo progetto, ma ne parliamo più avanti...
Perchè ZEROI?C’è stato
un tempo in cui i piccoli lettori di fumetti potevano trovare nelle avventure
dei loro eroi un modo unico di raccontare il mondo: storie in
cui gli eroi si battevano per il bene senza troppi lati oscuri, prima delle tante guerre segrete, crisi più o meno
infinite e morti di superuomini.
C’è stato
un tempo in cui i supereroi erano uno svago, ma anche un modo per iniziare a prendere le misure con la vita, come ricorda il motto reso celebre
dall’Uomo Ragno, “Da un grande potere,
derivano grandi responsabilità.” C’è stato
un tempo in cui leggere storie di supereroi con superproblemi era divertente e
a suo modo educativo.Quel tempo è tornato grazie agli Zeroi.IN DEMAND e STRETCH GOALPer coronare nel modo migliore il progetto ZEROI abbiamo chiesto ad alcuni maestri del fumetto di confrontarsi con brevi origin stories dei nostri personaggi! Se verranno raggiunti gli obiettivi dello schema sottostante queste storie verranno aggiunte direttamente in tutte le edizioni di Zeroi! cosa aspettate?
PERK!

PERK "STAGIONE UNO"

PERK "LIMITATISSIMO"





ADD ON! 





ADD ON CARTONEPer chi 
desiderasse trasformare il Trade Paperback contenuto nei perk di ZEROI 
nell'edizione Hard Cover sarà sufficiente fare una donazione libera di 
10 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON 
"CARTONE" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta!ADD WHITE COVER IN BIANCOVuoi una trade paperback con cover in bianco da farti autografare e dedicare dagli autori in fiera? Sarà sufficiente fare una donazione libera di 20 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON "WHITE COVER IN BIANCO" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta! Attenzione: questo add on è diverso dal PERK WHITE COVER che vi permetterà di scegliere tra gli artisti radioattivi (Cinci, Tuono Pettinato, Daniele Orlandini, Michele Bertilorenzi e Cammo) da chi farvi illustrare la copertina in bianco ricevendola direttamente a casa vostra!
ADD ON "MUG-NITUDO" SERIE TUONO e SERIE ZEROI!Una MUG degli ZEROI? Perchè no! Perchè non SETTE! Una bella tazza di latte fumante, girelle e buondì e la colazione è fatta! A scelta tra i soggetti che vedete (e vedrete) qui sopra con una donazione libera di 20 € per ogni tazza e la solita mail a info@progettoradium.it con oggetto "MUG-NITUDO". Se volete la serie TUONO intera (composta di 3 mug) prezzo scontato a 50€, per la serie completa ZEROI (composta di 4 mug) 70€.
ADD ON TEE VOGLIO BENE!Qui sopra vedete due t-shirt che NON SONO LA T-SHIRT STANDARD del progetto ZEROI. Sono magliette indossate da alcuni dei personaggi (e uno di questi e collegato a uno dei grandi misteri della prima stagione di Zeroi!) della storia. Potete richiederle in aggiunta a un qualsiasi PERK che prevede un materiale a stampa (quindi dal PRINT in su) effettuando una donazione libera di 18 € qui su Indiegogo e poi mandarci una mail avente come oggetto ADD ON "TEE VOGLIO BENE" a info@progettoradium.it, così possiamo tenere traccia della richiesta! Potrete scegliere il soggetto (e forse anche il colore, dipenderà dal numero di ordini!) direttamente nella vostra area riservata (dove selezionerete anche taglia e sesso!).ADD ON TPB e HC!Avete già perkato una copia cartacea e ne volete una in più? Basta fare una donazione libera di 15€ (TPB) o di 25€ (HC) e invarci la solita mail con oggetto "ADD ON TPB" o "ADD ON HC" così potremo inserire i premi aggiuntivi nel vostro perk!

Supporters

story:
Hi! My name is Kayla Davis!

I have been running an autobiographical webcomic about my married life online since 2009. I open the doors and let everything just spill out. You get to see what it's like to be the new age odd couple living in the bible belt of the south. Somethings are funny, somethings are sad, something are just weird. Like my obsession with murder mysteries, my husband's love of all things Mecha, and my current quest to get a mini horse!  Feel free to check it out here

With this project, I am trying to get at least150-300 cold cast resin figures made.   The figures will stand 3.8" and are fully pre painted.  The first figure to be made is Casually Kayla herself and if I get enough interested, Daniel will be printed at a later date.  

I am trying to get 2 figues made, right now,  regular clothing Casually Kayla and then a limited edition Kimono Kayla.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

So here is what we need.  $800.00, which is half of the funds needed to get the figures made.  I will supply the other half with my own funds.   This campaign is for the figures only,  so I will only being showing perks that are concerning the figures.  

15.00 will get you a regular clothing Kayla.  This includes shipping.  Or if you would like to get the kimono Kayla, that will run you about 19.00.

Why Donate?: 

So you can say you're one of the first, of course!  Also, this is essentially a pre order and with that, everyone who donates is getting items at a very deep discounted rate.  Once the pre orders are over, all items go up for their regular retail price. 

What happens if we meet our Goal?:

That would be so awesome! All items will then be shipped out no later than October 2013.    The samples have already been made all it will take 30 days to make the initial run.

 

What are Stretch Goals?:

Stretch Goals are like achievements in a video game.  They will unlock once we reach and exceed our target goal. The secret goals will effect all orders with special gifts.  Everyone knows that I like to include tons of freebies in my orders, so just imagine getting freebies and more presents for exceeding our goal!

 

What happens if we don't meet our Goal?:

I will be one sad Kayla, but I will understand.

This will mean that the production of the figures will be delayed.  Everyone who donated will get their items but it will be a little later. 

 

Can't donate?:

That's okay! Word of mouth is just as good. So tell everyone you know about Casually Kayla and the book and tell them how much you love it! Link your friends to the campaign or directly to the comic.

story:
When we started American Wasteland Entertainment, we knew we wanted to expand into comics down the line. We knew it would be a way to extend our current or past show universes and take audiences even deeper into the worlds of our shows. We would do this by releasing an online version of the comic and then releasing an extended edition in paperback form. 

  • We have a fantastic artist that is helping bring this story to life on the page. David Faught is one of the most talented artists in Springfield, Missouri and we are elated to have him as part of the Drifter Series team. His artwork and style alone gives Drifter: Off the Beaten Path its own unique feel that really stands out. 
  • Drifter: Off the Beaten Path is the starting point for this venture. The comic is going to be released on DrifterSeries.com in 3 parts, 5-6 pages each, in grayscale.  The extended print edition will be in color and feature another story, moments after the events at the end of Drifter: Broken Road, our award winning and critically acclaimed first season. 

  • After the release of Drifter: Off the Beaten Path, our goal is to do more comics set in the Drifter universe and expand on character stories and other events featured in the series. We are even planning other original comic series separate from Drifter. We are excited about this venture and hope you will join us on this journey. 


~Jason Brasier & Brittney Greer                                                       

 American Wasteland Entertainment, LLC.


Drifter Series World and Characters are property of American Wasteland Entertainment, LLC. Copyright 2014.
story_txt:
When we started American Wasteland Entertainment, we knew we wanted to expand into comics down the line. We knew it would be a way to extend our current or past show universes and take audiences even deeper into the worlds of our shows. We would do this by releasing an online version of the comic and then releasing an extended edition in paperback form. 


We have a fantastic artist that is helping bring this story to life on the page. David Faught is one of the most talented artists in Springfield, Missouri and we are elated to have him as part of the Drifter Series team. His artwork and style alone gives Drifter: Off the Beaten Path its own unique feel that really stands out. 
Drifter: Off the Beaten Path is the starting point for this venture. The comic is going to be released on DrifterSeries.com in 3 parts, 5-6 pages each, in grayscale.  The extended print edition will be in color and feature another story, moments after the events at the end of Drifter: Broken Road, our award winning and critically acclaimed first season. 


After the release of Drifter: Off the Beaten Path, our goal is to do more comics set in the Drifter universe and expand on character stories and other events featured in the series. We are even planning other original comic series separate from Drifter. We are excited about this venture and hope you will join us on this journey. 




~Jason Brasier & Brittney Greer                                                        American Wasteland Entertainment, LLC.Drifter Series World and Characters are property of American Wasteland Entertainment, LLC. Copyright 2014.

story:
Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). In case of overfunding we will evaluate to release an English version and for information write to info@tatailab.com

 

AGGIORNAMENTI:


Raggiunto il traguardo di 7.000 euro, siamo saliti fino a 10.000 euro sbloccando il primo stretch Goal (segnalibro in regalo per tutti i partecipanti al crowdfunding).
Ora puntiamo verso i 12.000, traguardo per sbloccare la spilletta in regalo di Gon!
 

Menu

Introduzione

La storia

I Perks

I personaggi

Il progetto

Come useremo questi fondi?

Come possiamo aiutare?

 

INTRODUZIONE

Mi chiamo Martina (anche se spesso pubblico online con lo pseudonimo di Mortinfami o MortinfamiArt), e sono illustratrice e fumettista freelance, ma soprattutto sono una fiorentina DOC.

Ho sempre frequentato scuole d’arte: mi sono diplomata al Liceo Artistico di Firenze, laureata all'Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna (indirizzo fumetto&illustrazione) e ho conseguito il diploma nel corso di fumetto alla Scuola Internazionale di Comics.

Ho pubblicato miei lavori in Italia presso piccole realtà editoriali come Crazy Camper, Nowhere Publishing e Cyrano Comics, all'estero presso la DabelBrothers e ora sono qui, con Tatai Lab, per presentarvi il mio progetto DEVA.

 

LA STORIA

“DEVA: A Tale of Gods” è il primo capitolo di una trilogia che racconta la storia di una grande guerra, scoppiata dopo secoli di tensioni tra le due più potenti realtà che popolano il mondo in cui le vicende si svolgono: l' Impero, governato dai potenti Siong e Mei - venerati come divinità dal loro popolo -, e la Federazione di Zuànshì, un’unione di quattro piccoli ma stabili regni retti ognuno da una dinastia antica quanto la federazione stessa.

In questo primo volume assisteremo proprio alle vicende che causeranno lo scoppio della guerra: Unalome è il sarto della famiglia imperiale, e dopo aver vissuto tutta la sua esistenza segregato tra le imponenti mura del palazzo degli imperatori, decide di sfuggire a quella vita di scintillante prigionia nascondendosi nella carovana di una delegazione di Zuànshì in visita all’Impero.

E agli imperatori, questa sua fuga non andrà affatto a genio.

 

I PERKS


LIBRO A CARTOOMICS: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è già pronto e lo puoi ritirare a Cartoomics.


LIBRO A CASA: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è pronto e lo riceverai direttamente a casa tua!


LIBRO + ARTBOOK: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + un fantastico Artbook con studi preparatori e illustrazioni, realizzato da Martina A. Batelli (64 pagine, formato 20 x 20 cm - Brossurato) + Stampa della Cover autografata dall'Autrice.


LIBRO + T-SHIRT: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una splendida T-Shirt realizzata dai ragazzi di Kingyo Sukui + Stampa della Cover autografata dall'Autrice.


LIBRO +ARTBOOK + T-SHIRT: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + l'Artbook di Deva (64 pagine, formato 20 x 20 cm - Brossurato) + la fantastica T-Shirt realizzata dai ragazzi di Kingyo Sukui + Stampa della Cover autografata dall'Autrice.


LIBRO + CUSTOM A4: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A4 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover autografata dall'Autrice.


LIBRO + CUSTOM A3: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) + una Commission personalizzata su A3 dedicata al mondo di DEVA + Stampa della Cover autografata dall'Autrice.


KING OF THE GODS: TUTTO! Libro + Artbook + T-Shirt + Commission in A3 + Stampa autografata! Con uno sconto del 10% su tutto!

 

I PERSONAGGI

Unalome è un sarto di grande talento, dall’età identificabile attorno ai 30-35 anni: ha un carattere buono e socievole, è sempre pronto ad aiutare chiunque sia in difficoltà e non farebbe male ad una mosca. Di aspetto ricorda in tutto e per tutto un essere umano alto e robusto, ma in aggiunta è nato con due paia di corna e i lobi delle orecchie allungati.

 

Wu è una giovane ma potentissima guerriera di appena 23 anni, dai lunghi capelli e le folte sopracciglia sempre corrugate: è testarda e leale, mette la forza fisica e le abilità in combattimento prima di qualsiasi cosa, ma il suo carattere spesso duro o aggressivo nasconde un lato molto affettuoso per le poche persone a cui vuole bene. A modo suo.

 

Gamgon è un bhakti (una razza identica a quella umana ma caratterizzata dalla presenza di un paio di braccia aggiuntive) e un adepto del Culto delle Origini. È un ragazzo di 27 anni che vive una vita da monaco guerriero nonostante la totale avversione per la violenza: di bell’aspetto, estremamente cordiale e gentile, ma anche molto, molto pigro. 

 

IL PROGETTO

DEVA è un progetto che è nato dal mio desiderio di “sfogarmi”.
In questa storia ho messo tutto ciò che desideravo disegnare: combattimenti con armi giganti, guerrieri massicci e possenti, divinità di ogni forma e dimensione, cercando però di amalgamare ed equilibrare il tutto con una storia avvincente che spazia tra guerra e fede, tra storie d’amore e scontri mortali.
DEVA rappresenta la prima vera espressione della mia estetica visiva e delle mie passioni, interpretate e vissute da tutti i personaggi che vivranno questa avventura.
Spero che la storia riesca ad emozionarmi almeno un centesimo di quanto ha emozionato me pensarla, scriverla, disegnarla. Renderla, insomma, il più possibile reale per voi.

 

COME USEREMO QUESTI FONDI?

DEVA è stato realizzato da Martina nel corso del 2017, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab. 
Si tratta di un progetto da 96 pagine ed è già tutto pronto.

I fondi che raccoglieremo verranno usati nel seguente modo:

€ 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo

€ 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget

€ 1.300 per la spedizione

 

COME POSSIAMO AIUTARE?

Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo questa pagina, sui diversi social network.
Segui i nostri account:
Facebook 
Instagram
Youtube
story_txt: Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). In case of overfunding we will evaluate to release an English version and for information write to info@tatailab.com AGGIORNAMENTI:Raggiunto il traguardo di 7.000 euro, siamo saliti fino a 10.000 euro sbloccando il primo stretch Goal (segnalibro in regalo per tutti i partecipanti al crowdfunding).Ora puntiamo verso i 12.000, traguardo per sbloccare la spilletta in regalo di Gon! MenuIntroduzioneLa storiaI PerksI personaggiIl progettoCome useremo questi fondi?Come possiamo aiutare? INTRODUZIONEMi chiamo Martina (anche se spesso pubblico online con lo pseudonimo di Mortinfami o MortinfamiArt), e sono illustratrice e fumettista freelance, ma soprattutto sono una fiorentina DOC.Ho sempre frequentato scuole d’arte: mi sono diplomata al Liceo Artistico di Firenze, laureata all'Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna (indirizzo fumetto&illustrazione) e ho conseguito il diploma nel corso di fumetto alla Scuola Internazionale di Comics.Ho pubblicato miei lavori in Italia presso piccole realtà editoriali come Crazy Camper, Nowhere Publishing e Cyrano Comics, all'estero presso la DabelBrothers e ora sono qui, con Tatai Lab, per presentarvi il mio progetto DEVA. LA STORIA“DEVA: A Tale of Gods” è il primo capitolo di una trilogia che racconta la storia di una grande guerra, scoppiata dopo secoli di tensioni tra le due più potenti realtà che popolano il mondo in cui le vicende si svolgono: l' Impero, governato dai potenti Siong e Mei - venerati come divinità dal loro popolo -, e la Federazione di Zuànshì, un’unione di quattro piccoli ma stabili regni retti ognuno da una dinastia antica quanto la federazione stessa.In questo primo volume assisteremo proprio alle vicende che causeranno lo scoppio della guerra: Unalome è il sarto della famiglia imperiale, e dopo aver vissuto tutta la sua esistenza segregato tra le imponenti mura del palazzo degli imperatori, decide di sfuggire a quella vita di scintillante prigionia nascondendosi nella carovana di una delegazione di Zuànshì in visita all’Impero.E agli imperatori, questa sua fuga non andrà affatto a genio. I PERKSLIBRO A CARTOOMICS: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). Il libro è già pronto e lo puoi ritirare a Cartoomics.LIBRO A CASA: Il libro a fumetti di DEVA (96 pagine a colori, formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato). What is Scurry?  
Scurry is the story of a colony of mice in an abandoned house who are struggling to survive a long, strange winter. The humans are all gone and the sun is rarely seen. As food becomes scarce and many mice fall ill, the scavengers are forced to search farther from their home, braving monster infested lands in search of anything that will help the colony survive another day. Being hunted by feral cats and predatory birds is part of life for these mice, but beyond the fences stalks something far more fearsome...  
The Books.
All 3 books are available during this campaign, in oversized paperback or hardcover format, as well as digital PDF format. In total the books are over 320 pages, with lots of concept art, character biographies, step-by-step process pics, and more!
There is also a hardcover set that includes a full series, foil-stamped, premium slipcover that will look great on the shelf.

Where We Are & What You Get
Books 1 and 2 are finished, and the 3rd book is mostly finished. The story for book 3 is complete and the artwork is about 85% done and I expect to have the final pages done soon. After some final preparations for printing and once the proofs are approved, the printing will be ready to go. I'm hoping to get them delivered around April or May if everything goes smoothly.
Complexity can be a campaign killer, so I'm keeping this crowdfunding campaign really simple so I can get it shipped out as smoothly as possible.  For this one there won't be extras or variant covers, and the stretch goals to improve quality have all been met already, so they are already included. Their are "perks" for digital, paperback, hardcover, hardcover plus slipcover, and a few sketch perks. There are also a few bulk order perks.
Who Are We?
Scurry has been the passion project of Mac Smith, nearly 5 years in the making. Mac is an artist, illustrator and writer based in Portland, Oregon (but has lived all over the country). He worked in the entertainment industry for over ten years primarily as a concept artist for videogames, but got tired of the studio grind, so he left Southern California and moved to a tiny apartment in the Pacific Northwest to set up shop as an independent artist. It hasn't always been easy (He makes far less money and has zero free time, etc.) but so far it's been one of the best decisions he's ever made. He loves creating art again. Hopefully, with your help, he can continue. 
Doug is a dog. A very hairy, very mysterious dog. Mac doesn't know what kind he is, but everyone asks. If Doug knows, he isn't telling anyone. Doug is super secretive about his past.

Perks:
Notes: 
I try to keep reward tiers as simple and limited to insure that things go as smoothly as possible, but if you have any questions, feel free to message me here on indiegogo or by email at mac@scurrycomic.com.
U.S. shipping for most tiers = $7 USD
International shipping is unfortunately very expensive, but I have worked to reduce the cost as much as possible. International shipping = $20 USD in Canada and EU, $25 USD everywhere else. (Important note for international backers: I have offered EU and Canada friendly shipping in the past, but due to possible changes to trade laws, I can't promise it for this one. I still intend to avoid passing on customs fees, VAT taxes and tariffs for as many backers as I can, but it's possible that they may be unavoidable. You may be responsible for these fees.)
- All paperbacks are currently sold out. 
- I went ahead and added an international shipping option for the sketch tier, but unfortunately it's very expensive for me to ship those overseas. Those are $40 to ship.

 
Risks & Challenges
I successfully fulfilled two crowdfunding campaigns for the first two books, and backers were very happy with them. So I have some experience.
Every possible precaution has been taken to ensure that the printing and shipping go smoothly, but it's possible that printing or shipping issues could arise and the book could be delayed. In such an unlikely case, backers will be notified and given updates on the reasons for the delay. I intend to update monthly regardless.
I understand the faith that backers have in me and my project so I'll be very transparent with everything that goes into the production of this book by posting frequent and timely updates, and being quick to notify backers of any setbacks.
Other Ways You Can Help
I can't overemphasize the impact sharing the project around on social media can have. I appreciate all the support!

story:
Orb

 

In The Shine, the first chapter of Orb, Eli and Mira send Tory, a young gay New Yorker juggling a challenging career and a difficult relationship, to retrieve his troubled brother Aren from London.  There, Tory meets Saj, and the three of them discover that they have superpowers.  In the thumbnail image for the campaign, Tory is depicted, and in the first image in the campaign's gallery, Tory, Aren and Saj are depicted just after this discovery.

 

Orb is a comic book series about a diverse group of LGBT individuals who must band together in order to usher in the next phase of evolution. Only Eli and Mira are aware of the purpose for which their special abilities are intended, and it is up to them to unite and train the others with powers for the impending challenge.

  

The Impact

 

My name is Tom S. Johnson, and I co-created Orb and co-wrote its first chapter, The Shine, with Jane Shepard.


I was raised in an extremely conservative, fundamentalist Christian home in the Midwest. I knew from a very young age that I was gay and that no one around me was a role model for the type of person I would be when I grew up. I turned to comic books and television to escape from this insular world and to seek alternative examples of how to live. I was craving someone to inspire me, someone to look up to: a hero.

 

I read about and watched Batman and Spider-man, whose secretive duality I could identify with. There were empowered heroines, Wonder Woman and Batgirl, and heroes of color, Cyborg and Black Lightning; they were encouraging to me since being different didn't stop them from being heroic. But an actual LGBT hero? Or even a positive LGBT role model? Nowhere to be found. This was the seventies. LGBT characters were always villains, wacky neighbors or insane relatives.

 

Today, of course, LGBT characters are much more visible and diverse in all media, including comic books. However, I still feel there aren't enough contemporary LGBT heroes, and there are even fewer LGBT teams. I hope that Orb, a series about a team of LGBT superheroes, will help fill this void.


 

What I Need and What You Get

 

The goal of the campaign was set at $3700 because that is how much money it will take to  produce the entire multi-issue first chapter, and enough money has not yet been raised to even complete the first issue.  But it's not too late!  There's still time left in the campaign.

You can play an integral role in making sure that there are more LGBT role models in the media by contributing to this campaign and/or sending a link to this page to someone else you know who might like to contribute.  There are Perks available for every economic bracket.  Whether you're a struggling artist or a wealthy philanthropist, any contribution you make will help insure that at least the first issue will be able to be fully produced. 


* In order to distribute the perks for $50 or more, at least enough money will need to be raised to produce the first issue. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help


You can get the word out by becoming a fan of Orb on Facebook or Twitter by clicking on one the links below and then clicking Join or Follow.  You can also recommend that other people become fans and contribute here.

Orb created by Tom S. Johnson and Jane Shepard Â© 2008, 2011

story:
Our Story

Our story is a comedic follow-up to the timeless tale of Romeo and Juliet.  Basically, with apologies to Bill Shakespeare, we call BS.  How could two horn-dog teenagers who'd known one another for less than 48 hours have any idea whether or not they were actually in love?  Aren't you at all curious to see how our most famous couple would have ended up if they'd pulled it off and run away together?  What would that marriage be like after twenty years?  Here's your chance to find out....    


The Impact

Our goal is to reexamine the most famous love story in the world from a new perspective, to bring our story to the big screen, and above all -- to make our audience laugh.  


What We Need & What You Get

We have raised a large portion of our budget through outside investors.  Now we're asking you to help us in any way you can.  In order to create a film with the best possible quality, additional money is needed.  Film is expensive, folks!  Especially in LA.  But we believe in this story, we believe in this film and with your help, we know we can make it a reality.  If you do end up contributing to our project, in addition to our thanks, you will also receive perks based on your level of contribution.  These perks are listed in our video presentation.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand money is tight for everyone right now.  And if you can't afford to contribute, we understand.  You can still help us out by passing on our link to your friends and associates who might be interested in supporting this project.
