story:
James and I teamed together because we found we were burning to tell some special stories. The story of Sara Vargas is one of many we have in the pipeline and is the one that is the subject of this Indiegogo campaign.  We intend for the book to be an ongoing series. There is a definite end to the story but we are unsure as to exactly how many issues it will take to get there.  The first issue, a 40 pager, is practically finished (all that remains is 5 pages that need to be inked and colored) and we will be debuting an ashcan of the second issue at the NY Comic Con in October. Proceeds from the campaign will cover printing and production costs of the first and second issues, costs of attending the NY Comic Con, marketing costs, and commission costs for some of the rewards we are offering.  We have some high-powered artists on hand ready to contribute to the campaign and, like everyone else, even though they are nice guys, they need to be compensated. It's hard work but we think it's well worth it, as our goal is for people to want to come in and experience, enjoy and share in these worlds we've created. 

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Emilio Rodriguez is a licensed practicing attorney in New York, as well as a college professor.  In terms of comics, his story is very typical.  After falling in love with comics as a child, he wrote and drew comics throughout his adolescence.  Early loves include the Carmine Infantino early Flash stories, Miller's run on Daredevil, Stan's run on X-Men, and many others.  As is the case usually (and unfortunately), he spent some time away from comics during his college and post-graduate years.  A failed collaboration with a friend stoked the fires of creativity inside him and now he plans to write until he has no more stories to tell, which he hopes won't be for a very long time to come.

James was bitten by the comics and illustration bug at an early age.  His influences come from an eclectic group of sources, including John Byrne, Arthur Adams, Norman Rockwell, Syd Mead, Ron Cobb, his favorite painter Diego Rodriguez de Velasquez, and his mother Ana who was a fashion designer in her home country of Ecuador.  He attended both the High School of Art & Design and the School of Visual Arts in New York, where he studied under comic book legends Walt Simonson and Joe Orlando.  After graduation, he worked in film, television and theater before creating Novastar Studios to make and publish creator-owned titles.  He has worked on "Quantum: Rock of Ages" for Dreamchilde Press, "Psychosis" for Atlas Unleashed, and sketch cards for Breygent Marketing, Vampirella, Red Sonja, and Joe Linsner's Dawn.  He is proud of his Latino heritage and looks to create more Latino-centric comics, as well as create opportunities for other indie artists.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

There are actually very few challenges that will arise after the project is successfully funded.  We have already gone through all of the possible production delays and have gotten the story to exactly where we want it.  As stated before, the first issue is done except for 5 pages that need to be inked and colored, and we have started production on the second.  We will be done with the ashcan well before the NY Comic Con in October because it will be comprised of 13 black and white pages and will not require the full production time of a 32 page color issue.  We have hit a "groove" in terms of the production system we have in place, and because James and I have multiple roles we can execute the work faster instead of having to "hand it off" to someone else.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Plain and simple: we have an excellent story to tell and we do a good job of bringing it to life.  Anyone who enjoys a ripping good yarn and is looking for a project that will actually produce some fruit, as well as contribute to the overall quality of indie comics, can be confident their contribution will have been worth the trouble.  Plus, we are hungry to bring many more quality stories to comic fans starving for good books. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Spread the word about a worthy campaign.  Indie creators are a hearty breed and I salute them all, especially the ones who are working mightily hard to bring true quality to the public.     

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
James and I teamed together because we found we were burning to tell some special stories. The story of Sara Vargas is one of many we have in the pipeline and is the one that is the subject of this Indiegogo campaign.  We intend for the book to be an ongoing series. There is a definite end to the story but we are unsure as to exactly how many issues it will take to get there.  The first issue, a 40 pager, is practically finished (all that remains is 5 pages that need to be inked and colored) and we will be debuting an ashcan of the second issue at the NY Comic Con in October. Proceeds from the campaign will cover printing and production costs of the first and second issues, costs of attending the NY Comic Con, marketing costs, and commission costs for some of the rewards we are offering.  We have some high-powered artists on hand ready to contribute to the campaign and, like everyone else, even though they are nice guys, they need to be compensated. It's hard work but we think it's well worth it, as our goal is for people to want to come in and experience, enjoy and share in these worlds we've created.  
Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Introduce yourself and your background.
Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Emilio Rodriguez is a licensed practicing attorney in New York, as well as a college professor.  In terms of comics, his story is very typical.  After falling in love with comics as a child, he wrote and drew comics throughout his adolescence.  Early loves include the Carmine Infantino early Flash stories, Miller's run on Daredevil, Stan's run on X-Men, and many others.  As is the case usually (and unfortunately), he spent some time away from comics during his college and post-graduate years.  A failed collaboration with a friend stoked the fires of creativity inside him and now he plans to write until he has no more stories to tell, which he hopes won't be for a very long time to come.
James was bitten by the comics and illustration bug at an early age.  His influences come from an eclectic group of sources, including John Byrne, Arthur Adams, Norman Rockwell, Syd Mead, Ron Cobb, his favorite painter Diego Rodriguez de Velasquez, and his mother Ana who was a fashion designer in her home country of Ecuador.  He attended both the High School of Art & Design and the School of Visual Arts in New York, where he studied under comic book legends Walt Simonson and Joe Orlando.  After graduation, he worked in film, television and theater before creating Novastar Studios to make and publish creator-owned titles.  He has worked on "Quantum: Rock of Ages" for Dreamchilde Press, "Psychosis" for Atlas Unleashed, and sketch cards for Breygent Marketing, Vampirella, Red Sonja, and Joe Linsner's Dawn.  He is proud of his Latino heritage and looks to create more Latino-centric comics, as well as create opportunities for other indie artists.
What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

There are actually very few challenges that will arise after the project is successfully funded.  We have already gone through all of the possible production delays and have gotten the story to exactly where we want it.  As stated before, the first issue is done except for 5 pages that need to be inked and colored, and we have started production on the second.  We will be done with the ashcan well before the NY Comic Con in October because it will be comprised of 13 black and white pages and will not require the full production time of a 32 page color issue.  We have hit a "groove" in terms of the production system we have in place, and because James and I have multiple roles we can execute the work faster instead of having to "hand it off" to someone else.

The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Make it real for people and build trust.

Plain and simple: we have an excellent story to tell and we do a good job of bringing it to life.  Anyone who enjoys a ripping good yarn and is looking for a project that will actually produce some fruit, as well as contribute to the overall quality of indie comics, can be confident their contribution will have been worth the trouble.  Plus, we are hungry to bring many more quality stories to comic fans starving for good books.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Spread the word about a worthy campaign.  Indie creators are a hearty breed and I salute them all, especially the ones who are working mightily hard to bring true quality to the public.     
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Fae Archaic Digital Edition is now FREE due to coronavirus. To view the Digital Edition click on this link:

Fae Archaic Digital Edition

This edition also includes production art and older attempts at making Fae Archaic. I hope you enjoy the book. Stay safe, healthy, and hang in there.

 

    What is FAE ARCHAIC?

    Following in the footsteps of Prince Valiant and Flash Gordon, FAE  ARCHAIC is a new adventure strip for modern times. It will be a full  color, 68-page hardcover graphic novel. 

    It mixes horror and high fantasy to tell the tale of an evil spirit  that possesses a senile smuggler’s riding toad. This story is  about villains, treachery, and self-destruction.

    Shipping Costs

    I have done my best to make sure I’ve charged the lowest possible shipping costs to my backers, domestically and internationally. 

    U.S. shipping costs for most tiers will be $4 USD.

    U.S. Territories shipping costs will be $8 USD

    Canadian shipping costs will be $15 USD.

    U.K. and E.U. shipping costs will be $20 USD.

    Other International shipping costs will be between $18-21 USD depending on country.

    I am keeping reward tiers simple to insure things go smoothly, if you have any questions you can message me on Indiegogo or e-mail me at kirttrikburdick@gmail.com

    Risks and Challenges

    Calamity can befall all in unforeseen patterns. I will be flexible and adaptive if fate scorns my desires.
    That said…
    …the book is currently being printed and ready for preorder. I will keep each backer up-to-date on the book’s production schedule and date of delivery.

story:
Hi! My name is Free Isabelo and I created LFDF Comics.

LFDF Comics is an independent comic book company that helps artists and creators get published. We also help the creators promote and market the books in various, innovative ways. LFDF Comics supports local artists and the comic community by keeping the artistic and creative artists in print! 

What We Need & What You Get

Because LFDF Comics is an independent publisher we need the support of the wonderful people that support comic and geek community. The funds we are asking for is to provide the following...

- production of the comic book

- production of the perks

- shipping cost

- time and effort we put into the quality of the books

- promotional materials

All of these things add up when you are an Indy publisher. 

The Impact

The comic book and perks are not the only thing we focus on here at LFDF Comics. We also do drawing workshops at schools and events for kids, we support charities like Ronald McDonald House (Las Vegas), and we help Critical Care Comics by doing free sketches at comic events.

The more published work we do the more we can provide money, time, and care to our amazing charities and events.

Other Ways You Can Help

LFDF Comics understands that money can be tight. We would appreciate any help promoting our company! Word of mouth, social networking, or simply tell a few friends would go a long way.

story:
Hey Everybody!


I've recently started training in improv at The Groundlings and I love it! 

I just finished the Basic class and was one of only 3 (in my class of 15) to advance to the Intermediate level of improv training and I did it on my first try!

The Groundlings is an improv school that has churned out some of the greatest comedic performers of our time: Will Ferrel, Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Wiig, Phil Hartman, and - with your help - Donald Gipson!

This improv program is the best in the country and I want to keep the ball rolling. 

I need your help to get my continued comedic learn on. 

Intermediate Class at The Groundlings is $510.

If you can pitch in anything - even a dollar - it would be a HUGE help!

If you can't pitch in, please SHARE this page with friends that might be interested in helping out. 

Thanks for your support, gang :)

story:
Hey everyone!

Thanks for checking out our page!  I'm a first-time comic creator seeking funding to get my comic off the ground!  I'm looking to be able to pay my fantastic artist, and to send the pages to the presses to print!

All perks will be paid whether or not we reach our goal!

Guardians: The Journey is the story of Kaeyar, a runaway who discovers a life of adventure isn't like the fairy tales.  Quickly attacked after leaving home, she is rescued by Grey, a warrior who protects the world from ancient evils.  A member of the Guardians, he and Zelthoriun, thought to be the Hero of prophecy, are sworn to the safety of the world. Together, they fight to stop the members of the cultic organization Ársa and their master Saiduir from bringing back and ancient demon king.

Through their travels, they grow stronger together, individually, and as a team.  Only as a team can they stand against the ultimate evil and protect the world.

story:
We are concluding the graphic novel series with Book 3: Stone Age Pagans. Each book has been a ~110 page chapter in the lives of this mysterious frontier town, and now that it’s wrapping up, you can be a part of it and read the entire saga.

We are publishing this story is 4 formats.

  •  A digital version (pdf file)
  • 3 separate trade paperbacks
  •  Pariah Omnibus softcover
  • 3 Oversized Hardcovers (Exclusive)

The Team

Pariah, Missouri was created, written and colored by Andres Salazar. Andres studied under Howard Chaykin for a brief time in Ventura, CA. He's been researching and writing Pariah, Missouri for 4 years. Artist Jose Pescador studied at the National Autonomous University of Mexico. He is a professional fine artist, has shown fine art in galleries across the globe and his work is amazing! These two gentlemen are committed to the project, work hard and will not let you down!

 

The Role-playing game

    

The Pariah Missouri Role-playing Sourcebook plugs and plays into whatever RPG system you want to use. There are chapters for Savage Worlds, FATE, and HERO systems. It will have all the background, characters, NPCs, maps and campaigns needed to create a rich world. Think of it as a campaign book that will have everything the GM needs to add Pariah to whatever rule system they enjoy. Included will be stats for all the major characters and everything you need to play Pariah! Full-color with art on every page 8.5 x 11. Over 120 pages!

T.I.M.E. Stories

TIME Stories is a "deck-ploration" board game published by Space Cowboy games.  They published a developer kit and with it I created a Pariah Missouri scenario, a full-fledged game. ALL BACKERS WILL GET THIS print-n-play version of the game!


 Book Specifications

  • Softcover Trade paperback
  • Each book is a self-contained story with a larger arc running through the series.
  • Over 110 pages
  • Full color

 

OMNIBUS

  •  Softcover Trade paperback
  •  Complete story, all 3 trades included
  •  Remastered
  •  Over 330 pages and signed!

Deluxe Hardcover

  • Over-sized (8.5 x 11)
  • Premium paper and colors
  • Kickstarter Exclusive. Not sold in retail stores
  • Hardcover 130+ pages
  • Complete story with commentary 5-page prelude story (full-color)
  • Character sketches and background Script pages "Making Of" Extras: design, photo references and process of making Pariah, MO

 

 

Finances

Having done 6 previous crowdfunding campaigns, I analyzed the projects on costs of each project by reward level, number of backers and shipping.  The following graph is my projection if the project is funded at $8,000.  (Assumptions: 200 Backers, average $40 spend and 20% backers foreign, similar to previous campaigns) Please note that there is no cost inserted for coloring, lettering and book design (my labor) nor is there a margin for "profit".  According to my previous Kickstarter's data, successful projects have had very small margins of profitability (less than 5%).  If we change to an off-set printers, that will change the finances (allowing for a smaller unit cost but requiring a large print order), and therefore will not move in that direction unless funded over 300%.

http://kicktops.com/all/pariah-missouri

http://xuwriter.wordpress.com/2014/08/14/pariah...

http://www.bleedingcool.com/2014/08/16/i-have-s...

http://www.geeknative.com/48219/team-set-supern...

http://coverlessreviews.tumblr.com/post/9511470...

http://www.tabletopgamingnews.com/2014/08/22/93...

http://multoghost.wordpress.com/2014/08/25/read...

http://alternatehistoryweeklyupdate.blogspot.co...

http://www.lovetrain.super-coven.com/pariah-mis...

http://www.fandompost.com/2014/08/29/pariah-mis...

http://schirduans.com/david/2014/08/pariah-miss...

http://www.geeksofdoom.com/2014/09/04/kickstart...

http://gamingtales.wordpress.com/2014/09/07/par...

http://robot6.comicbookresources.com/2014/09/an...

http://fanboycomics.net/index.php/podcasts/fbs-...

http://thegrassygnoll.wordpress.com/2014/09/10/...

http://alternatehistoryweeklyupdate.blogspot.co...

http://westernsreboot.com/2014/09/12/graphic-no...

Risks and challenges

I've done six successful  campaigns, so I know what it takes to execute and get the job done. The book is in progress, art pages are coming in weekly and I am working on the colors, letters and book production. So this will get made, no doubt about that.

The usual challenge/pain point will be handling the files and getting them to the printer. I've done this four times previously, so I know what to do, the book proofing is the most challenging part, mainly due to working with the printers and their customer service team. If the project becomes very successful, we may go with another printer, which might cause a small delay in transferring files to them.

I've done this four times previously, so I know what to do, the book proofing is the most challenging part, mainly due to working with the printers and their customer service team. If the project becomes very successful, we may go with another printer, which might cause a small delay in transferring files to them.

story:
Mythics and The Mythoverse

Mythics is part of a line of contemporary fantasy comics known as the Mythoverse. The first campaign was funded successfully just over a year ago, and despite a hiccup in fulfillment, we were able to deliver the inaugural issues of Adobe Kroger: Dame Commander, Changeling: An Urban Fairytale, and Mythics. 

Now we're pushing onto IndieGoGo to give a new audience a chance at the Issue One variants that were initially exclusive to the Kickstarter campaign. 

In Issue One of Mythics, Elthia Fletcher, an agent of the Mythic Order, rescued a baby changeling named Arlene from a coven of witches set to sacrifice the baby to summon a demon lord. While Elthia was able to complete her job, complications arose when the coven alerted the Order of the Carolingian Cross. The rival Order sent a paladin team to investigate the baby's kidnapping. Sensing a greater conspiracy in the shadows, Elthia watches over Arlene with her fiance, Jarel, their familiars, and the newly arrived Morella.

In Issue Two, Elthia is given a new job a few days after Issue One. A spriggan has been spotted in the same metropark where the coven tried to sacrifice Arlene. The problem is that Elthia's familiar Galatyn has been dealing with a family emergency, and Elthia is terrified of spriggans.  Will Elthia be able to overcome her fear of spriggans to do her job? Is there a connection between the coven and the spriggan?

Issue One's Pages

Issue Two

With the relettering of Issue One after complaints about the dialogue, and lettering, I decided to learn how to letter. While the first issue is rather rough, the new dialogue improved the story. I think I improved quite a bit since relettering Issue One.

The Covers

The Mythics standard covers are done by Beth Varni

Issue One Standard

Issue One Variant by Antonella

Issue Two Standard

Issue Two Variant by Dylan Fagan

Why IndieGoGo Now?

We're breaking it down to the essentials of printing and shipping. Since this is the first Mythoverse campaign on IndieGoGo, we're keeping it as low as possible so that we'll hit goal, and get the books out to you as soon as possible!

To be completely transparent, we want to expand our audience, and the audiences for crowdfunding sites are as split as the audiences between Xbox, Playstation, and Nintendo. So we want to see as many people as possible enjoy our stories. 

With that out of the way, we'll get to the good stuff.

The Rewards

As it stands with the pandemic, we're going to be offering less physicals so that we can get our fulfillment.

Print by Leandro Panganiban

Print by Luigi Teruel of RAGS fame. 

Beach Print by Leandro Seva

New Print by Trevis Martinez!

Mythoverse Year One Omnibus

This will be a book of 148 pages, it has Mythics, Changeling, and Adobe Kroger Issue Ones, every MythoChibis strip produced, and fan appreciation section. This will only be available on crowdfunding campaigns.

MythoChibis:

During the first year, we pushed out a series of comedic strips referred to as MythoChibis with over thirty pages done, and commentary from each of the creators on the strips, this is the first time MythoChibis will be collected into a single volume.

The Mythics Writers Notebook is a document produced showcasing the development history of Mythics from the first script to the current. Three years worth of development history in a single document. (digital only)

The Team

Matt Trinh-Writer/Letterer of Mythics and head writer of the Mythoverse.

Beth Varni-Artist of Mythics.

Matthew Merz-Mythics Issue Two editor. 

Risks & Challenges

While there were issues with the first Mythoverse campaign, we worked out all the bugs with the printing and fulfillment, and are ready to go when we hit fulfillment deadline! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some ways you can help is raise awareness of the campaign, we're putting out some special rewards. The retweets/shares can hit their goals whenever, while the rest are time sensitive.

New Print by Trevis Martinez!

Mythoverse Year One Omnibus
This will be a book of 148 pages, it has Mythics, Changeling, and Adobe Kroger Issue Ones, every MythoChibis strip produced, and fan appreciation section. This will only be available on crowdfunding campaigns.

MythoChibis:
During the first year, we pushed out a series of comedic strips referred to as MythoChibis with over thirty pages done, and commentary from each of the creators on the strips, this is the first time MythoChibis will be collected into a single volume.

The Mythics Writers Notebook is a document produced showcasing the development history of Mythics from the first script to the current. Three years worth of development history in a single document. (digital only)

The Team
Matt Trinh-Writer/Letterer of Mythics and head writer of the Mythoverse.
Beth Varni-Artist of Mythics.
Matthew Merz-Mythics Issue Two editor. 
Risks & Challenges
While there were issues with the first Mythoverse campaign, we worked out all the bugs with the printing and fulfillment, and are ready to go when we hit fulfillment deadline! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some ways you can help is raise awareness of the campaign, we're putting out some special rewards. The retweets/shares can hit their goals whenever, while the rest are time sensitive.

story:
RENDERWAVE'S COLORPEDIA is a 200+ page full color book , measuring 8.75 X 11.75, covering everything to do with digital painting and comic book coloring. The book is broken down into 5 sections +  a digital archive full of resources to aid you in your art quest.

SECTION 1 is all about color theory. Here you will learn the basics of color psychology, how color affects the way the viewer sees your art and how to use that to your advantage to make your art more impactful. SECTION 2:  Rendering. This section covers a huge range of painting techniques & concepts. Here you will find everything from the basics of rendering shapes, to different kinds of rendering styles, shading & lighting lessons,  as well as advanced painting methods and technical skills like adjustment layers and clipping masks. All taught by a diverse group of artists. SECTION 3 is specifically about comic book coloring. While this section deals with the process and workflow that is especially suited to coloring comic books, the information and lessons in this section are applicable and helpful to any kind of digital painting. SECTION 4 is dedicated to artist features and tutorials where top tier artists will lead you through their own process and teach you their own personal methods and tricks. Finally SECTION 5 is the TUTORIAL LIBRARY. Here you will find over a huge collection of tutorials on how to paint a wide variety of common and not so common subjects.

We wanted to give you more than lessons and techniques. We wanted to provide you with tools to improve your art and build your own archive of assets. The digital resource archive is full of useful items like custom brushes, swatches, gradients and textures. You will also receive the complete and lettered black and white files for Light # 1 to practice your rendering skills on. 

Because nobody else did. There are plenty of books out there about how to draw but very few on painting and even less on digital painting. The books that do exist are either very niche or contain lessons and art work from only a single artist or type of artist.

 

We wanted a book that covered everything, starting with color theory,  in- software lessons, to  comic book coloring and methods for rendering common and not so common objects. Basically we wanted a book that answered the riddles so many digital painters and colorists have had to struggle with. On top of that, we wanted to just bring together a bunch of really cool artists and create a beautiful book full of awesome modern art by some of the most talented digital artists from around the world.

 

Many of us have been looking for a project to work together on for a long time and we finally found it. Putting the Colorpedia together has been a blast and we think you're going to be blown away by the art we've collected in it, and will be referring back to the lessons for years to come. 

​

 

 

 

 
 

In addition to the book every backer also receives a bundle of digital resources including but not limited to, tools, swatches, gradients, brushes, line art, + the black and white files for LIGHT #1 for you to hone your rendering skills on.  

 

THE LIST OF CONTRIBUTERS IS GROWING EVERY DAY AND WE WILL CONTINUE TO ADD ARTISTS RIGHT UP UNTIL THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN. THE CURRENT LIST OF CONTRIBUTORS IS:

story:
Bleeding disorders suck, especially when they prevent an activity or life choice from playing out as we would have preferred. Yes, they have numerous challenges; but at the same time, it is important to maintain perspective. There are countless conditions worse than bleeding disorders and in the grand scheme of things, being born a bleeder is preferable than being born with MS or cancer or sickle cell anemia (you get the picture). 

While it may seem, to a clotter, we bleeders are afflicted with this terrible curse and will never experience the life which others would have wished for us; the reality is there is absolutely no reason to believe a bleeder’s life, especially today, will be any less full or rich or adventurous or rewarding than the life of our fully clotting peers. This isn’t romanticizing either. Bleeding disorders have in many ways become an affliction of the soul and mind just as much, if not more than, of the body; and it’s important we treat it in those regions as diligently and bravely as we do the body.

Even today, growing up with a bleeding disorder can be a challenge mentally for little bleeders. Most grownups, unsure of their potential ARE afraid to fully engage in life. Afraid to hear the constant, "No, don't do that, you might get a bleed!" They have feelings of being a defective kid who isn't "normal."

A common message older bleeders are beginning to spread to the younger generation is "You have a bleeding disorder, it doesn't have you, own it!" And that is our vision for the Hemo Hero.

Who is the Hemo Hero?
Hemo Hero is the secret identity of Sebastian Weiss, a six-year-old hemophiliac. An engineering genius, he's able to develop sophisticated gadgets from household appliances and computer hardware, which he uses to come to the aid of hemophiliacs everywhere. Tired of bullies and ignorance, Sebastian is taking his fight to the streets. 

That's where his big sister Sera comes in. At twelve, she has troubles of her own. She has to take care of Sebastian, protect his secret, and make sure they're both home in time for dinner. Her secret identity, Serum, has the ability to deliver clotting factor without a needle, which comes in handy when they get into serious scrapes. 

Together, they are the Hemo Heroes; dispensing justice, educating the public, and just trying to get along.


Hemo Hero is not only a comic book we have created; it is more than a comic, it is a project. It is a project we are so incredibly proud to be a part of. The theme of the Hemo Hero series is to help young bleeders feel empowered. We want our bleeding disorder brothers and sisters to know and understand a bleeding disorder is not a curse; instead, it should be viewed as a badge of courage. Additionally, Hemo Hero will tackle other problems bleeders face, such as bullying and their fear of needles.

We want all of you to be part of this vision so we can make sure our children also make the difference for the upcoming generations. If we begin now, our efforts can only help these kids realize their dreams. All it takes is ALL of you!

We are offering up 10 opportunities for people who support us in this vital early stage to appear in our comic!

The appearances you earn for backing this project won't get you some lame cameo as a random face in a crowd. If you're a character in our books, you will be a character Hemo Hero & Serum interact with throughout the comic. We'll even send you a signed print of your appearance page. That is how we roll.

Three substantial characters are also up for grabs. Would you like to be The Whispering Shadow? The Emerald Mimic? How about The Ultra Hawk, a hero from Sebastian's favorite comic book – until a disruption in reality catapulted you into Sebastian's world where you fight alongside Hemo Hero & Serum? We have some great roles available, but they are first-come, first-serve. So grab yours now!

We are already working on the beginning issues and have everything in place to succeed. Now, we could release as a digital comic on our own, but with the amazing story by Jason, stunning artwork of Jessica and the rich color by Jeremy, it would be a crime to restrict this story to computer screens.

Hemo Hero is being written by author Jason Christie, illustrated by Jessica Gaskill and colored by Jeremy Roark.

This project is so important to us - we have poured our hearts and souls into it. We are part of this movement and we really want all of you to be part of it too. We are convinced that with the help of all of you, we can accomplish great things.

The response from the bleeding community has been humbling.

Dawn M. "I asked my 10yr old why a hemophiliac superhero is a good idea and he said, 'people will see that people with hemophilia aren't weak'."

Erika W. "My very own Hemo Hero loves Wreck It Ralph. I love the idea of a more relatable hero! I absolutely love the character Sera as well! There's nothing quite like that bond between siblings."

Brenna S. "Great idea! It is important for young bleeders to see themselves as strong able bodies individuals that posess inner strength as well. Nice to be a hero instead of needing to be saved all the time."

Vaughn R. "I've always loved comics, and superheroes. And, as a hemophiliac, I've dreamed of being a superpowered villain chaser most of my life. Plus, it's a great way to teach my kids about hemophilia. Mostly, I just dig comics and this is cool as Hell."

Krystal M. "I think its a great idea it gives hemo kids something special of their own and super hero they can relate to thats something no one else has i mean really who honestly can relate in real life to Superman or Batman and other famous super heroes but our kids can compare their real life experiences with Hemo Hero."

The Budget

The $3,000 goal is precisely what's required to put Issue 1 to your hands. Our team has been, and will continue, working for free until Hemo Hero is a self-sufficient and profitable project. We all believe in the long-term potential of this project and have funded everything out of pocket up until now. To be able to take full advantage of illustrator Jessica and Jeremy’s gorgeous digitally painted artwork, we need to print in full color, which isn't cheap. That is why we’re asking for your help.

The printing cost of 1,000 copies of a 16-page, full-color comic is $2,200. The balance goes toward marketing the comic, creating and sending out the rewards you'll receive for supporting us and helping cover the cost of taxes (Indigogo funds are considered taxable income).

None of this money goes to us. Every penny is channeled directly into printing costs, your rewards and paying Uncle Sam.

If you want to add extra items to your package go ahead and do so! This chart here shows the cost of any items added to one of the base pledge levels. 


So, how does this Indiegogo thing work?
If you're not familiar with Indiegogo, here's the idea. During the next 30 days, you'll be able to pledge support for the production cost of Hemo Hero #1, with pledge amounts as low as $1. For your pledge, you get to select one of the rewards—listed on the right sidebar—of equal or lesser value to your pledge.

Will I be charged any additional fees?
Nope. The amount you pledge is the amount you pay. Shipping costs to anywhere in the U.S. are included in your pledge amount. 

If you haven't pledged yet click on the pledge level you want, and on the first tab there's a field called "additional gift". Here you can simply write in the value of the extra item(s) that you wanted.

If you've already pledged and want to still add things: click on "contribute now" at the top (pink button), select "no perk" and enter in the value of the extra items you want. Make sure you use the same account/email for each contribution you make so that I'll be able to merge them afterwards.

story:
Disclaimer

An Adventurer's Memoir is intended to be a fan tribute to Mabinogi © devCAT Studio, Nexon. This project is not endorsed by, nor affiliated with either creator and does not represent itself as an official publication of any kind. All characters and locations depicted herein remain the trademarked possessions of devCAT studio and Nexon, co. ltd.

An Adventurer's Memoir: A Mabinogi Fanzine will be a Limited Edition zine available from September 6th, 2016 - October 30th, 2016. Meaning that the zine, goods and even the PDF will not be available after the end of the campaign. 

About Us

An Adventurer's Memoir is a non-profit zine organized by Gooeh and Narcotic Android, a full coloured anthology depicting the Mainstream Questline: Generation quests, The Saga: Iria, Divine Knights and Side Generation Quests. With our team of artists from the Mabinogi community, An Adventurer's Memoir will be available as a digital and physical along with bonus content of charms, buttons and mini prints. 

The Goal & Its Perks

We've decided to go with a Flexible goal of $2,000 USD, a Flexible goal allows us to keep the funds by the end of the campaign despite not reaching our 'goal' since the funds generated are based on individuals. As long as we have  the funds to fulfill your perks you've ordered, this project will succeed!
Note: Images and merchandise shown are still in development, however there will be updates when they are finalized and produced!


PDF
  • Sent via. email 
  • 48 illustrations, full colour
Zine Booklet
  • 6x9 Inches
  • 48 illustrations | 26 pages | full colour
  • Perfect bound | Glossy cover and pages | 100# Cover and Text
Charms
  • Metallic Charms | Keyring
  • Gloss, single sided
  • 2 Inches
  • Nao and Caravan Joe

Buttons
  • 1.5 Inches
  • NPC: Reno, Vay and Tion
Miniprints
  • 4x5.5 Inches
  • Card stock
  • Ibbie, tba... 
Shipping: We've given the option of tracking and NON-tracking prices towards USA and International shipping, please be advised that if you choose to pick a non-tracking perk, we will not be held responsible if your package has been lost. 
Canadian shipping only has a tracked option (and so will appear at a fixed price).
As a non-profit zine, all money raised will be used to produce the zine and any leftover funds will be donated to Youthline! A Canadian LGBT based organization that offers support through telephone, text and chat services.

The Artists

Akesari // Quinrose // 6ooey // Luecius // Sun // Nouv
Aorteau // Turpets // Narcotic Android // Lusis // Amirreow // Purah
Wizardscallion // Sakayani // Anita // Krissmas Eve // Amyykitty // Rae Barrett
 Cadix // Xiel // Whalephat // Nuryfury // Daneari // Moogin
Tulhip (Hip) // Izsumi // Liju // Nekyua // N. Tan // Mistreil 
FadingJade // Krissypootel // Pyonko // Robokyano // Coro // Kino
AlwaysDoodlin // Rendoodads // Lex Ullmann // Leo // Fifth // Kernah
Pyu // Ariasrose // Akai // Okamixdimsum // Churpybird // Nondoka // Dimourgos


The Impact

As the first Mabinogi Anthology created by the Mabinogi NA Community, our message and purpose of the zine was to give back to the game itself. As we believed that Mabinogi has made an impact on our lives, through the memories we've made and the friends we met along the way. This is our contribution, thanks, love and nostalgia for Mabinogi.

Risks & Challenges

Our individual prices are based on a stock of 50 Zine bundles, anything less than 50 individuals who contribute to the zine may cause some tight budgeting. However, we've allowed a window of 1 month and a few weeks to promote our zine! 
  • Shipping via. Canada Post
  • There are both tracked and non-track shipping rates for the USA and International
  • Canada automatically has tracked shipping (no non-track option)

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us by spreading the word! Our campaigns lasts only from September 6th - October 30th, make sure to let your friends and fellow Milletians about the zine since we are distributing them for a limited time only! Meaning that the zines,  goodies and even the PDF will NOT BE AVAILABLE after the campaign has ended.

Follow us for any updates regarding the zine:
  • Mabizine@Tumblr
  • Mabifanzine@Twitter
  • Mabifanzine@gmail.com

story:
What's up, you guys!

 

I've been writing erotic stories on the subject of domination for about ten years now. I'm a great fan of manga in general but hentai in particular and I would love to see one of my stories in drawing. 

 

The one I picked is called 'The sweet life of a Skater Boy' and it's the story of two teenage boys: Kieran and Finn. Finn is gay and after pretending otherwise for a few years he plucks up the courage to come out of the closet to his straight best friend Kieran, a skater boy who only thinks about skating and girls. Kieran is  surprised to hear the news but being shrewd and practical he takes advantage of the situation and convinces Finn to blow him, giving his friend a taste of something he will get totally addicted to.

 

You can read the first chapter of the story (and all the next ones) by following this link: https://www.nifty.org/nifty/gay/highschool/the-...

I also have a blog if you want to check it out:

http://naughtybardblog.jimdo.com

 

I already contacted a fantastic manga artist to draw the first chapter, the thing is it's very expensive and I would appreciate all the help you can give me, guys!

 

Of course each of you will receive a digital copy of the manga once it's finished.

 

I want to thank you all in advance for any contribution!

 

Naughty Bard

story:
Happy Go Lucky Go Fuck Yourself!

So my name is Richard Garvey. I write and perform upbeat acoustic folk music. I live in Kitchener, ON. I write all kinds of songs. Happy songs, sad songs, love songs, songs about friendship, community and making the world a better place. "Happy Go Lucky" is a new direction for me. The songs are bitter, angry and confused. I spent a long time trying to write songs like little gifts wrapped in bows. It was really fun and I have had great response from my albums "To Become/To Grow/To Create". But it doesn't express everything I feel or want to say. I've written lots of songs. These are some of the silliest and most sarcastic...and these 5 songs get a really great response and make people really question so much about the world and themselves while participating in the music. 

The EP will have A CD with 5 Songs, book will have comics by Trevor Waurechen and all of the lyrics and chords for the songs. The EP is recorded and the comics are being created. I've paid the DUKE OF ERB recording studio to record 5 songs. And I've paid Trevor Waurechen to create the comic book. But I'm at the end of my funds. And still need to make the physical copies. 

I'm asking fans/friends and friends of friends who would like to pre-order the EP/comic book or contribute financially to this campaign so I can get the things ready for a bunch of release shows at the end of march. 

Where the $ goes!

I need $500-$1000 to create 200+ copies of the EP/COMIC BOOK.
Any extra $ will be used for things I need to perform and keep recording my next full length album "Where Fools Gather". Things I need extra money for - rent, transportation, recording, strings, gear, paying band mates, etc. If I don't make the money I won't be able to make the physical copies until after the shows at the end of March. Which would be silly as its supposed to be a release show!

An exchange!

Ok perks are all in the side bar. I will get the EP/COMIC BOOKS in the mail late march or to you at a local show. 

Thanks!

Thanks friends. You have been so generous over the past 6 years of me trying to make my way as an artist. I think I am getting there slowly still. I know this EP will get more people listening to the tunes and coming out to shows.  Usually when I write a song and people say did you really just say that...I know I'm on to something creative and special. These songs and comics will really hopefully help me and the people who sing-a-long shake out their frustrations so we can get back to the good stuff like playing music, potlucks and building a dreamy world. So thanks for all of your help! 

Sing-a-long! 

Friends! The most important thing is to join a sing-a-long movement near you. Start your own. Just open your mouth and express yourself. It will be beautiful!

story:
ABOUT THE STORY:

Outbreak is a 24 page full colour book.

Twenty-six year-old nurse Taylor Martin is a nurse working at an inner city hospital. An energetic, strong and independent young woman, Taylor sees it as her mission in life to cure the world of its troubles – beginning by convincing her friend, Holly, to give up smoking.

But a normal day at work turns into a nightmare for the two friends when they’re sent to the site of an incident in the city centre. They arrive on the scene to find a military-controlled quarantine surrounding a group of office buildings. Information is being kept tightly under wraps, but Taylor and Holly are instructed to treat the victims of a rampant and unknown virus. The terrifying illness strips the flesh from its victims, driving them insane before finally killing them.

Despite the efforts of medical personnel, the situation is rapidly spiralling out of control. Taylor and Holly work to contain the spread, but it appears the only cure is death.

As a state of emergency is declared and the military take complete control, Taylor and Holly are horrified to find they are now included in the quarantine zone, and are ordered to remain inside their specified area – a tent set up to treat the victims.

Unknown to those inside the tent, the military is being recalled – the situation has become uncontrollable, with the virus spreading to other parts of the city. Those inside the quarantine zone – dead or alive – are being abandoned.

 

ABOUT US:

Conan is the artist and creator of Outbreak. He is a dedicated artist who has been drawing since childhood, and has a keen interest in digital art. He completed an Advanced Diploma of Game Design in 2010 and currently runs his own games studio - Sinars Studios.

My name is Ruth and I am the writer of Outbreak. I have been writing since I was twelve and have a deep love for literature and film in all forms and genres, and I’ve completed a Bachelor of Arts/Diploma of Arts in Professional Writing and Editing. Writing Outbreak has given me a chance to let my imagination roam free, and I’m looking forwards to writing the rest of the series!

Conan and I began to work on Outbreak around a year ago, following a concept Conan had. We’ve drawn inspiration from many of the great disaster movies and books, as well as our unlimited imaginations, by asking ourselves ‘what would happen if ...?’

Our aim in this story is to create believable and interesting characters and present the complex situation surrounding them. By placing this incongruent group in a world where there are no laws, there are boundless possibilities. Every minute can lead to a twist and every action can create new problems. We are eager to show how these characters develop throughout the series.

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed the first issue of Outbreak! We are raising money to put it into print. We need to cover the costs of printing and shipping, as well as smaller incidental costs such as buying an ISBN and promotion.

Each donation will bring us closer to our goal of completing this thrilling, action-packed series!

 

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE:

If you contribute

$5 – you will receive credit in the book

$10 – you will receive credit in the book

AND a digital copy of the book

$25 - you will receive credit in the book

AND a digital copy of the book

AND an original character sketch by the artist

$50 - you will receive credit in the book

AND a digital copy of the book

AND an original character sketch by the artist

AND a signed print copy of the book

$75 - you will receive credit in the book

AND a digital copy of the book

AND an original character sketch by the artist

AND a signed print copy of the book

AND you will be written and drawn into the second issue as a cameo appearance as a member of the marauder group

$100 - you will receive credit in the book

AND a digital copy of the book

AND an original character sketch by the artist

AND a signed print copy of the book

AND you will be written and drawn into the story as a major character!

story:
Hello,

Welcome to our page. My name is Sergio Armendariz the creator of Interstellar Eddy.

Interstellar Eddy evolved from my love of superheroes and my passion for adventure. When I was growing up, I noticed that there weren't any characters that represented me and what I was going through, so I decided to create Interstellar Eddy as a way for me to see those types of characters which are still missing in the media.

 

Interstellar Eddy is an out of this world adventure that hurls you through time, space and mind. Our lead is a young boy, 13-year-old EDDY TORONADO, who always has his head in the clouds,  One short and concise phrase sums up Eddy’s purpose in the Universe: “A diamond doesn't start out polished and shining. It once was nothing special, but with enough pressure and time, becomes spectacular.”

 Eddy, is a teen boy who thinks he’s nothing special but finds that he is the new chosen ruler of a forgotten race that is a link to the Mayans that once thrived on Earth; only to one day just disappear. 

 

Interstellar Eddy is a groundbreaking idea and a strong positive role model for children and adults of all ages. Not only does it deal with Intergalactic issues, but also with the present day issues of cultural diversity and the lack of real positive Latino and Latina characters thrown into a world where they must find new and smarter ways to handle issues set before them in all walks of life.

Why is Interstellar Eddy Important?

Interstellar Eddy can be an enormous cultural significance, not only by being a landmark graphic novel/comic book but also because it’s about a superhero who is of Latin descent and heritage. The stories from the saga include Mayan history, mythology, and culture as the backdrop to Eddy’s powers and his adventures.

Eddy’s experiences are based on human issues, which make these stories universal and relatable to everyone. There is currently no other graphic novel/comic book out there based on a Latino superhero. The great thing about Interstellar Eddy is that in the midst of all the action and adventures, the main character is just an innocent and curious boy living a child’s dream of being an adult for a day, month or year. Not only is this fun but it can also be a learning experience about life in general and the struggles we all must endure through our lives. 

 

Latinos in the Media

The goal is to create a Latino superhero that kids can see themselves becoming, no matter what obstacles they must overcome.  To teach them that they can indeed be anything they choose to be once they set their minds on their future and reach for the stars.

At a time when the Latino population is at 57 million and represents 18% of the U.S. population, Latino’s consumer power is at an all-time high.  However, Latino presence in the media is still struggling to gain traction. To fill the void, Felipe Salazar and I have taken on the task to bring forth a groundbreaking character into the superhero realm.

All of the funds raised will go towards the production and distribution of the graphic novel.

Hope that you will support us in bringing Insterstellar Eddy to life.

Thank you!

story:
After 2 successful campaigns, T-BIRD & THROTTLE is back with its 3rd chapter! Inspired by the comics & cartoons of the 80s & 90s, T-BIRD & THROTTLE is a story about comic book heroes and villains and what defines them - and how those definitions shift with changing times.

Who am I? 

My name is Josh Howard and I've worked as a professional comic book writer/artist for over 15 years. I am best known for my indie action/horror series DEAD@17 published by Image Comics. My other creator owned work includes BLACK HARVEST and THE LOST BOOKS OF EVE. I've also done illustration work for DC Comics, IDW, and Mattel.

What's T-BIRD & THROTTLE about?

After being granted incredible powers by a mysterious alien "engine," astronaut Mitchell Maddox rose to fame as T-Bird, defender of Centennial City - until the day a horrific tragedy robbed him of everything. Now, 10 years later, Maddox sets out to revive his glory days as T-Bird. But the demons of his past have other plans...

READ THE 16 PAGE ISSUE #0 PREQUEL HERE FOR FREE!

READ THE FIRST 30 PAGES OF BOOK 1 FOR FREE!

What I Need & What You Get

After 2 successful crowd funding campaigns for T-BIRD & THROTTLE, I'm now looking to fund the 3rd chapter in a planned 4 part story arc. Each book (except #0) runs 50 plus pages and Book 3 will be no different. If this campaign is successful, the funds earned will go towards printing, shipping, & production costs, as well as keeping the lights on while I work to complete Book 3.

And don't worry - if you missed out on the first 2 campaigns, I am offering 0,1, and 2 again. There are a limited number of original cover sets available, as well as A NEW RUN OF ALL-NEW TRIBUTE COVERS that homage some great covers of the past.

STRETCH GOALS!

$17,500 - If the goal is surpassed and we hit $17.5K, an all new pin-up section will added to Issue #0 (tribute cover) featuring pin-ups by me and some awesome guest artists! Here's a sample:

 

Here's what people are saying about T-BIRD & THROTTLE!

Risks & Challenges

I'm a one man production team -  writer, artist, colorist, and letterer. While this makes me slower than a lot of creators who only handle 1 or 2 tasks, it also minimizes a lot of potential delays since I'm never waiting around on communication or work from other team members. I've been making my own comics for over 15 years and have good grasp on what it takes to create & deliver a professional product in a timely manner.

story:
Outworld: The Summary

Hey, there!

First of all, thanks to all of you who contributed to our initial fundraisng campaign. All of your help is greatly appreciated. If you'd like to check out our initial campaign, click here:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/outworld-retu...

I'm Jiba Anderson, owner of Griot Enterprises and creator of its flagship title, The Horsemen. This spring, we're releasing the next addition to our roster, Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers, and we need your help to make this happen. 

Outworld: The Premise

Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers is a science fiction, kung-fu epic spanning 3 generations.

The Master Teachers have been outlawed and hunted to the brink of extinction by one of their own. The Diaspora System is under the iron grip of Oro, The Despot and his Beret Sheri armada led by his acolyte, The Paladin. The Diaspora, once a galaxy devoted to peace and diversity, has become the Utopia, a totalitarian society dedicated to expanding its territories through war, subjugation and destruction.

However, a rag tag band of rebels led by a disgraced Master will provide to the key to the Diaspora’s liberation and will ignite a revolution that will restore the glory of the Master Teachers and bring justice to a beleaguered solar system.

Outworld is a property geared towards males aged 10 -35. In addition, females in the same age bracket may become a large part of our audience as well due to a strong, capable female cast in the series. Finally, we may find a large adult audience as well. Outworld is reminiscent of such properties as Star Wars, Dreadstar & Warp and kung-fu films such as Hero and The Five Deadly Venoms. 

Outworld: The Final Package

Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers will be released as two 24-page issues in digital format as well as a 64-page “Expanded edition” print graphic novel. The book will distributed throughAmazon, Comic Flea Market, Drive Thru Comics, Graphicly, IndyPlanet and Lulu.

Real Talk, we need some dough... 

Here’s the deal: we are looking to raise $1500.00 to help with production, marketing and printing costs. Here’s a breakdown of how the funds will be disbursed:

•         35% will go to finishing the production of the book

•         25% will go to the printing of the graphic novel

•         25% will go to funding convention appearances throughout the spring   and summer (C2E2, ECBACC, Motor City Black Age & SDCC)

•         15% will go to advertising the book via pay-per-click channels.

The Cool Stuff

Of course you’ll get some really cool incentives based on how much you donate…Here they are!

•            $5.00 – You will have a place in the thank you section of the upcoming Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers digital issues and printed graphic novel and a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST AND SECOND issues.

•            $15.00 – All of the rewards above PLUS a FREE AND SIGNED PRINTED copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.

•            $25.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE AND SIGNED Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers 11” X 17” promotional print!

•            $50.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master TeachersT-shirt!

•            $100.00 (limited to 20) – All of the rewards above plus a Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers promotional FREE AND SIGNED PORTFOLIO series (8 prints) FREE!

•             $150.00 (limited to 10) – All of the rewards above plus an ORIGINAL sketch of a character from Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll still push on. The book will be completed and all incentives will be honored. That’s how we do at Griot… Can’t stop, won’t stop!

The deal about Griot…

 Since 2000, Griot Enterprises has existed for one reason: To tell great stories featuring heroes of color.

We have seen many great African American superheroes in comics, but we never saw an iconic African American superhero team. We didn’t have our Justice League, our Avengers. We, as comic book fans of color, young and old, didn’t have a universe where our heroes reside...

... With the release of The Horsemen in 2002, Griot Enterprises filled that void.

Now, we are expanding our horizons and redefining what makes a hero for future generations. From pulp fiction to science fiction, from prose to graphic novels and animation, Griot Enterprises knows no boundaries…

… And honestly, Black heroes are cool.

Other ways to help

We understand that you might not be able to financially assist us, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help us out:

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/horsemengraphicnovel

And share this on your page, follow our blog, The Afrosoul Chronicles:http://jazintellect.wordpress.com/

Listen to our podcast, Ghetto of the Mind: http://jazintellect.podomatic.com/

tweet, tweet, tweet!: https://twitter.com/jazintellect

The more people knowing about us, the better…

…And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks in advance, fam and keep supporting Indie Comics and Black Sci-Fi… Cheers!

http://www.griotenterprises.com
story_txt:
Outworld: The Summary
Hey, there!
First of all, thanks to all of you who contributed to our initial fundraisng campaign. All of your help is greatly appreciated. If you'd like to check out our initial campaign, click here:
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/outworld-retu...
I'm Jiba Anderson, owner of Griot Enterprises and creator of its flagship title, The Horsemen. This spring, we're releasing the next addition to our roster, Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers, and we need your help to make this happen. 

Outworld: The Premise

Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers is a science fiction, kung-fu epic spanning 3 generations.
The Master Teachers have been outlawed and hunted to the brink of extinction by one of their own. The Diaspora System is under the iron grip of Oro, The Despot and his Beret Sheri armada led by his acolyte, The Paladin. The Diaspora, once a galaxy devoted to peace and diversity, has become the Utopia, a totalitarian society dedicated to expanding its territories through war, subjugation and destruction.
However, a rag tag band of rebels led by a disgraced Master will provide to the key to the Diaspora’s liberation and will ignite a revolution that will restore the glory of the Master Teachers and bring justice to a beleaguered solar system.
Outworld is a property geared towards males aged 10 -35. In addition, females in the same age bracket may become a large part of our audience as well due to a strong, capable female cast in the series. Finally, we may find a large adult audience as well. Outworld is reminiscent of such properties as Star Wars, Dreadstar & Warp and kung-fu films such as Hero and The Five Deadly Venoms. 
Outworld: The Final Package
Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers will be released as two 24-page issues in digital format as well as a 64-page “Expanded edition” print graphic novel. The book will distributed throughAmazon, Comic Flea Market, Drive Thru Comics, Graphicly, IndyPlanet and Lulu.
Real Talk, we need some dough... 
Here’s the deal: we are looking to raise $1500.00 to help with production, marketing and printing costs. Here’s a breakdown of how the funds will be disbursed:
•         35% will go to finishing the production of the book
•         25% will go to the printing of the graphic novel
•         25% will go to funding convention appearances throughout the spring   and summer (C2E2, ECBACC, Motor City Black Age & SDCC)
•         15% will go to advertising the book via pay-per-click channels.
The Cool Stuff

Of course you’ll get some really cool incentives based on how much you donate…Here they are!
•            $5.00 – You will have a place in the thank you section of the upcoming Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers digital issues and printed graphic novel and a FREE PDF copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers’ FIRST AND SECOND issues.
•            $15.00 – All of the rewards above PLUS a FREE AND SIGNED PRINTED copy of Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.
•            $25.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE AND SIGNED Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers 11” X 17” promotional print!
•            $50.00 – All of the rewards above plus a FREE Outworld: Return of the Master TeachersT-shirt!
•            $100.00 (limited to 20) – All of the rewards above plus a Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers promotional FREE AND SIGNED PORTFOLIO series (8 prints) FREE!
•             $150.00 (limited to 10) – All of the rewards above plus an ORIGINAL sketch of a character from Outworld: Return of the Master Teachers.
If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll still push on. The book will be completed and all incentives will be honored. That’s how we do at Griot… Can’t stop, won’t stop!
The deal about Griot…

 Since 2000, Griot Enterprises has existed for one reason: To tell great stories featuring heroes of color.


We have seen many great African American superheroes in comics, but we never saw an iconic African American superhero team. We didn’t have our Justice League, our Avengers. We, as comic book fans of color, young and old, didn’t have a universe where our heroes reside...
... With the release of The Horsemen in 2002, Griot Enterprises filled that void.
Now, we are expanding our horizons and redefining what makes a hero for future generations. From pulp fiction to science fiction, from prose to graphic novels and animation, Griot Enterprises knows no boundaries…
… And honestly, Black heroes are cool.
Other ways to help
We understand that you might not be able to financially assist us, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help us out:
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/horsemengraphicnovel
And share this on your page, follow our blog, The Afrosoul Chronicles:http://jazintellect.wordpress.com/
Listen to our podcast, Ghetto of the Mind: http://jazintellect.podomatic.com/
tweet, tweet, tweet!: https://twitter.com/jazintellect
The more people knowing about us, the better…
…And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks in advance, fam and keep supporting Indie Comics and Black Sci-Fi… Cheers!
http://www.griotenterprises.com

story:
We are funded, but not finished! If we hit $1500, everyone who receives the physical comic will also get a copy of Netd Nation Presents #1, our new 24 page anthology book!

Keep sharing, and give if you can!  Most of all, THANK YOU!

Anton Lehrer was exiled to Mars for murder. He mysteriously reappears on Earth with an agenda that includes recruiting Phillip Flynn, a young man with little ambition and an amazing ability.  People in power want Anton to fail, and disappear. If they succeed, two worlds are doomed!

Gateway Runners is a four issue series written by Gene Hoyle, with art by Aaron and Kitty Pierce. 




The world of Gateway Runners

The population of Earth grows at a rapid pace. With Terraforming now possible, the expansion into space is both feasible and necessary. 

An ark containing 100,000 of some of our best and brightest leaves Earth for the eighteen month journey to Mars.....and disappears!

The colonization must happen, and a second ark is built. Many are hesitant to make this trip given the disaster of Ark One, so the passengers are given little choice in the matter.

Ten years go by with no real contact between the worlds. Mars is a lush farmland, but lacks needed tech to thrive. Earth has continued to rapidly grow in population. 

Something needs to change. 

Anton Lehrer, passenger on the second Ark,has a plan and special ability that can make the worlds come together. 

When he mysteriously appears on Earth, many powerful people need to make sure that he goes back where he came from, or disappears.....



The future depicted in Gateway Runners is described by our writer as "Part of the way to the Star Trek future" . There are huge scientific and technological advances, but the people still have a lot to learn. What the Runners can do may be able to push humanity in the right direction. 

It was important to Hoyle to show that we have made great strides as a society on the way to this future. Though not directly stated in the book, you can see that many characters are of mixed heritage. Race is not an issue, or an excuse to hate. Though far from perfect, humanity has changed for the better. 

Each new tech introduced in the book was deliberately added because it was a logical step in the authors view of what is to come. Nothing exists purely as a plot device, with the exception of the Gateways themselves. (Which Gene insists COULD be possible) 

The Runners team, from Gene's script to Kitty and Aaron's contributions, not just to art but to plot, have created a world that is both interesting and possible. 



The Impact

Gateway Runners is a story that we believe can touch readers. Our diverse cast and their mission can inspire as well as entertain. Though written with an adult crowd in mind, Runners can be enjoyed by anyone 12 and up. 

We intend on giving away a part of the print run to literacy programs locally. Nerd Nation Publishing strongly believes that comic books are "gateways" to reading. 

Our writer struggled with reading until introduced to the world of comics. He intends on repaying that debt. 


What We Need & What You Get

This fund raiser will go to printing the book, and to finish paying the art team. Through sales of the zero issue, we have raised much of what we need.  The book itself is almost finished. We expect to go to the printers the day this campaign ends. 

 Whether or not we are successful here, the book will happen.  The only thing that changes is the time frame. If you pledge here, you WILL get what you pay for.  This project is one of passion. We have all suffered from late delivery on fund raisers. We are going to do our very best to avoid this. We want lifelong fans, not one time pledges. 


The Tiers

Our pledge levels contain some great prizes. From even $1.00, you get the digital prelude. Entitled "Rock Bottom", it explores Anton Lehrer's dark past, and his first meetings with other cast members. This prelude will be released one chapter at a time, coinciding with the release of each issue. 

A super limited amount of Gateway Runners zero will also be part of a tier.



The Mel Madigan as MJ print is part of a tier that also includes a print of Mel's character, Felicia. (Both prints below)


Artist Aaron "Aarpie" Pierce is offering character sketches as part of a limited tier. You may chose a character from Runners or a character from another book that you enjoy.



Almost every tier gets you something cool and we will be adding tiers throughout the campaign. 


Another vital aspect to our success is YOU! We can't do it without your help! If you like what you see, share this campaign with friends. We hope to beat our goal, and show you our insane scratch goals!


In closing, we think that Gateway Runners is a comic book that you will love. Give it a try and see for yourself!



Preview art from the prequel story, Rock Bottom!



Now available on the Gateway Flair tier!

story:
For the first time in English, in one omnibus edition, Soaring Penguin Press will be publishing Régis Loisel's epic series, Peter Pan.  This 372-page, full colour hardback will tell the entire story of how Peter, a young boy on the streets of Dickensian London, became Peter Pan.

This omnibus edition collects the complete 6 volume bande dessinee series lovingly created by Loisel from 1990 to 2004.  This series has never before been seen in the UK, and has never been collected in English.

To support this exciting publishing venture, Soaring Penguin Press has created this Indiegogo campaign.  We’ve developed a few perks to accompany the campaign.  Frankly, we’d rather sell the book.  If you have a choice between buying one of the lesser perks, and saving your money to buy the book, buy the book.

The creator, Régis Loisel, will be attending the BD & Comics Passion Festival, May 30th to June 2nd, Institute française, London.  If you are able to attend, purchase the Pan perk.  You get a copy of the book, and a pass for the weekend so you can meet M. Loisel.

If you are unable to attend, then purchase the Peter perk, and we’ll send you a copy of the book as soon as it becomes available.

Soaring Penguin Press has the UK and European English Language Rights only.  For that reason, the book cannot be offered outside of the UK or Europe.  However, we will be shortly starting a Kickstarter campaign to secure the North American Rights.

The budget for the UK book is set out below.  All costs must be met by the sale of the book.

Rights purchase

£1574

Royalties advance

£3374

Printing

£10781

Translation

£3852

Lettering

£1500

Marketing

£2500

Total

£23581

 This is the total advanced costs for getting this book in print.

 

To show you why we're so excited about this book, here's the first page of the story. (Click on the image to open a new window with a larger image.)

Every day for the run of this campaign, we'll add another page.

story:
We made it! Funding goal ACHIEVED! Secondary goal announced!

Thanks to everyone for backing and spreading the word about Our Time in Eden, we hit our funding goal last night! We're really happy, not to mention humbled, that folks seem to like what we do. Cheers to you all, we love you.

Up next, as a thanks to all our backers, if we hit $600, we'll be drawing one name from the list to receive the original black and white cover art! Free art! Thanks to Ben for agreeing to part with the piece in the name of comics, and thanks to everyone one more time.

Keep that word spreading, and we'll see you at $600!


Our Time in Eden, Chapter One

Two lives, broken and cast out of paradise, spiral toward each other. Ellis, a lost and fading mystery, returns home in search of her childhood friend Tim, a reclusive drunk dodging any touch of the world around him.

From author Gibson Twist and artist Ben Steeves, Our Time in Eden is a story of lost innocence, lost direction, and lost hope. The promises and lies of childhood, the endurance and heartbreak of friendship, and the bitter consequence of tasting the fruit of knowledge.

Here is the first chapter in this engrossing and deeply-emotional, Eight-issue comic series.

 

 

What's On Offer?

This is a simple campaign, free of bells and whistles. We have only one thing to offer, copies of the 24-page black and white comic for $6 USD in the US and Canada, $8 USD international. We're also offering Retailer packages, so bug your local comic shpp to come on out to the party.

 

The comic is ready to print, just waiting for funds to skyrocket into the universe! Get in on the first ever printed edition of Our Time in Eden and make all your friends really jealous.

 

 

The Story of The Story

Our Time in Eden began as a novel, written by Gibson Twist in 1995, then languished for many years. Gibson met Ben Steeves in 2005 at a local comic-making event, teaming up to win cash and prizes in a collaborative comicking marathon. A unique artistic connection formed quickly between them, and they began discussing a larger project. Ben chose Our Time in Eden.

 

The project was first posted online at ourtimeineden.smackjeeves.com in 2008, gaining critical acclaim and small, devoted audience. Ben and Gibson are now bringing the series to print, beginning with this chapter entitled Fatigue, and hope to publish a new chapter every four months.

story:
Firstly let us thank you for taking the time to look at our Indigogo campaign and to read this pitch!

Shadows In The Blood is a webcomic, updating twice a week, that follows the adventures of Teran, Reim and co, created by Enka McEvoy and Cymon Wing. Enka does all of the drawing and colouring for the comic along with most of the writing. I help write the story and mostly steal credit for the best bits Enka has come up with but is too tired to remember doing.  We both work full-time jobs and create Shadows in our free time and the project has become somewhat a labour of love for us. We've already achieved several of our goals with Shadows In The Blood; with the help of our tech team, we've built our own website for the comic, we've been to our local comic conventions with Shadows and been very well received, we even printed the first story arc (at our own expense) and gave it away free to fans at the convention! 

But now we need your help. Our drawing tablet that had served us so well up to now has died and without it we’re struggling to keep updating the comic. Moving forward from this we really want to upgrade our equipment, enabling us to put out even better pages at a faster rate. We want to give you, the readers, the best comic we can possibly make, as often as we can possibly make it. A Wacom Cintiq has been on our wish list for almost 2 years now and the more funding we get, the better Cintiq we can buy. Our base goal of £800 lets us buy a Cintiq 13HD, a very useful piece of kit! Shadows In The Blood is a live project, its happening now and we’re asking you to help us continue to make it happen. We're not asking for a handout to get an idea going, we asking for funding to make it better. To make a good product great. We're asking for help to make one of our life goals a reality! Our dream is make make Shadows In The Blood our full-time jobs, to give 100% of our time and energy to the project but without funding to get us going, that cannot happen. Please make the dream of two comic creators come true.

Thank you for your time, thanks in advance for your donation and thank you for sharing this campaign with your friends via social media. The more people that hear about this project the better the chance of it succeeding!

If you want to read the story so far, and to see what you’ll be helping to save, check out www.2040online.com (the home of Shadows In the Blood)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/shadowsintheblood
Tumblr: http://2040productions.tumblr.com
