story:
Short Summary

I am James Bretney and today I am going to talk to you about the graphic novel the Kursk.  We have based the Graphic Novel word for word from the play by the same name.  In 2007, after over six year of research, playwright Sasha Janowicz wrote and produced an awarding winning play the Kursk in his home of Australia.  The Kursk dramatizes the Naval catastrophe that occurred in August 12, 2000.  Introduce yourself and your background.

What We Need & What You Get

We have a very talented artist who will realize this story visually. Her name is Andrea Montano. Born in Columbia, Andrea attended Ringling College of Art and Design and the Dryefoos School of the Arts. She has been freelancing for the past four years and her portfolio speaks for itself.

To make this graphic novel happen we will need $ 2,500. $ 1,800 will go to Andrea Montano to compensate her for her labor. Another $ 500 will go to Alex Mcardell for cover art and $ 200 in marketing costs.

There are risks and challenges in every endeavor especially creative ones. Our art must commercially viable for young people. The Kursk Naval disaster happened 13 years ago. Those that remember are more than likely over 30 and many do not want to remember. Is this story relevant for those that remember? Is it relevant to those ignorant of the catastrophe?

This is a business. Half of all small businesses fail within five years and seventy percent are out of business within 10 years. We are marketing this story to independent comic book publishers like Image. A few of us know those that have sold to Image and independent comic book publishers. But no one on our team has. Producing a quality product and nurturing a home grown fan base, we hope will overcome this great unknown. But more than that, We believe that the story of these 118 good men needs to be told.

For the first 10 backers who pledge $25 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site.


For the first 10 backers who pledge $100 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site and send you a digital download of the first issue.

For the first 10 backers who pledge $100 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site, send you a digital download of the first issue, a video thank you from myself and a secret surprise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you cannot contribute, please consider liking our Facebook page or our website, sharing it on your social media and comment on the numerous articles, photos and developments of this story


The Impact

Your contribution will help tell this story of bravery and courage to people all over the world and keep faith with the families of the fallen who have a right to know how their sons, fathers, husbands and brothers lived and died.  Thank you and God Bless You!

We are marketing this story to independent comic book publishers like Image. A few of us know those that have sold to Image and independent comic book publishers. But no one on our team has. Producing a quality product and nurturing a home grown fan base, we hope will overcome this great unknown. But more than that, We believe that the story of these 118 good men needs to be told.
For the first 10 backers who pledge $25 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site.
For the first 10 backers who pledge $100 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site and send you a digital download of the first issue.
For the first 10 backers who pledge $100 or more, we will acknowledgement and honor you on our facebook site, send you a digital download of the first issue, a video thank you from myself and a secret surprise.
Other Ways You Can Help


If for some reason you cannot contribute, please consider liking our Facebook page or our website, sharing it on your social media and comment on the numerous articles, photos and developments of this story

The Impact
Your contribution will help tell this story of bravery and courage to people all over the world and keep faith with the families of the fallen who have a right to know how their sons, fathers, husbands and brothers lived and died.  Thank you and God Bless You!

story:
What is Mucho Man?

Mucho Man is a farcical super hero romp that stars a Mexican superhero living in a world in which there exists a United Nations of heroes. Each country is represented by an arche/stereo typical character.

The Mucho Man comicbook is an ongoign series.  Issues will become available through the Mucho Man website every 5 or 6 weeks.  The book will be in black and white with color covers.

I plan to promote and sell Mucho Man as a digital comic book.  This Indiegogo campaign is the begining of what I hope will be a long career and the fulfillment of a life-long dream.

What We Need?

I plan to promote and sell Mucho Man as a digital comic book.

This requires 2 large expenditures:

First, the production of a complex and secure website that is capable of collecting money and data from customers as well as bundling e-mail addresses for group e-mailing and linking website updates to facebook and twitter.
Approx. $1000

Second is the cost of internet based advertising. I plan to advertise the book at comicbookresources.com and newsarama.com
Approx. $3000

If I do not reach my goal the Mucho Man project will carry on but withh more limited advertising.

If, by some miracle, I should raise more than my $4000 mark Mucho Man advertising will get an additional boost.  And any left over money will go to paying guest artists to contribute to future issues of Mucho man.

 

SWAG!

$1 - For a pledge of $1 or more you will receive: Access to the first issue of Much Man and my eternal gratitude.

$5 - For a pledge of $5 or more you will receive: Access to issues 1 through 6 of Much Man and my eternal gratitude. (The first three issues are already completed.)

$25 - For a pledge of $25 or more you will receive: Access to every issue of Much Man that I ever put out and, of course, my eternal gratitude.

$100 - For a pledge of $100 or more you will receive: A single page of original artwork from issues one or two of Mucho Man(first come first serve). As well as access to every issue of Much Man that I ever put out and, of course, my eternal gratitude.

$300 - For a pledge of $300 or more you will receive: Either an original piece of cover art from issues 1 or 2 or a two-page spread of original art from issues 1 or 2. (first come first serve) As well as access to every issue of Much Man that I ever put out and, of course, my eternal gratitude.

$1000 - For a crazy a$$ pledge of $1000 or more YOU yourself or any of your friends or family members of your choice will become a superhero in Mucho Man!!!  The character will bare your likeness.  You(or perhaps more appropriately your parents) will be credited as a co-creator of the hero.  Your input into the character's creation will be used in it's creation.  As well you will have access to every issue of Much Man that I ever put out and, of course, my eternal gratitude.

 

Why Mucho Man is "Important"

Name a Mexican Superhero. 
 
Besides Mucho Man.
 
Exactly.  There aren't any(even remotely well known) Mexican Superheroes.  The first issue of Mucho Man introduces two.
 
Additionally, the world of comic book publishing, like all traditionally print media, is changing.  My plan for a non-print, profitable, independent comic book, if successful, could change the face of independent "publishing".  A guy can dream.

story:
UPDATE : 100% and stretch goal!

100% funded! Thanks to all involved!

You want a free patch on top of your order? The stretch goal is 1.750€! If this amount is reached everybody who placed an order (starting at White Belt Fever perk) will get a free 10cm woven patch (WIP version)!

Spread the word! Talk about this to your training partners!

 

What is SNAP?

SNAP is a A5 format 48 pages +cover collection of my best BJJ themed comics and illustrations. It will be printed in glorious risograph colors.

Taking inspiration from those crazy punk/hardcore flyers from the 80's and the 90's, I started doing some BJJ themed illustrations for my club's open mats. It soon transformed into an Instagram account filled with dozens of comics and drawings about BJJ (among others):

https://www.instagram.com/grkztr/

I decided to collect the best ones in this project, and the artwork has been:

  • reworked
  • re-lettered
  • colored

I also created new artwork specific for this book.

Oh, and I also invited some prestigious guests to provide exclusive never seen before illustrations for this project (more on that below)!

About me:

I am a BJJ black belt from Paris, and  the last 10 years have been completely filled by a devouring passion for BJJ (you BJJ guys know what I'm talking about!). Like many of us, I became completely obsessed since the very first training and it took me a decade of grueling training sessions, injuries, and competitions to go from white to black...

I was always into comics and drawing so a long dream of mine as always been to publish something, and coming from the HxC scene I always loved the DIY spirit found there.

This project is the opportunity to blend all of this stuff together and make a dream come true!

I did a DIY black & white pre-version in order to have a feel of the finished thing. A lot of changes have been made since, so this is really a pre-pre version! The finished product will be in color, a bit bigger, etc.

The guests:

The following guests have agreed to provide exclusive never seen before illustrations for this project, and I cannot thank them enough:

  • Dominique Bell is a black belt from ATOS and draws crumbesques depictions of the BJJ lifestyle:
    https://www.instagram.com/dubious_dom
    https://www.instagram.com/bjjcomics
     
  • Meerkatsu doesn't need any introduction, also a black belt, he is one of the pioneer of the exploration of BJJ's visual side:
    https://www.meerkatsu.com/
    https://www.instagram.com/meerkatsu
     
  • Immortal Choke, a purple belt, has been spitting gems of BJJ humor at an inhuman rate for years:
    https://www.immortalchoke.com/
    https://www.instagram.com/immortalchoke
     
  • Jean Marc Forax draws a lot of his inspiration from Japan, and his paintings navigate between absurd humor and contemplative poetry:
    https://www.jeanmarcforax.fr/
    https://www.instagram.com/jmarxforax/
     
  • Endhovian, a purple belt, has been carving his art on people's skin for years:
    https://www.instagram.com/endhovian_tattoo
     

Why do I need you?

SNAP is born out of my undying love for my 2 passions: BJJ and comics, and completing this project is a dream of mine.

The art is being finished so the funds are going to go the printer, to the tee-shirt manufacturer, the shipping, and paying the guest artists (something really important to me!)

 

Why do YOU need this?

On top of getting this cool art book, here's what participating in this campaign brings you:

  • The opportunity for you to get this book for the crowdfunding exclusive price of 15€ instead of the future regular price of 18€.
  • All the books printed for this campaign will feature a gold ink logo. All eventual future prints will be done without the golden bling!
  • All the books will be hand numbered, signed, and dedicated to you! I might even throw in a little doodle...
  • Depending on the perks you choose, you get the opportunity to have the bonus items (stickers, patch, tee-shirt...) at a special crowdfunding price instead of the regular one (see below for details).
  • The first backers will have the opportunity to have some of the tests prints pieces, I'll add a random signed test print piece for those who choose it and get there early enough! Once they're gone, they're gone! (see Early Bird Bonus below)
  • For those who like comics, this is the opportunity to have 3 of my A6 format mini-comics, including one never released before! (see Comic Book Nerd Bonus below)

 

If this campaign doesn't make it, I'm still doing this project one way or another! The funds will be used to finance part of this, it will just take a little longer, so you'll have the stuff you paid for anyway!

The Perks:

Depending on the perks you choose, You'll get the chance to get the following stuff at an exclusive crowdfunding price.

-Kaneda & Shadok stickers:

Crowdfunding price (for both) : 5€ / Regular price : 8€

-Berimbolo woven patch (10cm = 3.93 inch):

Crowdfunding price : 5€ / Regular price : 6,66€

-Jiu-Jitsu tee-shirt:

Crowdfunding price : 25€ / Regular price : 30€

-Quantum Roll art serigraph (format 40x30 cm / 11.8 by 15.7 inches) - Hand signed and numbered:

Crowdfunding price : 15€ / Regular price : 30€

-Original A4 format art:

 

Early Bird Bonus:

Throw in an additional 2€ with your order choosing the Early Bird Catches The Worm Perk and I'll add a signed A6 format random test print piece with your order.

Comic Book Nerd Bonus:

If you like comics, add 5€ with the Comic Book Nerd Perk to your order and I'll send you 3 different A6 format bootleg mini-comics, including one never released before!

Want to distribute this?

You got a shop, a website, a club, and would like to distribute this? Get in touch with me directly and we'll work out something depending on the number of books you want.

Risks & Challenges

The art and coloring is 95% done (I'm just doing the final color tweaks after having received the test color prints), the test prints have been done, so apart from a global catastrophic event like, let's say... A pandemia, nothing can stop this project!... Hey wait a minute!

Joking aside as all the art is almost done, the printer and providers have been found and everything is going smoothly, so the only problem I see would be if this campaign becomes such a huge success that I have to figure out the logistics of sending out thousands of comics around the world, but that's a problem I'm more than willing to have!

On the serious side I already have been selling and sending merchandise and artwork worldwide through my website, so this part won't be a problem either.

Other Ways You Can Help

Apart from participating in the funding of this campaign, you can also help this project by spreading the word among your BJJ friends, clubs, social medias... Any help is welcome!

story:
Is privacy dead?  

Many people want to declare that privacy is dead or that it's not important anymore. That's because these people want to get rich by exploiting it. 

From the revelations of Edward Snowden in 2013, the American people have learned how the government has complete access to your online lives. Nowadays, everyone carries a tracking device on them at all times. We trust Google to give us directions, Uber to take us home, and Facebook for our social lives. But what if someone on the inside of one companies had bad intentions? 

My name is Mars Black. Obviously, this is a pseudonym. There are many reasons for this. 

Corporations want to know everything about us. The more they want to know, the less I want toreveal anything about myself. I put this project on IndieGogo specifically because their competitor would force me to reveal my name. 

This story will illustrate how powerful knowledge really is!

 

About me

I've been an artist my entire life. When I was a kid, I was completely crazy (politically correct term - hyperactive or ADD.) The only time I could sit still was when I was making art. This is still true today. 

I was fortunate enough to meet my mentor John Tartaglione when I was 10. John was a Marvel comic artist who drew one of the best selling comics of all time. (The Life of Pope John Paul II.) He helped me develop my art skills and got me into drawing from life.  

When I became a teenager, I became obsessed with photography and making movies.  When I was trying to decide whether to go to film school or art school, Mr Tartaglione recommended I go for film. He told me that if I could always come back to comics. 

For the last ten years, I've been working as a commercial cinematographer and film professor (for three of them), but making a comic has always been my dream. 

Apex Huntor is the result. 

This 80 page trade paperback will be the first two issues of Apex Huntor along with bonus material. You can read the first issue for FREE at:

www.MarsBlackPresents.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding for the project is going for printing & shipping costs. I'm also going to hire a colorist and a letterer. 

I have TWO perks, One is a digital download and the other is an 80 page trade paperback. There are only two perks because this is my first crowdfunding campaign and I wanted it to be very easy to fulfill.   

 

Risks & Challenges

I know it might sound dodgy to give money to someone with a pseudonym, but I've produced videos for Porsche, Toyota, Tommy Boy Records, and Sotheby's, among others. 

Also, you can read the first issue for free at:

www.MarsBlackPresents.com

Follow me on Twitter and Instagram at MisterMarsBlack.

Thank you for reading this and I can't wait for you to see this book!

story:
Our Story

Thanks for taking a moment to check out our campaign. My name is Brandon Barrows and I've been writing comics for almost four years. Red Run is my first real foray into horror, along with my artist collaborator Joel Cotejar. Joel and I have worked together on several short stories in the past, but this is our first full-length story done together.

 

 

Red Run is a one-shot comic (twenty-eight story pages) telling the story of the McConnells, a down-on-their-luck family desperately in need of a fresh start. Packing only what will fit into a trailer, young parents Becky and David move their two small children, Dina and Ben, out of state to an unassuming town somewhere in America's heartland in order to seek employment. They rent a cheap apartment and make a surprise discovery that seems like a dream come true, only for it to be the beginning of Becky's nightmares.

 

About Brandon

Brandon is a lifelong comic fanatic. He can almost literally not remember a time when he was not enthralled by comics, and writing them is a dream come true.

He has been called an "amazing genre writer" by Geoff Arbuckle of A Comic Book Blog and Tommy Hancock of FanBoyBuzz called his writing "brilliant". Brandon is humbled, awed and grateful that someone would think that highly of him. 

On his most recent work, JACK HAMMER, reviewers have said such varied things as:

"I can't remember the last time I found a hero so likeable...there is a lot to squee about here" - Sequential Tart

"Jack Hammer is a picture perfect example of high quality gritty noir storytelling." - Comics Forge

He hopes RED RUN will be as well received.

 

About Joel

Joel is an artist whose talents have variously been lent towards comics, children's books and advertising in styles as varied as the mediums he works in.

Joel's art has been referred to as "sleek", as possessing "the spirit of the masters of the genre" and as "simply gorgeous".

Reviewers have said about his work:

"Dynamic" - Jason C, featured reviewer on DriveThruComics

"Quite good...comforting on a visual level" - A Comic Book Blog

Joel hopes readers will be as excited about RED RUN as he is.

 

The Impact

The object of this campaign is to raise $1000 to partially fund the creation of the comic. Joel is a professional working artist, both in comics and in other fields such as advertising, with a family to support and as such simply cannot afford to work on a book with no guaranteed pay.


While we both feel strongly about this story, that it's one that needs to be told and will be enjoyed by many, I cannot afford to pay him everything he is due. That's why we need your help because I can't do it alone and without you, this story may not see the light of the day.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $1000, just over half of what the total cost of doing this book will run. I am paying the other half out of my own pocket and the funds raised here will go to paying Joel for his time, effort and the supplies neccessary to pencil, ink and color the comic. I am not taking any page rate as writer of the book, nor is our editor Martin Brandt taking any pay for his contribution.

 

If, through your generosity, we raise more than $1000 the extra funds will go towards paying the remainder of the money owed to Joel, as well as to paying the letterer of the book.

 

When the book has been completed, it will be shopped around various independent publishers seeking a home that will publish and distribute the book so it can be discovered and enjoyed by folks across the world.

 

And, as much as we need your help, we don't expect you to shell out without getting something in return. Donation gifts vary with the amount donated, of course, and include the following:

 

  • All donors will receive a "thank you" mentioning their name on a special page set up on my website at the conclusion of the campaign.
  • Digital copies of a special Indie GoGo version of the final book
  • Physical copies, signed by the writer, of a special Indie GoGo version of the final book
  • Limited edition prints of the cover art, signed by the writer
  • Original production art (actual penciled pages of sequential art)
  • Original, custom sketches done by Joel
  • A professional comic credit, listing you as executive producer of the comic (with $500 donation only)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to help financially, please consider donating your time by sharing this project with your friends, family, co-workers, etc. You truly are helping us reach an important goal for us and it's as simple as sharing our link on Facebook, Twitter, or Google Plus. Every additional link to the campaign, or word about it to a friend, helps and we will be extremely grateful.

 

Thank you very much for checking out our campaign!
story_txt:
Our Story
Thanks for taking a moment to check out our campaign. My name is Brandon Barrows and I've been writing comics for almost four years. Red Run is my first real foray into horror, along with my artist collaborator Joel Cotejar. Joel and I have worked together on several short stories in the past, but this is our first full-length story done together.
 

 
Red Run is a one-shot comic (twenty-eight story pages) telling the story of the McConnells, a down-on-their-luck family desperately in need of a fresh start. Packing only what will fit into a trailer, young parents Becky and David move their two small children, Dina and Ben, out of state to an unassuming town somewhere in America's heartland in order to seek employment. They rent a cheap apartment and make a surprise discovery that seems like a dream come true, only for it to be the beginning of Becky's nightmares.
 
About Brandon
Brandon is a lifelong comic fanatic. He can almost literally not remember a time when he was not enthralled by comics, and writing them is a dream come true.
He has been called an "amazing genre writer" by Geoff Arbuckle of A Comic Book Blog and Tommy Hancock of FanBoyBuzz called his writing "brilliant". Brandon is humbled, awed and grateful that someone would think that highly of him. 
On his most recent work, JACK HAMMER, reviewers have said such varied things as:
"I can't remember the last time I found a hero so likeable...there is a lot to squee about here" - Sequential Tart
"Jack Hammer is a picture perfect example of high quality gritty noir storytelling." - Comics Forge
He hopes RED RUN will be as well received.
 
About Joel
Joel is an artist whose talents have variously been lent towards comics, children's books and advertising in styles as varied as the mediums he works in.
Joel's art has been referred to as "sleek", as possessing "the spirit of the masters of the genre" and as "simply gorgeous".
Reviewers have said about his work:
"Dynamic" - Jason C, featured reviewer on DriveThruComics
"Quite good...comforting on a visual level" - A Comic Book Blog
Joel hopes readers will be as excited about RED RUN as he is.
 


The Impact
The object of this campaign is to raise $1000 to partially fund the creation of the comic. Joel is a professional working artist, both in comics and in other fields such as advertising, with a family to support and as such simply cannot afford to work on a book with no guaranteed pay.
While we both feel strongly about this story, that it's one that needs to be told and will be enjoyed by many, I cannot afford to pay him everything he is due. That's why we need your help because I can't do it alone and without you, this story may not see the light of the day.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking to raise $1000, just over half of what the total cost of doing this book will run. I am paying the other half out of my own pocket and the funds raised here will go to paying Joel for his time, effort and the supplies neccessary to pencil, ink and color the comic. I am not taking any page rate as writer of the book, nor is our editor Martin Brandt taking any pay for his contribution.
 
If, through your generosity, we raise more than $1000 the extra funds will go towards paying the remainder of the money owed to Joel, as well as to paying the letterer of the book.
 
When the book has been completed, it will be shopped around various independent publishers seeking a home that will publish and distribute the book so it can be discovered and enjoyed by folks across the world.
 
And, as much as we need your help, we don't expect you to shell out without getting something in return. Donation gifts vary with the amount donated, of course, and include the following:
 

All donors will receive a "thank you" mentioning their name on a special page set up on my website at the conclusion of the campaign.
Digital copies of a special Indie GoGo version of the final book
Physical copies, signed by the writer, of a special Indie GoGo version of the final book
Limited edition prints of the cover art, signed by the writer
Original production art (actual penciled pages of sequential art)
Original, custom sketches done by Joel
A professional comic credit, listing you as executive producer of the comic (with $500 donation only)
Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to help financially, please consider donating your time by sharing this project with your friends, family, co-workers, etc. You truly are helping us reach an important goal for us and it's as simple as sharing our link on Facebook, Twitter, or Google Plus. Every additional link to the campaign, or word about it to a friend, helps and we will be extremely grateful.
 
Thank you very much for checking out our campaign!

story:
(backers: my email is JohnDylena@gmail.com)

In the fall of 2013, I wrote and published a trilogy of erotic romance books that would later become the novel Raethiana. For that novel, I created a world home to supernatural creatures including the primary species: succubi. That novel was a love story, and when it ended, I felt that the universe that contained it had much more to offer.

That, and I wanted to tell a story that included BDSM.

In November 2013, I wrote and published the first book in what would become an ongoing, 11+ book series that contained a wide array of kinks and fetishes; crossdressing, gender transformation, latex and bondage, female domination and much more.

Book One of The Succubus' Sub tells the tale of the lonely 20-something virgin, Brett, and how one night with the succubus Myserra changed his life forever. It's available to read FOR FREE on Amazon. This series of books is for ADULTS ONLY!

One thing I have always wanted to do with this series was to see it adapted into comic book form. For months I searched for an artist, and finally found one. An artist who not only had the "comic book style" that I wanted, but was also okay with drawing the depictions of sex and the various kinks and fetishes that were contained in the story.

The artist is one Pop-Lee. Check out his work on Deviant Art, tumblr, and Hentai Foundry (18+, NSFW)

The goal of this project is to gather the funds to create a comic book adaption of Book One in the series, titled The Offer. For this issue, I added in bits of pieces of the second book: Dressing for the Occasion. Should I reach my goal for this project before the time is up, all proceeds will go toward producing the second issue! I will also publish and sell both the digital AND print copies on various online retailers like Amazon.

I already personally commissioned three pages from the series. While the first one is in color, the second and third pics (as well as the entire 24 page comic) will be in color as well.

Every dollar (that isn't swallowed up by the fees) will go directly to the artist. Should we make our goal with time to spare, and enter into "stretch goals" the first little bit of that will go to me to write the script for issue 2 (taking time away from writing and publishing normally) then anything after that will go toward the artwork.

 Thank you for taking the time to check out my project! I hope you like what you see and pledge!

story:
{Ita} Ghost Stories è un book che raccoglie storie a fumetti e illustrazioni di 39 artisti italiani, composto da più di 120 pagine a colori rilegate in brossura. 

Il progetto nasce dalla voglia di unire la passione per l'arte visual e un tema che ci ha sempre affascinato, ed è stato reso possibile dalla collaborazione di menti brillanti e talenti unici che abbiamo selezionato tra personalità emergenti o che abbiamo sempre ammirato nell'ambito artistico italiano!

{Eng} Ghost Stories is an anthology that collects comics and illustrations by 39 Italian artists. It consists of more than 120 color pages. 

The project was born from the desire to combine the passion for visual art and a theme that has always fascinated us, and was made possible by the collaboration of brilliant minds and unique talents that we have selected among emerging personalities or that we have always admired in the Italian art! [note: the book is in Italian! But you can enjoy the beautiful illustrations too!!]

{Ita} Ideato da Andrea Sodaro (Illustratore) e Alessandro Pecin (Graphic Designer), il book colleziona fumetti e illustrazioni di una vasta cerchia di abili artisti italiani, tra cui: Paola Zanghì, Giuseppe Balestra, Helena Masellis, Ilaria Grieco, Ilaria Catalani, Kalina Hristova Muhova, Laura Borio, Lonnie Bao, Martina Fari, Monica Sangermano, Paolo Traisci, Renata Castellani, Rosalia Radosti, Silvia Vanni, Ste Tirasso, Tommaso Lucchetti, Valeria Viero, Andrea De Dominicis, Agnese Innocente, Alejandra Salvaterra, Alessandro Abbadini, Alessia Trunfio, Angelo Pintore, Cecilia Ferri, Daniela Giubellini, Elisa DueBì, Emanuele Galletto, Enzo Triolo, Erica Dalle Luche, Fabio Mancini, Federica Frenna, Federico D'Amore, Francesco Corigliano, Freddie Tanto, Giorgia Marras, Gloria Goderecci, Nicola Pezzato.

Insomma.. Un gran bel mix di mani d'oro! Da non lasciarsi sfuggire l'opportunità di avere un prodotto creato dall'unione di tanti ragazzi con una passione comune!

{Eng} Designed by Andrea Sodaro (Illustrator) e Alessandro Pecin (Graphic Designer), the anthology includes comic stories and illustrations by a wide circle of artists whose names you can read a few lines above!

{Ita} Abbiamo individuato come goal per questa campagna di crowdfunding 3.000€. 

I fondi saranno distribuiti secondo questa suddivisione: la stampa delle copie fisiche prevede un costo di circa 1.100€, le spese di spedizione per gli acquirenti a distanza ammontano a 1.000€, la realizzazione dei perks costerà intorno ai 500€. Infine le tasse di Indiegogo e Paypal vanno calcolate sul 15% del totale.

Nel caso in cui non dovessimo raggiungere il tetto prestabilito i fondi torneranno a voi!

{Eng} Our campaign goal is reaching the amount of 3.000€. The funds will be split up for printing (1.100€), shippings (1.000€), perks creation (500€) and Indiegogo+Paypal fees (15% of the total). If we don't reach the goal, you will receive back your money. 

{Ita} Per rendere ancora più intrigante la nostra antologia, abbiamo deciso di affiancarla a dei perks niente male per completare questo quadretto spettrale! 

Cosa intendiamo? Semplice: per chi fosse interessato, oltre al pre-ordine del libro, è possibile affiancare al proprio acquisto anche degli extra targati Ghost Stories. Eccoli qui:

{Eng} To make our anthology even more interesting, we decided to create some nice goods that complete this spooky scene! What do we mean? Simple, here a list of the perks:

  • [Ectoplasma]: BOOK = 15€ + shipping
  • [Fuoco Fatuo]: BOOK + Enamel Pin + Stickers = 20€ + shipping
  • [Poltergeist]: BOOK + Keychain + Stickers = 20 € + shipping
  • [Spettro]: BOOK + Enamel Pin + Keychain + Stickers + Bookmark + PDF + Deluxe Packaging = 40€ + shipping (this last perk only for Italy)

    {Ita} Come Stretch Goal abbiamo stabilito la realizzazione di un segnalibro spettrale da inserire come plus ad ogni perk se dovessimo raggiungere e superare la quota di 3.500€!

    Siamo sicuri che grazie al vostro contributo riusciremo non solo a raggiungere questo goal, ma potremo aggiungerne un successivo! 

    {Eng} Our stretch goal consists in the making of a spooky bookmark to add to every single perk. This could happen if we reach and pass the amount of 3.500€!

    We are sure that thanks to your support we could make it, and also break a next reach goal!

    {Ita} Questo progetto è il primo di questo genere che abbiamo deciso di affrontare. Abbiamo sempre puntato ad un prodotto che non solo fosse un oggetto di qualità come fattura e contenuto, ma che potesse anche rimanere un'esperienza totalmente positiva per collaboratori e fruitori, in vista di realizzazioni simili future (alle quali stiamo già pensando!). 

    Siamo sicuri che con l'aiuto di tutti i partecipanti e le persone intorno a noi saremo in grado di provvedere alla sua realizzazione: è una vera sfida a cui non ci siamo tirati indietro! 

    {Eng} This project is the first of this kind that we decided to begin. We have always focused on a product that is not only a quality designed handwork and content, but that could also remain a totally positive experience for contributors and users, in view of similar future achievements (which we are already thinking about!). We are sure that with the help of all the participants and the people around us we will be able to provide for its realization: it's a real challenge we could not give up!

    Sappiamo bene che non tutti sono in grado di supportare una causa economicamente, ma siete comunque interessati a darci una mano in qualche modo? È facile!

    Un'ottimo strumento a vostra disposizione è il passaparola: parlarne con amici e conoscenti fa già tantissimo: aiutandoci a spargere la conoscenza della nostra antologia ci aiuterà a creare più risonanza e possibile sostegno!!

    Se volete seguirci sui nostri profili social ci trovate a:

    • Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/ghoststoriesart/
    • Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/ghoststoriesart/
    • Twitter - http://twitter.com/ghoststoriesart/

    Grazie a tutti!!

     

    Le immagini usate nelle grafiche della campagna sono degli artisti: Paolo Traisci, Laura Borio, Ilaria Grieco, Alessandro Abbadini, Rosalia Radosti, Agnese Innocente, Andrea Sodaro, Alessia Trunfio, Alessandro Pecin ed Helena Masellis.

Grazie a tutti!!

story:
What's this about?!

Set in 1930s small town America The Mighty Millborough concerns the days of Millington F. Millborough; bachelor gentleman and distinguished eccentric. His adventures are tales of perplexity, wonder, and toy soldiers; lust, loneliness and the great mystery of it all.

  • The Mighty Millborough collects all Millborough strips and stories Christoph Mueller has drawn between 2011 and 2016, including nine pages of all new material never published before!
    •  
  • 24 grandiosely oversized pages in beautiful full color measuring a massive 11½ by 16½ inches!
  • The beautiful design is highlighted by Mueller's outstanding lettering and ornamentation skills!
    •  
  • Features a special endnotes section with little known facts and curious annotations! 
  • Available for the very first time in English!

Parts of The Mighty Millborough appeared between 2012 and 2015 in Mineshaft Magazine in the United States and MovieBeta Magazine in Germany, and were published as the graphic novel The Mighty Millborough – Contes d’un homme de goût in France. This will be the first time all the material is collected into one volume, complemented by new material, and presented in lavish full color!



Who is this Christoph Mueller?

“I believe him to be one of the most talented young cartoonists in Europe, and easily one of the most sensitive hand-lettering typographers in the world. […] Of all human hands, Christoph's is one of the more elegant and sensitive I know.”

—Chris Ware


“An obsessive-compulsive after my own heart.”

—Robert Crumb


“A brilliant illustrator.”

—The New York Times


Christoph Mueller was born in 1980 with a pen in his hand. His first comic The Mighty Millborough – Contes d’un homme de goût  was published in 2013 in France. He has recently self-published the well-received Nincompoop #1. Some people assume he is the true Millington F. Millborough and they might be true. He lives in Aachen, Germany with his girlfriend Leonie and their two weiros Wembley and Schlomo. 




What is needed & What you will get

In order to cover printing costs for a limited edition of 500 copies we have set our funding goal to € 1300. 

  • The Mighty Millborough is printed using the offset technique. This guarantees high quality print results! 
    •  
  • In case we fail to reach our funding goal of € 1300, any additional costs are covered. This guarantees that you will receive The Mighty Millborough in November! 
  • Every supporter—no matter which perk—will receive a personal thank-you note handwritten by Christoph Mueller!

“The Mighty Millborough” signed print 
available though the  COMIC BOOK + PRINT perk.


“Nincompoop #1” available through the
COMIC BOOK + NINCOMPOOP perk.

This beautiful piece of original art is available
through the ORIGINAL ART 1 perk. 

This stunning piece of original art is available
through the ORIGINAL ART 2 perk. 


Timeline

The book is a true labor of love, carefully thought out, drawn, and designed. If you share Mueller's passion for the beautiful your support will directly aid in the making The Mighty Millborough.

  • The Mighty Millborough and all perks will ship after the campaign has ended during the first days of November.
    •  



Other ways to help

Besides from supporting The Mighty Millborough directly we would very much appreciate your help in making our little campaign known. This could be simply by sharing your enthusiasm for the book with a friend or by sharing the Indiegogo campaign website on social media such as Facebook and Twitter. It might seem like little, but it would help us in a big way!

  • Share the link to our campaign on social media! You can use the Indiegogo icons at the top of the page for that. 
    •  
  • Talk to your friends about The Mighty Millborough and help us spread the word!
    •  

“Could I interest you in a comic book?”
For size comparison: The Mighty Millborough placed next to the artist.

story:
The Name Of This Comic Is Reverb

My name is Flynn Nicholls and I'm an illustrator from Baltimore. (You know, like Ace of Cakes?) Last year, as an exercise to stay productive, I started doing brief, off-the cuff comics with no thumbnailing or scripting. I didn't have to like them, I just had to finish them.

 

Out of this exercise came Reverb, a comic about Cool Dog, Jolene, and Sobek,  three friends in a weirdo city who sometimes frustrate each other. Reverb itself is more fully realized while still retaining the lo-fi, impromptu spirit of its origin. I'm really excited about it and I'd like to share it with YOU, in the form of not ONE, but TWO BOOKS! Both making their print debut at Small Press Expo 2013! Whoa!   

 

I'm Going To Ask You For Money But I'll Give You Something In Return

I'm asking for money to get some quality minis printed! Many of the strips are in color, and so I'd like to print in color--which is definitely going to run up the cost. If I have anything left over, it'll go toward table costs for SPX. 

YOU, the contributor, will receive digital and/or print copies of the book, plus other cool things based on the donation levels on the right! Wow!

Comics are my #1 passion in life and being able to share that with other people is amazing. Creating a book is always a learning experience and with this project I'm hoping to expand beyond what I've done before. I couldn't do it without the support of friends and people who like what I do, for which I am eternally grateful.

 

Tell Yr FriendsCan't donate? It's cool! Just be sure to spread the word and tell folks about it. Thanks for your support! And thank you to Dale and Sara for helping me get this Indiegogo in order! 

 

UPDATE: IF YOU CONTRIBUTED $25 OR MORE, ARE GOING TO BE AT SMALL PRESS EXPO, AND WOULD RATHER PICK UP YOUR BOOKS THERE, PLEASE LEAVE A COMMENT HERE OR LET ME KNOW AT ANY OF THE TWITTER/TUMBLR LINKS BELOW! THANKS!


UPDATE #2: WOW! THE CAMPAIGN CLOSED OUT AT $590! THANK YOU ALL AGAIN FOR CONTRIBUTING, YOU SHOULD RECEIVE AN EMAIL FROM ME ABOUT ANY CLAIMED PERKS WITHIN THE NEXT WEEK OR SO (IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY). DIGITAL DOWNLOADS WILL BE SENT VIA EMAIL, PHYSICAL COPIES SHOULD BE DELIVERED BY THE END OF SEPTEMBER AT THE VERY LATEST!


UPDATE #3: ALL BOOKS HAVE BEEN MAILED! IF YOU'RE PICKING YOURS UP AT SPX I'LL SEE YOU THERE!

story:
My name is James Fuller and I am a Canadian born fiction/fantasy/horror author and have written several titles that I have Indie Published. My epic fantasy series Fall of a King, my anthology Broken Shards of a Masterpiece and of course my dark fiction revenge tale, Unforgivable. All of which have gathered a respectable fan base and garnished some amazing reviews.

I have been writing for nearly a decade but only in the last two years have begun to take it seriously and venture into the world of publishing. Like many writers I sent off to several publishing houses and found rejection due to mostly my lack of having an established name. So with that I decided to take matters into my own hands and begin to make a name and a platform for myself and began Indie publishing my books in hopes that one day a Traditional Publishing house will finally pick me and my work up. But in the mean time I have a lot of books to write and several projects to work on such as this one, which is by far the biggest venture for me so far.

When the idea for Unforgivable first came to me, it was indeed an idea for a dark comic series. Much like the Punisher or Witch Blade etc. And so I began to write it. Since I had never written a comic layout and formate before I wrote it how I have always written and that is as a full story that could later be broken down into separate scenes and pages. Once I had the first 3 Issues written up I began searching for an artist willing to team up with me on this exciting journey. Well needless to say many were interested but few came through and fewer were willing to work as a partner on the project in hopes of getting paid for their hard work and countless hours drawing and colouring each Issue. So I decided to put the dreams of seeing Unforgivable as graphic novels aside for a time and just write them as books in hope that one day I would find the right artist.

Well almost 2 years have gone by since then, both Unforgivable 1 and 2 have been out and published for over a year and have made considerable headway in the Indie publishing world. Both have sold several hundred copies and have received many great reviews. Unforgivable 1 has 25 reviews and holds a 4.7 out of 5 star rating on Amazon where Unforgivable 2 has 12 reviews and has a 4.9 out of 5. And last month I released news that there will indeed be a Unforgivable 3 to be released Spring of 2014.

About a month a go a friend of mine asked me how my plans for the graphic novels were going and I admitted to him that I might have to give up on it for a few years because I hadn't been able to find the right artist for the job. The he told me about a friend of his who might be interested and so I went to bed that night not holding my breath. To my surprise come morning I had a email awaiting me from Jamie Scherer asking about the project. I filled her in on what was needed, how I wanted to do it and the problems I have been facing. She was thrilled about the project and the possibilities it could mean for her own artistic career and if all else the practise it would bring.

After several lengthy emails we came to terms on what we wanted/needed from each other to make this work and have partnered up to not only see my dream of seeing my series turned into the graphic novel series it was always meant to be but also to help her further her own career as an artist.

Because the magnitude of work needed to create a single comic book, and the hours Jamie will spend drawing and colouring each page, I could never ask her to do it for completely free and just for profit shares. Each page takes her between 3 and 6 hours, but since she believes so much in this story and what turning it into a graphic novel will do she has agreed to draw each page for $15, plus profit shares on sales.

Each comic will be between 20 and 25 pages long, ranging her costs to $300 to $375 per comic.

The $1400 we hope to raise is to fund the first 3 comics in the series. There will be 42 in total, but of course we want to see if we can make this happen and so we are starting small and going for just the first 3 and then from there we hope that profits will be able to pay for the the other 39 our fingers are crossed.

Most of that money $1100 is to pay Jamie for her to draw the 3 comics which is going to be roughly between 72 and 75 pages in total. That is the bulk of the money.

Then $90 will be formatting costs so we may have it not only on Kindle but also be able to order print copies from Createspace.

Then the remaining $210 will go to printing copies for the several book store and comic shops that already carry copies of my other books. Also to show our appreciation to those who contributed to the cause, with signed books and comics.

None of the money is directly for me but for the project itself and to see it to completion.

Depending of what people Contribute, you can get your hands on not only the first comics themselves signed by myself (author) and Jamie (artist) but even the Unforgivable novels as well. Book marks, and even special thanks within the comics themselves or on our facebook page. We appreciate every dollar given to the cause and all money raised goes towards making this dream come true.

We hope if all goes well that before the end of 2013 the first comic will be finished and ready!

If we only raise part of the funds we will ensure the first comic is finished and hopefully be able to go further next time.

We understand that not everyone has the extra means to help and donate, but that doesn't mean that you cannot help us. Spreading the word of our campaign anywhere you can is a big help! So please feel free to share our links and tell others who might be interested.

We thank you all.


Some info on Jamie Scherer

As a child I first loved art when I started to color pictures in Pre-school. For me that was a lot of fun, and I would doodle and draw and paint, I got every marker, paint, color pencil and crayon I could find to create something special. Now I am a student at Bowling Green State University continuing my love for art and trying to obtain my Bachelor in Fine Arts Degree. I would say that painting is my favorite thing do, but I also love drawing and photography and even digital painting. Digital painting is something I discovered late in high school and I gained a real interest in it. I started to research about it and look at other peoples work that used Photoshop to create a painting. So I began to fall in love with this style and created work of my own. Now my dream after I graduate is to become and illustrator/concept artist for a company. I am somewhat living my dream early by helping to create this comic series. My favorite thing to create is dark, scary things that make it hard for you to sleep at night. I am 21 years old and my life is just beginning and hopefully this is a grand beginning. 

-Jamie


James Fuller & Jamie Scherer

Video Book Trailer for Unforgivable 1

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f33LLg_El_0

Video Book Trailer for Unforgivable 2

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A1EGTAUWrB4

story:
$14,000 STRETCH GOAL  (LOCKED)

Trading Cards (1) Asami Nishimura Card (1) John Moses Card

$12,000 STRETCH GOAL  (REMOVED)

Variant Cover Stretch Goal removed. Professional Hired for Setting up print file and Digital Copy.

$10,000 STRETCH GOAL  UNLOCKED!

Upgraded Paper & Cover Quality 

$8000 STRETCH GOAL  UNLOCKED!

Upgrade to Square binding and additional pages for comic line art & Sketches

$6500 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!

Professional Letterer & Asami bookmark

 

Asami - Children of Rusu issue #1 will be a 40 Page comic!

Design Team

Stephen Hart - Illustrator/Co-Writer

Gabriel Rosales - Co-Writer

DC Alonso - Colorist

Eric Weathers - Letterer

 

 

Prologue

Hello, my name is Stephen Hart and I am the creator and illustrator of Asami – Children of Rusu. I am determined to create an entertaining story that targets people who love good story and Japanese culture. I believe people who grew up watching Anime and have an affinity for Japanese culture will appreciate the story I am trying to tell. People who like Ninja Scroll but would like to see a scale of Gurran Lagann.  Your contributions will directly fund the illustration, color and print of this comic as well as set the foundation of the story to be expanded in upcoming issues. This is immensely important to me, being able to create a story and share the story illustrated in full color would be wildly fulfilling.

Short Summary

Japan, late Edo period. A young samurai named Asami Nishimura is on a journey to save Japan from her former Clan and Daimyo. She is daughter of Kenichi Nishimura, a most trusted bodyguard to the current Daimyo of the Rusu clan. After troubles beseech their land at the hands of a Daimyo who has been chosen by the gods, Kenichi rebels against his lord and sends Asami away. Armed with a mysterious holy weapon Asami searches for a man named John Moses. By banding together, they set out to unite the Daimyo of the other provinces to wage war and Defy the Gods of Rusu.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is $5,000 Fixed Goal This would fund my time, the colorist, printing and preparing for shipping. As well as lay the foundation for the future issues. There are a few Perks available like signed 11x17 line art print on Bristol board. I’m open to more suggestions! 

The Impact

Your impact in the creation of this comic will be monumental. By reviewing this page and making a contribution you are showing me that there is a demand for quality stories and specifically this story that I don't believe has been attempted. 

Risks & Challenges

Understand there is a risk on the ground level. There are possibilities of inevitable outcomes that are not foreseen. I can tell you i am dedicated to creating this. My original plan was to create this for myself by myself. Why not let some like minded individuals share the journey? The biggest risk i can see would be delays. I work full time and this comic would be done in my spare time. I will do my best to meet the deadline given or beat the deadline given. I have all the equipment to help me accomplish the goal. only thing we have against us is time. I will keep you updated throughout the process. 

other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share the campaign. Keep the movement going. Lets have our voices heard. Let produce quality comics again.
